Reviews.Title: “The customer service at this hotel will exceed your expectations!”
Reviews.Author: ptraber
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel last weekend and were SO impressed with the service we got at this hotel from everyone - the front desk staff, the housekeeping staff, the reservation person - they all went ABOVE and BEYOND in service! My husband and I were traveling with 3 other couples and had come up to go to the Magic Castle to celebrate my husband's birthday. We rented one 2 bedroom suite and 2 single rooms. When we arrived and checked into the suite, they had set balloons on the table along with two chilled bottles of wine and 4 wine glasses PLUS a personalized birthday card and a chocolate cupcake and even candles! The two bedroom suite was HUGE! It was like an apartment - we had 8 people in our room for drinks and appetizers - the living room area had plenty of seating for all of us and several ottomans to put the food on! The housekeeping staff brought us extra wine glasses and dishes. The bedrooms in the 2 bedroom suite were good sized and the beds very comfortable. The next morning they had a continental breakfast with yogurt and granola and fresh baked croissants and scones and muffins from a nearby bakery and wonderful STRONG coffee! We had a wonderful stay here and would DEFINITELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: peyyala
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I was skeptical despite having seeing the great feedback on the hotel . This was my first visit to US and I was confused with the choices that were being offered. I wanted to stay in hollywood at a reasonable cost. The reservation desk was most helpful in taking my booking and also offered options of pickup. I was given the option of shuttle which was really very convenient since i was travelling alone from Bangalore. My friends were travelling from New Delhi. The checkin was really smooth. The hotel allowed a early checkin for my friends on our request. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Bathroom was clean and looked new. I had some doubts since some folks had given a review on ageing bathrooms. It had a cooking range with all the necessary utensils, fridge. Towards the end of our stay we used their facilities to cook. Breakfast was complimentary, it was adequate. Wireless was free. unlimited snacks and beverages at the minibar counter in the reservation desk. But i guess the best asset or quality of the hotel is the staff. They are extremely courteous and tried to accomodate our requests. example- when I asked for directions to some stores, the receptionist (jason) printed out the directions from Google Maps. Really I thought it is a great thought process of the Magic Castle Management., by itself the property is very unassuming and boring. But its really the service at this cost that really makes this hotel really good.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: CanineLover65
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I have stayed here whenever we visit family in LA. This hotel has no downside whatsoever. The suites and studios are spotless, the location is attractive but yet very close to Hollywood center, public transportation, restaurants and large food markets such as Ralphs, excellent and generous breakfasts and snacks are provided and the heated pool makes it possible to swim in December. The hotel's biggest asset is its staff. They are warm, attentive, competent and hell bent on making one's stay as pleasant as possible. Our appreciation to the managers: Gretchen, Darren, Christen and Frank and to the wonderful people at the front desk: Marcus, Zeeshan, Caren, Jason, Marzia, Lisa and Nick. Oh, the rates are reasonable too!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and good hotel in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: itravel100
Reviews.Content: We stayed with 3 children and grandparents for two nights in a two bedroom suite. The hotel staff (reception and cleaning) were all very helpful and accommodating. The heated pool was a hit with the kids and even though it was January, many were using the pool. The hotel looked like the 'Melrose Place' apartment. The breakfast was a good selection of cereals and pastries. The hotel is ideally located if staying in Hollywood. However we found Hollywood itself to be cheap, nasty and tacky. Next time we would stay in Beverly Hills, same price but much nicer location with young children. We were also disappointed that the magic show at the hotel was only for 21+ during the week. Also the free Wifi was very unreliable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Magic Castle, except the odour!”
Reviews.Author: allwests
Reviews.Content: My husband and two teenager children stayed in a one bedroom apartment. We arrived in our room after carrying our bags up a lot of stairs, to be hit by an overwhelming odour. At first we thought maybe the carpets had just been cleaned and the room had been closed up, but it was rather strong. We called reception and were offered an alternative room but at 10pm, having lugged all our bags to the room, we were too tired to move to the 2nd room which was at the opposite side of the hotel. We thought the smell would go - it didn't and in hindsight we should have moved. I bought a scented candle and we lit that while in the room. A little disappointing as it was clear management knew of the smell. Aside from the smell in our room, we liked the spaciousness and having two TV's and a kitchen/dining area made family travel so much more comfortable. Just avoid room 315!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful & Staff is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ALLIGATOR9
Reviews.Content: A block away from Hollywood Walk of Fame & I was lucky to get a room here. Packed my carry on & strolled over from Roosevelt to Magic Castle. Very nice room, great staff & hot apple cider at the reception. Plus the staff at reception is so nice it makes you feel so much comfortable. Free Dvds to watch in the room, free snacks & sodas to keep you going. You are in Hollywood. This is a hotel I would love to stay again & again. Wish they had more hotels at other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location”
Reviews.Author: TripTrip83
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night, but loved every second of it. The front desk was incredibly friendly, starting even before we arrived and called to make reservations for the Magic Castle. When we checked in, they upgraded us to a suite since the place was rather empty. They also insisted on driving us up the hill to our dinner reservation. The room was huge and incredibly clean. There were lots of cute "magic" themed touches that I won't spoil on here. The hotel is within walking distance of some of the famous Hollywood sites and next to the Magic Castle. Parking was $10 extra, which we didn't expect, but didn't really mind all things considered. It's a little pricer than other hotels in the area, but they make it worth it with the unlimited snacks, cleanliness, shuttle, and friendly service!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: scarletbgn3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magic Castle while in Los Angeles for business. As my son and husband came with me, we picked the Magic Castle based on the room and the location. We were incredibly happy with our choice. The hotel is a repurposed apartment building, meaning that our one bedroom suite was actually a one bedroom apartment complete with full kitchen and dining area. While the appliances and furnishings are dated and well worn, everything was very clean and in workable condition. Each room has wall mount air conditioning, rather than typical hotel room central air but as we were there in January, this wasn't an issue for us. The service at the Magic Castle Hotel was the best part of the trip. Every staff member we encountered went above and beyond to enhance our stay. My infant son was greeted with bath supplies and a rubber duck, while my husband and I were met with a drink at check in. Our bags were brought up quicfkly to our room (very important as there are lots of stairs and no elevator that we could find), and we were provided with a portable crib in our room. We made use of the free shuttle service to the fabulous Japanese restaurant up the hill from the hotel, and while enroute the hotel staff made us a reservation and ordered us an appetizer, compliments of the hotel. The free breakfast in the morning was more than adequate and the coffee was great. The location was great for my husband and son to explore Hollywood during the day. On top of it all, the price was incredibly reasonable, particularly in regards to the amount of room space.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Best Hotel Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: night-life-angel
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle Hotel is a one of a kind hotel...In fact I've never had a better hotel experience! The staff is beyond helpful; they are exceptional, right on hand to offer you a welcome beverage and anything else you might need upon your arrival and during your entire stay. In addition to very clean and spacious accommodations, this hotel offers some extra amenities including a free mini bar and a complimentary breakfast that includes scrumptious croissants and scones. A block from some of Hollywood's coolest restaurants and down the hill from extraordinary Yamashiro restaurant, the location is ideal. The hotel is also located on the same property as the world famous Magic Castle, and guests staying at the Magic Castle Hotel have access to this private club, which features the world's top magicians. I highly recommend both--a stay at the Magic Castle Hotel and an awe-inspiring evening at the Magic Castle!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing frtf”
Reviews.Author: ProfChampaign
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the glowing reviews on TripAdvisor. This was the one disappointing hotel amongst all the others that we booked in our itinerary. First the strengths: The people are nice. This is what probably drives the hotel(?)'s popularity. The service aspect is great in terms of promptness, civility, and helpfulness. The kids loved the free snacks. The parking is useful. These are the reasons for two stars. The weaknesses: Unfortunately service alone cannot drive a hotel stay. What is also equally important is how good the room and the amenities are. In our room, the main bed was ok, but the sofa bed sagged a lot, and my son could not sleep. The bathroom door could not be locked. The microwave was not cleaned, there were coffee stains. The amenities are all very old, and need a desperate upgradation. The area where the washing machines are kept was filthy (Management - have you even looked behind the machines, ever?). The hotel(?) is an old apartment complex with paper thin walls. I could not sleep the whole night because of the sound. The hotel cannot control the road noise, but it does have the option of investing in insulation. The breakfast is a nice touch, but we could not find butter. The "free" internet did not work. (There have been previous postings on this issue - why not resolve it?) The point is simple - freebies and service is great, enjoy it if you want to, but this is not a top grade hotel, and is very uncomfortable for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience we've had in years!”
Reviews.Author: Small_family_mom
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle Hotel is a true delight. We would definitely stay there again if we are in L.A. The rooms are large, clean, and comfortable. As others have said, the service is exceptional. They really go out of their way to make everything perfect, providing maps, restaurant recommendations, directions, snacks, movies, ...all of which is free, so you don't feel like you're getting charged for everything, like you do in many larger hotels. I didn't even realize that the hotel is only a couple of blocks from the Metro when I made the reservation, so that was a surprise bonus. The weather was a bit too cool to use the pool, but it created a nice atmosphere in the courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “A counterbalance....”
Reviews.Author: CThom7
Reviews.Content: Just want to say I am flabbergasted as to why this place gets great reviews. We have had great luck with trip advisor in the past and booked this place on the basis of these amazing reviews. Underwhelming experience. Thought it was a bit of a dump, to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay amazing service”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: This is not a high end hotel but they do not charge high end rates either- so for the price you get an excellent stay. It is an older apartment complex that is now a hotel. With that I want to warn folks: The kitchens are older and the showers are small. The rooms need painting and the carpet is older. However they made up for this in service. We were traveling with a group of 5 adults and 5 kids. We needed 3 rooms and wanted to be by the Magic Castle and Hollywood. The location was perfect and the service was amazing. We had a 1 bedroom suite and a 2 bedroom. Both had kitchens and one had a balcony. Breakfast was included and so were snacks and sodas. You can walk right to Hollywood- great food and walk of fame. Nice pool and patio area is well kept. I will also caution that there are many stairs- we were on the 2nd floor and we had to walk up 4 flights from the parking garage. We are in good shape so it is not a big deal for us- but if stairs are not your thing I would request a room on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable staff and comfortable rooms !”
Reviews.Author: curryjb
Reviews.Content: What a unique and fantastic hotel experience....Nick, Jason, Caren, Zichan (sp)...Yes, we knew all of the staff by name and they knew us !! If we needed it, they got it ! Terrific location just one block from all the action of Hollywood Blvd, but far enough away for a quiet stay. Apartment like feel. We stayed in a one BR suite and both boys (18 and 16) were very comfortable in the living room. Best continental breakfast I have ever had, and the boys enjoyed snacks each night (or the hot apple cider !) with a DVD provided by the hotel....They even brought us milk to go with our cookies one night ! This is what customer service is supposed to be about. Rooms were very clean and spacious and we enjoyed the heated pool every night even when temps dipped into the low 50's. My family loves to workout, and the hotel provided complimentary trips to a fitness facility right around the corner. Great recommendations for dining and all the help we needed getting around. I would recommend to anyone needing some space and enjoying getting to know the staff of the hotel. We got some Texas hospitality in California ! We will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, spacious room with a special touch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Magic Castle for 3 nights in the one bedroom suite on the ground floor. The room is huge with rollaway bed. The tv in the bedroom came in handy as the kids could watch the cartoons in the room while we caught up with news and movies in the living room. The scones served at breakfast was delicious and kids simply loved the free snacks. The staff were friendly and helpful. We couldn't find our knife and the front desk receptionist even brought 2 chambermaids to help look for it. If there is anything to complain about, it just strange how the cups were decreasing in number everyday. The first day, there were 4 cups, followed by 2 on the 2nd and by the 3rd day, there were none at all. Just simply intriguing. Would definitely stay with MCH again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY, BEST SERVICE IN USA”
Reviews.Author: ashton2005
Reviews.Content: This is our second time visiting the States from Perth, Australia. This time while in LA we chose to stay at the Magic Castle Hotel. I have to say having spent almost 4 weeks this year our last few days were at the Magic Castle and we will certainly be staying when we visit again in 2010. The staff could not have been more helpfuil or polite. We were travelling with our 14 month and 5 year old Grandsons, the staff were fantistic with the children. On our arrival the staff had the baby cot all set up and a supply of johnsons baby products for our use. The free continental breakfast was nice as was the warm apple tea at night. The kids loved the free snacks and drinks available from reception any time of the day or night. Once again thank you to all the management and staff at the Magic Castle for our stay. We can't wait to come back. The Owens-Smith family

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1024_9
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here before and came back for the great location, accommodating staff, and excellent value. Rooms are spacious suites, include a complete kitchen, and surround a swimming pool. Continental breakfast is included, as well as hot cider and cookies through the day. They also have a free "minibar" which basically means you can ask for snacks and beverages all day long. Free movies too. Very nice place for families looking for comfort and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “most amazing staff and lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: samamy
Reviews.Content: the staff here were the most accommodating people I have ever met. Our group (my boyfriend and I and three of his friends) caused quite a scene in their lobby and fought over where we were sleeping. They attempted to give us various room options and patiently waited for us to sort things out, offering us apple cider, soft drinks and snacks all the while. They have free dvds to borrow during your stay for use in the room. The bed is quite high off the ground but comfortable. The shower is large enough for two to fit and good pressure. Definitely reccommend this. continental breakfast was included as well.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, great location, clean, but not luxury”
Reviews.Author: Louise100_10
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone who posted reviews in the past – you made organizing my December 1-10, 2010, trip easy where we stayed in eight different California hotels. Great location a block away from the Chinese Theatre, friendly and efficient service, comfortable and clean beds, and a very low price that includes breakfast. Rooms are small with odd functional décor. I would stay here again if I was spending most of my time out sight seeing and need a clean place to land. I wouldn’t stay here if I was planning to spend much time in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and very pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: smzhang
Reviews.Content: After a 17 hour flight, the welcoming reception at the Magic Castle was a breath of fresh air. Amazing service with free wifi, complimentary snack bar, great DVD selection and tasty breakfast - ALL FREE! You cannot find better value or service anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: riggingdiva
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Magic Castle Hotel two days ago for a trade show at the LA Convention Center - which, in LA traffic, is a good 40 minutes driving time away. Normally I would have booked us adjacent to the LACC, but when my husband insisted that we book the MCH instead, I read the TA postings and made the booking. After only two days, I am hooked. All the details of the reviews below are dead on: excellent staff, free goodies, heated pool, free LA Times,free shuttles to MC or the spectacular views from the Japanese restaurant on the hill above, quiet complex (we are in 211 - the top center one bedroom, so no noisy upstairs neighbor issues, but an occasional car or truck in the middle of the night on the road behind the bedroom - what do you expect? You are IN a city). And yes, the kitchen stove should eventually be replaced along with the rolled linoleum in the bathroom, but everything is spotless. They offer turn-down service with a mint and the next day's weather forecast - a LOVELY touch that I have only experienced at 5 star boutique hotel in Paris and Quebec City. Match that with a glass of cold, sparkling, Italian lemon soda served in a champagne flute to welcome you at the check-in desk to sip while completing the normal boring paperwork and I daresay, even the road warriors among us will soften. Now, DO make reservations for the Magic Castle. As anyone who knows me well, as a 20 year veteran, former Lincoln Center opera and ballet production stage manager and personal assistant for years to a multi-Tony award winning director: I don't "do" bad theatre - or theme parks. That said, our Magic Castle adventure was top notch - ok, I agree that the food could have been better, but not the experience. Here is my top advice: arrive before your dinner reservation so you can see the two smaller venue shows before dinner or the main hall attraction. Once you get into the castle (yes, you get to whisper, "Open, Simsim" to get through the library "door" ) send your partner to the bar directly in front of you for drinks and walk your own feet directly to the left (stageright) and get in line for the Close-Up Gallery. There you will be only one of about 20 audience members, in the tiniest venue I have ever experienced, to watch - and participate if you are picked from the 1st or 3rd rows in what I can only express as a private magic show. A delightful start. This review is getting too off track from the MCH, so... We will be here for another three days and it the MCH is an oasis to return to after all day on your feet in an exhibit booth. Come, Enjoy, You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in the entire trip”
Reviews.Author: TSF8
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I thought the reviews were wrong. The hotel appeared old, and certainly not as grand as I expected it to be. However, our perception of this hotel changed very quickly. We arrived slightly past 8am, and the children were tired. The Front Office staff allowed us to check-in early, which was much appreciated. We were also invited to join the complimentary breakfast which was being served at the lobby. The rooms are old, but well equipped. It was extremely comfortable and felt like home away from home. The best things about this hotel : - Staff are exceptionally friendly - everyone was great and smiley, without being too intrusive. A special mention must be made to the Front Office Staffs who made every effort to make us feel welcome and comfortable. - An array of complimentary things, which is hard to find anywhere these days. These included free breakfast, drinks, snacks and DVDs. Oh, and the hot apple cider served daily was always a warm welcome, coming in from a day out in the cold winter. - Location - 5mins away from Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre, etc. There is no better location. Thank you, everyone at Magic Castle, for making our stay wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Had we stayed on the 2nd floor, we would have given it a 5...”
Reviews.Author: wendypel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 10 year old twin boys, spent 4 nights at the Magic Castle. We debated on our rating because we loved the hotel, except for one major drawback. First the positives. The hotel is a converted apartment complex (think Melrose Place) and it is a refreshing change from the cookie cutter "hotel in a box" that so many chains have become. The staff is friendly and helpful. The amenities are great - especially with kids - free snacks, sodas and movies. Anything we asked for was promptly delivered. In the afternoon, they offered cookies and cider (wonderful smell upon entering the hotel...) Of an evening, they lit candles on the tables in the courtyard surrounding the pool. The location is one block off Hollywood Blvd, right near the Kodak Theater. We'd venture out and about during the day, then park the car in the free hotel garage and wander out for dinner. All of that is wonderful, but then there is the one big negative we experienced. Our room was a 1 bdm suite on the 1st floor. It was large and clean and right next to the courtyard pool. The problem was the noise from upstairs. Anytime the guests in the room above moved, it sounded like a creaky herd of thundering elephants. When they took a shower, it sounded like a foghorn. Now, our neighbors were not overly loud - they were just moving about their room. To the hotel's credit, when I complained after the 1st night, they offered to move us, but they don't allow roll away beds on the 2nd floor, so we decided to tough it out. Earplugs were a must for sleeping. If we find ourselves in Hollywood, we would definitely stay at the Magic Castle again - our boys absolutely loved it. And we will recommend it to friends...however, we will insist on staying on the 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location, fab service”
Reviews.Author: Phil_E_Usfog
Reviews.Content: Great location to explore Hollywood on foot and central enough in LA to visit the rest within a short car journey (short in distance that is - not always short in time due to horrendous LA trafic). Rooms were spacious and clean albeit the bathroom/kitchen/furniture is long overdue an upgrade. Staff were great - friendly, efficient and had a genuine desire to do all they could for you. Staying there also allowed you access to the Magic Castle Club next door (a members only magic club) well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “If you have Kids don't stay in LA - Stay Here : Location, Location with Top Service”
Reviews.Author: Chuck_AU
Reviews.Content: Fours night with a 13 Year old and a 10 year old during Halloween. Great Points # Room size - we had a one bedroom apartment. It had a eating area, a kitchen and nice parents retreat bedroom. Balcony over looking pool. # Swimming Pool - heated. Just what we needed after long days out. # Unlimited Snacks including soft drinks, Chocolates, Snacks # Service - staff always friendly and helpful # Location - One block from HW Boulvarde. One train station from Universal Studios # Continental Breakfast included. Cereals and Pastries. Eat by Pool or in room. # They catered for Gluten Free at Breakfast with GF Toast and they supplied a box of GF Cereal. # Free Internet Bad Points # I made 3 phone calls from Australia and 3 emails to confirm bookings, and Airport pickups. Was promised multiple times of a confirmation email. It never came and neither did the hotel pickup car. Not what you need with Kids at the end of a 15 hour flight. # The fold out lounge bed is dippy and really didnt work with two teenagers (boy and girl) they kept rolling into the middle. We asked the hotel could we make up a bed using the cushions and they OK'd it. They made it up every day. Still not the most comfortable Rating Points were lost only due to these above points. But would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Magical Experience at the Magic Castle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FutureTravelers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were attending a conference in San Diego so we decided to add a few days and went to L.A. - it was close to Halloween so we decided to stay at the Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood because that gives us access to the Magic Castle, the world famous magician's club - which is normally only open to bona fide magicians and people they refer as guests. It is tricky to get into the Magic Castle if you're not a magician, but possible if you know one of the three or four methods to get a reservation. The hotel is very quaint, sort of reminiscent of a bed and breakfast. The staff is SUPER friendly, accommodating - they greet you with a list of goodies that are complimentar (candy bars, soda, chips, etc.) and a list of free videos. Breakfast rolls and coffee is complimentary. There is a pool. Hotel guests have guest privileges at the Magic Castle which is up the hill about 100 yards - the hotel offers a free shuttle service to and from the Magic Castle which is good for ladies wearing high heels who don't want to risk the uphill climb. The room was "vintage" but clean, large bed, nice TV, amenities. This is a great way to get into the Magic Castle for dinner - the food was gourmet in description but not as tasty as the description suggested. It's good, not great, but then this is a club, not a restaurant, and the value of the night is not the food but the ambience which is SUPERB. There are several magic rooms with magicians doing performances or closeup magic for small groups - and nightly shows which during our trip included "Mr. Dead" with a tap dancing schtick by the world's oldest showgirl (87 years old and taps faster than a 20 year old!!). Drinks are served everywhere, there are 2 or 3 bars and a room where an invisible ghostly pianist named Irma plays anything you suggest - while we were there, Irma played a sophisticated opera tune, a classical fugue (very spooky), lots of pop tunes - and answered questions with songs/lyrics. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. We drove a rental car and there is secure parking underneath the hotel - the next day we drove to Beverly Hills and had lunch, then drove up the coast to walk on a secluded beach north of Malibu. We also could have walked down Hollywood Boulevard with is also walking distance. It's a really nice "Hollywood experience." A lot of people asked me, "How did you get into the Magic Castle - I thought it's a Magicians-only club!" - and I just said, "I stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel" - that's the secret.

Reviews.Title: “Great place. Wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: sdtravelers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in order to gain entrance to the Magic Castle. The hotel was a pleasant surprise. The staff was very friendly, they let us check in early, upgraded us to a bigger room, and had a cake a balloons in the room as a surprise for my birthday (we told them when we booked that we were going there to celebrate a birthday.) It's walking distance to the castle and they handled booking the dinner reservations for us. The hotel is older but the rooms are clean and comfortable, including the bed. They have a free snack bar, dvds to check out, and a nice continental breakfast. They also have secure parking for only $10. It's also just a block away from the sightseeing on Hollywood Blvd. I'd definitely recommend staying at this hotel. I think it's worth the extra money for the one bedroom suite. The suites are huge and come with a full kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Yeh, I liked it! It's all true.”
Reviews.Author: row481
Reviews.Content: I'd read all the reviews before I left so I was not surprised when we received free snacks and drinks, fantastic friendly service, large rooms-like a small apartment, simple but nice breakfast....the list goes on. The courtyard area around the pool has a wonderful relaxed feel about it. I can imagine sitting there on a warm night having a swim and a beer and chatting with other guests. It was great to stay somewhere where you can do a load of washing for $1 instead of paying high rates in 4-5 star hotels. The kids loved the hotel. They had their free snacks, free DVD, and swam in the heated pool. Our room had a lovely king size bed and the kids slept on a queen sofa bed. Yes, the room did smell a bit and the walls are thin but it wouldn't put me off staying there a second time- the rest of it was great. The location is wonderful. One stop on the metro to Universal- too easy. I was thinking originally that we'd stay in pasadena or Santa Monica but so glad we didn't as we had limited time. One day we returned to The Magic Castle from Universal and were pretty tired as we had just done open to close at Disneyland the 2 days previously, and we just wanted to have a wine and relax but didn't know were we could buy some so asked the staff. They were more than helpful, they actually provided us with a bottle of wine at no cost! Nice, friendly, go out of your way service is priceless when you're travelling. So a huge Thank you to everyone at The Magic Castle.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further...”
Reviews.Author: VitaminCplus
Reviews.Content: Great place that is situated a few minutes walk from the Chinese Theatre. Staff are remarkably helpful and nothing seems to be a problem. My wife and I had a late international flight and asked for a late checkout. 'No problem', said the front desk and our checkout was extended to 2 pm. If I were to fault the place, and I think these are minor issues, the bed we stayed in was a little hard and the room quite small. Most of the rooms are larger and we booked very last minute. But it didn't bother us as who really stays in their rooms in Hollywood? We had a great stay. Only wish we had enough time to go to the magic shows next door. Next time perhaps...

Reviews.Title: “I want to live here”
Reviews.Author: HullUKAnon
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault anything about this hotel. The rooms were excellent and the kitchen facilities meant that you could make use of the plentiful fresh ingredients from the local supermarkets nearby. The staff are friendly and efficient without being in your face. The free soft drinks are a welcome touch as is the 24 hour pool - great for early morning dips in the moonlight when jetlasgged!!! The location is also excellent which means you can hit the tourist spots such as the Chinese theatre in the early morning before the crowds and photograph to your hearts content. Dont miss the garlic hotdogs and fries at Skoobies on Hollywood Boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “old Hollywood reminiscent”
Reviews.Author: eytch2
Reviews.Content: My family (all 12 of us!!!) traveled to LA to see a show at the Pantages and were lucky enough to get to stay at the Magic castle. It's tucked away enough to feel like you're in old hollywood hills, but close enough to the action to walk and take the Metro anywhere you want to go! The service is incredible (starting with the lemonata greeting!), the extras are awesome! I'm missing my morning scone (delicious!!!) and coffee on the patio!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Gemma_8_1
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nothing special but the service here was excellent, and the free snacks, drinks, dvd's were brilliant altho we werent told about this at check in not sure why. We had a standard room which was fairly small but clean and fine for our stay, staff were extrememly friendly and helpful and I would return to this hotel. Upon arriving home I noticed they have charged 65p to my credit card, not sure what this was for as we settled our bill in cash before leaving, I havent been in touch since noticing it as its such a small amount. Note if u want to go to the magic show next door in the evening men need a formal suit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff & service, spacious suites - if you're visiting Hollywood, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been touring US since mid August, so have stayed in a lot of hotels. This is the first one that I have felt compelled to review immediately as it is such a great place to stay. It doesn't look much from the outside, as it blends in with the apartment blocks ( it isn't the fairytale castle that overlooks the busy street!)- but once inside, the staff make sure that you have everything you need. They are all genuinely happy to help and nothing is too much trouble (a big contrast to some of the places we've stayed in). There is no bar or restaurant but a delicious breakfast is served every morning(try the scones) and my daughter took full advantage of the free minibar service! The hotel can arrange a visit to 'The Magic Castle' just up the road. We went for Saturday brunch & were amazed by the magic shows (and the variety of food offered). Situated a short walk from Hollywood Boulevard, we had a great time here & would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't of been better!”
Reviews.Author: pinkdaisyfoot
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Magic Castle Hotel but i won't be my last. My friends and i had such a great time at this hotel starting with the location, 2 blocks to the Metro on Hollywood blvd that we took to Universal Studios for the Holloween Horror Nights. Couldn't of been easier and we avoided having to pay for parking our whole trip with the use of the metro. Upon checking in we were greeted with the most refreshing beverage in a champange flute, much appreciated after a 5 hour car ride, with no stops and the surprises didn't stop there from the popcicles being offered on our way back to our room to the complimentry snacks. On the only stay in night we were pleasently treated to a movie rental and then had the snacks to go with it. This hotel went way beyond the call of service when i lost my id and the Magic Castle Club the night before and the hotel upon hearing of this promptly called the club and just a minute later was told that the id was found and that they have it ready for me to pick up. The staff was so helpful and fast and because of the teamwork involved left me with no worries. We had a great time and a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “It's true - this is the perfect hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Ben B
Reviews.Content: Okay, so you might drive up and say "hmmm..." but once you enter the doors this place is *magical* - the staff is down to earth, friendly, courteous, and just truly cares about you. You're handed a drink as soon as you check-in, the rooms are huge, huge, huge. There's free internet, a free minibar stocked with goodies at all times, comfy beds, nice amenities, etc. If you're a snob, or are looking to be treated like a snob, save the staff and the rest of the guests from yourself and go to some 5-diamond hotel somewhere... but if you want to mingle amongst a bunch of other friendly people and be treated like family, stick with the Magic Castle Hotel. It's truly like having your own apartment in Los Angeles, and unlike all the super-expensive hotels in LA, you won't be staying in a tiny cube of a room and paying through the nose. Tip: go to the Magic Castle Club while there - it's a once-in-a-lifetime experience. Also, walk out of the hotel and in 2 minutes you're at hundreds of shops and can hop on the Metro to get to Universal Studios and all the cool stuff in Downtown Los Angeles! Thank you for everything, can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Holloywood”
Reviews.Author: sandster64
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is a great place to stay if you want to be steps from Hollywood Blvd! The staff is very accommodating, making sure that we had everything we needed. The pool is open 24 hrs, the front desk provides all the snacks and soft drinks you could possibly need, as well as a continental breakfast, free of charge . The suite style rooms come complete with comfy robes, kitchen utensils and wifi! We all loved our time at the Magic Castle!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of space. Incredible staff.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleJeeber
Reviews.Content: This is your place if you want a lot of room. These were obviously apartments at one time so, for the price, it's quite a deal. If you are wanting a bar with pool side service and a restaurant to go to, this is not your place. When we wanted that, we went to a hotel very close by and spent the day at their spa which included the kind of pool described above. Our room was slightly worn, but not in a way that would make me want to leave it. The street below was a bit noisy, but the roaring air conditioner covered it up well. The light breakfast served in the lobby is a very nice touch and was better that I expected it to be. The self serve coffee service in the room was of very good quality (this coming from someone from Seattle) and the plush robes were very nice. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. Any question or concern was quickly and professionally addressed. Directions, reservations, recommendations, whatever you wanted was met with a sincere desire to be of service. And the location in the heart of Hollywood is ideal. You can walk to a number of interesting sights and attractions. We took the subway to Universal Studios one day and were impressed with how nice it was. And it was only one stop away! Although this is not the kind of hotel I usually stay in, I would absolutely stay here again. It's just quirky enough to be extremely charming.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to the concierge, I experinced unforgettable nights in a Glamourous City”
Reviews.Author: LCrox
Reviews.Content: Upon reading many bad reviews about Hollywood and Los Angeles in general, I was not exactly excited about a weekend get away to Los Angeles. The tickets were bought "so let's just give it a shot," I said. To my surprise, the Magic Castle hotel was better in person than on the online pictures. Sure, Hollywood has heavy traffic, bums in all corners, and pissy pew sidewalks, so because of this I figured the concierge department would be my best bet. It was! I have to mention her... Caren Solis (and I know her name is right because I wrote it down specifically for this) was very amusing. She was very charismatic, and friendly. I figured she knew what she was doing. The staff in general were all very professional. Caren mapped out leisurely and fun things for me and my friends to do. At night we flocked the streets of H.Wood and Downtown LA, and by day we relieved out hangovers by lounging on the pool side. My weekend get away made me skeptical about LA’s bad rep. Check it out and see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Service Excellence”
Reviews.Author: AWilson28
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stay at Magic Castle on our honeymoon. It was by far the best hotel experience either of us have ever had. The hotel isn't brand new so the rooms were a little old, but always very clean and well maintained. The customer service at this hotel is second to none, and all the little extras like the free snacks just added to our experience (even if you don't eat them it's nice to know they're there!) The location is also very good, very close to Hollywood Blvd. Being able to go to the Magic Castle Club was also pretty cool - it was an experience!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: Travelerr07
Reviews.Content: We actually visited this hotel in May 2010, and had a wonderful stay!! The best thing about this hotel is their staff, they are extremely friendly and helpful! When we moved in, the receptionist welcomed us very warmly and offered us drinks. We were asking him for places to visit, and poor guy he printed for us the directions for those places to visit them. Very very helpful!! Something I will never forget, at one day I called the reception to ask for pair of sleepers for my room, and she told me that it is not available (because they do not offer it). So I was like "okay". Then, when I went out and came back in that evening, I was very surprised to see a new pair of sleepers on my bed. That was "magical"!! This hotel deserves to be called "Magic Castle Hotel", because it is like magic.. You ask what you want, and you get it. They will always try to make your stay comfortable, and if you need anything they will get it for you. They offered DVDs and snacks/drinks where always available. I would definitely return back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: katwomanAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last November with my sister in law and my 2 sons, aged 10 and 5. We all had a fantastic time! The staff are amazing, so nice and so incredibly helpful. Talk about location- It was a 5 min walk to Hollywood Boulevard! The kids loved the free snacks too! And the breakfast was great. Only downside was when we were there, there was construction outside our bedroom window from Franklin Avenue which woke us up. I am returnin there in less than 2 weeks with my best friend. I'm sure we will have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Need more stars - Stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: GardenwithaB
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here on the second half of our anniversary trip - first 3 days in a b&b, but the 2 nights at the Magic Castle Hotel was the most satisfying stay we've ever had at a hotel. Yes, it's clean and well kept up, but every single encounter we had with the staff was terrific - I want to know how management trains these young men and women, because every single one we spoke to was sincerely friendly, knowledgeable and unbelievable helpful and eager to please. Thanks, TripAdvisor for once again helping us find a special spot that we otherwise would never have known about. Oh, and getting to go to the Magic Castle is a pretty great perk too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, but one not so small problem...”
Reviews.Author: Fricker66
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights. A fantastic location for sightseeing, and for a family hotel, this was probably the best service I have ever received...anywhere...period. The endless free snacks for the kids, the recommendations of the staff, their responsiveness and just the general kindness with which they treated us was beyond compare. They even drove us up the hill to visit the weekly farmers market (If you are staying there, go up! Great wine and food!) We were put in a suite that did not overlook the pool. The suite was very large and comfortable and well-appointed...great for a family. The one significant problem was that our room smelled funny. It had a musty smell and it was very strong. The staff was constantly cleaning, so it was not a surface cleanliness issue. We advised the staff and they came in quickly with Febreze and then left a full container with us. It helped somewhat for the first night, and with each time we sprayed it masked the odor, but the smell was ultimately overpowering. We probably should have requested a room move, but we instead vowed not to spend any time there other than to sleep. That turned out to be a good thing as it kept the whole family out at the pool or in Hollywood doing fun stuff rather than watching TV. I regret giving a low rating for cleanliness because the rating really does not reflect the overall cleanliness of the hotel, which was very good. The smell alone knocked the rating down to 2 stars. When/if we go back, we'll request a room overlooking the pool. I have a feeling that the sliding glass doors patios permit the rooms to air out as we appear to be the only ones who had this problem.

Reviews.Title: “Top Service in a Top Location”
Reviews.Author: KiwiCuz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the numerous positive reviews. They were all right. I cannot praise the service and friendliness of the staff enough. Nothing was too much. We stayed for three nights. The rooms are spacious and had full kitchen facilities. Not the most modern but clean. The layout does have lots of stairs though so if your mobility is limited it might not suit. These are probably the only negatives. The kids loved the pool and the free drinks, popsicles etc. Breakfast was terrific and you could take it back to your room. Really saved some cost. Free Wifi too. Location is good too, for a short stay it made a good base for Hollywood and the train station is close too (one stop to Universal Studios and then a courtesy bus). There is also a small supermaket one block away which we used. But my overall memory of the place is still the excellence of the service. These guys have nailed it. Fantastic place for families and we would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, highly recomended, great location”
Reviews.Author: claire190747
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic, really great location close to the walk of fame, chinese theatre and kodak theatre. Short driving distance to universal studios, beverly hills, sunset blvd and rodeo drive. The hotel rooms were very spacious, clean and the pool was great. The staff were so friendly and the free snacks and soft drinks were so handy and saved us money. We all loved this hotel and would love to go back. I am so glad i found it as we had a really great time. It was very reasonable cost as well. The manager was so helful, friendly and attentive, helping recomend beaches and restaurants. Wouldnt hesitate to recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, characterful budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: tramp153
Reviews.Content: A great find in LA, very well located for Hollywood. It isn't luxurious, but the atmosphere is very friendly and their hospitality is imaginative. If you're sitting by the pool they bring round popsicles every now and then -- and they are offer a free mini-bar of confectionary, snacks and soft drinks which they'll deliver to your room. They also do a good free breakfast in the morning from a tiny space in the lobby, which you can eat on your room balcony or by the small pool. There's a genuine sense that they'll help out if you have a problem with something. Stayed in far more luxurious hotel in Las Vegas, with a twentieth of the character and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stace_steve_10
Reviews.Content: Loved staying here the service was fantastic. Great location and rooms were huge and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT.....just magnificent”
Reviews.Author: John44V
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Magic Castle Hotel in LA at the end of our 4 week-holliday in the USA. We enjoyed The Magic Castle Hotel very, very much: great location (just around the corner of Hollywood blvd and near Griffith Observatory) great facilities/amneties, spacy, quite and clean rooms, and last but not least very kind, helpfull and service- and clientcentered staff. If you want a good stay in LA you must go to the MGH. John Voets, the netherlands

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: angie-mc-0101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our holiday. The staff were fantastic - nothing was too much trouble. We had a pool facing ground floor room and felt perfectly safe sitting out at night due to the layout of the hotel. We did not suffer from any noise from the pool or other rooms at all. The room was spotlessly clean although the kitchen area was a bit dated but we were in LA to see the sights not the inside of a hotel room. The main bed was really comfortable but our teenagers found the sofa bed uncomfortable, maybe that could be looked out. The complimentary mini bar was a godsend for the children and the movies were a nice touch. (One surprise was there was a bottle of water in the room with a $4 charge, why do this when you are giving away sodas?) Breakfast was also very nice and fresh. Location was great a 2 minute walk from Hollywood Blvd and a short drive to Universal Studios. We also spent a day at Santa Monica Beach which although a little farther away it wasnt too hard to find or find our way back!!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: cmw669
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has left negative feedback for this hotel must be thinking of somewhere else. Sure it's not the flashiest and yes the pool is not large but it was comfortable, clean, rooms are large and the service is better than we have ever received anywhere. Even before we went the staff (thank you Marcus) booked activites for us and helped us with advice. The free "minibar", dvd library, popsicles at the pool are all really lovely touches that help make the stay great. Location is brilliant just one block from Hollywood Boulevard. If you have kids we'd recommend the brunch at the Magic Castle Magic Club on Saturday/Sunday - great fun and one of the things the hotel organised for us beforehand. If we ever go back to Hollywood we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “dirty, old and expensive”
Reviews.Author: anna018
Reviews.Content: way tooo expensive for something dirty.....old furniture......lack of service Looks more like a motel..........no way..choose something else Ants everywhere

Reviews.Title: “LA trip Aug 2010”
Reviews.Author: shant1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at LA. We were a family of 2 adults, 1teen and 1 child. Great hotel with family and children in particular. Ample parking at reasonable rates at the hotel. You could walk to Hollywood in 5mins. The children were impressed with the poolside snacks and dvds that they checked out each night. The staff were pleasant and remembered my request for a poolside suite during booking. The room was clean and neat. However I think the bathrooms though clean are due a renovation. The rooms were cleaned every day with any change of sheets and towels promptly carried out. The reception also printed me my boarding passes on my date of return. Only service lacking was I had to struggle to carry all luggage up a floor from my car on arrival. I thought that the effort that the hotel spends to welcome the guests- drink, candies etc was spoiled by lack of effort to take the guests to the room. Good spread of morning breakfast and fruits all day at the lobby. Would defiinitely recommend to all families for the rooms that we were allocated.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto to all the positive reviews!”
Reviews.Author: JupiterTwo
Reviews.Content: Just wrapped up a 3-day stay here and will echo what has already been said ~ great value, really genuinely nice staff, great free breakfast (the raisin scones are seriously amazing!), large quarters and super Hollywood location. Very highly recommended!!! Be aware that the underground parking is a bit tight (leave the Hummer at home and bring the Pruis instead ;), the WiFi can be a bit unreliable, no elevators, pool-facing rooms can be noisy, and there's wee bit a shabbiness to the rooms. If you are used to Ritz-Carlton-like vacation digs, you may not be happy here. We loved it and will absolutely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place To Stay in L.A!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sueeliz51
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Magic Castle again this year as we had such a fantastic time last year. It was every bit as good as last time. The staff are absolutely fantastic. We stayed up the hill as we did last time and it is so tranquil it seems a million miles from the hustle and bustle of Hollywood Boulevard. The beauty is that it's only a short walk away as is the metro. We travelled around on the metro which was easy and cheap. Pleaces to visit near by are Graumanns Chinese Theatre, The Kodak Theatre, Guiness Book of Records and the Hollywood Bowl is within walking distance. Not far away is a small supermarket so self catering is easy. To eat I reccommend Mel's Diner and Shelley's for breakfast. Although breakfast in the hotel is really good, everything is so fresh, my daughter particularly liked the iced cucumber water available in reception after a long day out sightseeing. I would reccommend this to anyone. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel, great location, great value for money”
Reviews.Author: dutchtourist7
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in this hotel and we liked it very much. The location is great, the service is very good and the staff is very friendly. The complimentary breakfast is simple but adequate. The room we had was large and it was a pleasure to have a kitchen. On some evenings we heard some noise from the pool, on other evenings it was very quiet. The only drawback for us was that when we checked in, the room that we reserved was not ready for us and therefore we had to spend our first night in two separate rooms. The staff did not charge us for this night. Still, we were unpleasantly surprised, especially because we made the reservation months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully unexpected magical experience - we didnt want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: scottishma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a month trip to States travelling with teenage boy and girl. We had booked on the internet and some of the reviews were a bit mixed so we weren't expecting too much. BUT - it was just wonderful! They sent a driver to pick us up at the airport - cost less than a taxi fare and much more fun. A really attentive and helpful welcome on arrival. Our room was absolutely spotless and lovely touches like the had set the bed side radios to be playing gentle classy music when you went in, and we also had a chocolate cake because we'd let them know it was my birthday trip. Staff were the most helpful I have ever come across - everyone from the porter, the reception staff, the maids were falling over themselves to help. Complementary breakfast which you could eat by the nice sunny pool, or take back to your room - great choice of fresh baked pastries, cereals and fruit. An added bonus was the guest laundry - really cheap $3 I think - and so necessary when travelllng with kids. The location was great too - only 5 minutes from the madness of Hollywood Boulevard - but 5 minutes from Runyon Canyon where you could hike or jog. Also just short walk to the subway that takes you straight to Universal Studios. There is free wireless in the rooms, and free soft drinks and snacks at reception, as well as videos. All great to keep teenagers happy. We would definately go back - a real unexpected gem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and a great location”
Reviews.Author: clhorton
Reviews.Content: Upon planning our family trip, I read reviews on the hotels for Los Angeles through Trip Advisor, and loved the comments about the Magic Castle Hotel. It was everything everyone said about it....great service....the front desk people couldn't have been nicer, along with recommending restaurants to us, and even ordering our pizza for us. The suite we got was wonderful, my kids loved all the snacks, great continental breakfast, and if I would have sent postcards, they would have provided the stamps, and the laundry soap if we would have done laundry. To sum it all up in my 17 yr. old's words, "Mom, how much are you paying for this place a night, because the service makes it worth $500 a night!"

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience delivered by well trained customer focused personnel”
Reviews.Author: EdwardNaylor
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have visited California on many occasions during the last few years, we found the Magic Castle Hotel some 2 years ago and have seen significant improvement particularly in the infrastructure of the building during our visits to Hollywood. We were always impressed by the overall friendliness of the hotel staff and their desire to always help and go the extra mile. The management of the hotel have undertaken a strategic room by room refurbishment which is beginning to match the staff's enthusiasm for delivering outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and people!”
Reviews.Author: NY11235
Reviews.Content: We were in LA for family reuninon. We chose this hotel because of the reviews and they weren't wrong. The hotel is in a great location and staff are friendly and very helpful. Minibar service (free) is great. We know where to go next time.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest hotel entire trip!”
Reviews.Author: 1968Sandra
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for three days and it was absolutely amazing. De staff is so friendly and they do everything to let you feel comfortable. We travelled with our four children, age 11 and 14, and they got ice cream at the swimming pool, candy, soda and chips, as much as they wanted. So we had to temper them now and than. They even made us some coffee at the day we were leaving. The two bedroom suite was spacious, but a bit old. Some stains in the carpet and a bit noisy. Next time we'll ask for an apartment in the main building at the swimming pool, i think they are better. For us this hotel was a great experience and we hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Not all rooms are created equal...”
Reviews.Author: busywkids
Reviews.Content: Although we requested a 2nd floor suite overlooking the pool, they were not able to accomodate us and placed us in a 2nd floor suite that faced Franklin St. That turned out to be a big mistake because Franklin St is busy and noisy 24/7. There was constant traffic that woke us up several times during the nite, and on our first nite there some person was screaming out intermittently at 3am for 20-30 minutes. Don't know who it was, but there are homeless people camped out right across the street from the hotel. The suite was roomy but old and surely did not look as new/modern as some of the pictures taken by previous visitors, which could only mean that some suites have been renovated more recently. If we had only known... Other cons with the room included an ant problem in the bathroom (when we brought attention to it at the front desk, the lady there acted like it was the first time she had ever heard of such a thing, even though other reviewers have spoken of a similar problem), which they attempted to correct with ant spray, but the smell lingered and the ants came back intermittently. Also, the bathroom was small, the paint was chipping off of the bathtub, and the bathtub drain would back up if you showered for too long. The DVD player could not be connected to the TV in the living room (even the maintenance guy couldn't fix it), so the kids could only watch their DVDs in the bedroom (that was a bit inconvenient). The wi-fi connection was spotty, and there was surprisingly a lack of utensils in the kitchen (only provided 2 forks and 2 spoons) for a family suite. Also, for those who aren't aware, there is a daily parking fee of $10. Otherwise, the staff was friendly and responded quickly to any problems. The free minibar was a real plus for everyone, and the staff was always generous in asking if we needed any more for our excursions. Location is great, as it is just a couple of blocks to the walk of fame, mann's chinese theater, kodak theater, etc. Also, it's just a couple of miles from Universal and the Hollywood sign. Also, the continental breakfast was fine, with a selection of cereals, oatmeal, scones/pastries, juices, fruit...good when you're on the go. All in all, expected a bit more for the cost and will probably research other hotels if we're in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “You would be mad not to stay here!!!! My...”
Reviews.Author: orla_8
Reviews.Content: You would be mad not to stay here!!!! My family and I spent 5 nights here in mid July , had a one bed suite , 2 children age 10 & 8 slept fine on sofa bed & our bed v comfortable,space huge , kitchen fully equipped , nice toiletries & robes in bathroom,yes all minibar free just have to ask they even give u bags to carry back to your apartment, pool lovely, we used to send kids down to bring breakfast up to us.....!always plenty no pressure to rush down early!!only quibble no lift for luggage but plenty of offers of help from v friendly staff, this is a gem of a hotel & having just come from 4 seasons in Santa barbara which was lovely too but this was a better experience at fraction of the price.5 min walk to centre of Hollywood bld where all the hype is ..... If u r lucky enough to get a reservation here enjoy!!!keep up the good work lads you put a lot of 5 stars to shame

Reviews.Title: “Believe all the raves ... it's absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: EC_Bill
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying here July 9 - 13 and loved every second. Gretchen and Jason at the Front Desk could not have been more helprful. So much to rave about: the super location one block from Hollywood Boulevard, the free snacks, the heated pool, the yummy breakfasts ... just everything. We even saw the Sunday Brunch show at the Magic Castle and my wife was brought up on stage by the magician. You can even get discount tix to local attractions like Universal Studios. You will not be dissapointed. Hey ... it's Magic!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, Great service, Comfortable suite”
Reviews.Author: Luv2g0lf
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very conveient to everything we wanted to see in Los Angeles while we were vacationing there. The staff could not have been more service oriented, starting with the lemonade served in champagne flutes at check-in to the free laundry detergent provided. They were very sincere in making sure that all of our needs were met. The hotel is a bit dated but the courtyard setting and the suite environment with the kitcheonette makes up for that nicely. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling with family.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a chain hotel this isn't it... it's better!”
Reviews.Author: elleinad_789
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel July 12-14. It began very smoothly and the front desk staff was awesome! These people have some of the best customer service skills I have ever encountered at a hotel and they are willing to help you with anything! The room was pretty good (two double beds) and the full kitchen was definitely very helpful... especially considering we didn't want to have to eat out every night! Pool was warm at night and parking was safe and secure and also the safety deposit box in the room was great. The free snacks were a good touch and the continental breakfast was good if you had good timing. Overall one of the best hotels we stayed at in California! It may be a little older but it's definitely welcoming and comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle, has the most welcoming employees, best service with amazing concerns and smiles!”
Reviews.Author: amendoza_18
Reviews.Content: I loved Magic Castle, Karen & the night shift employees are so sweet and welcoming, that day we previously had a bad experience with a hotel next door the Hollywood celebrity hotel, we had booked there and when we arrived, the clerk then mentioned that are booked hotel room was no longer available, the Hollywood celebrity didn't even contact us once by phone email or anything, we became very furious, right across the street we found yours Magic Castle, from the very first time we stepped in we were treated with amazing service, Ive never been treated so well by any other hotel! Thanks so much, i will definitely be staying again when I'm out in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: TheNinjas
Reviews.Content: Ok- to get this out of the way: if you are a fancy person looking for a luxurious hotel, this is not for you. But if you are a regular person looking for a wonderful hotel that is full of charm, with a warm, friendly, helpful staff, the you have found a gem. My husband and I went to a concert at the Hollywood Bowl to celebrate our anniversary and decided to spend the night nearby to make it a vacation. A few days before our stay we got an email letting us know they were looking forward to our stay and wishing us a happy anniversary. When we arrived we were upgraded to a one-room suite (complete with balcony overlooking the pool) and had a bottle of wine, card and cake waiting for us in the room. Seriously, that kind of personal service just does not exist in the world of chain hotels. The staff was completely accommodating and helpful- they seemed to genuinely want to help in any way possible. The hotel has a cozy layout around the courtyard pool, and offered a lovely breakfast in the morning. It felt like we had our own little hip L.A. apartment. Sure, the carpets had a little wear and tear, but for the price, it is truly a steal and you won't find nicer staff anywhere. Go. Now. You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and staff, but not the room”
Reviews.Author: MissWhitey
Reviews.Content: The staff were overly nice, and the location we perfect. About a 3 min walk to Hollywood Blvd and the Chinese Theatre. You are also given a menu of complimentary drinks and snacks to get from reception throughout your stay, which was great. The room was nothing like the website would suggest. We stayed in a double room which certainly hadn't been renovated. It was clean, but old and small and a bit dingy. It was the most expensive hotel of our trip and by far the worst room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tracydoyle
Reviews.Content: It was just my husband and I this time, but I have already recommended the Magic Castle to various friends with kids. The suite was large and comfortable with great amenities like free WiFi, flatscreen televisions in the bedroom and livingroom, and a great kitchen. The room was quiet and I slept in daily while my husband frequented the pool. The hotel is exceptionally well-managed and the staff super friendly. Whether it was a request for a petite breakfast at noon or we were taking advantage of the free snacks and beverages, the service was always dispensed efficiently and with a smile. All in all, the hotel is one that I would recommend unhesitantly!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing oasis in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: gapngo
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for a better place to call home base during our stay in LA. The staff members we met were all very friendly and welcoming. The location was central for all we wanted to do and see. I loved the ambiance of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey P
Reviews.Content: My immediate and extended family all stayed at the Magic Castle at the beginning of June for five nights. We enjoyed every minute. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful and made us feel so welcome - hotel management should be very proud of their employees. We arrived quite late on the first night and the staff (thoughtfully) put us in a ground floor room so as to make it easier with luggage and two kids...however after we complained about the noise (we were very very close to the pool area) we were moved to another room that was further away and perfect. Our room was a one bedroom apartment that was actually larger than some apartments my husband and I have lived in! It had a large renovated kitchen, living area with sofabed for our daughter, hallway with lots of storage cupboards and a large separate bedroom. Our friends stayed in another one bedroom apartment that had not yet been as recently renovated so I can see why some guests would not be happy, however even so - the space makes it a perfect base for families visiting the area. A suite in a hotel would not be as large and would cost a LOT more. The hotel is not brand new, there is some work to do, but we have stayed in five star hotels that had nicer rooms and have not had nearly as good a time as the staff had been so rude. We will take nice people and a bit more space anytime. We will be staying here again when we return to LA next year. Thank you Magic Castle!

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOOD”
Reviews.Author: jett_9
Reviews.Content: The staff wase awesome!!!!! The room smelled like pee--- really strong pee. I Asked for airfreshner and it did not help! It was so strong that I could not sleep. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as this website would suggest”
Reviews.Author: SoontobeMrsStewart
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel on account of the price and the reviews on this website. Although we enjoyed our stay, there is no way this hotel is LA's number one hotel. The staff are incredibly polite and helpful, but that is about the only bit I can't find fault with. Our room (a studio) was small and very dated with a view of the wall of another part of the building. The A/C in the room also looked like a very old system and was incredibly noisy, meaning you couldn't sleep with it on so your sleep is disturbed due to the heat. Worst of all, our bed was crawling with ants from the second day onwards! They were all over the duvet, pillows and valance sheets and also all over my bag and clothes. We reported it but were told this is normal for the time of year. I'm interested to know if anyone else experienced this? I struggle to believe they couldn't do anything about it. Breakfast is a bit of a chaotic experience as the food is assembled over just a few tables in the lobby and if you time it badly, it's too difficult to get to the food to enjoy the experience. I had such high expectations of this hotel based on their own website and this one but found it a massive disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “MARVELOUS”
Reviews.Author: SinatraDJ
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I play the Close-Up Gallery at the Magic Castle. Spent one week with Robert Morse, who was in L.A. acting in a stage production. Never know who you will bump in to.

Reviews.Title: “A unique hotel with wonderful amenities.”
Reviews.Author: ifindkarma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night with a friend, on June 10, 2010. The room was spacious and clean and quiet, the bed was comfortable, and the minibar was stocked with lots of magical goodies. Marcus and the wonderful staff really made sure everything was perfect. Thanks to them, I enjoyed a wonderful meal and show at the Magic Castle, a midnight swim, a walk on the Hollywood Walk of Stars at 3am, and another swim in the morning in which the hotel brought us goodies while we swam. I've never found another hotel like this -- and I will gladly stay here again anytime I'm in Hollywood!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location and service not to be beaten”
Reviews.Author: clarestone
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just a few weeks ago with my husband. Loved every minute of it. Great location for a quick trip to LA. Strongly recommend a night out next door at the Magic Castle for a fun way to spend the evening with good food and entertainment - just another reason why to chose this place. Other reasons to choose this place: secure free parking; surprisingly quiet, spacious rooms; excellent service and genuinely friendly staff; complimentary breakfast, snacks and cold drinks; just steps from Hollywood Blvd walk of fame and all those touristy things you have to see (thus saving you an otherwise nasty little drive and parking dilemma); and great value. We didn't use the laundry or the pool but these also add up.

Reviews.Title: “spacious, large modern suites, great location, lovely extras”
Reviews.Author: ilasik
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom suite for couple of nights with our 12 y.o twins. The size and decor of the room was a pleasant surprise - light, spacious, contemporary furniture. Big kitchen was never used but it was nice to have Bed very comfortable, really liked citrus-flavored toiletries. The hotel surroundings are a little beat up but clean. The pool is on the small size but lots of people seemed to be enjoying it. Did not have any issues with noise Again, loved the snacks, used the hotel shuttle to have lovely dinner at Yamashiro, quick walk to Chinese theater. Next to it is a big mall - if you climb to the third level it is a great vista point to take pix of the HOLLYWOOD sign. Parking was $10/day. Front desk super helpful. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Service, Service, Service”
Reviews.Author: beawade
Reviews.Content: My teens loved this hotel! Greeted with lemonade and a list of snacks envied by the hershey and mars companies. Yes, it is a bit older, but look at the rest of the dated neighborhood; they've updated the rooms. You enter the rooms which have lots of natural light, and classical music greets you. Air freshener smells good in the rooms. Tons of closet space in our room. The continental breakfast is exactly that: but we were satisfied. Boxed kellogg's cereals, yogurt, granola, juice, coffee, toast, scones, mini muffins. It is more than enough. The walk to Graumann's Chinese theater was one block. Front desk staff is phenomenal! Very knowledgeable about the area and are very accommodating. DVD's available at lobby. Room was very clean except for a few scouter ants in the bathroom and kids bedroom. Two of my kids slept in the living room area and were kept awake by other guests swimming around the clock and slamming the gates. Neither my husband or I heard the noise; daughter in 2nd bedroom didn't hear it either. We had to check out but they allowed us to keep our vehicle in underground parking until we left in the late afternoon. The night before, we had stayed at disneyland's Grand Californian where they wouldn't accomodate our family of five and my husband had to sleep on the floor. He finally got sleep at the Magic Castle Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very, very good”
Reviews.Author: PERANN
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights enroute to Australia after a six week holiday. We arrived late in the evening and were greeted by a very friendly person who helped us to our suite of rooms which was a great surprise. Although this hotel is older and maybe has a fewscratches around the edges it is very very good. we are an older couple and the only downside id that luggage has to be carried up and down stairs. We had help on arrival and I'm suer if we had asked on departure we would also have been helped. Extras in the way of drinks and nibbles were always available and the staff were so very helpful in every way. If we had known that we could book Dinner and Show at the Magic Castle Club on booking our accomodation we would have done so. Thank you so much for a great stay. Annette and Perry

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle hotel was terrible.”
Reviews.Author: ianfreo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel between 6 to 9 June 2010. It was a terrible experience, the room was small the walls paper thin you could hear the people in the next room talking, the Mattress was rock hard and squeaked everytime you turned over . This is avery old hotel that is need of some tender loving care. Do not pay in advance as I did because I think you get the worst room and service.The owners provide you with sweets and drinks to cover the inadequacy of the hotel.Breakfast was nice pool looked okay and staff were reasonable although they deducted money from my credit card for things I didn"t use and told me it would take 5 days to be recredited which is riduclous.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our experience from entrance to exit”
Reviews.Author: mellowmomoftwo
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel while looking for hotels close to West Hollywood. We were looking for a heated pool, breakfast, and as always close to the main attractions. After searching thoroughly, decided the amenities were worth the price. Upon arrival, was unsure how I would like it because it is rather quaint at first glance. At check in, it was clear the staff was willing to go the extra mile to help you enjoy your stay. From soda and popsicles poolside to movies and popcorn for the room, we loved all the little extras that came with our time at Magic Castle. We have definitely just become lifetime guests.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: beau07
Reviews.Content: OMG! this hotel was great! we were driving around the hollywood area and looking for a relatively inexpensive hotel for the night. we thought the name was great, but thought maybe the hotel would be...not so great. boy were we wrong! the staff at the hotel could NOT have been nicer. lisa, who greeted us at check-in, was so incredibly friendly and helpful and nice. it's a small hotel, which i loved, but i think the staff is what makes it. the room was the best of all the hotels we stayed in our week long trip to LA. we had the 'junior suite' , which had two queen beds and a small kitchen. the front desk offers complimentary snacks 24 hours/ complimentary dvd's to watch in your room/ complimentary breakfast. just overall, a wonderful stay...can't say enough good things and will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with just a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Abel2go
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very convenient location - a few blocks from Hollywood tourist sites, public transit and a big shopping center but far enough away to be out of the hustle and bustle. The staff were always very accommodating and wanted to make sure our stay was going well.
