They offer nice extras such as a continental breakfast in the AM; a variety of snacks and soft drinks by request at the front desk and DVDs to borrow. The only caveats would be that the parking ($10/night) is hard to navigate with a full size sedan or minivan so bring a compact car and be aware that all entrances to the hotel have stairs. There are no elevators so this might not be the best choice if stairs are difficult for anyone in your group.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great location & Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Ipoxy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and was very pleasurly suprised. We had booked the hotel through experia a way in advance, and since it was a weekday we got a very good price. At arrival on hotel we were met by a charming lady who did her best to make us feel welcome. We recived a refreshing welcome drink, were told of the benefits they offered, got a good recommondation about where to shop and eat and to top it all she upgraded our stay from a traditional double room to a suite. The suite was huge, and clean, the room was very pleasurable to us and we got way more than we paid for. However if your stay is most about having the newest room, with the fanciest gadgets, you probarbly can find better somewhere else. By remodeling the hotel i guess it could be a realy glamours hotel, but I rather keep the GREAT service and friendly atmostphere and the price we paid, rather than to upgrade the hotel. The benefits they offered included a number of soft drinks, chips, chocolate, candy and more, all for free. They also offered a list of dvd you could borrow for free. In the middle of the hotel area there was a decent pool which is open for use 24 hours a day, the only thing they ask is that you keep the noise level down during night hours. The hotel is located just a short walk (under 5 min) from the walk of fame of Hollywood. Here we did some shopping, some sightseeing and got some tasty food for dinner. I will defenetly book this hotel again in future LA stays.

Reviews.Title: “The Bates motel is alive...dirty, dingy and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: quicktraveler2010
Reviews.Content: I had read all the excellent reviews on Trip Adviser and was very eager to get to the Magic Castle Hotel. Well, as soon as we arrived we were greeted by a lovely young man who was enthusiastic and welcoming. He offered refreshing lemonade and then walked us to the room (even waited for us to get in). So yes, the service is more personable that any other hotel I have stayed in. Although the overall hotel needs a revamp...and quick! When I walked into my room I was a little shocked... outdated, dirty furniture and scuffs all over the walls. The kitchen and bathroom were worse - peeling paint and begging for a bulldoze. As we got in very late in the evening, I decided to stay in and check my email. I connected quickly to the free wi-fi, although found over the course of my stay that it was an unreliable connection that dropped out every 10 minutes or so and one evening would not connect at all! None of the TV remotes worked...I suppose it is a little too much to check the batteries every now and then? And the lounge room was infested with ants...they proceeded to crawl all over me whenever I sat on the couch. Oh and a moth was flying around in the bedroom when we went to bed. The whole place just felt dirty, like you needed to give the chair a wipe before you sat on it. I was glad to have brought my disinfectant wipes - they came in handy! Stains all over the furniture, from the couch to the footstools and carpet too. The linens on the bed also had stains on them, and we had to request they be changed. The air-conditioning units rattled and rolled all night long. The hotel was quite noisy overall...from the pool area, to the slamming doors, the thin walls of the room which meant you could hear everything! I was even kept awake all night listening to the loud snoring coming from the next room. And don't be fooled by the free mini-bar...you have to ask every time you want something, which really defeats the purpose of a 'free mini-bar'. The breakfast was average, given you had to get up very early or miss out. The highlights - the staff! Absolutely the nicest and friendliest bunch of people. The breakfast scones were delicious too, and we also loved the 'turn down service' of mint chocolates with a note on the follwoing day's weather. You could not request for a better location...very close to the famous Hollywood Boulevard and public transport of the red metro line. It is such a shame that a place with such excellent customer service falls short on the rest. The Magic Castle Hotel needs a revamp of the decor and interiors...from the outside it can look like Melrose Place but peer in a little closer and you feel like you have ventured into the Bates Motel. What a shame, with so much hype we were left feeling ripped off and in need of a shower!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel & Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: longy7925
Reviews.Content: as above, the hotel is fantastic, we arrived 11pm and were greeted by lovely reception staff, they already knew we were on honeymoon and gave us a balcony suite which was very big, clean and had everything we would ever need, also handed a glass of lemon each which was nice touch, you are given a free complimentary breakfast in the morning which is very nice, muffins, toast, coffee, orange etc, whats great about this hotel is the customer service you get from the free snack list to choose from, (yes its free) from m&ms, skittles, sodas, crisps and also the dvd rental list, about 100 dvds they have which you can rent, location is also ideal, literally one block from main hollywood boulevard, i would recommend getting either taxi or driving to THE GROVE in fairfax, some great shops and food overall great stay to end whats been a great american adventure, many thanks magic castle :)

Reviews.Title: “Everything great !”
Reviews.Author: Alban_Marion
Reviews.Content: We were perfectly welcomed at the Magic Castle Hotel (Thank you Lisa and Jason). This is well located for people wanted to see the hollywood boulevard, and only one metro station from Universal Studios. The swimming pool is in the middle of the hotel permitting to meet all the hotel customers. For the breakfast, you serve yourself what you want and can eat in your room or better, under the sun near from the swimming pool. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Apartment”
Reviews.Author: SOF-007
Reviews.Content: This is not really a hotel, more like your own apartment. It had own kitchen, dining area and lounge. It was a lovely place to stay and the staff were really friendly and helpful, where the apartments surrounded the swimming pool. Non cooked breakfast but you are near plenty of places to eat. Its 2 minutes from the Hollywood Walk of Fame and the Chinese Theatre, and the tube. Has parking garage, but charges $10 a day. There is internet but again additional charges. It was great to have a balcony where you can smoke (although rooms are non-smoking), instead of having to go downstairs to the entrance of the hotel (as in other places I have stayed in California). Would definately stay here again if in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in central location Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: FunintheSun111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with family of three children and husband. Loved how central it was to Hollywood Blvd and Hollywood attractions, such as Universal Studios! Walked to Hollywood Blvd which was only two blocks away. Universal Studios was a 10 minute drive in our rental car. We were lucky to witness the red carpet world premiere of Iron Man 2 on our last night there, right on Hollywood Blvd! Service was outstanding, the kids loved the complimentary snacks! The staff was very friendly and made sure we had a cot set up as soon as it was available. They had a little birthday cake for my son's birthday, which he absolutely loved! We truly felt like VIP guests at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: travelbuff68
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Magic Castle. Every staff member we encountered over our five day stay was super friendly and helpful. And we loved all the little extras they provided: a nice, basic continental breakfast we could take to our room, mints on every bed in the suite, complimentary snacks and soft drinks and movies from the front desk, etc. Location was perfect, only a 5 minute walk from Hollywood Boulevard, yet far enough away to not hear traffic noise. Our suite felt more like an apartment, and it was wonderful having our own kitchen and dining room. A great value for what we paid, and we would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest service ever”
Reviews.Author: duffersarethebest
Reviews.Content: The people were friendly, helpful, and energetic to please - personnel were as good as I have ever seen -

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: christinap92
Reviews.Content: I had the best experience staying at the magic castle hotel. Everyone that works there is incredibly nice and personable, and my friends and I were upgraded to a larger room with a better view as soon as we checked in. They also have cookies and any other snacks and drinks you want available for free in the lobby at all times. I had four girls total staying, and that one room was more than large enough for all of us to have plenty of space. We also had a large balcony and an amazing view of the Hollywood Hills. Every morning someone would come and deliver our complimentary breakfast to our room along with whatever juices we wanted, it was such a great day to get our day started. We also had our own parking spot for only 10$ per day/night, which is incredible for Hollywood. I have zero complaints about the hotel, everything was perfect and for the price, it is almost ridiculous. I love the Magic Castle and have had all my friends stay there since my first trip. I'm coming back to the area in a month and already have the hotel booked :) And the staff is as good as it gets anywhere. Loved them.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location but the magic is fading due to shabby room condition”
Reviews.Author: Tony_No
Reviews.Content: Several years ago I spent 4 great nights at Magic Castle in a 1 bed suite so was very much looking forward to our return visit. This time we spent 8 nights at the property and stayed in a 2 bed suite. There is still much to like; the location is great for all the LA attractions and the staff are still really amazing and very helpful. However, our 2 bed suite was a disappointment. Many of the cheaper 1 bed suites have balconies, the more expensive ($350 per night!) 2 beds don't. As a result of its position the suite was always dark and never got direct sunlight. And while the public areas (and in particular the pool and lobby) remain in good condition it just felt like it was getting shabby. There were signs of shabbiness in all the rooms but the large bedroom in particular where my wife and I slept just had an unacceptable amount of knocks and scuff marks everywhere. A bodged repair paint job on the AC unit had been done which looked horrible and there were some (minor) stains on the door (see photos). Obviously it is not realistic to expect a hotel to repaint walls every time a guest scuffs the walls, but this room was WAY overdue for redecoration. At the very least, a member of staff should have been in the room wiping down the walls with a bucket and sponge to clean the doors/walls to make it look less grubby. I did mention this (twice) to the front desk and they promised to pass it on to maintenance but they did not want to come see the issues for themselves (it felt like my complaint was not news to them) and nothing improved in my remaining 6 nights in the hotel. I hope the hotel are not trying to milk their reputation by under investing in upkeep of the rooms. I can't recommend the 2 bed suites, particularly at the price Magic Castle now charge, and I would be cautious about going back to any of their rooms unless I had confidence that the room was in good decorative order. So I'm sorry to say that in contrast to my 5/5 review the first time I stayed there, this time, and despite the great staff, it is only 3/5.

Reviews.Title: “Disgraceful Castle”
Reviews.Author: Jack123Australia
Reviews.Content: My Family of five had booked this hotel months in advance due to its great reviews on Trip advisor. No disrespect to Trip Adv as the rest of my USA holiday was based from its reviews on accommodation and local attractions were spot on, but this place left a very sour taste in our mouths in an otherwise great overseas holiday. We holidayed in Vegas, NYC, Tennessee, and (in the end, alternate LA accommodation) and this place was a disgrace!. We arrived at about 3.30-4pm in the afternoon and (after struggling by ourselves with about 6 bags of our luggage up the stairs) were greeted by a polite young man and woman who greeted us with a glass of soda squash each. We were informed that the room we requested with a roll away wasn't available, but they had organized a room with all our bedding requirements in their "sister apartments above the current hotel next to a Japanese restaurant". I asked if the rooms were of the same standards as the original rooms I viewed on the net, and she replied "oh yes but with a much more fantastic view". I thought OK until she said' and we will also drop your room rate back to $99 a night". And that's when the alarm bell started. We were shuttled up the hill by the young man Marcus(who always I must say was polite through this) to a what looked liked a 'hostel" complex. He unloaded our luggage and pointed to a hallway which was partially blocked by bags of rubbish to venture down to find our room. By this time my family and I were extremely concerned, but after Marcus opened the door ushered us in and quickly departed we noticed our concern was more than warranted. This place was a disgrace. The tiles were chipped, stained, and where the tiles met the fridge there was a 1-2 inch gap full of dirt and grit. And this was at the kitchen near the entrance. The blinds were falling off the ceiling, paint peeling off the walls and veranda and numerous stains everywhere. I sat stunned, and I never complain as a rule but i was really ##** off at this point, and so I rang reception and said to Marcus, this room was not up to my expectations of this hotel and could I be moved back to my original booking at the previous hotel. He said"oh, i will ring you back". He then rang back and said" we have had some flooding in your original room that was booked and it is undergoing repairs, and if this current room isn't adequate I will give you assistance in finding another room at another hotel". I replied to Marcus, if this was the case why wasn't I contacted by phone or email, and sensing his nervousness, I asked when the flooding occurred, and his response was "I don't know". I then informed him that I had only booked this room from the reviews on Trip Advisor and only then he informed me he would ring and talk to his manager. He rang me back about five minutes later and said I could have a room in the original hotel the next night and they would comp my current room for that nights stay. I declined and asked him to find me alternate accommodation elsewhere. He could find nothing to my liking so a found accommodation elsewhere myself. All up I felt humiliated that I was, I think duped of my original room, and told a falsity about the flooding, due to the fact that if a flooding had occurred that someone would have known when. Every other hotel I stayed in the states including my final hotel in LA was above my expectations of room and service. This place was disgrace! AND SO WERE THE ROOMS. Ps I also spent almost two hundred dollars in peak our traffic from the airport, to this hotel and finally to my final destination in cabs and shuttle hire. I await with interest the managers reply, if any. JCB.

Reviews.Title: “Reminds me of the crappy apartments from my days at UCLA”
Reviews.Author: Chug_in_OC
Reviews.Content: I went there based on the reviews of this site and was not impressed. I will stay elsewhere next time. First the good. The location was perfect for our night at the Hollywood Bowl. The parking is no hassle, unlike some of the other properties that are close to the Bowl on Highland that stack park. There are plenty of dining options nearby. There are free snacks and drinks at the front desk and the staff could not be more helpful. I also enjoyed the morning paper and the breakfast scones. The Magic Castle Hotel, however, was transformed from an apartment building, one that reminded me of the crappy, cheap apartments in West LA, Palms, and Hollywood that my friends and I inhabited while attending UCLA. We were relegated to a small room in the back, one that had been the bedroom of a converted apartment. It had that familiar smell and cheapness that brought me back to days that I thought had long since passed. The bed kind of felt that way too, and had not a hint of luxury - or even $161 a night. Yeah, you can see where they did spend some money to fix things up and make things nice, but that is the problem, it totally obvious. When all was said and done I think I can do better for the nearly $200 I paid (tax and parking) next time I go to the Bowl. Chug

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location for Hollywood and LA”
Reviews.Author: Jaz3000
Reviews.Content: Great service and very welcoming. Good underground parking at reasonable daily rate. Fantastic check in service and friendly staff throughout stay. Very good complimentary breakfast and daughters enjoyed free DVD service and drinks and snacks. Very large studio which was however, in need of makeover - very tired decor and pullout bed in lounge could also do with replacing as daughters complained that springs poking through. Also when asked for duvet for their bed, was told this was not provided for the room. Whilst could do with a refurb, this would probably push up the price and for families on a weekend or short stay whilst travelling through LA, we could not fault the staff and location for our base to see LA

Reviews.Title: “A Treasure in Hollywood where service is king”
Reviews.Author: Vodkaonice
Reviews.Content: We used Trip Advisor reviews to select this hotel. After Disneyland we stayed a couple of days in LA. This very cool "Melrose Place" style building has been converted into a lovely boutique hotel. It was spotless, the room was fantastic, the pool was wonderful, but the service blew us away. Seasoned travellers know the drill with hotels, bored desk clerks and uniformed mistreated workers following a script that feels hollow. You want a genuine helpful wonderful hotel experience, come to this place. Our children FREAKED out over the unlimited free snacks. I won't even admit how many times they went back to get goodies.. and maybe a few times for us. One night we didn't feel like braving the traffic, and craved chicken and ribs. The whole front desk crew went to work to find us a place that boasted good food and delivered. They found us a place, looked up the menu on line, called to make sure the place delivered, and then walked the menu up to our room. That is one example of about 20 over the call of duty things that these folks did for us. Parking is secure, this place is a 3 minute walk from the Chinese Theatre on Hollywood BLVD, and the pool is heated salt water and nobody is stingy with towels or anything else. My only advice is don't take a room at the front of the hotel. The automatic doors rattled us out of bed all night. Take a suite with a balcony at the back of the building overlooking the pool. You will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Magic!”
Reviews.Author: Lost_Weekenders
Reviews.Content: If you get a chance to stay here, do it! And don't skip the real Magic Castle next door. We stayed for two nights while visiting family and could not have enjoyed ourselves more. Great staff, clean room, continental breakfast, nice pool, on-site parking. The highlight, by far, was our night spent seeing performers at the Magic Castle. Dinner, card tricks, comedy, magicians, billiard balls appearing out of nowhere - amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ezpass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Magic Castle Hotel for 3 nights and we enjoyed it very much. I've booked this hotel based on recommendations on Trip Advisor, and as usual I was not disappointed. As soon as we arrived, we received a refreshing lemonade, and explanation how to get to the Chinese theater, which is within 3 minutes walk. The room we got (for four guests, two queen beds) was large and spacious, and included a full kitchen, well equipped and accessorized. (we bought products in a nearby supermarket and prepared light meals). The room also contained a large dining corner that allowed us to sit comfortably and eat (or work, if necessary). The room had a free wireless internet connection. The bathroom was small but nice, including good quality cosmetics. The television set was little disappointing (not a flat screen) and too small for the size of the room. But anyway, we did not come to Los Angeles to watch TV. Heated pool was great. The children swam in it every night and were very happy. After swimming, they wrapped themselves in robes of the hotel, and felt themselves like in Hollywood… Continental breakfast was pleasant and had a reasonable variety of products. You can sit at the table by the pool or take the food on trays in the room. There is also a free mini-bar, which we almost did not use, although it is nice and generous service. One downside: There was some low noise (not from the street) of some appliances or equipment, sometimes sounding like a buzzing during the night. Summary: highly recommended hotel, I am sure that I'll be back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for family trip to L.A.”
Reviews.Author: ashear
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at The Magic Castle with our kids, who are 8 and 11, and it was a perfect place to stay in L.A. with our kids. The room was huge with a living room, dining are, kitchen and separate bedroom. Incredibly spacious room for the price. The first night we walked the one block to Hollywood Blvd, had dinner and went to a movie at Graumann's Chinese theater. What a great location. The people were very nice. Breakfast was basic, cereal and pastries. Staff was very nice. It is a little worn around the edges but totally clean with nice, modern furniture. If you are looking for shiny luxury this is not the place for you. Also, there are a lot of stairs to many of the rooms so if that is a problem for you this may not be your place.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Great location, great value, great service.”
Reviews.Author: Shanberry
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to West Hollywood in July 2009. Our purpose: shopping. Since we were both under 25, we didn't want to rent a car. This limited what we could do so we wanted to stay somewhere close to public transit. We were also students so we wanted to save as much money as we could. We took the Metro line from the airport all the way to the Hollywood/Highland stop. Though it could have been unsafe, we didn't run into any problems. Considering we were just two young women with luggage, I don't know if we were just lucky. The metro system was easy to use so I would recommend it if you're with a group of people. Saves about $50-70 US? Magic Castle was very close to the main Hollywood strip. This was perfect for us. We didn't mind the 10 minute walk at all. We had no problems checking in; we were there early but there was a room available for us. The room was quaint. I don't have high expectations. As long as the room was clean, I was happy. We only stayed for 3 nights but it was very enjoyable and very worth it. There was unlimited candies, chocolates and snacks (though you do have to ask). The pool was good enough. I spent one morning just tanning and it was absolutely fine. We also watched a couple movies since they had a few we could borrow (for free of course). I don't have any complaints!!! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel! Loved our stay!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic time and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: SusieandJonnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only two nights and had a great time. the staff could not have been more helpful from giving directions to the local supermarket to suggestions for eating out. Nothing seemed too hard for them. The room (222) had two bedrooms and a separate living area which was great after a long day to be able to put the kids to bed and relax with a glass or two of wine. I would fully recommend it to anyone who wants to stay close to Hollywood Bvd but not pay the earth.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC service!”
Reviews.Author: christinamac
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle Hotel exceeded my expectations even before our arrival. After calling earlier in the day before check-in and explaining some rough travel circumstances, we were given a complimentary room upgrade. Once at the hotel, we were greeted with sparkling lemonade. The service only got better from there over our 4-day stay - from the delivery of free snacks and DVDs to our room, the prompt housekeeping staff, to the helpfulness of the staff in giving us public transit and walking directions and recommendations of things to do on our stay, I couldn't rate this hotel more highly. The pool, open 24 hrs, was heated, and feels cozy in the center of the hotel. The rooms, though not ultra-modern, were incredibly spacious and apartment-style, and the beds were incredibly comfortable. I would stay at the Magic Castle over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “setting the standard for service, comfort & convenience.”
Reviews.Author: jordular
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! free breakfast had delicious scones and croissants! cucumber water was always refreshing. free snacks and dvd rentals were clutch! heated pool super relaxing and the rooms were enormous! i'll take extra space and such kind helpful service any day over those over-designed boutique shoe boxes. very glad i stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel. and the Magic castle...really cool. it's where harry potter would go for happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Heated swimming pool was the charm”
Reviews.Author: wlross
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel. When my wife and I first checked in we thought we were on the set of Melrose Place. Very nice apartment type setting with a heated pool in the middle. The plants around the gardens were beautiful. Very friendly check in service. Breakfast on the pool deck in the morning was a very nice touch. The rooms were large and comfortable. We really enjoyed our stay and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but should not be rated #2 in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: rntlee
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Magic Castle, booking there after reading the rave reviews on Tripadvisor. Upon check-in we were welcomed with glasses of sparkling cider and were well impressed with the staff. The free snacks and drinks were also a nice touch. Things that were disappointing were the stained and shabby furniture, the musty odour in the room and the way noise passed with ease through the floor, walls and windows. The pool was open 24 hours and a couple of nights we were awakened by clubbers taking a 3:00 a.m. dip. The people in the room below us left for the night, leaving their blaring stereo going. The second night we finally called the front desk to have them enter the room and turn it off. We are not overly fussy travelers, but this hotel needs some TLC. The location is good but we had great difficulty finding decent, reasonably priced restaurants within walking distance. All qualms aside, the staff is very helpful, friendly and first rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a city of many bad ones”
Reviews.Author: lazyoaf
Reviews.Content: Looks from the front are not great, I will warn you, but thats the only bad t hing about this place. Not an ultra modern place, has some old world charm (and no thats not a way of saying it needs a refit, its actually in good order) Highly recommended in a City that has many terrible hotels (as do most to be fair)

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel in LA, Great hotel, staff, service”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan_2010_10
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and I, and 3 of my sons friends, all 20 year olds, were visitng my sister in Los Angeles and searched for a hotel. We wanted a hotel close to my sister, close to sightseeing, affordable parking, safe location, a pool if we could get one and space for 6 people. The Magic Castle answered all of our needs. We arrived close to midnight the first night to find cider and fruit in the lobby. check in and parking were quick. As my husband and I fell into bed that night he said "I feel like I am crawling into our bed at home." The bed was comfy and CLEAN. We had a two bedroom, two bath suite with a kitchen and living area. PLenty of room for 6 people and 2 baths for the teenagers to get ready in the morning. The hotel provide a list of snacks that are complimentary as well as DVD's that are complimentary. The kids made use of both. Breakfast is served in the lobby and included fruit, cereal, pastries, yogurt, milk juice, coffee and tea. We had great weather and ate at the tables in the courtyard surrounding the pool. The staff are friendly, available and knowledgeable. We plan to stay here again when visiting my sister. In addition, my sister is planning to tell her friends and neighbors about this gem when they are looking for accomodations for family. Thanks Magic Castle for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, a bit tired, but great service & location”
Reviews.Author: galtons
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle was presumably an apartment block in a former life. The rooms therefore are huge for a hotel - each is an apartment with lots of room to spread out and relax. Our room had a separate kitchen, dining and lounge. The furniture is all new but the apartment itself has had a marginal makeover. The kitchen and bathroom are both quite dated with original fittings but with fresh paint, while the bed and sofa and linen is all very nice and modern. The hotel staff could not be more helpful; lots of friendly advice. And of course, there are the perks - free drinks and snacks and DVDs. Free parking was also a welcome perk to us as we had been stung with excessive parking fees in other US cities. The central pool area is also nice enough with tables and chairs and umbrellas for lounging around. There is a quaint internet computer hiding in a 1970's space invaders style cabinet, which costs about $6 per hour. You can't beat the location as you can walk easily to nearby Hollywood Boulevarde, and the reception staff will organise for all the tours to pick you up from the hotel. People might be surprised to see it is rated as No.1 when the decor and fittings are quite old but if the rating is on excellent value for money and location, then it is warranted. We would expect that for family groups, it would be considered even greater value, as you could make your own food in the room, and relax around the pool with the few drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Nekolover
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel, and it's convenience to Hollywood just can't be beat. It's only about a 10 minute walk to Grauman's chinese theater. The hotel had a nice little pool and a very nice continental breakfast. The hotel had many nice touches. It was chilly in February, so they had hot cider and cookies available in the front lobby in the evenings. The front desk has unlimited snacks and soda, which my teenage boy really enjoyed. They also have a list of free DVD rentals. Our room had a mini kitchen, and with the little supermarket on Hollywood Blvd available nearby, it was all very convenient. I felt it was a little pricey, but considering it's location and the fact that it allows you admission to the Magic Castle makes up for price. I felt the linens needed to be refreshed (one of our sheets was torn and the towels were somewhat dingy) and the room need to be repainted and recarpeted, but all in all it was a pleasant hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: Niem
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at the Magic Castle Hotel. The staff are so friendly and great with kids. We loved the free snacks and drinks, as well as the continental breakfast and the hot cider every evening. Great location, spacious rooms, very clean pool, inexpensive parking. It is all good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Great Staff. A+++”
Reviews.Author: fade32242
Reviews.Content: Great Location, 5 minute walk to walk of fame, Kodak theatre Top Notch staff, A++ Large rooms, reminded me of Melrose place Cheap $10 parking Safe location The negatives- somewhat outdated rooms. If you are looking for Sheraton/Hilton type hotel, don’t stay here Not much else Great for singles and families Rate was slightly higher than i wanted to pay but a pretty good value

Reviews.Title: “Another great time”
Reviews.Author: jakmusic
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Magic Castle Hotel as a family. We arrived very early after a morning flight from Auckland. The staff were outstanding as usual. They organised our room within an hour, which helped a lot. They offered us breakfast while we waited. We stayed in L.A. for 4 days and this is the perfect location to see the sights. It was great to see Daphne again. Thanks for all your help. Hope to see you again the future.

Reviews.Title: “Top quiality”
Reviews.Author: tonylondon28
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some friends. Great service, great location, helpful staff. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: KeefRichards_London
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at the Magic Castle Hotel. On the surface it is very modest looking but right away, the service is top class. Nothing is too much, they do evetrything they can to accomodate your needs. it is the little touches like the ipod charger and player in your room, the bathrobes, choccies on your bed and an endless supply of snacks that makes your stay an easy one. The pool is open 24 hours and is heated and fresh towels are available at any time. The hotel has a shuttle service which includes dropping you off and picking you up from the nearby but hilly heights, yaroshima restuarant. This hotel is just a two minute walk from the Walk of Fame, Chines Theatre and the Kodak Centre. It is understated Art Deco stylish, i loved it and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “No. 2 in LA? No!”
Reviews.Author: MEXJ
Reviews.Content: This place is filthy. The only pro is the walking distance to Hollywood Bowl. I cannot believe this hotel is still ranked this high. Magic Castle helped me not to trust TripAdvisor all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, older but very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: efarm
Reviews.Content: We pulled in about 1am and were shown a 2brm suite with kitchenette and bathroom. We took it and wearily went to bed. The place is older style but beds and linen were fresh and new, lots of free stuff from the mini bar, continental breakfast is comlimentary and served near reception. Staff were really friendly and helpful and well informed. Has a casino and a japanese restaurant that we didn't visit but was recommended by others. Only one block back from strip near Kodak Theatre and metro train line.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Magic Castle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: calgarygal55
Reviews.Content: My husband and grown daughter and I spent 5 nights at the Magic Castle Hotel recently and had a wonderful time. Can't say enough about the wonderful service at the hotel. They were most helpful even offering to check in for us with our airlines as we were without a computer. Breakfast pastries were very tasty and fresh. We had a one bedroom suite and the king bed we slept on was fine with lovely linens. The hide a bed was not great for an adult and had seen better days. We experienced some trouble with noise from some partying upstairs from us - noise travels easily between units but one call to the desk remedied the problem. Free snacks and movies were a lovely touch. The location is an easy five minute walk to Hollywood and the Kodak and Grauman Theatres. The pool was lovely though the weather was not warm enough to use it. Easy access to several buses which we used regularly. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: littlegrrl
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through TripAdvisor and couldn't believe all of the good reviews. Immediately booked it and hoped it would live up to the hype. It TOTALLY did! The front of the place looks totally unassuming but once you enter the lobby, it's a completely different view (and a little like Melrose Place which was fun for me). At check-in, we were upgraded to a 2-bedroom suite which was a fantastic surprise for our family of 4 (especially considering we paid under $160 for the AAA rate). The suite was basically a really roomy 2 bedroom apartment (bigger than our 1st apartment, my husband said), fully equipped with everything you might need. We all LOVED the free snacks--everything from chips and pretzels to cheese crackers and candy and sodas--and the staff was so sweet and would make up "goody bags" for our kids each morning as per their requests. The hot apple cider and cookies each night were a nice touch too. Breakfast was delicious (I'm seriously missing the scones now that I'm home) with scones, croissants, muffins, toast, cereals, yogurts, fruit, oatmeal, etc. Location was excellent--a block from Hollywood walk of fame, Graumann's, and the other sights and a short drive to everywhere else. The kids loved the pool and found it plenty warm even though it was quite chilly outside (they spent HOURS in there!). They also liked the free DVDs that were available. The nicest touch, however, was when the staff ordered an adorable and delicious little cake for my husband's birthday and sent it over, complete with balloons. Oh, and the staff drove us up the hill to Yamashiro, a great Japanese restaurant up in the hills behind the hotel, which was really convenient. The kids kept saying over and over that this was their favorite hotel. If we're ever in LA again, there is no question that this is where we'll stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Make the "Magic" happen”
Reviews.Author: thesits
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Magic Castle, for the past three years. Every stay has been Wonderful! The Hotel Staff is courteous and helpful. The rooms have that "old" California hay day feel to them, and have California old Hollywood Decor. The bath tubs are not huge, however the ambiance makes up for it. I believe the hardwood floors to be original. Now Mix that all with the Magic at the Castle and you will have a WONDERFUL stay! Book early as parking can be a little hectic. Be prepared for steps as there is not an elevator, at the Hotel. However if you need assistance they will accommodate well at the Magic Castle. Don't forget to book Dinner! And Breakfast on Sun :) you will have a wonderful time here!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff but request room away from the road”
Reviews.Author: aspy61
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the staff on reception are super. One lady was especially helpful and gave great directions. I had also had very helpful advise about getting a driver from anaheim to hollywood. this was really convenient and was thanks to her help.There are some nice touches like the cider and the kids loved the snack bar although were too embarassed to ask. The rooms are spacious and yes it is older style but was clean. My only gripe was that our room was beside the road and it is incredibly busy. The traffic noise was really bad and the room too hot. We only stayed one night and I would have asked to be moved if we stayed longer. Found some ear plugs which helped.

Reviews.Title: “The best view and service that I have ever had!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tennisbammer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little dated---but you forget all about it when you see the view from one of the rooms up the hill!! The service is the best I have ever had at any hotel! They did not expect tips for everything---but they were worth every penny. They had a breakfast in the lobby area but brought it to our room when we asked. They checked me in for my flight and even found a bottle of wine to open for us while we were waiting on friends.!!! It was great. The view from our room was beautiful. You won't have a fancy flat screen in your room....but you shouldn't be hanging out there anyway. This hotel was clean and the employees some of the best. It was easy to find and you must eat dinner at the Magic Castle and see the magic show!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Magic Castle makes you feel right at home!! Great Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: tiny1246
Reviews.Content: After a long day of traveling we arrived to the Magic Castle to smells of apple cider and cookies. Upon checking in we were given fluted glasses of non-alcoholic sparkling drink with a big welcome from the staff. This was just the beginning of the fabulous service we received from the Magic Castle. Upon opening our suitcase we discovered that cough syrup had exploded in flight and was on several of our clothes. The staff was so accomodating in going out of their way to help us with dry cleaning drop-off and laundry to fix the problem. It was so nice to wake every morning to a continental breakfast and not having to leave the hotel first thing in the morning. We also enjoyed the free movies and popcorn. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. The Magic Castle is 2 blocks from Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the walk of fame. While this is not as upscale as the Hilton, and is definately a boutique hotel, it was our favorite hotel of 3 that we stayed at on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service, location, best staff anywhere on the planet.”
Reviews.Author: pippin123
Reviews.Content: We have stayed many a time at this hotel and have been pleased with everything EVERY time. The staff is the best and the rooms and location are wonderful. An apt. style room with plenty of space, and an efficiency kitchen. The people bend over backwards to make your stay wonderful, and can get you just about anything you desire, be it reservations to a restaurant, or a ride to the airport. Always friendly and smiles on the faces, ene though they work Christmas or New years. Terrific....I recommend to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: arne500
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in November with our daugther 7 year and one friend of us. It depends what you want to do in LA but location is really good , close to many things to do. Staff is really friendly and everything was very clean. Breakfast was ok but not more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Customer service but had some issues”
Reviews.Author: pmazcomm
Reviews.Content: First, i agree with most of the reviews, the staff here were exceptional with customer service. Greeted us with drinks, helped bring bags in and of course the endless supply of snacks for free. Keep in mind this was an apartment complex with outside entry to your room from outside. Our room was by the stairs so we heard every person bring up their luggage and talk as they were walking in and out (room 115). The room was huge with kitchen, large king bedroom tucked away around the corner, decent size bathroom and dining table and hideaway couch. We did ask for a roll away and it was in our room when we arrived. The bed was good but its an outdated apartment made into a hotel room. That didnt bother me but the Wii fi was difficult to get connected too. They do offer free complimentary breakfast until 10am. We arrived at 9:30am and there were about 6 slices of break left and just a few pastries so I would recommend getting there early so you have choices. We ended up with some toast and coffee. They did have plenty of cereal though. That was disappointing because the staff who checked us in told us about the awesome fresh bakeries they have each morning. They must have been good because there were none left. Check out was easy and the hotel is near/walking distance of hollywood blvd and sunset strip. My son wanted to watch the Chicago Black Hawks and he found a bar/restaurant within walking distance. Overall, the stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “The best service...”
Reviews.Author: LGPerth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for 3 nights coming in from a long haul Sydney. The absolutely best thing about this place are the staff. Whilst the 2 bedroom apartment had loads of space, the bathroom could probably do with a renovation. But the staff - both reception and even house staff are very friendly and helpful, going out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. The complimentary snacks and drinks for the duration of your stay is also a great treat- especially for kids! They even had "Mary Poppins" drop in and leave us some "some treats" with a lovely "spoonful of sugar" card when they knew we had gone out to see Mary Poppins at the theatre. The location is really central to Hollywood Boulevard.

Reviews.Title: “Magic castle was perfect”
Reviews.Author: thrahtobe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Magic Castle hotel from the 24th october 2009 - 27th october 2009 as part our our multi city honeymoon across America. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with smiles and friendly staff. This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in for the staff and hotel going the extra mile. As it was our honeymoon a bottle of wine was in an ice bucket in our room when we arrived. The rooms are clean and well stocked with shampoo and conditioner etc. There was also a fridge, iron, safe and tea & coffee facitilies. The Contiential breakfast in the morning was good which you could eat in your room or around the pool area. The hotel will also provide dvds to watch in your room and the free snacks at anytime was a good touch. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the action on Hollywood Boulvard and very safe to walk at night. We ate at a couple of places on Hollywood Boulvard, cafe Audrey a small snack place for sandwiches and pannis, highly recommend. Another place we ate at was La Cantina, a mexican restaurant food was excellent and would recommend to others. Another night the hotel made reservations at Yamashiro located on top of the hill behind the hotel, they even took us up and brought some back down by car. Excellent views of Downtown Los Angeles. If you thinking or booked The Magic Castle Hotel you will be not dissapointed. Extra special thanks to the staff, Kristina, Daniel, lisa and Gretchen.

Reviews.Title: “What a magical memory”
Reviews.Author: Jozza
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at the Magic Castle during our visit to the US two years ago and wish it had been longer. The location is brilliant, a short walk from Hollywood Boulevard, the rooms were large, clean and comfortable, and the staff were brilliant. We arrived late in the morning after a $100 cab ride from Anaheim, but the staff rustled up the complementary breakfast for us even though it was packed away. Throughout our stay, they greeted us with smiles and helped us with assistance. It was a magical experience that lived up to the hotel's name.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you're going to the Magic Castle next door!”
Reviews.Author: truthwilltell
Reviews.Content: If you're driving from a distance and going to the Magic Castle, this is the most convenient place to stay. It's next door so you can walk to the castle. Formerly an apartment complex transformed into a boutique type hotel. The property is older but the rooms are large and clean.The bathroom was basic and there was sort of a musty/old smell in the suite. The complex in general could use a little TLC. You won't find supreme luxury. It has a retro feel and was neat in its own way. Service sets this place apart. The employees are SUPER nice and SUPER accommodating. And the front desk will dispense free chips, candy, soda, etc., to your heart's content. Breakfast a bit disappointing. I thought the room was a good value for the size and location, dead center in Hollywood. All in all this probably had the best service/attitude at any hotel I've been at, and that includes the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: grg25
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay long at the Magic Castle but it was a great place to rest our heads after a long haul flight from London. Easy to find and with secure parking. We were given a warm welcome even though it was late and I really liked the list of free snacks and DVDs available, a really nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely one of the best we have stayed in during our holiday”
Reviews.Author: Stormbunny
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle Hotel lived up to all our expectations and we will certainly stay there again when we next visit the USA. The staff were great, nothing was a problem for them, not that we had any problems, they even provide you a list of snacks that are free for all guests and you can have as many or as little of them as you like during your stay. There are cooking facilities within your unit, a stove and microwave, plus full size fridge, so if you want to prepare a meal and not eat out, it is there for your convenience. Our rooms were private and comfortable, including the sofa bed that I slept on! The pool is heated and available 24/7 and we swam at midnight after our night out to the Magic Castle club which is nearby and accessible for all guests staying at the hotel. It is walking distance to Hollywood Boulevarde and all its attractions, and has on site security parking included in the price. Each night, David would knock on our door at sunset, offering chocolates and a little note telling us about the next day's weather forecast, a very nice little extra touch. Again all staff were great, friendly and courteous at all times. Breakfast was yummy too!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: hcame
Reviews.Content: We would like to say thanks to the wonderful staff at the Magic Castle. They made us all feel like family and very welcome. To picture this place for those of you that are old enough - think Melrose Place! We stayed in a 1 bedroom room with full kitchen, king size bed and queen sofa bed - family of 5 - the room was clean, and huge with a seperate dining table - the room was a little dated- but well and truly great value for money. The all day FREE mini bar was a huge hit with the kids - with all the skittles, chocolates, soft drinks, etc that they could eat - they were in heaven. We also took some supplies for during our day trips. The pool was heated and clean. We were surprised that a free continental style breakfast was included and included crossaints, cereal, toast, muffins, fresh fruit. Location is great - just 1 block from the "Walk of Fame', Gruemens Chinese Theatre, Madame Tussades. Requests to staff for extra pillows, cutlery etc were always met promptly and with a smile.Free laundry powder for use in their washing room. Extra special was the care they showed to one in our party whom had broken her arm the day before- sending a bottle of wine to the room. No amount of money can buy the friendly service from ALL the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in the US”
Reviews.Author: sandycandle
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle felt like a home away from home. The staff are super helpful, the little extras (24 hour snacks and drinks) and the breakfasts ensured our stay was better than comfortable. I highly recommend The Magic Castle for all travellers and it is especially great if you are having a slightly longer stay and want to settle in.

Reviews.Title: “Best overall experience of any hotel I have stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: AYH23
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle lives up to its website descriptions and more - especially the part that says more than you expect. This was our last stop in a 5 week trip in USA/Canada, and I can't tell you what a pleasant surprise it was. During our trip we had stayed at many hotels (mostly 4 and 5 stars) but this was the best overall experience. The genuine friendliness was astounding and they seem to bend over backwards for everyone in so many ways. The accommodation was incredibly spacious (especially great when you are with small children) with a full kitchen and all the facilities to feel at home. It was also clean. The overall feel of the place both inside and out was one of good feng shui. The breakfast provided is simple but a great choice and like everything else they do, it was displayed with care and style. We ate it each morning in the cute courtyard by the pool. The kids loved the FREE minibar service available from reception and the list of order-in foods they provided us with was fantastic (they even put the order in for us once we had decided which to settle for!) The proximity to all the attractions couldn't be better. It is just a short stroll to the walk of fame, Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the Metro station for Universal Studios (and it IS a short walk - even for kids). At the same time it was like a quiet oasis from all the action. Seeing the busyness elsewhere I was SO glad that I had chose the Magic Castle. I could go on....this is the best kept secret. I hope it doesn't get too popular because we look forward to staying there again soon :). Amanda, Newcastle, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ShooAddict
Reviews.Content: After many hours on trip advisor I picked the Magic Castle and was not disappointed. The layout reminds me of Melrose Place. If you are a Hollywood virgin you could not get a better location. Literally 3 minutes walk to the Kodak Theatre and Chinese Theatre, Walk of Fame, tour providers that do tours of the stars' homes and the Metro. We stayed here at the beginning of our trip and at the end (after we'd been to NYC, Vegas and San Fran). We booked the 'single Queen' room but they gave us a 1 bedroom which was great, it had a kitchen. The building is old but it's been refurbed and is exceptionally clean. The staff are fantastic and so helpful. Breakfast is provided each day, cereals, bakery items, juice, etc. They give out free snacks and soft drinks whenever you want them and hand out free ice creams around the pool. The staff are great at giving directions. Universal is only one stop away on the Metro (make sure you get a front of line ticket to Universal too - totally worth it). One of the staff gave us directions to Santa Monica on our last day and we caught 3 public buses, stopping at Beverley Hills for lunch. We followed his directions and were able to navigate our way to the beach for a good look around. On our return stay we had a 'single Queen' room and it was more than adequate. The beds are really comfortable and I felt totally safe there. It's a great 3 star hotel. Would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle - our savior!”
Reviews.Author: Muertos
Reviews.Content: Our original plans of staying two nights at the Vibe Hotel were canceled at 10pm (take note, DO NOT CONSIDER STAYING AT THE VIBE, THEIR MANAGEMENT IS TERRIBLE). Anyway, our first night was spent at a miserable hotel on Sunset known as the Townhouse. We then looked into the Magic Castle for our final night after it was recommended by a friend. Boy were we glad to be at a hotel with quality and reliable service! We were impressed with Magic Castle from our first phone call to the point of checking out. No complaints at all from me. Loved the room, pool, snack bar, breakfast, room service and location. Thanks for making up for the first horrid night we spent in Hollywood. I would definitely stay there again and be sure to recommend it to friends. I didn't get pictures but I made a video review. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wxElaKamMVo

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle fun and easy”
Reviews.Author: sarahsilb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great spot being just around the corner to the Chinese Theatre and Kodak Theatre. It was easy to catch the metro to Universal Studios and generally found this to be a convenient spot to head out around Los Angeles, which is a very spread out city. The hotel staff were friendly and very helpful, especially with our heap of luggage! We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment, which was very large and like staying in a large set of the TV series, Melrose Place. The rooms themselves are basic but clean. The kids liked jumping in the pool and choosing their free lollies and drink. The breakfasts were good and there was enough choice to suit all the ages in our group. We ate at the Japanese restaurant above this hotel on our last night and had a gorgeous dinner in this beautiful old restaurant with great panaromic views, though it wasn't really a place to take young kids (like our 2 year old)!. Would stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely inviting experience with excellent sevice.”
Reviews.Author: lyndac0629
Reviews.Content: When we drove up to the Magic Castle, we were amazed how enchanting the castle looked. We entered the lobby and were greeted by Lisa who was so friendly. Prevoiusly, a few weeks prior we spoke to Marcus, who I really felt badly for., having to deal with two suspious women from New York who thought the hotel sounded too good to be true. He was so patience and sweet. When we first arrived and signed in we were greeted with a orange refreshing beverage.. The room was upgraded to a jr. suite at no extra charge. The rooms were so tranquil with classical music playing.. sweet smelling shampoo and soaps in the bath. Lisa had arranged for the tour bus to pick us up at the hotel, which also was great. Marcus had come in by then and graciously introduced himself, a real gentlemen. He offered us cool cucumber water and plenty of snacks. The strip is a block away, so it pays to leave your car at the hotel and walk. Overall I would recommend this hotel, based on availibility of rooms, price ,cleanliness and the friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Marcus, we are definitely coming back !!!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel169
Reviews.Content: I had seen the Magic Castle Theater on a Criss Angel tv special and was excited that the hotel was available for the dates we were visiting Hollywood. I made the reservations with your representative, Marcus, who was so pleasant and friendly. I had mentioned that our visit was in celebration of my friends' 29th wedding anniversary and when we arrived, we were given an upgraded jr. suite and there was an anniversary cake waiting in the room. Both Lisa who assisted us at check-in and Marcus who we contacted a number of times during our stay were both extremely pleasant and accommodating. Lisa arranged for our pickup at the hotel for the tour of the movie stars' homes which was very appreciated as my elderly mother was also with us and found walking alittle tiring. Marcus could not have been more accommodating, bringing us numerous refreshments, snacks and an extra blanket when requested. We have stayed at many hotels but will certainly be back next spring when we are planning another trip to Hollywood with other family members. I will definitely call Marcus personally as he was the best hotel representative I have ever dealt with. When checking out, we even told Marcus if he is ever in NY, we would love for him to call us so we can show him around NY city and Long Island where we live. If all the staff of the hotel are as good as Marcus and Lisa, you will certainly have many, many repeat visitors. Thanks again for making our trip very special and memorable. See you in the spring !!!

Reviews.Title: “Emmy Night”
Reviews.Author: KimZ4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel. Walking distance to the Kodak Theatre. Awesome trip with my sister.

Reviews.Title: “A special place that welcomes you with open arms”
Reviews.Author: fmj648
Reviews.Content: from the moment you walk in past a great fountain the staff at Magic Castle does everything possible to make you feel at home. They have great suite style rooms with full kitchens, living rooms and some have balconeys that overlook the pool area. As you enjoy the pool a staff member brings around popsicles., you can go to the desk and ask for a soda or snack. It's complimentary. They have lots of knowledge of the surronding area with tips on what to do. Great place to stay if you want to see hollywood or have a concert at the hollywood bowl.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic..Great location, fantastic helpful staff plus lots more..”
Reviews.Author: jodiplus3
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the wonderful staff at The Magic Castle Hotel for looking after all of us including our 3 children. The hotel has a great pool, fantastic complimentary snack bar with lots to choose from (which the kids love), great breakfast, close to Hollywood Blvd and walking distance to the Metro. The rooms are great. The size was great for us with 3 children (2 in queen bed and 1 on fold out lounge and us in king bed). Would love to go back again. Would of loved to go to the Magic show brunch with kids but didn't have the correct dress attire.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MDM2401
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in September, as the first stop on our honeymoon. The staff at check-in were very helpful and friendly, presenting us each with a glass of chilled lemonade upon our arrival (we must have looked rather hot and bothered after a transatlantic flight and a slightly stressful rental car drive). As soon as they learned we were celebrating our honeymoon, we were given a bottle of "Honeymoon" white wine - which was a nice touch. Our room, a one-bedroom suite, was very spacious, well-equipped (with a kitchenette - good for keeping our beer cold), the room was very clean (my most important criterion) and we had a nice view of the pool area. Some of the furniture and fittings are a little care-worn, but everything works as it should. The hotel allows guests to borrow DVDs from a good list, free snacks and soft drinks (which we didn't use until the last day, but if you were going to be sitting by the pool could be invaluable) and the complimentary breakfast is exactly what we were looking for - lots of fruit juice, coffee, cereal, pastries and yogurts - perfect for filling up before heading out for the day. The staff were very friendly and helpful - recommending local restaurants and even making reservations and calling taxis for us - small things, but they go a long way to making our stay more pleasant. The hotel itself is in a good location, the Hollywood-Highland shopping centre and Metro station are only a few minutes walk away - the Metro and bus services allow you to reach most of Los Angeles without having to drive/park and we used them a lot. In short, the Magic Castle is a great little hotel, offering great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great location (for Hollywood)”
Reviews.Author: salsa42Leeds
Reviews.Content: Service at the hotel is some of the best we have ever experienced. The staff are so helpful and friendly all the time. The location is great just situated one block from Hollywood Blvd, easy walking distance to the El Capitan theatre and the Sid Grauman's Chinese theatre (the one with all the stars hands and foot prints) and of course the walk of fame. A little further away but still walkable (for the English anyway!!) is the Hollywood bowl and the Hollywood Heritage centre, as well as good photo opportunities for the HOLLYWOOD sign. Especially useful is the proximity to the subway station Hollywood Highlands (?). Not much of the city is served by the subway, but you can actually get here from LAX via three changes (easy) on the subway. We took the hire car back having got here and could probably have done with hanging on to it. It cost $90 in taxi fares to get to and from the Getty centre which is just fantastic. Getting anywhere further west requires public transport as the subway does not go there!! We used the hop on hop off tourist bus to get further west.... 48 hour ticket for $40 sounds good when compared to taxi fares... the buses are a bit on the old side and some of the sound systems are not too good. The red and yellow circuits each take 2 hours, the red takes you from Hollywood Blvd to Rodeo Drive (for those who care) where you can then join the yellow route to get to Santa Monica (Baywatch... Venice etc) Must mention complimentary breakfast, (quite good), and complimentary snacks, chocs, and drinks, (amazing) (no beer!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: ShoegalAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle in September purely through the reviews on Trip Advisor and it definitely exceeded our expectations. The staff were so helpful and friendly and knew everything there was to know about L.A. The location was the best, quiet enough to get a good night's sleep but just a short walk to Hollywood Boulevard and all the action. In particular Shan, Gretchen and Ricky were so friendly and helpful I couldn't have wished for better customer service. Will definitely stay at the Magic Castle for my next visit to L.A and would recommend all my friends do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service & great location”
Reviews.Author: Avionasa
Reviews.Content: My husband, our 17-month old son & my parents stayed here over Labor Day weekend. I found this hotel through tripadvisor while I was looking for an affordable place to stay near my cousin's wedding reception in Beverly Hills. The location was great! Just a block away from Grauman's/Hollywood Blvd./Hollywood & Highland. I also emailed the MCH ahead of time asking if there was something special they could do for my parents' 44th wedding anniversary and they had a nice card & petite cake for them upon arrival. They had also placed a playpen in the room along w/ a nice J&J travel set -- toiletries for the baby. How special was that! We had orig. reserved a 2-BR suite but were informed that we were given a 1-BR suite AND an adjoining 1-BR room which meant "2" bathrooms -- much better! Kitchenette a really nice added feature. Plenty of closet space. Dishes were "wrapped" w/ saran wrap. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. If you're a stickler for the "details", sure, the baseboards might not have been "straight" but the room fit our needs and again, the customer service was top notch! The continental breakfast w/ the delicious pastries was a big plus! So much more than a typical continental breakfast and the FREE mini bar -- AWESOME! Shan helped us with reservations for Sunday Brunch at The Magic Castle and was extremely helpful & accomodating throughout our entire stay. Marcus, who was in training, was also very friendly and apologetic (even though he was learning the ropes so that was not even necessary). Nice pool (although we didn't swim) and courtyard area to relax. Underground parking for $10/night convenient & affordable. Last but not least, I had some relatives coming up from San Diego who were allowed to park out front & come freshen up right before the wedding reception. The front desk again was extremely accomodating. My whole family really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The added extras really make the stay.”
Reviews.Author: omega5
Reviews.Content: Great service, complimentary breakfast and all day snacks, free wifi, and you can use the pool any time you like. Access to the Magic Castle makes this hotel unique and fun.

Reviews.Title: “I felt pampered by the friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mouseangel
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is just off the Hollywood Strip, but is relaxing and quiet. The staff was so friendly and attentive, they made the stay exceptional. They were very helpful to local friends who came to visit at the hotel and made sure they could find parking. We sat by the pool, which awesomely was open 24 hours! It was a quaint spot with nostalgic charm, and a great value. Only a block away from all sorts of tourist sights and shopping, and great eats. If I have friends coming to California that want to see Hollywood, I would suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer care I've experienced”
Reviews.Author: zeddyorg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights during our stay in L.A. to sight see and visit the various theme parks. Our stay was truly amazing, and I would certainly visit again on my next trip to the States! Initial impressions are great – the outside of the building looks like a castle right in Los Angeles! We were greeted by a very friendly staff member and checked-in swiftly, he even provided some complimentary lemonade and the icing on the cake was a free room upgrade to a suite! The suite we stayed in was huge, very clean and modern. We were provided with a well sized kitchen, lounge area with television, bathroom, balcony and a bedroom with plenty of storage space. The quality of furnishing was very good, the only fault I could find with the room was the lack of a bar of soap but all the other complementary products were provided (so we didn’t smell ;-)) The maid service is highly efficient and seems to be a round the clock service. The rooms are cleaned very well; the maids also clear the tables in public areas and the poolside. I was also impressed with the turn down service in the evening, the knock at the door in the evening was a nice surprise. The staff were very friendly and helpful, continually offering us complimentary beverages and snacks, whilst swimming in the pool I was offered an Ice Lolly from a cheery staff member! The continental breakfast service is also a nice light start to the day. Cereals, croissants, fruit, coffee and juice are all laid on in the morning around the pool area. Further to this, we were told that we could request free beverages and snacks anytime from the front desk. Another demonstration of the high level of customer care. Finally, the location was amazing for sigh seeing. You’re literally a block away from the walk of fame and unlike a fair amount of L.A., the surrounding area feels safe and comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a comfortable place to stay and do some sightseeing and relaxing. The level of customer care exceeds anything I have previously experienced, this and the great location add up to a fantastic experience.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE, GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Hails81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and found our stay very good - great location, customer service and good value for money. Rate includes a light breakfast, snacks from reception and wireless internet. The accommodations are apartment style and suited us great as we cooked a few of our own meals - supermarket is very close by. The apartment could do with a bit of a renovation but i had a peek in another room and it looked as though the kitchen had been redone - so maybe they are in the process of updating? I loved that they came each evening (turndown service) with lil mint chocolates and the weather forecast for the next day - nice touch. Overall, id reccommend this hotel for price, location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and free wireless connection.”
Reviews.Author: Gi0RGi0
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is really great: very near Hollywood Blvd on foot and perfect to go by car to Universal Studios (you don't have to drive for hours before going out from LA). Breakfast was quite rich and good for people who like continental breakfasts (milk, coffee, tea, croissants, yogurt). Breakfast is self service. Unfortunately if you have breakfast when most people do, it will be hard to find some place to sit down, so you have to take your breakfast to your room. The room where we stayed maybe needs a renewal, especially the bathroom. The reception employee was kind when we asked her to extend our staying at the same room. Parking is 10$ per day. The air conditioning of our room was a bit noisy. Wireless connection is for free.

Reviews.Title: “Better then a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: RA-FS1
Reviews.Content: Although i stayed just one night at the Magic Castle Hotel, I was truly inspired by the schooling in customer service perfection i got from each member of the staff. From the minuted i got there until the minute I left I was made to feel special and I believe I was truly appreciated by the staff. From the welcome drink, to the carefully detailed amenities and free DVD rentals, to the free minibar, to the incredible fresh pastries from the Continental Breakfast, this was a truly 5 star experience. While this may not be a new hotel, everything in my room was immaculately cleaned and the furniture and bedding was top notch. There is a real personal touch that, and customer service culture that seems to be ingrained in every member of the hotel. I will definitely be staying here again, and look forward to my next trip to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: fiona180
Reviews.Content: Just checked out from this hotel and would recommend to the budget conscious who love a good location and friendly atmosphere. We stayed in a two bed suite and overall were very happy. Carpet could do with being replaced with wood or tile and an aircon unit in the second bedroom would have been an extra but these were minor details when the location was taken into consideration. 5 mins walk from Hollywood Blvd walk of fame and the kodak theater,and with in driving distance of all of the main sites. on a special note one of the best praises i have for this hotel is for the staff. I have never been treated so well in any hotel i have stayed in in the past. Nothing was too much effort for them.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly whacky, but great time”
Reviews.Author: Swiss-Williams
Reviews.Content: Really less than 5 mins walk from Hollywood Boulevard, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre, etc. Ideal for the base for our 3 night stop in LA where we wanted to pack in a lot. Very easy (and clean and safe) to get to Universal Studios via one stop on Metro. It's a small and quite old hotel, nothing magic or castle-y about it, except that it is connected to The Magic Castle, which is some sort of long-standing venue for magic shows, old clubhouse, etc. I think. The odd quality is that for our "room for one adult, 2 kids (6 & 13)" we had a large suite with living room, dining area, fully fitted kitchen, large bathroom, very large bedroom, etc. The decor was fine for us, but don't expect smart and glitzy, it's well past it's prime, but somehow it pulls it off. Great sleep in the beds, and the aircon made us comfy. There's no restaurant - and important to know for a European - no bar or even licence, so I had to go down the street to buy some wine and beers for the fridge - but that was OK once I knew. All centered around a fun little pool - as often the case in US - but this was fully enclosed by the hotel so felt more private and exclusive than can sometimes be the case.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay highlighted by staff”
Reviews.Author: smdubowsky
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the "Hollywood vibe" of this hotel. When we arrived the suite we had was rather close to the street do we were upgraded to an even larger suite with a smile. There were a lot of extra perks including breakfast and snacks. The location is fantastic! You can walk to all the hub-bub of Hollywood Blvd but leave it all behind whenever you want. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, great location, perfect for the family.”
Reviews.Author: DenmarkHanne
Reviews.Content: You made our holiday complet - thank you. Best service, nice spacious rooms, clean sunny pool, all you would need for the perfect holliday. Next time I go to LA - this is going to be my hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Agree With All the Rave Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: amydd
Reviews.Content: Well, this will be a short review because all i can say is "ditto" to all the raves already posted. My 11 yo daughter and I stayed for 2 nights this past weekend (mid-July). We came from a short stay at a hotel in Beverly Hills where I was staying for business. The other place was very nice & fancy, but we both loved the Magic Castle so much more! Huge rooms, unbelievably friendly and genuine service, and all the little touches already mentioned made us wish we could stay an extra week! I want to give a special shout-out to Adam for the awesome music piped in poolside - he had a great mix going on. I want to reiterate the comment about how easy it is to take Metro to Universal Studios - we did that and it cost $5 roundtrip for both of us. I'm so glad I decided not to rent a car, we didn't need it at all for the local sites we wanted to see and use of Metro. And by the way, check your Coke can for $15 off coupons for Universal Studios! The only thing to be aware of is very weak water pressure in the shower, but that was just so minor and I would not hesitate to highly recommend this place to anyone. We can't wait to find a way to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: indie1982
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we stayed in on our drive around California! The hotel is in a great location, just two blocks from Hollywood Boulevard and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We arrived mid afternoon, given complimentary glasses of champagne and shown to our room. The room wasn't by any means huge but had a comfy bed, large LCD TV with HD Cable, DVD Player, big wardrobe and a smallish bathroom with tub and shower. One of the great things about this hotel is a free mini bar, you have to go to reception to get what you want, but it's all free. No alcohol but as many free snacks and drinks as you want. They also have a DVD collection you can pick from for free, another great touch for after a night out. It was our first time in LA so we asked the staff at reception for somewhere nice to go for dinner, they recommended some great places and drew us a map to get to them. The breakfast was good too, breads, muffins, cereal, yogurt, juices, teas and very drinkable coffee with syrups. There's a decent pool with Popsicles handed out and ice cold towels on the hour. Every evening our bed had been turned down when we returned and the weather forecast for the next day left on the bed with some chocolates. There are so many little touches like this that made it a great stay. A couple of weeks after we arrived back home we received a hand written postcard from one of the staff members who had helped us out so much. It's just a shame we can't return as often as we would have liked! Minor negatives were the the building is obviously fairly old, some of the fixtures in the bathroom were cracked and access to the parking garage ($10/night) in the basement is tight because of the supports.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - cant speak more highly of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: susiehancock
Reviews.Content: This is a fantasic hotel. The location is the best bit, two blocks from Hollywood Boulevard, most hotels around this area are much further away.
