The service is brilliant, they couldnt be more helpful and gave us some fantastic recommendations for dinner (go to the Burger resturant at the Hotel Roosevelt- amazing!) You also get unlimted free drinks and snacks at reception which is great! Breakfast is lovely. Rooms are great, we had a suite and it was massive, they put chocs on pillows at night and turn the beds down. Pool area is lovely, shame we had so much sightseeing as we couldnt enjoy it. All in all, I would say dont hestitate to stay here, one of best hotels on our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, amazing service, amazing vacation”
Reviews.Author: alilaw
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so unassuming on the outside that it blows your mind once you step inside your room. The service is always impeccable with the staff going out of their way to make sure your stay is everything you hope for when you leave home. The rooms have all the necessary amenities plus more, since you have tons of room to live in-as it is an apartment. The location is wonderful and easy to get to. Kudos to this amazing bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Magical - best place in LA - they don't nickle and dime you”
Reviews.Author: ceetown22
Reviews.Content: Arrived to this hotel for a Sunday check in, we got there early, but our room was ready and we were allowed to check in early. The staff is absolutely wonderful, they explained all of the amenities and I was surprised that they do not charge for drinks or snacks at all and you can get anything 24hrs a day. The only thing they do charge for is FIJI water and it's cheaper here then at 7-11. They come around in the morning and give courtesy weather updates, offer great turn down service in the evening, I could really write a book about how great this place is -- and cheap! This is truly a five star place at a 2-3 star price. You are only 2 short blocks from Hollywood Blvd (walk of fame, Kodak theater, etc). On a Tuesday night we didn't have much to do so we asked the front desk about places we could go within walking distance, they gave us a map and labeled all of the places they recommend we check out. I couldn't believe how great this place is, all their rooms have a nice balcony to sit out on, we had a full kitchen, dining area, flat screen tv's just absolutely magnificent. I would love to continue writing more, but I don't have anymore time, if your coming to LA you need to stay here and be pampered. When I come back to LA this is where I will be staying, Thanks Magic Castle Hotel and see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend staying here! Customer service is best in California!”
Reviews.Author: kristie7700
Reviews.Content: For my first vacation to California, my sister chose this place due to the awesome reviews. I was a little hesitant because of all the places to stay, why this one, it looked old, but I have to tell you, I was pleasantly surprised. The stay here was so wonderful, we actually stayed an extra night. The place is immaculate, extremely clean and fully stocked with everything we could ask for. The staff was amazing!!! They went above and beyond. The turn down service was really nice. The free refreshments 24/7 was so convenient. We absolutely love this place and it has made our first visit to California so wonderful. It is located in a great area next to everything! I will be back in a few months and will definitly stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle = Magic”
Reviews.Author: OzMum231
Reviews.Content: I can only endorse the other comments. The fantastic staff make up for any shortfalls in the decor etc. The rooms are clean but basic. The size of the rooms more than compensates for the basic nature of the accommodation (the bed was very comfortable). My flight back to Australia did not leave until very late at night - they offered me a late checkout and storage of my bags and when I decided to just sit around the pool and read till my transport pick-up, the staff arranged for me to use an empty room to sit and watch TV and use the bathroom facilities until time to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but not impressive”
Reviews.Author: jeepdon
Reviews.Content: The location - near Hollywood & Highland, not to mention the Magic Castle club - is great. Note that although the hotel advertises how the club's doors are "thrown open to you," in reality expect to pay a $20/person cover - even if you're having dinner. The hotel itself is a 50's-era apartment building, converted to a hotel. So the rooms are huge - 1- and 2-BR apartments. The paint on the walls, and the sparse furniture, is a clean, contemporary style. The lack of artwork (aside from a couple of magic-related posters, framed) on the walls contributes to a sense of squalor, as do the worn appliances and the minimal furnishings. An investment in decor would improve the property immeasurably. Service was fine, and the included continental breakfast - enjoyed on the pool deck - was appreciated. The rooms, while basically clean, are in need of attention and suffer from inexpert repairs - bad caulking in the bathroom, stained tubs, flaking paint. Window coverings are all-vinyl shutters, when contributes further to a "cheap" feeling. For the price and the sheer square footage, this is a deal; don't expect anything approaching the comfort and style of the nearby Renaissance hotel, though.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Basebirds
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is a wonderful, gem of a hotel. It's far enough away from Hollywood Boulevard that you don't get the noise, but is within a few blocks to make it easy walking. No need to move your car. The hotel was built as an apartment complex in the 40's and I could picture young starlets lounging by the pool. You actually stay in an apartment so you have a full kitchen, living room and balcony. The rooms are authentic with some updates, but they're still old. You have to appreciate ecclectic. However, the personnel are soooo friendly and the morning breakfast is a dream. Every morning, my husband would rise first, walk to the lobby and pick from fresh pastries from a local bakery. He would bring various goodies along with juice and coffee back to our room on the provided trays and we would enjoy all on our lovely balconey overlooking the pool and Hollywood. It was just wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel and you absolutely cannot beat the price in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “If the Magic Castle isn't the most popular hotel in Hollywood then it should be ...”
Reviews.Author: AJD57
Reviews.Content: Absolutely magnificent - there is just nothing to whinge about at all. The Magic Castle is simply great. The entire staff are just wonderful. The property itself is a former apartment block and has retained the original floorplan - hence the "rooms" are huge. The property is non-smoking - but - balconies abound for the afflicted! Heated pool (in California!) is fastidiously clean. Guest facilities cater for tourists and business travellers alike, eg, laundry facilities for $2 a load. The property itself is getting a little tired - but - IF this was a concern then the staff and facilities more than make up for flaky paint on the gutters. The Magic Castle is a short block from Hollywood/Highland and all of the Hollywood tourist attractions and conference facilities. This intersection is also a major public transport hub for buses and the Metro Red line - you can go anywhere in greater LA from here. And contrary to popular belief - public transport in LA is great. In our ten days in LA we didn't (as tourists) use a taxi once - the buses and trains were just great - and only $5 for a day pass. I have recommended - and canned - other properties in the past but the Magic Castle takes the absolute cake - this is the best property we have used anywhere - due in no small part to the performance of the entire staff. This property compares very favourably with European five star properties! We returned for a second stay within the month - cancelling another property to do so. We were THAT impressed with the Magic Castle. Suffice it to say we could rain all the superlatives in the language on the Magic Castle. They even drive you up to the restaurant on the hill behind the hotel - and pick you up after your meal. We were actually sad to leave - we've been sad to leave places before - but never because we'd miss the staff! We miss being at the Magic Castle. If the Magic Castle isn't the most popular hotel in Hollywood then it should be. We will continue to use the Magic Castle - and in preference to staying downtown (a whole 21 minutes away by Metro).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic from the Staff, Location, Cleanliness..THE place to Stay in Hollywood!!”
Reviews.Author: tarrendayle
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Magic Castle 3 times now and have no interest in staying anywhere else in Hollywood. The location is fabulous, just one easy walk block from Hollywood Blvd. Rooms have been renovated and are always clean...the 'fairy' even comes in and turns down the bed, leaves chocolate and tomorrows weather forcast for you! The Staff are fantastic and so helpful, whether it comes to room assistance or sightseeing hints..they give you easy ways to get to places you want to see. I cannot speak highly enough of this location...it is a MUST and the prices are very good in comparison with other accomodation in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Charming acommodations, gracious staff, wonderful experience.”
Reviews.Author: fairophelia9
Reviews.Content: The most wonderful thing about the Magic Castle Hotel is most definitely the staff. They were courteous, helpful, and always available. Our room was spacious, with full kitchen, dining room, living room (complete with large sofa, desk, DVD player, and flat screen television), balcony overlooking the pool, bathroom, and bedroom with ample closet space. The location was ideal, practically right behind Mann's Chinese Theater. I had settled in so easily and felt like I was moving out of my apartment at the end of my five day stay. I loved visiting LA and can't wait to come back, and when I do I hope that I'm able to stay at the Magic Castle once again! I thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: h0neym00ner
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Spacious rooms, all you can eat candy for free, free breakfast, great location. Lovely staff. Super location to walk to walk of fame, kodak theatre etc... Magic Castle Club at Hotel is also a great night out with mopst delicious food we had in LA! Like Melrose Place

Reviews.Title: “Large apartment but old and expensive”
Reviews.Author: kabowe
Reviews.Content: The pictures of the hotel certainly were a LOT nicer than the reality. Not knowing LA, we chose to stay in Hollywood which is dirty, busy and certainly not recommended for a relaxing stay with a young family (choose Santa Monica instead). The pool was the main reason for choosing this hotel but it was closed on 2 of the 3 days that we stayed which was very disappointing for our daughter. There was also a mixup with booking our onward transport which was stress that we could have done without. It was EXTREMELY noisy at night, not just from the traffic but the walls were very thin, we could hear someone getting on and off their bed. For $179 US per night I expected a lot more. Wouldn't stay in Hollywood or at this hotel again. The up-side was the lovely Cal-Asian restaurant at the top of the hill - a must!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: ml_1444
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from LA and while there stayed for 3 nights at the Magic Castle. The best thing about this quaint hotel is the staff, Terrell and Shan in particular were amazing. It is also fantastic for family accomodation - we had a large apartment, with two bedrooms with large very comfy beds, a sitting room, bathroom and kitchen. The traffic was a bit noisy, but we did get used to it and I'm sure that thats how it is anywhere in LA. Behind the hotel is a lovely walk up the hill where you can get great views across the city. And nothing, nothing was too much trouble for the staff - they organised all our tours on request, and provided handy advice about everything from where to eat to how to locate a lost mobile phone (which despite their best efforts stayed lost). LA was a bit intimidating for us but they made it much more manageable! And the breakfast by the pool were yummy too. All in all excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel very close to everything in Hollywood.”
Reviews.Author: J_I_London
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the hotel & we were just as impressed this time around. The hotel is very well located just a block from Hollywood Boulevard. The staff are incredible & the little touches like free 'mini bar', welcome drink & dvd rental all add to the experience. The breakfast included (cereals, toast, pastries, muffins, etc) was delicious. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite & the room was clean, spacious & well equipped. The customer service & well thought out extra touches should be the benchmark for other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Mgrs And Service People Gave All they Had!!!$”
Reviews.Author: NGU-BarbTucson
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 17 senior women, and we occupied 6 rooms............We go as a group one long weekend every year....Also, we have done this 25 years and .This hotel,(Magic Castle Hotel L.A.) was the best Service we have ever had...... ......One lady had a birthday and they brought her a cake ... Same lady had broken heel on dress shoes, and they glued it for her. ....We had frozen items that they put into their personal freezer...............They charged us less for Valet parking and helped us in many more ways........Very King Staff and Management.............. B. PATCHIN....TUCSON

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff - fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: kc1912
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i recently stayed at The Magic Castle Apartments!! This is a fabulous, clean, friendly place to stay!! The location was amazing and the staff were soooo helpful. My only complaint would be that the shower was a little mouldy but for the price and convenince of this place, i willn ot complain!! Thanks Sooo Much for the enjoyable stay and i would definately come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Well Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: DeaconFans
Reviews.Content: We were in California for a week and our stay at the Magic Castle Hotel was fantastic! The service was absolutely amazing. Shaun and the other desk staff were simply delightful...from offering a glass of champaign (non-alcoholic!) upon our arrival, to driving us up to the Yamashiro Restaurant up the hill (and ordering us a free calamari appetizer) to having pre-made driving directions to various points of interest, this hotel is a must stay for families. They provide free DVDs and snacks as well. Breakfast on the pool patio is very pleasant. We have two kids (8 and 10) who loved the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ReviewAddict20
Reviews.Content: We (4 adults) stayed at the Magic Castle in a 2 bedroom apartment for 4 nights at the end of March 2009. As we arrived at reception we were greeted warmly! and presented with a non alcoholic fizz (the hotel is not licensed). We were given a list of snacks & drinks that were available from reception at no cost and a list of DVD's available from reception at no cost. We defiantly took advantage of the snacks & cans! The apartment had 2 double bedrooms one larger than the other but both adequate, a good size kitchen which had a table that you could eat at and a bathroom with a bath and separate shower. The kitchen & bathroom are what my sister referred to as retro! The paint was pealing off the bathroom walls but the apartment was very clean so this was not really an issue. The free WiFi was handy but signal was weak in our apartment The pool was great open 24hrs, breakfast was included in the room price and was laid out in reception and eaten by the pool. There was a wide selection of small boxed cereals, pastries and breads, no cooked food. The location was great just one street back from Hollywood boulevard which was also good for public transport. Although there was trafic noise most of the time. The only problem we had was that there was only one mirror in the whole apartment in the bathroom with 4 adults trying to get ready for a night out we ran into some problems.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: FriszFamily
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood. The stay was even better than expected. The room was clean and confortable, the location was perfect near all of the sights. The service was wonderful and very attentive. They even re-parked my car when it was not in an easy location to navigate. I would gladly recommend this hotel to all !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and perfect for the family!”
Reviews.Author: peab
Reviews.Content: My two kids, my husband and I had an absolutely wonderful stay here. It felt like the hotel went way beyond what is usually expected for hospitality, to make us feel welcome and comfortable. We were in a very spacious suite. It was very convenient having two separate bedrooms and two full bathrooms. The kids especially liked that we could get unlimited free snacks (chips, crackers, candy bars, etc.) and drinks (soda, juice, bottled water), as well as a long list of free DVDs from which to choose and take to our room. Also, the continental breakfast was probably the best I’ve ever had. Particularly, the scones, croissants, and the strong coffee were fantastic. And we’re big movie fans, so the fact that the hotel is located in the heart of Hollywood is a huge plus. I hope to stay here anytime we’re down in the LA area and will highly recommend it for anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “The Other Reviews Were Right”
Reviews.Author: crookedbarn
Reviews.Content: The actual hotel is a bit older, but the rooms were nice - clean, very comfortable bed. Location was excellent! A block away from the Walk of Fame. Good restaurants nearby. Pool was 8' deep! I've stayed many places and these were some of the nicest, most helpful staff I've ever encountered. Continental breakfast by the pool - great scones. Free round-the-clock snacks being available was just fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: eckythump
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in late May 2008. Chose the location for the purpose of attending the R.E.M. concert at the Hollywood Bowl (wanted a hotel not far from the venue). We had also stayed here in October 2004 and loved it then so we knew what to expect. Stayed in a 1 bedroom suite at the back of the hotel up a few flights of stairs. We had some heavy suitcases and the staff was quick to help us with the bags. In fact all the staff were amazing, everyone was pleasant, friendly and willing to help at all times. One feature we loved which wasn't there in 2004 was the free soda/water/snacks available any time from the front desk. A fantastic feature and makes you feel so much more welcome than having a weight sensor in a mini bar that charges you a fortune for just lifting an item! Free wi-fi is also provided. The room was fantastic, as good as it was the first time we stayed. It's really like staying in an apartment it's that big, living room, dvd player, kitchen (full size fridge as well) and separate bedroom and bathroom, it was a fantastic suite. The only downside was the tv was still an old analog tube one that had average fuzzy picture quality. Maybe by now with digital tv here they have been replaced? A really nice pool was in the center of the hotel with the rooms around it. Breakfast was provided and really nice, cereal, toast, bagels, muffins etc., a great start to the day. When it's busy though there's not enough chairs and tables for everyone unless you take it back to your room. We did some washing in the laundry room, free washing liquid was provided, another little way you feel like you're not getting squeezed for every dollar like a lot of hotels these days. The location is fantastic for exploring Hollywood. Short walk to Hollywood and Highland and main Hollywood area. First time we stayed here we used the subway to get to Universal Studios which is extremely convenient and cheaper than a taxi or paying for parking. It's main benefit though this time was for the short distance to Hollywood Bowl, which is not too far away (we caught the bus from Hollywood and Highland to get there, but you could easily walk). Hollywood still felt like a rough area, particularly at night, it's not an area we felt safe walking in, particularly away from the Hollywood and Highland shopping area. Overall this is a fantastic hotel with great staff and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in the Hollywood area. Next time we come we will definitely check out the magic show next door!

Reviews.Title: “It's like the Nordstrom of Hotels.”
Reviews.Author: juliagold1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to stay at the Magic Castle Hotel for our first weekend away with out the kids. It far exceeded our expectations! Upon arriving we were impressed by the brewing apple cider and cookies in the lobby as we waited to be checked in and the employee's attentiveness when we checked in. He was very warm and friendly and eager to help us plan our evening by noting popular restaurants in the area. We loved the quaintness of the buffet breakfast by the pool in the mornings and our room was charming. My husband and I appreciated the complimentary snacks that the desk provided 24/7 and reveled in the quietness that the hotel offered. My husband and I were also impressed that the hotel reimbursed us for entry to a beautiful local gym in the area. My husband and I look forward to our next weekend away so we can revisit this unique establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service. Great location at a good price!”
Reviews.Author: adventurelover63
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Magic Castle both before and after a trip to New Zealand and Australia. In this time of poor customer service the Magic Castle hotel stands out as the place to stay if you want extra attention, friendly helpful staff and a feeling you are #1 in their eyes. Even after a 16 hour flight Terrell and Adam were able to make us laugh and feel right at home. The hot apple cider and cookies doesn't hurt either! All members of the staff go out of their way to be helpful. The evening manager even drove us over to the Magic Castle Club next door and offerred to come back and pick us up.When I called to inquire about reservations at the club Darren made the reservations for me and then sent me an email letting me know it was taken care of. Wow! The beds are comfortable and the continental breakfast is very good. The heated pool was just the right thing after a long day. We will definitely stay at the Magic Castle again. Terrell even printed out my boarding passes on his computer. You can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: moresun9
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself, 14 yr old son and 14 yr old friend stayed four fun nights! We had a king bedroom with a large living room and dining/kitchen area room 208. The teens loved the heated pool and outside patio area. I loved the fact the weather was warm and the patio area has beautiful flowering landscaping and is candle lite during the evenings. The staff were fantastic they were MORE than friendly and helpful at all times. They seemed to truely want to please the guests in any way possible. They were very knowledgeable in dining, tours, directions, shopping, nite-life and the list goes on. The breakfast was wholesome, fruits, scones, cereals, assorted juices, coffee, teas, and yougart. I think "light healthy breakfast". Numerous FREE snacks and beverages at any time was a bonus for the teens. Less than a block walking distance to stores, tours, restaurants. I loved the turn-down service at night with the chocolate mint and the note left telling the weather forecast for the next day, free newspaper. The bathroom was a little outdated, needs exhaust fans but the tolietries were wonderful too. My favorite memory will be looking out the dining room window in the morning and seeing the morning glory flowers in bloom and watching the humming birds feed! Saving up my money to return next year! Thanks to a great staff for a fantastic stay and wonderful memories!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: trey141
Reviews.Content: I booked the Magic Castle for a one night stay with my family to see Hollywood. The hotel called around noon and told me the room I booked was not available due to someone extending their stay. They appologized and offered me 2 rooms for the price of one and asked if that would be o.k. I said that it would work for us. The staff was the friendliest I have ever seen. The manager even made it a point to see me the next day and appologize again. Anything you asked for, they were happy to help. They have free snacks in the office and free movies to check out and will bring them to your room. The rooms are not the most updated but they are very clean and comfortable. The hotel is right in the heart of Hollywood so you are within walking distance of everything. Overall, this was one of my best stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...choose your room carefully”
Reviews.Author: designergirl2009
Reviews.Content: Location is on a busy, convenient and noisy street. Ask to be at the back of the hotel or you must have the air conditioner turned on high to drown out the noise. We booked two Jr. suites...unfortunately located by the office and an electric front door that opened and closed CONSTANTLY. Our family in one room were unable to sleep past 6am due to the motor operating the door. The manager said, "No one has ever complained before"...(unlikely) but did offer to move us. The rooms are old ( built in early 1960's?) and remodeling was done by a poor amateur. Shutters on window were broken, but closeable one slat at a time. Bathroom was a step up and small cabinet was falling apart from water damage. We LOVED the down comforters and fluffy pillows on the exceptionally comfortable beds. The dry "breakfast" was marginal. As a hotel guest, the privilege of reservations at the magic shows in the historic Magic Castle next door, overshadowed the minimal frustration with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Wayne-Gemma
Reviews.Content: Was here for the last night of our month long honeymoon. Location was great (just 5 mins walk from the Chinese Theatre, Walk of Fame etc), staff were really friendly, the room was a good size, and there was a pool to use. Definitely recommend it as a place to stay if you're visiting Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Eilth
Reviews.Content: A small, really friendly hotel 5 minutes from the Chinese Theatre. The rooms could be spruced up a bit but there is so much to do in LA that the room was only used for sleeping in. Staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and the hotel is literally a 5 minute walk from the Chinese Theatre, Walk of Fame etc. Would definately reccommend if you are trying to stick to a budget and would return myself. Make sure you have a midnight swim!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault the Magic!”
Reviews.Author: klive1961
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to fault the Magic Castle. Visited the Hotel twice in the past 10 years and this time around, had the choice of choosing a 'cheaper' deal at a hotel located just around the corner. I didn't think twice and plumped for the Magic. Great spacious rooms, complimentary mini bar, cheap/secure car parking and the fact that you can sit poolside, enjoying the free breakfast whilst surfing the internet with the free wandering WIFI access makes the Magic real value for money and a cool place to be. Can't wait for my return visit to LA and the brilliant Magic Castle Hotel. Oh, yes and the staff are friendly, helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great staff, lots of steps!”
Reviews.Author: Chriswith2kidsandawife
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle hotel is good value - we booked 2 rooms which were really large suites, with a kitchenette, sofabed and large dining table. This would make an ideal base for staying for a few days to explore LA. Pros: - Good value - Close to Graumann's Chinese Theatre etc. - Great staff (really, they were very helpful and cheerful) - Free "mini bar"; saves a fortune on candy and soda for the kids and water for us. - great complementary continenal breakfast - pool open all hours Cons: - Lots and lots of stairs. A bit of a pain when dragging in 2 week's worth of luggage into and out of, but other than that not a problem. - No views from the rooms - could do with the interior decor updating and brighter lighting in the rooms (they were really quite dark even in full daylight) We stayed just around the corner from the Magic Castle hotel, in the Hollywood Celebrity , in March. Whilst their rooms are cheaper, they are also smaller and there is no pool. As long as you aren't expecting the Ritz, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: Ladspin
Reviews.Content: Nice location with only a few minutes walk to Hollywood Boulevard. Minor breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “'SWEET 16' A SMASH!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SpecialSweet16
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter to Hollywood/LA for her 16th birthday on October 16! After making the hotel reservation with Gretchen, she mentioned the hotel would do 'something' for her birthday, too! I was really surprised and impressed when I got a phone call and email from Mary Jane asking what they could do to make our trip extra special and my daughter's birthday especially memorable. I told Mary Jane a few things about our daughter, and when we got to our room, our daughter couldn't believe her eyes!! There were balloons, sparkling soda, sixteen candles on a beautfully decorated chocolate cake, personalized greeting card in her favorite color with a picture of the Jonas Brothers on the front AND a JONAS BROTHERS CANVAS TOTE BAG! WOW!!! We were very pleasantly surprised, and after an 8-hour road trip, it got us pumped and ready to go, again. Our daughter always talked about her trip to New York, but this Hollywood/LA trip beats all (and, she is a hard to please teenager!!!!). And, thanks Mary Jane for greeting us at the front desk when you heard us check-in and for bringing us a refreshing glass of 'lemon sprtiz.' It felt like like you were waiting on family to come in and visit. And, thanks, Jeffrey, (the really nice bell captain) for helping us get around so easily. On our last day at the hotel, we left with a 'goodie bag' from the front desk minibar and munched on our snacks all the way home while talking about what a special trip we had.and how great everyone was to us at the Magic Castle......Thanks So Much!!!!!! The King family

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: thosetwo
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and our room wasn't ready, but the friendly staff offered us breakfast, stored our bags, and told us what interesting sights were nearby -- in the middle of Hollywood, so it wasn't hard to kill a couple of hours. When we returned they had upgraded us to a suite, and it was wonderful - roomy, cool (the temp went up to 95 one day, but we were comfortable) and clean. The free snacks and free WiFi were a very nice touch, and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating. We'd stay here again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Excelletn value in the heart of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Phil2408
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is an excellent hotel, particularly well suited to families, just a few minutes walk from Hollywood Boulevard, Chinese Theatre, Walk of Fame etc. The suites are very large - plenty of room for families. However, they are quite old - the bathroom and kitchen fittings are particular dated, so if you are looking for a modern luxury hotel, this might not be for you. But even so, this hotel offers fantastic value with excellent service in a great location with lots of nice touches. On arrival, you are given a glass of lemonade and there is a turndown service with chocolates left on your pillow. But best of all is the free mini-bar. Unlimited soft drinks and candy all day. It really is free. At the prices usually charged for cola, this is a big money saver. The continental breakfast is very nice, and there is a good pool. The staff are excellent - they will help you will anything you ask them.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things and the attention to detail that make this a fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebnNick
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights on 4-5th oct in a one bedroom suite with our two small children and we loved it. It was the last two nights of our trip to California and it did not disappoint. What makes this hotel amazing is the attention to detail and the little things that make you feel that they really want to please - such as the great complimentary breakfast which is nice and early at 7am, the free sodas and snacks and chocolate and crisps all day whenever you want and given with a smile and being told that they 'love' being able to do this for guests - wow! they even mailed my mum's postcards for free back to the UK! When we arrived we were given a glass of 'bubbly' to welcome us, the kids were given some play cards and rubber ducks and we were even sent up a gift of shampoos etc for the baby! The rooms are very comfy and well laid out, and very clean- yes they are not the plushest but we loved it. The pool is lovely too although we didn't get chance to use it and the location as other guests have stated is just perfect for an introduction to Hollywood. When we returned to our room in the evening we used to find chocs by the bed and a little card telling you what the weather would be doing the following day which my husband thought was fantastic as he is always checking the weather when we are on holiday! The manager, Darren, came round to see everyone and introduce himself at breakfast and took a real interest in what we thought of the hotel and the service and said that he reads comments on trip advisor every morning so if you're reading this Darren, I hope the sun is shining there still and I take my hat off to you and your team for the fantastic job you are doing, you have the best team in any hotel I have ever stayed in and we stayed at the Beverly Hills Hotel on our trip too so that is praise indeed! well done and thanks so much for a fab stay and for your hospitality and kindness by your staff - they are wonderful and work so hard to give your guests a pleasurable stay - we will definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: moodycow
Reviews.Content: this is an excellent hotel in a very good location just 2 min walk to the chinese theatre and the walk of stars on hollywood bvld. you get free mini bar from reception which is open 24hrs as so is the pool which is heated. our room was very spacious with a seating area a seperate kitchen area. our bedroom was very good with alot of wardrobe space. the staff are very helpful and friendly, and there is free internet wireless in room. you get included a continental breakfast which you can eat by the pool or take back to your room. the only negative was we were not aware of the parking charge and so upon checkout there was a $20 parking charge for our 3 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but magic!”
Reviews.Author: LFC79
Reviews.Content: After seeing reviews on trip adviser we gave Magic Castle a chance.. .and were glad we did! The staff were friendly, the room was clean & huge, the bed was excellent but most of all the breakfast was very convenient. As it was our first stay in USA and we werent quite up with the tipping rules... as breaky was self serve i think your meant to leave a tip for the breakfast but im pretty sure we forgot - so i apologise to the staff!!! Location is perfect straight out the front door you walk 5 mins to Hollywood blvd. My only suggestion for your trip is if you go to USA - stay here in LA and go to Magic castle FIRST as there is no elevator in this hotel so its a little tricky if you have heaps of luggage. Overall we thought due to location, hotel services and guest relations this was the best hotel on our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location, Roomy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: writur
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay Sept. 26-28 at Magic Castle. As other reviewers have noted, the service was incredible -- we've stayed in Ritz-Carltons that didn't have as good service. Really. All of the staff was friendly, helpful, ready with great suggestions for dinner, always offering free snacks and sodas. I can't say enough good things about them. That said, this isn't a five-star resort, so don't expect the rooms to be elegant. They're basically a converted apartment -- living room, dining area, kitchen, bathroom and separate bedroom. We loved that one of us could be watcing tv in the living room while the other slept late and since the bedroom had a door, there was no noise. It was great to have a fridge and a stove/oven, too so we could heat up leftovers and chill a bottle of wine. The rooms could use a little updating, though, which is why I didn't give it 5 stars. Everything was extremely clean, but definitely some wear-and-tear -- old paint on the tiles in the bathroom, cracks on the concrete walkways to the rooms, and wall units for air conditioners (which worked extremely well but were a little noisy). It didn't bother us in the least, but if you're used to everything being modern and perfectly maintained, this might not be the hotel for you. The location was great -- 1 block walk from Kodak Theatre and Mann's Chinese, a few more blocks walk for shopping, restaurants and pubs (we liked Happy Ending for a beer -- definitely try the andouille corn dogs, the food was incredible for a pub). We felt safe walking in the neighborhood, even at night. One more thing to mention about the hotel -- you can go to Magic Castle if you're staying here. It's a once-in-a-lifetime experience (a private members-only club) to see magicians perform up close. We probably saw 8 different shows + dinner over about 5 hours and the magicians were incredible. Make sure you go early, when it opens, so you can get in line for the best shows -- and prepare to wait -- we went on a Saturday night and had to wait 1 hour+ for the best shows (there were at least 250 people there). Dinner was good but pricey - $135 for two with one glass of wine each. And you do have to wear jackets and ties for men, very dressy dresses for women, we saw lots of people in black tie. It was a fabulous experience that you just can't get anywhere else. I will definitely stay at Magic Castle Hotel again next time I'm in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Magic place for tourists”
Reviews.Author: rubybellissimo
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel because I wanted access to the Magic Castle behind the hotel. So glad I did. Other reviews have identified the magic qualities of the Magic Castle Hotel. Superb staff, unfailingly helpful. My husband was ill one day and they were wonderful. They are young, energetic, authentic, polite, beautiful people with perfect customer service attitudes. Best hotel staff I have come across in .. 300 hotels?.. I have stayed in. We were upgraded to a ground floor one bedroom suite. Yes, it is a fading hotel, just like Hollywood is fading. Oh well, no matter. All the important bits were fine- a really comfortable bed, super spacious living area. Really good breakfast and nice to eat under the umbrellas around the pool. And the free nibbles all day and night... where else can you feel so much like you are at home? I will come back here with grandkids some day. They will love the hotel and its pool and the staff. Take them to the Castle, too, to see the magicians. A word of advice, the food at the Magic Castle restaurant (behind the hotel) is pretty ordinary. Choose simple dishes and cut your losses. or miss dinner and just pay to see the wonderful magic shows. Casual dress not permitted, jacket and tie for men.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lean_10
Reviews.Content: let me start by saying that big difference is made by the Staff that this Hotel has. They are great, especially Shan. He has been extremely helpful during our stay. Rooms are fine, nothing from other world, A/C could be a little noisy but not an issue really. Complimentary Breakfast was good. I didnt use the pool but I saw many people enjoying it. If you get this hotel @ a good price I would go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service-Great Location-A LIttle Shabby”
Reviews.Author: nthsh01
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Magic Castle, at the beginning of a week long vacation in Southern California. Our flight arrived at LAX an hour early, so we were concerned about arriving too early in the morning at the hotel. Not to worry, we not only received a friendly greeting and the obligatory fizzy lemonade in a champagne flute, but we were told our room was ready, and we were upgraded to a two bedroom suite. That was quite a pleasant surprise, but I guess after reading all the plaudits here for their service, it shouldn't be so suprising at all. The suite was obviously an old 1930's apartment, with some great architectual details - a living room, kitchen, huge bathroom, and two big bedrooms. Closets galore, and some really great toiletries. The furnishings, paint, etc. could use an upgrade, they were a bit shabby, and there was an odd smell in the entire suite. Several of the obviously new plantation shutters had some damage, which was a shame, as they looked great. The continental breakfast in the morning was much appreciated - nothing special, but very convenient. And the free snacks, soda, water, etc. at any time are a great plus. Combine all that with the suberb location, right next to the famous Magic Castle and you've got a winner. A bit faded, perhaps, but we'd stay again, for sure. Great staff, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but hotel is fading”
Reviews.Author: Geraldo_Bonzo
Reviews.Content: It's a great little hotel with nice suites. That said the decor is fading fast and starting to look in of refurbishmet. Beware of walking near pool in bare feet - some of the pebbles surrounding the pool are very sharp and painful! The staff and freebie nibbles are fab and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely people”
Reviews.Author: Leylachu
Reviews.Content: Staff were extremely courteous and helpful, even upgrading us when we mentioned we were on honeymoon. Everyone was treated so well and the little perks such as free mini bar, DVD rental and the like were nice touches. Anything we needed, especially local knowledge, they were only too pleased to help. The room was spacious and had everything we needed and more.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good for families”
Reviews.Author: AbiV
Reviews.Content: This hotel was well situated, just a couple of blocks from the Kodak Theatre, but still a relatively quiet location. We were travelling as a family with our 15 year old son, so the accommodation, with a separate double bedroom, was ideal for us. There was also loads of cupboard space in the bedroom. The lounge was very large, with a dining table and kitchen area and a small balcony with tables and chairs overlooking the pool area. Some of the decor and fixtures and fittings were a little tired and the kitchen facilities are quite basic. There was a fridge, cooker, microwave and sink, but crockery and cooking utensils were fairly limited. Fine for making sandwiches and heating things up, but not much more. There was good parking with underground facilities, but a charge of $10 per night, which I hadn't noticed when we booked. Lots of nice touches - a huge bottle of iced water with cucumber in the lobby to refresh guests, which was great, as well as a free "mini bar" facility. You just had to ask at reception for any drinks, chips, chocolate etc, plus they supplied DVDs free of charge to watch in your room. The staff were very friendly and there were always enough on duty at reception to deal with guests with promptly. The complimentary breakfast by the pool was good. Not a massive selection, but enough to choose from by way of fresh fruit, yoghurt, granola, cereals, toast and cakes, as well as coffee and tea. Get up early to get a table by the pool though! The hotel isn't licenced, which was a bit disappointing when we arrived after a very long flight, desperate for a nice cold beer. But there's a good supermarket a couple of blocks away where you can stock up. All in all a good choice, but not cheap by comparison to other places we've stayed in the US. I've rated it average more because of the cost than the facilities.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!! Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: TheEdwardsFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights with our 2 teenage children and my parents and loved it, the staff are so lovely really helpful. The free mini bar was great so was the breakfast. The rooms are not to dated at all, they are clean, the bed is really comfortable for the price it was everything we could have wanted. So close to everything. I agree with the previous comment and would go back to LA just to stay at the Magic Castle. You are made to feel so welcome. Thank you so much to all of the staff for making our stay so great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Robbie88888888
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the reviews given from Tripadvisor. And I must admit it is pretty much spot on. The only drawback was we were given the room facing the main road and the word noisy is an understatement. We tried to swap rooms but was told it was full. I 'm sure these rooms are regularly have complaints (118 and 119). Beware if the reception telling you that hey have given you an upgrade for room 119 at no extra cost. Apart from that everything else are great. Good location, great breakfast and free Wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay! Cannot wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: samlondon86
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a group of 4 Twenty-one/Twenty-two year olds, we were welcomed by a friendly guy on the door who took our bags from the cab and welcomed us in. We got fresh lemonade as we got checked in, then we were told where are room was and told us they would take our cases up for us! Our room was a one bedroom suite on the 1st floor up with a balcony overlooking the pool...amazing. As we had four, we made use of the sofa bed which wasn't too bad. People who say the aircon is loud, hmm it can be but we just used it during the day and shut it while we slept and had the balcony doors/windows open with shutters closed. We had a good kitchen with big fridge/freezer, dining table etc. TV in the main room and the bedroom, bathroom was good with a shower/bath and a huge mirror. Room was awesome basically, I hear what people say about the dated decor...but I think it adds to the charm and at the end of the day for the price...its FINE. Got to add that the pool is lovely, temp is brilliant always and they offer towels so you don't have to have your own! Location is incredible and if like us you will not be having a car, public transport is SO easy to use and is like 5mins walk from the hotel, bus and subway. Cabs are expensive try to only use those for longer journeys. Right so everyone ALWAYS seems to mention the staff and rightly so, they are all amazing. Always there to help with a smile! Everyday we got the next days weather delivered to our door with chocolates by the lovely dave! The free mini bar was also incredible which we made use of everyday for either snacks or water as we went out anywhere. Thanks to all of the staff for making our stay brilliant!! I know for a fact I shall be back!

Reviews.Title: “I would go back to LA just to stay at the Magic Castle!”
Reviews.Author: Essexfamilyontour
Reviews.Content: There is nothing I can add that has not been said in earlier reviews - we loved the Magic Castle - the staff are wonderful and could not be more helpful, the children loved the free mini-bar, we felt very safe there, the pool was excellent, rooms incredibly spacious for the area and price - it's a wonderful, wonderful place - a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: cheshirelad01
Reviews.Content: we spent 6 very enjoyable days at the magic castle in the 1st week of august, having read all the reviews prior to booking and the latest ones I dont really need to say to much as most bases have been covered, just about all the reviews say pretty much the same and pick up on the positives & negatives of a stay at the magic castle,the location is fantastic for hollywood blvd,the staff are by a long way the most helpful ever , the suite we were given (210) was huge , the rooms & hotel in general are very clean,the breakfast was great , nice products from local bakery, the pool is great & open 24hrs ,parking was secure ($10 per night) most reviews pick up on decor/fittings being a bit tired ,this is true in places but it is an old apartment building converted to hotel use , the fact is you kind of get the feeling that its not really changed much from when it was an apartment building and the result is you get a chance to see how it might feel to live in Hollywood , the place has plenty of charm & character , unlike just about every hotel chain, when once in the hotel you could be anywhere in the world , at the magic castle it really feels Hollywood ! Apart from the charm we also liked the balcony with pool view ,the kids loved the free snacks & drinks & the free D.V.D library ( dvd player/ 2x t.v `s/ hi-fi in suite) full size kitchen , 2 x air-con units , 5 min walk to Hollywood bvld , close to Universal studios (easy by car or metro) but the big plus here has got be the staff ,nothing is to much trouble , any help or advice needed is gladly given by knowledgable staff, they have pre-printed colour coded sheets with details of how to get where you want go & will print of any additional maps etc you require,whatever you need they will help, when we asked about local car hire they had the hire firm fetch the car to the hotel & arranged to have it collected when we were ready, a great place full of character ,clean, plenty of those nice touches like turndown service ,mints on your pillow with next days weather report ,nice quality bathrobes etc etc , I would love to go again & would not hesitate to recommend both the hotel & the fantastic staff , thanks for a great stay!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “magic castle a big hit with family”
Reviews.Author: vdams
Reviews.Content: My husband, our two teenage children and I spent four nights at the castle and enjoyed it very much. We checked right in (did not get the welcome drink everyone talks about and I saw others get when they checked in) to a bottom floor room facing the pool that I had requested when I booked directly with the hotel. We like the room right away because of the size ( we just came from a much smaller room in san fran.) My son was in his glory with the free snacks that were given to him with a smile every time. I also made use of this feature on beach days and we must of saved a good one hundred bucks overall getting snacks before we left for the day. We swam one night the pool was clean and heated with nice music playing. We loved the baked goods in the morning the best of any continental breakfast we ever had. Another great feature of the hotel is they have washer and dryers. we were on vacation for two weeks so we need to do some wash. washer was one dollar per load and dryer around seventy five cents. They give you free laundry detergent. This hotel is everything this web site claims it to be. Friendly hard working staff, clean, great location , and with All the freebies its a good value for families. I have to give a shout out to the housekeeping staff. perfect service never knocking on door when we slept in and room always spotless when we returned with the extra turn down service you don't see much any more in this class hotel. Now I do have one complaint and its pretty significant. the air conditioning system is old and very loud which made it hard for me to get a good nights rest. Besides the noise the room temp changed from hot to cold all night long blankets on blankets off. I was unable to get up as early as I usually do making my mornings a little rushed. I never complained about this to management because moving rooms was not an option for me ( I hate doing that more then anything) and I read that was a problem so I suspected all the rooms were like that. I know the manager reads this site. Please do something with the air conditioners and you will have your self a perfect hotel in my opinion. Thanks for a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Elisha02
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is fantastic, Great Location and the rooms are massive, very comftable bed. The free munchies, drinks and breakfast is great. But one the best thing there is the cucumber water... Very refreshing, I would definantly stay theer again

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but overrated ranking”
Reviews.Author: Smooth_Sluggo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great example of how different types of hotels appeal to different types of people. If you are a family with lots of kids who would sacrifice room quality for quantity (size), the Magic Castle is perfect for you. If you don't have kids, you may be disappointed in the quality of the rooms. The staff at the Magic Castle is the best I have ever seen in the US. They go out of their way to smile, assist, and otherwise be polite. As an example, I asked for directions to NBC studios, and they promptly looked up the best route on mapquest.com, and gave me the printout, while concurrently advising me of the best / worst times to drive. Unlike other hotels that have a good staff, at the Magic Castle they seem very sincere. They deserve the oft-mentioned recognition. However, there is one downside: the check-in counter is very narrow (as is the front entrance), so they can only serve one person at a time...when they try to accommodate 2 guests, it becomes quite chaotic. The location is also excellent. Its one long block off of Hollywood Blvd, so its easy to walk there. The room comes with free WiFi and the 'free mini-bar' was also a nice touch. The breakfast may not fill up some people, but I was personally happy with it. I had a suite and the room was huge--much more than my wife and I needed. It would be great for kids. Unfortunately, the bathroom was very small, with peeling paint and tiles and an unintentional retro look of the 70's. The beds, carpeting, and furniture looked like it was several decades old, though the bedding was excellent and the downturn service--complete with tomorrow's temperature and soft music on the new stereo--was very nice. Sadly, it seems lost on the tiny TV and cheap (thin and harsh) towels...the plusses and the minuses cancel each other out. There was one other major disappointment with this room. The first was noise. It may be far enough from Hollywood Blvd to not hear anything there, but if you're on the ground floor with a room on Franklin Ave, good luck trying to sleep unless you turn up the tiny AC unit and drown everything out with white noise. Trucks seem to rumble on Franklin all night long, and you can hear every footstep in the room above you. I would have switched rooms but I also knew the hotel was full during my stay, so I didn't bother. As comfortable as the bedding was, it was hard to sleep with all the racket. If my wife and I return with our kids, we would definitely stay here again--there's lots of room for them to run around, and the cheapness of the room will alleviate any fears of their misbehavior. Based on this scenario, I could see them as being the best that LA has to offer. But would I return without them? I am sorry, but I could not recommend it. And having stayed in several other hotels in LA before, I can't quite fathom how its #1 overall. Respectfully submitted.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise!!”
Reviews.Author: GMandSM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel while we were in L.A. recently and I was thoroughly impressed with the staff and the service they were second to none. Nothing is too much trouble for these people! When we arrived I was a bit sceptical as the furnishings were quite basic in the living area, in the bedrooms the beds were brand new looking and the linens were beautiful and white, spotlessly clean. We had lovely clean towels and the apartment was cleaned everyday. A complimentary breakfast was available at the reception each day which you could eat while sitting at the pool and if you required a cold drink or even a snack, you just asked at the reception which was always manned and again there it was complimentary. The staff were always willing to help even when we wanted to go to the cinema they looked on the internet to see what was on etc for us. For me the nicest bit of all was coming home in the evening to find your lights on for you, your beds turned down, two chocolates and a little card which told you what the weather was due to be the next day what a lovely touch..... It is in a great location too, just one street away from Hollywood Blvd. I would recommend this hotel with no hesitation please don't be put off with the basic furniture in the living area everything else more than makes up for that. Well done guys, keep up the good work !

Reviews.Title: “A Gem In Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: tim2788
Reviews.Content: After searching through seedy motels and low end budget hotels in Hollywood and being scared off, it was a relief to find a good value clean hotel just one block away from the Hollywood & Highland area! The Hotel is situated on Franklin Ave, just a 5 min walk to Hollywood Blvd which contains the Chinese Theatre and Walk of Fame etc The Hotel (A converted apartment complex) features a swimming pool, patio area and rooms overlooking the pool. The rooms were spacious and functional and the staff were possibly the most polite and helpful people in Hollywood! Nothing was too much trouble! The complimentary breakfast and mini bar (free soft drinks and snacks) was amazing! Didnt need to spend a penny! The price is outstanding value for the area and I highly reccomend this hotel to families or couples. Don't forget to book any tours from the front desk! The staff will also book reservations for restaurants if you ask!

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right! Fantastic Place!”
Reviews.Author: Brownes
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews on Trip Advisor I was hoping the hotel met our expectations....and it did!!! The location is great, just a quick stroll to Walk of Stars, Chinese Theatre , Kodak Theatre and shopping/ restaurant areas. The staff were amazing, so helpful and kind. We had a lot of problems with a local tour company called Starline Tours. (They run tours to Star homes, LA beaches etc Were terrible to deal with) They company tour did not go where it stated in the brochure. The staff at Magic Castle continued to contact Starline event after we left to try and arrange some sort of compensation. You can have FREE drinks and snacks from reception at any time (so great!) They even ordered us take away chinese one night as they were ordering their own dinner. The hotel is a little old but the staff and location definitely make up for it. I would recoomend to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: travelluvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Caste Hotel on a recent side-trip to a family reunion. We arrived early and unfortunately were not able to check in. That was fine as we had just travelled from NY and were starving. They sent us to "The Grill" for lunch and said they would call when the room was ready. We walked around the corner to the the Hollywood/Highland Complex and had lunch. The front desk called within an hour to tell us the room was ready. I had asked to be put on a waiting list for a 2 bedroom but there weren't any available. They offered to move us if we wanted the next day when one became available. The thought of packing up again didn't appeal to us so we stayed put! The room was fine- very clean and spacious with plenty of space to have 4 people spread out. We had 2 yound adult kids with us- 18 & 20. The 20 yr old got the sleeper sofa and the daughter shared the 2 queen beds with us in the bedroom. The bathroom was small but certainly adequate and it was nice to be able to open the window as there wasn't a fan. The 2nd day we returned hot and exhausted to our room at 4:30 and it hadn't been cleaned yet. The cleaning staff was just entering it when we got to the hotel. We were a little disappointed but just got a drink and waited on the pool deck with the free snacks. The parking garage is really different- you need 2 people to operate the entry system and it is very tight quarters. We never used the pool- it was closed the day we arrived -very milky white. The following 2 days people swam in it and it looked fine. Again ,everything around us was very clean. The 3rd day I asked if we could take the bath towels withus to the beach. Before I knew it - the girl at the front desk had packed us up a beach bag with beach towels, snacks and cold water. She even wanted to give us sunscreen!! This service is what MCH is all about. There wasn't anything they wouldn't do to make your stay wonderful. The location is perfect for Hollywood in a very safe residential neighborhood. My only concern was when we checked out there were 2 calls from our room which we never made. We had cell phones and honestly never even saw the room phone. Also- there was no one in LA for us to call! It was a local # and I would bet that housekeeping probably used the phone. That was the day we were at the beach the whole day. We paid the $2 fee and that was the end of it. It could use a coat of paint to spruce things up but other than that- it was great and we would return. There is nowhere else in LA you can stay for the price. The breakfast was fantastic and my kids loved it. The snacks came in handy and we even walked around the corner to Longs and bought a bottle of wine! I would highly recommend MCH.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: sjbg
Reviews.Content: Our family of four spent 6 nights at The Magic Castle in late June and had a terrific experience. Ok, so the rooms are a little tired and the air con hums but nothing could detract from the extraordinary perfomance and service of the staff at this hotel. They were helpful,friendly,resourceful - nothing was too much trouble. Combined with the great location,the complimentary snacks (don't underestimate these especially if you have kids!) and the size of the rooms, we would have no hesitation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great and friendly stay”
Reviews.Author: Frank65
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and 16, 13 10 & 8 years kids. Since we arrived, a friendly bellmen helped us with luggage, the manager gave us a refreshing drink and the kids really enjoy the pool, free DVD's and free snacks. Adults liked the ALWAYS smile staff, the location, free breakfast & snacks (remember 4 kids) and large rooms. We stayed 4 nights, in a 2 bedroom suite, starting June 27, and that was the best deal we finded in our trip (San Diego, L.A., San Francisco, Napa , Las Vegas), according of the size of our family. I am not a person who write reviews, but I promised my family to write this, because was the best experience in our 19 days trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: shingers
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for two nights as part of an east coast road trip and loved the place. Two bedroom suite was massive, large living and dining area and a kitchen. Air con to only master bedroom and lounge could have been a problem but never bothered us. As other reviewers have said the rooms are a bit tired and the surface round the pool was worn out and rough, however the staff were terrific, the continental breakfast was limited but high quality, and the location was great for the Chinese theatre and walk of fame.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: jane_birkin
Reviews.Content: Nice place. The service was among the best that I have experienced at a hotel recently, and I travel a lot. They easily booked me a hair appointment on short notice, recommended restaurants, and advised me on traffic times. Love the breakfast. Plus I felt pretty secure with the need to swipe my room key to get both in and out of the parking garage at night. A plus when a woman travelling alone. The one thing I would say is that it is hard to figure out where the heck you're supposed to park when you pull in. There is an adjacent restaurant and from the street it appears that the doors for the hotel lobby are actually the restaurant entrance. They also tell you to review them on TripAdvisor if you're happy with your stay, which I thought was a bit tacky. But overall a terrifically convenient, reasonably priced, comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Magic!!”
Reviews.Author: drbabbers
Reviews.Content: Check In We arrived at the hotel at 10am, this wasn’t an issue at all as our room was ready for us. The check in was a very friendly and welcoming experience; I was given a glass of complimentary lemonade and also an overview to the local area. I was also informed of the complimentary 24/7 mini bar! My initial impressions after the check in were very positive. Hotel The room itself was not a suite, but a king bed. The bed was very comfortable and it actually has a proper duvet as opposed to a single sheet that is very common in hotels. The bathroom was also nice, particularly the shower which was a large walk in style with sliding doors. The stairway leading up to our hotel could have done with a paint job and a bit of an update, but a minor complaint in such a fantastic place. Also provided was a large LCD and DVD player. Don’t forget to ask for a free DVD rental at reception! They have a large selection of complimentary DVD’s that you can watch in your room. Overall the room was average looking and could probably do with an update, but it was adequate for our needs and we felt very comfortable. Glancing round the hotel, the suites look very cool! We also had a fridge freezer in our room, but no other kitchen facilities, useful for keeping our drinks in and that was about it. There is a well sized heated swimming pool in the centre of the hotel, which is an attractive feature to glance at when you walk through the reception area. The rooms are kind of built surrounding it and if you are lucky you will have a balcony overlooking the pool. The hotel also has a very secure and cosy feeling to it when you are roaming about. Breakfast is also included and is a very relaxing and fulfilling experience. They have a continental breakfast on display which was very satisfying. We relaxed by the pool enjoying our food with other guests, everyone seemed to be very happy and this created a positive atmosphere for your morning meal. A great start to the day! Another thing worth mentioning is the free mini bar they offer. You can go to the front desk and ask for anything off the menu for free. It is a good selection of snacks and drinks, very impressive and served to you with a smile always. The free wireless internet access was the only real upset here. It was a working service, but was very slow pretty much every day. It was useable, but not as fast as other hotels I have stayed in. It is also worth mentioning that as the hotel is small and cosy, the noise can sometimes be a bit frustrating. The main thing is slamming doors. Pretty much every morning I could hear doors slamming at early hours, I guess some people are just inconsiderate to others. Some hotel have devices on the doors to prevent them slamming, something the Magic Castle may want to invest in perhaps. Staff 100 percent the best hotel staff I have ever experienced. All of the staff at the Magic Castle are exceptional and provide the best service in any hotel I have stayed in. They all deserve a pay rise and are the backbone to this hotel. Every single person I spoke to was extremely helpful and also happy to listen to what I had to say. They also demonstrated going that extra mile on many occasions, Example 1: Myself and my partner were relaxing by the pool when one of the staff approached us offering us bottled water or a popsicle!, perfect to quench us whilst bathing in the hot sun. Example 2: I went to the front desk and asked for a DVD for the evening, the lady then said ‘how about some popcorn to go with that?’ I actually didn’t have a microwave in my room, but don’t worry they then offered to microwave it for me and bring it to our room! 2 minutes later there was a knock on the door and we had our delicious popcorn ready to eat. Outstanding customer service and what was more impressive was the fact we never actually had to request any of this, it was simply offered to us. If you want to feel welcome in a hotel this is the place to come! Another thing I found quite nice was a knock on the door each night with a card detailing the weather for the next day and also some free chocolate! Location We arrived at Union Station by Amtrak rail and the cab was 25 bucks to the hotel. About 8 miles I believe. Not too bad! The good thing is that this hotel is just round the corner from the main walk of fame strip in Hollywood. It was very convenient to go back and forth from the hotel to the local attractions on offer at Hollywood Blvd. Perfect location for what we wanted. Overall This has to be the best overall hotel experience of my life. Whilst not necessarily being the best hotel in the world, The Magic Castle compensates by offering exceptional service and value for money, whilst also providing a location 2 minutes from the main features Hollywood has to offer. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Hollywood and I most certainly will return here if I am ever in the area. An absolute pleasure from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Depends what you are looking for”
Reviews.Author: brettystar
Reviews.Content: My recent (and only) stay at The Magic Castle Hotel was mixed. The best asset that this hotel has is the staff - they truly are the most accommodating group of hotel staff that I have ever come across. I received the warmest, friendliest check in that I have ever had in my life. To me, the little touches is what differentiates good service from exceptional. To the welcome glass of lemonade, to the unlimited complimentary mini bar and the attitude that nothing you asked was any trouble - the service was first class. They make you feel like they are truly glad that you are their guest. I can only imagine that the owners must treat their staff well for all of them to be so happy. The worst asset of this hotel is the hotel itself. When I entered my room there was a very unusual and unpleasant odor in my room. I was only there for one night and was going to see 'Wicked' that evening so I didn't bother about asking to move rooms. However I got the feeling that the same smell would possibly be in the next room anyway. It was a mix of mustiness and cleaning product. It didn't go and was still there the next morning. The hotel room was extremely generous in size, especially for one person, however it was in bad shape. The kitchen and bathroom felt dirty; they weren't but they seemed like they were because they are so old. The security did not feel that great. From what I could see (and I could be wrong) there was only one door separating the guest rooms from the reception area (which anyone can walk into). I walked straight into the reception area and to my hotel room without anyone seeing me and as all the rooms have an outside entrance it kind of felt a little unsafe to me. It is close to Hollywood Boulevard however for those people visiting LA for the first time, I think it is better to stay in an area like West Hollywood or Beverly Hills. I spent one night at Magic Castle and another two at the Chamberlain in West Hollywood (I had always planned it this way), I felt so relieved when I got to the Chamberlain - I could just relax and not feel so on edge. Very long story short - the Magic Castle is conveniently located, has wonderful accommodating staff and offers a very good rate. However, when I visit LA I go there to relax by the pool and chill out. I think you can do this much better and in much more style at the Chamberlain (which charges a higher rate however).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience... Nothing but the best !!! Treated like gold!”
Reviews.Author: spauldingja
Reviews.Content: AMAZING!!! A+++ Service! There was nothing that the Magic Castle would not do for us! My girlfriend and I travel on business quite often. We went out to LA for business, but deciced that we needed an extra night for a little girl time! Gretchen went over and above the call of duty. From check in, to needing some band-aids... (they did not have the ones I needed so they were going to go to the store and get them). We asked where we could get a bottle of wine and poof.. there it was. They had one.... no problem. They turned the beds down. There was an amazing breakfast for us. They accomidated our every wishes and NOTHING was a problem. Always with a smile. The beds were yummy. The hotel was very 30's style! I loved it! Perfect location and easy to walk to some of the major sites. If you want good ole traditional service and not the typical service of a chain hotel. Stay here. The resturant at the top of the hill was breathtaking. The gardens were spectacualor. I can not wait to go back. Thank you Gretchen and Staff! You all were AWESOME

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families to stay while visiting Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: robbandy
Reviews.Content: My family of four (2 adults, 2 teens) stayed at the Magic Castle for 2 nights, and had a great experience. We had a suite with a bedroom with queen size bed and a pull out couch in the living room. The quality of the pullout couch wasn't wonderful, but it was fine for a teenager. The kitchen facilities were adequate although we didn't make full use of them. We got some takeout from a good local convenience store on Hollywood Blvd., about 10 minutes walk away, with a nice variety of prepared asian & western foods, but the oven, microwave, etc. in the kitchen were very handy. The room wasn't as modern as some generic hotel rooms, but it had a 40's/50's charm that you can't get in a modern hotel room, and certainly the rooms and bathrooms were clean. The staff was wonderful, even offered to drive us to the top of the hill to the Japanese restaurant, for us to admire the amazing view of Hollywood and L.A. We walked back down again, but I'm sure they would have picked us up had we requested it. Snacks were free upon request, as were DVD's from their extensive video library. The staff was always cheerful and friendly, and seem to enjoy working there! The location is great, about 2 blocks from the Chinese theater and Hollywood Blvd., but far enough away that noise was not really an issue, despite the hotel's location on a fairly busy street (although not a major boulevard). We didn't use the pool, but we did see a number of families using it. The nice breakfast buffet (included in the price) was a real plus; guests can either take their trays and sit by the pool, or bring them to their rooms to eat there. If you're looking for a luxurious Hollywood hotel stay (probably for a lot more money), don't stay here - but for budget-conscious travellers, especially families, looking for a good location and friendly atmosphere, this is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Small in Stature, Big on Service”
Reviews.Author: Mardukas
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Hollywood, we stayed in the Hollywood Roosevelt hotel. The location was ideal for us, but the hotel left much to be desired. It's not that the accommodations themselves were bad, but that you feel like second class citizens when you stay in one of those trendy places. We had to show our room keys in order to get into the pool, only to find that many of the poolside seats were reserved for people who were apparently more important than we. And who, most days, didn't even seem to show. Not to mention the fact that if you wanted to enjoy the pool you had better do it early, because it was off limits at night, as this is where the trendy outdoor bar is located. Which we didn't even try to get into. For our second trip to Hollywood, we were to have more people with us, requiring an additional room. With the Roosevelt out of the equation, our only reasonable options seemed to be the Hollywood Renaissance and the Magic Castle. And by reasonable, I mean somewhere you'd want to stay. Because there is nothing reasonable about the prices at the Renaissance. The fact that the Magic Castle offered two bedroom suites with full kitchen for the price of one room at the Renaissance is what really sealed the deal for us. Though I did have my concerns after reading some of the reviews on here. Those concerns were largely unfounded. Upon arrival we were greeted with sparkling lemonade and a menu for the free mini bar, offering everything from sodas and candy to chips and granola bars. We made good use of the mini bar during our stay, even receiving more of the sparkling lemonade as requested. And, although we did not end up using the in-room DVD player, I could see that they had a healthy selection of free rentals on hand behind the front desk, even such recent releases as The Simpsons Movie. Unlike our experience at the Roosevelt, seating at the pool was first come first served. And the pool did not close at dusk, or even at all. Which proved to be a bad thing a few nights into our trip as the rowdy group of twenty-somethings who had checked in next door to us engaged in a late night (3:00 AM) swim with no regard for their fellow guests. But after a call to the front desk, the woman on duty sent for security (I don't blame her for not wanting to handle it herself) and shortly thereafter we were able to get back to sleep. With the Magic Castle, we were able to stay in the same location as the Roosevelt, but with much better service for the common man. The rooms were nice and clean, if a bit dated. And though I'm no interior designer, there seemed to be more they could do with the space. But that didn't really matter. What did matter was we had more than enough room to accommodate our party and were treated as well as you could ask. Other nice touches you won't find most other places; the poolside popsicles provided by the staff, the free continental breakfast, and the nightly mints and weather forecast card for the following day. And, though the room description indicated that only one of the bedrooms would have a TV (in addition to the one in the living room), we actually had one in each room. If you're looking to stay in the heart of Hollywood, I would highly recommend the Magic Castle Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is Magic!”
Reviews.Author: Maryfoxwell
Reviews.Content: My girl friend and myself were going to LA on business for a week, we went out a day early and stayed at this hotel.
