The only bad thing about this hotel stay, we could only stay one night! What an amazing staff! From the time we got there until we left, they took care of everything! I was greeted with a refreshing glass of sparkling lemonade, snacks and fresh fruit. I even asked where I could buy some wine, they handed me a bottle! When it came time for dinner, they not only made our reservation but took us there and picked us up! The view and dinner was to die for! It's a top the hill from the hotel and has a great story behind it! Ask the staff, they will tell you all about it! The pool was great and heated! I felt like I was an old time Hollywood movie star! If this hotel could talk, the history would be rich! The breakfast offers fresh baked breads & rolls from a local bakery along with fresh fruit and dairy products. Coming from Corp. hotels all the time, this was a welcomed stay! I will make plans to stay longer then next yr. What a great place for a girls get away! Thanks to all the staff for making us feel like we were the only guest there!

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Very pleased with Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: Jayboy4
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle TA reviews brought us here, and we were not disappointed. We stayed two nights in a first-floor 1-bedroom right off the pool. The hotel is a block from Hollywood Blvd, and just north of Grauman's Theater. It is a landmark to locals and tours/deliveries all recognize it. Yes, the decor and fixtures are dated, but everything is clean and the service is exceptional. The continental breakfast, the location, whatever other 'extras' you get, the security, free wireless (this review is going out on it), and the great service you receive merely underline what a great value this hotel is. The feeling was much more like a cozy B&B than a hotel. The Magic Castle is a great value and would work well for families looking to stretch out a bit beyond the normal hotel room "box".

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the customer service at check-in fool you!”
Reviews.Author: Theberd
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, I thought this was going to be a great place to stay. The staff was welcoming, and the hotel had lots of perks included. They gave us a welcome glass of lemonade and a list of DVDs you can borrow for free. The staff really went out of their way to provide excellent customer service. At least, that's how it seemed. THEN...We borrowed a DVD from the front desk. We went into the room and saw that the DVD player was missing. We went ahead and asked the girl at the front desk about it. She seemed very surprised and said there would be one in the room when we got back that evening. We got back to our room at about 10 pm, ready to settle into our movie. We were stopped by the guy at the front desk and told that they couldn't get the color to work on the DVD player, so we'd have to watch it in black and white. (Seriously?) This is when we realized that the customer service during our arrival was just an act. We thought, ok, that's ridiculous, but we'll suck it up and watch black and white. We turn on the system and realize the DVD player not only has no color but no sound. Additionally, the picture looked so pixelated, it was basically unwatchable. I called the front desk to ask how they could resolve this situation. The girl told me she'd have to call me back in 5 minutes so she could talk to the manager. Fine. 10 minutes later, she called to tell me that the room description did not guarantee a DVD player, so we were out of luck. Now I started getting upset. Most hotels would offer to move you to a different room or comp you in some way. NOT THE MAGIC CASTLE. I asked to be moved. She said she couldn't do that, so I asked to speak to the manager. Coincidentally, she had left 5 minutes before. She would talk to the supervisor, who was on his break. He'd call back in 5 minutes. 15 minutes later, she called back to say that the only room they had was a suite. If we wanted to move, we'd have to pay an extra $30 for the "upgrade." Now I was getting really upset at the horrible service. I asked her if she would rather have an empty room and an upset customer. "There's nothing I can do unless you want to pay the extra money." I told her there was no way I was paying extra to get the services that they had promised me when I checked in. 20 minutes go by, and she calls back to offer a complimentary move to the suite. It is now 11 pm! When we checked out, the girl at the front desk asked how our stay was. I told her we had some problems. Her response: "I'm sorry to hear that." Seriously, that was it! No follow-up. No offers to make things right. Nothing. And the last straw was that when we got our bill, there was a $10 parking charge that is neither listed on their website nor mentioned when they give you the parking permit. Lastly, these rooms are renovated in the cheapest way I have ever seen. Door jams look like they've been broken into. The tubs were resurfaced and are now peeling. Etc, etc, etc. If you are going to stay here, HOPE against HOPE that you have no problems. They will *not* be solved here.

Reviews.Title: “Sooo Cute”
Reviews.Author: Hamptonmom
Reviews.Content: Loved this place. I was a little wary when I first got there, however the staff, the cold drink and a snack while waited for my room helped a lot. Yes it is very dated. I reminded me of the 1950s. Once I got into my room I was pleasantly surprised. It was nicely furnished and exceptionally clean. Some of the upgrades needed upgrading again. The new finish on the old tub was pealing and some water stains were showing through the paint job. Hollywood leaves much to be desired things have changed a lot since I was there over 20 years ago. the staff is the best thing about the castle, they do everything they can to make your stay pleasant. Don't miss the great cucumber water in the lobby. I have never tasted anything so refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again FOR SURE!!!”
Reviews.Author: rattyratrat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights and loved every minute of it. The front desk staff made us feel so welcome. The breakfast was delicious and a fantastic start to the day. The bed was the most comfortable of any hotel in our one month US/Canada stay. We felt like it was a home away from home. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We stayed in the room without a kitchen but this was fine for our needs. The front desk helped us with driving directions, restaurant suggestions and even where to get my nails done!! Nothing was too much trouble for them and everything was done with a smile. The free snacks and drinks were a great touch as we never had to find a store to buy these items. We really were spoilt. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and will most definately stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff, Great Location !!”
Reviews.Author: AJCairns
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for 4 nights in April. We were thoroughly delighted with our stay. The rooms were spacious and clean although not the most modern decor, but then we weren't visiting LA to critique hotel furniture! The staff go beyond fabulous. They are always friendly and helpful at all times. Our kids loved the swimming pool, free mini bar and breakfasts. The location is wonderful, so close to Hollywood Blvd and all the tours depart from there too! The metro train stattion is also just down the block. Our only down side was having been woken up 2 nights in a row by the same guests. The returned to the hotel at 2.30am and decided to sit outside our window smoking and chatting loudly! I promptly contacted front desk and was astounded with how quickly the situation was dealt with. Rembering that the hotel can't be responsible for the actions of others, I didn't see that as a mark against the MAgic Castle Hotel. We would definitely return to this hotel without hesitation. We were thrilled with this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: feefeefifi
Reviews.Content: We selected the Magic Castle after reviewing the trips on this site. It was more than we could have expected for a 3* hotel - one of the cheapest we could find! The staff could not have been more helpful. Lots of comlimentary extras like breakfast, drinks snaks, excellent toliteries, dvds, mints, a weather report posted under your door for the next day! It is in a perfect location, great swimming pool, clean rooms. I do not think there is anywhere better for the price. Top tip: get the staff to book you into the CalAsian restaurant at the top of the hill behind the hotel. The hotel staff took us in their car and picked us up. We got a complimentary appitiser. The view over LA was spectaular and the food absolutely delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel!”
Reviews.Author: knkuk
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, a real one off! We had a fab suite with living room, kitchen/diner and seperate bedroom and bathroom. The fixtures and fittings were a little dated, but we felt that added to the charm, and everything was immaculately clean. The staff were fantastic and happy to help with anything any time of day or night. And the free "mini bar" is a great service, they even made sure we had enough food and drink for our forward journey. Breakfast was served in the reception every morning (croissants, danishes, muffins, cereals etc). Parking was $10 a day in a secure under ground car park, which we thought was a really good price for 24 hour parking in a city. The hotel is in a great location for the Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre and bus stops for the tours. If we returned to LA we wouldn't look at any other hotels, we'd book straight back into the Magic Caste!

Reviews.Title: “Great girlfriends retreat -- clean, quiet, great location”
Reviews.Author: 34fun
Reviews.Content: I planned a trip for myself and three girlfriends and wanted someplace within a reasonable distance of the Pantages theater (Wicked). Hollywood seems full of margin hotels at high prices but the Magic Castle is an excellent value for the price ($189). Our one bedroom suite had a queen sofa sleeper in the LR (comfortable) and a queen in the bedroom. I requested a quiet room and was given room 210 overlooking the pool. I am a light sleeper and heard NOTHING. We enjoyed the free snacks, excellent location, reasonable parking ($10) and friendly staff. The free breakfast was great and the rooms were clean. The nearby Renaissance and Roosevelt hotels are $100 more per night at least, with fewer amenities. I will return to the Magic Castle again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: upsidedown_i
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed two nights at the Magic Castle. Upon meeting the staff we knew we had a winner... they were very friendly. We were delighted to find out that we were upgraded to a suite at no extra charge. The pool was gorgeous, and we were offered help with our luggage but turned it down. We got up to our room and were amazed to find an entire kitchen and more than enough space for two early 20-year olds. We felt like we really were being treated to Hollywood glamour! The staff continued to be helpful for our whole stay. We even got a ride up to Yamashiro for dinner our second night. The free mini bar items were awesome, the breakfasts were good, and we were never bothered by any housekeepers. The bathroom was a little dodgy, though. The only shelf was on a slant and couldn't be used, and there was mold around the tub. That wasn't enough to spoil our stay, though. And the price was definitely worth it! Besides the beautiful pool and great staff, the best thing about this hotel is the great location. Steps away from Grauman's Chinese Theatre and Kodak Theatre. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For Us!”
Reviews.Author: GirlieGirlTravel
Reviews.Content: My family just got back from our week in California with the Magic Castle Hotel being the highlight! We were travelling with two adults and two teenage boys. Perfect, perfect! We spent three nights at the hotel after a couple of nights in Santa Barbara. The Magic Castle Hotel is within walking distance of Grauman's Chinese Theater which is a great shopping/dining area. Our room was the size of an apartment with a separate bedroom with two full size beds. The living area had a pull out sofa sleeper. We had a full kitchen complete with stove, microwave, fridge, etc. Upon check-in we were greeted with a faux, yummy, champagne for each of us and an extensive list of free snacks that we could ask for at anytime. There was also a list of dvd's that you could rent, again for free. With a room rate of a little over $200 a night, the freebies really added up. It was great to walk by the front desk, on our way out for the day, and have free bottled water waiting for us. The continental breakfast included fresh fruits, cereals, juices, and yogurt. Every evening there was iced cucumber water sitting in the lobby. Everytime we walked into the hotel, one of the employees would greet us and make sure our stay was going along perfectly. The staff was as attentive and nice as they could be. I cannot think of anything I would've changed about our stay at the Magic Castle Hotel. If we thought of it, they provided it, with a smile on their face.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: M18elle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Magic Castle hotel for 4 days and found the hotel staff were beyond helpful and friendly in fact they were amazing. Upon our arrival we were upgraded to a suite which was a pleasant surprise. We were at the back of the property on the top floor, overlooking the pool. We didn't use the pool but some kids used it whilst we were there and seemed to be having a ball. Now for the not so great:- We (or I should say my husband) had to struggle up the stairs with our cases without any assistance The bath had a little bit of mould around the grouting but the bathroom itself was otherwise clean they alos provided fluffy robes The furniture was a little scruffy in places and could do with being updated. This was true of the hotel in general, it is in need of an upgrade especially the main reception, walkways and stairs. All in all these things were not a big deal and really didn't spoil our stay. The suite we stayed in had a fully equiped kitchen: microwave cooker, fridge freezer with ice tray coffee maker. The living area was spacious with generous seating a tv and satelite and DVD player. The bedroom was very comfortable with a king size bed lovely! it also had ample wardrobe space and tv and satelite and lovely lighting. We could not hear much road noise as we were at the back but I have to say that the walls are very thin and could almost make out the conversation the people below us were having. But that said, luckily we did not have any noisy neighbours during our stay. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance to the Kodak Theatre and other attractions, most tours pick up from this hotel too. Most attractions were no more than 20 mins drive away. I think it's fair to say that what made the stay good for us was the amazing staff (we have stayed at some top hotels but I have to say that the staff here rival those) who were more that happy to help with anything from turning on the heating system almost immediately when asked and booking our tour which was brill!!. Oh and not to forget the free mini bar snacks and drinks that were availiable 24hrs and DVD supplies. If it's luxury you're after then this is not the place for you. But if you want to be treated like royalty be comfortable in knowing that the Magic Castle is not only value for money but is a great place to stay for seeing Los Angeles, Beverley Hill and such places.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGrove
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights late March 2008 and had a great time. The location is excellent - easy walking to the Chinese Theatre and the subway stop that takes you to Universal Studios. The Reception staff were superb, extremely helpful and the kids absolutely loved the free drinks and numerous snacks available from Reception. Also the free DVD rental facility. While it's true there is a parking charge per night, it's what you come to expect in large cities these days. The only minor issue we had was with housekeeping. Our toiletries were not replaced/refilled during our 3 day stay and a broken lamp which we reported on our first night wasn't dealt with, but all in all a very good place to stay in Hollywood. We had a takeaway one night from a local Chinese restaurant called "Le Oriental Bistro". The food was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!! Great Service!!”
Reviews.Author: ypoons
Reviews.Content: We were only staying one night and wanted to take our kids (9, 12) to see the walk of fame, so we wanted to stay within walking distance of Hollywood Blvd. This was Perfect! We were two blocks away. The hotel had Excellent service. They greeted us with a drink (non-a) and knew who we were. Snacks, pop and movies were free. Selection was great. Everyone was so friendly and when we asked for extra blankets, someone was there within 10 minutes. Our room was large with a separate bedroom with TV. We could put the kids to bed and stay up to watch TV and use the kitchen. The staff suggested a pizza place to deliver and it was terrific and delivered right to the room. We also had a cruize to catch the next day and they set us up with a driver in a large towncar to take us to the port of LA. He was outstanding too! He even was there to pick us up when the ship came back in and took us to the airport and that was on Easter! Absolutely wonder service. We all are looking forward to visiting again! Oh and the pool was great too! The only issue that could be for someone are the stairs and there is no elevator. Remeber these are old apartments, but ours was kept up VERY well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: Andrewuk56
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 16 nights and found the location to be excellent for all the tourist sites, especially in the Hollywood / Beverly Hills area, being only a short walk from the chinese theatre and Kodak theatre on Hollywood Boulevard We were very impressed with the staff who were friendly and very helpful , the service from the staff was without fault, the best we have experienced in a long time. The pool was clean and well maintained and heated, very nice indeed. The Magic Castle Club adjoining the hotel gives membership to hotel guests but bear in mind if you have children you will only be allowed to take them in for Sunday Brunch, all other times is Adult only. Having said that the Brunch was excellent and great magic shows to accompany it. There is a strict dress code but relaxed a little for the Brunch. So why only the average rating ? Safe parking in underground car park but $10 per day and we were charged for all 16 nights although we only parked in the garage on 13 of the 16 days being away in San Diego and Las Vegas for a few days. Our big dissapointment was our room, room 108 which was a suite but in a bad position being on the gorund floor the view from the windows was a derelict falling down fence at the back of the hotel. The suite was also in bad need of decoration and refurbishment, no handles on the wardrobe doors, loose electrical sockets, the fridge wasn't working although was quickly replaced. The bathroom was the worst being in a very poor state of repair, although clean. The Plumbing system was very noisy so if anyone in an adjoining room decide to have a shower in the early hours you could not fail to wake up. We didn't see inside any other rooms, but would recommend you ask for a pool view room. There is no bar or restaurant, except in the adjoining club but an adequate continental style breakfast is servved in the lobby, you can sit around the pool or take it to your room, although we found it hard to get a table by the pool as there were only a small number and in great demand. I would certainly recommend this hotel on the grounds of service and location alone, but bear in mind your room may be quite the same as the photos on the website ! Andrew Parker Suffolk England UK

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for families!”
Reviews.Author: PATwinMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a former apt bldg which provides clean but somewhat shabby rooms. We were traveling with teenagers and needed more than one sleeper sofa for them, but were not eager to spring for 2 hotel rooms, so having both an extra bedroom and a sleeper sofa in the living room was ideal. We reserved a 2-bedroom unit, which is recommended if you are troubled by noise, as these units are in the back (away from the street). We also appreciated the heated swimming pool, the free breakfast (fruit, scones, muffins, juices, coffee), the laundry facilities, the free water bottles and snacks and the cheerful hospitality of the staff (who readily offered advice, printed directions to sites and help with dinner reservations). It was also convenient having a reasonably priced parking facility ($10 a night) underneath the hotel. (L.A. is huge and sprawling, so you need a car to see anything beyond the immediate Hollywood area.) I would choose something newer and nicer if it were just the two of us, but if you are traveling with kids who are too big to share a sleeper sofa (and the local suite hotels I tried informed me that they did not have additional cots at their L.A. locations), this works out well.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID!!!!”
Reviews.Author: c4sper21
Reviews.Content: Possibly my worst experience of Los Angeles. We had been touring the west coast for 3 weeks and booked this hotel as our final destination, the last 3 nights of our holiday. It was the most expensive and by far the worst in both terms of facilities and service. When we arrived there was some kind of magician's event on at the club....we found it very difficult to find parking...but accepted that it was a one off due to the event. When we arrived at reception our visit started promisingly, we were met with a cocktail and a very enthusiastic female. We were shown to our room....right at the very back of the hotel in a corner on the first floor. Right away...I had my reservations. The room layout was very very odd and "snug" to say the least. As we had been travelling by parter was desperate for a shower. As soon as the shower went on..the lights and the tv in the room started to flash on and off.....there was a terrible rackett from a generator and the pwoer cut on and off.... Right away I called reception who told me they'd send an engineer....The engineer arrived to tell me that the room had been made by splitting a larger room into two...and that he'd had reservations about the electricity circuit since it had been done. Right away I called reception to explain....they advised that they'd fix it the following day. I refused to stay in a room which was unsafe. To be fair to the hotel...all be it grudgingly....they moved us another room, a much larger room, right next to reception.

Reviews.Title: “Extra charge”
Reviews.Author: RomiB
Reviews.Content: I just came back from the trip in California and stayed in Magic Castel,stuff are very friendly,change room upon request because the first one we got was super noisy overlooking the main str.Make sure you would not get that room.The other room was facing the Magic Castle club and had huge A/C going on so it was not very quiet either but at least it was not the huge traffic as the first room.Also this room had another door that would go into another probably 2 bedroom apt. and we could hear ppl talking any time they were at the living room.Our room (#305) need to be updated and they need to change toilet seat plus every door are very squeeky.Specialy our apt.next door.Breakfest was very good addition but one thing I have to say that they charge 10 $ per day for parking which we didn't know about and traveling from Florida half day(my fault that I sign paper when we arrived but beeing tired didn't read the whole page so it would be nice to mention those 70 $ for week for parking,don't you?Not to find out when you come back home there is extra charge. Go see Griffin Observatory(great view on whole LA,great show about planets ,earth),Getty museum-also nice view on Beverly Hills and downtown behind,Santa Barbara-the best city,clean,friendly ppl,beautiful,Solvang-dutch looking city 3,5 hours away from L.A,Farmers market-nice shopping,good dinning (just careful about parking charges),downtown L.A,Beverly Hills hotel ,maybe you will be lucky to see one of the hottest celebrities .(we saw Mariah Carey) and definately UCLA that is amazing (almost felt like in one of the Harry Potter movies).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - the personal touch”
Reviews.Author: sheamy
Reviews.Content: Having had the Magic Castle hotel recommended on trip advisor, I decided to book the hotel for 2 nights as part of our honeymoon to california. I booked directly through the website, and made the comment that it was our honeymoon stay (as I did with all the hotels - just in case!). When we arrived the bed had rose petals and there was complementary red wine & a conrats card from the hotel which I thought was very nice touch! The hotel its self is in a great location for discovering Hollywood & LA - if you really need to! We were very dissapointed with LA (in comparision with the other places on our trip, San Fran, San Diego etc), Hollywood was the wiredest mixture of freaks and disposible camera wielding tourists i have ever seen. However I am glad we did it as we seen all the sights form the movies etc. and was nice to have 'ticked the box'! The breakfast in the moring was more than adequate and the free drinks/snacks from reception were another unique plus point. Along with free wireless access & friendliness of the staff we were more than happy with our choice, and if this hotel was in a different city - we would definitley be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Service Beyond Belief”
Reviews.Content: This venue is a gem. I have stayed in Hotels around the world and have never been so pleased. The staff truley go beyond your expectations to make just about anything happen you request. The building itself is refurbished but with the finest quality of convienience. The pool is maintianed and breakfest is in. Rediculously close to the transport system to take you to Universal studios. A suite sleep 6 and is very family freindly. Grammans theatre is outside the door practically and the walk of fame. Hop on Hop off bus one block away. Freindliness of the staff is amazing and they just make you feel like you've been there forever. Good location and value for your money. When I return to LA this will be my hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: luvtrav
Reviews.Content: I was so grateful for the suggestion at Trip Advisor that this was a number one choice for LA. They treated us as if we were in a first class hotel. The room was huge and pleasant with kitchen. The breakfast by the pool was really a delight. Wi-Fi easy! Location is central near Hollywood Blvd. for the Chinese theater, Kodak theater. They drove us to the restaurant at the top of the hill and picked us up after dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Nice perks but needs touching up”
Reviews.Author: former_LA_resident
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MC Hotel primarily to take advantage of the opportunity to visit the Magic Castle (private club next door). The location is excellent for a Hollywood destination, indeed. And the Magic Castle club experience was one-of-a-kind. I was curious to see how nice the hotel would be due to its #1 ranking on this site. In this case, it seems to be a victim of overinflated expectations. Yes, there are nice perks and the staff is wonderfully attentive, friendly and helpful. As we had to leave early to catch a flight, they even had some pastries bagged for us (I had asked them prior to our visit). However, the physical hotel is dated and needs some attention to detail and updating. Caulking in bathrooms, molding, patio surrounding pool all need some work. Also we could clearly hear our neighbors through the suite door connecting the 2 rooms. One last important note....there is no elevator to the second floor rooms and the layout is awkward. This would be particularly difficult for someone a bit older carrying a suitcase. All in all, the room was very comfortable and we enjoyed the flat-screen television. Pretty fair overall, but beware of some shortcomings and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: outofmanyone44
Reviews.Content: First off let me start of by saying yes this hotel is old, and there are some matinence issues that need to be addressed. But for the price you can not get a better hotel in LA. A one-bedroom suite that would cost you double at nearly every other hotel. Now I would normall give this a 3 1/2 star if just based off the room. (ie. its a big room thats been recently renovated, but still needs work, cracks in wall, old smell) BUT the staff and ammenities make up for this and make this a 5 star stay. For example. - The free mini-bar was just great, all types of snacks/candy/soda that would cost you $2 each at a normal hotel -Free breakfast -nightly chocalets in room (or on valentines night, sweethearts) - Free internet. -$10 a night parking, VERY reasonable for LA -Staff went above and beyond call of duty. They drove us up to the japanese restraunt on the hill, free of charge. Offered to run out and get breakfast for us when they were running short. Offered the lady in front of me at check in to run out and get medicene when she said she wasent feeling well. All in all a great stay, and I hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mackensie
Reviews.Content: We moved into the Magic Castle Hotel after a lousy experience at their (ugly step-)sister hotel, the Hollywood Hills Hotel. We had come to LA for the Grammy Awards (we won in our category!) and had been looking for a great, small hotel experience. The MGH turned out to be a really nice - attentive staff, nice amenities, great location (just a block or two to Graumann's Chinese on Hollywood Blvd!). There were a couple of minor frustrations - for example, the wifi didn't work in the room. In this day and age, it's really a requirement in a hotel that serves visitors to a major city. In any event, in spite of the experience at the Hollywood Hills Hotel, I would heartily recommend the Magic Castle Hotel to a wide range of travelers and I expect to stay there on my next trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm wonder what you are thinking”
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our stay in Hollywood California, 2 days ago and our last night was in the Magic Castle. Everything people say about their staff is true. Wonderful people very very accommodating. The place was clean but needed lots and lots of work. Its really too bad the owners don't upgrade their property to match the high standard of their staff. It is really old style plaster rooms with old plywood cupboards in the kitchen and hallway, this is not retro just "old". An old apartment turned into a hotel room with very little character in the rooms. We had a room with 1 bedroom and kitchen. didn't sleep at all as there was a road right outside the bedroom window which was busy enough to keep us awake most of the night. The TV in the bedroom needs to be raised so you can see it while lying in bed. The bathroom had lino with burnt cigarette marks, the mirror had black marks on the mirror...like when it is old., the shower curtain didn't cover the entire tub area so as you shower you need to keep moving it around. The lighting in the suite needs to be improved it was quite dim at night. We could hear the people in the room next to us, very clearly and embarassingly I might add. As you can see in the pictures there are no draperies on the windows thus the sound does bounce around. I would recommend it if you need to stay in downtown hollywood this may be your cleanest and safest choice. as it is right next to the main attractions, the Kodak theater and such... but bring your earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: jonphil
Reviews.Content: This is my home away from home and everytime I'm in L.A., with or without my family, I stay here. Sure, sometimes the bathtub is a little rusted and the shelf in the bathroom falls down and the lights from cars going up to the Japanese restaurant on the hill in back of the hotel shine in, but this place has character! As one who appreciates Hollywood history and a place to just crash after a crazy day in L.A., this place is perfect. The staff is incredibly nice and helpful and the little amenities - the cold drink when you check in, the cider at night, the music playing when you go into the room - are great. The place reeks of Hollywood History and it is a great jumping off spot for Hollywood and the Valley (don't try to get on the 101 at rush hour from the hotel!). Franklin Avenue itself is historic - parts of Rebel Without A Cause was filmed here, Janis Joplin died next door, Yamashiro, the Japanese Restaurant on the hill has an incredible history, and Ozzie and Harriet's (and Ricky's) house where they lived during their long-running popular TV show is just a few blocks away on Franklin. The parking is a little tough, but what really makes this place so special is its location to the Hollywood tourist stuff, it's access to the Magic Castle (no jeans!), and most of all, its staff. It ain't first class luxury, but it's homey, clean and incredibly comfortable and roomy .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: Jenniferanne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Magic Castle for 2 nights in Jan and wished it had of been 7 nights. Booked this hotel due to TA reviews and were so delighted with our choice. Family of 6 we had 2 bedroom unit with sofa, Very clean, nice kitchen, plenty of space. The most outstanding quality of this hotel ( apart from the location) is without a doubt the staff ( especially Daphne). They couldn't do enough to make our stay fantastic, this service you do not get from bigger well known hotels. They had all the answers and right advice. Being a family of 6 we found the free snacks and drinks a huge bonus, they would pack us up a bag of goodies each day. We loved this hotel and have now decided to return in Jan 2009 for longer this time.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in hollywood!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimmyfairy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks and it was brilliant. It was very homely and the staff were so friendly they really made my holiday. The rooms were large, spacious and very clean. Everything about this hotel was excellent and I would definately stay there again. Thank you for making our holiday!!!

Reviews.Title: “not for everybody?”
Reviews.Author: timgrrr
Reviews.Content: I have to weigh in here. This place may not be for everyone. Do you like chain hotels where the rooms are exactly the same all over the country right down to the bedspreads and the picture on the wall? Do you like being far removed from all the hot spots with maybe some nice freeway noise to sooth you to sleep? Well, then maybe you WON'T care for this place. On the other hand, we really enjoyed the character of the room, its unique decor, the "neighborhood" feel of the breakfasts by the pool. The kitchenette was very helpful to us traveling with two ravenous teenagers. A hotel room with atypical roomy apartment-like feel. We were so close to what we came to LA for. For example: a nice stroll down Hollywood Blvd past Grumann's Chinese Theatre (who doesn't want to get a free ticket to a tv show or see a superhero or 2?) then some great shopping and eating choices on the corner, (eavesdropping on studio types talking about their deals at the next table) then onto the new-ish LA subway for a ride to Universal Studios (no parking hassles for us!). Super staff over the top with great advice and recommendations. Ohmygod you cannot imagine the view from the restaurant at the top of the hill - get 'em to give you a ride up there! Will definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Superb in every aspect”
Reviews.Author: Julesbusiness
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle far exceeded any expectations that I had when I booked. Upon arrival there were two members of staff on reception who genuinely took an interest in me, where I was from, how was the journey, what did I want to see/do in LA etc. As it was a hot day, they immediately gave me a complimentary drink and provided me with lots of advice about how to get around the area (as I didn’t have a hire car) as well as bus timetables and maps. Following this, I was shown to my room and was amazed at the size of it. It was as big as an apartment that you would be quite happy to live in. There was an open plan living room complete with TV, radio, sofa, comfy stools that lead into a dining area with full sized dining table and then on to a kitchen complete with sink, cupboards, microwave, full size fridge and a fresh coffee maker. In the back was the bedroom with two full size built in wardrobes and large comfortable bed and in the next room the bath/shower. My room was on the ground floor near reception so the view looked out onto the pool that is in the centre of the complex. A continental breakfast was available in the reception area and you could eat it in the sunshine at the tables around the pool. An internet service is also available in this area. The hotel is in an excellent location, just five minutes walk to the Chinese Theatre and all of the other attractions of Hollywood Boulevard. As mentioned, I didn’t have a car, but getting around was not a problem using the Magic Castle as a base as it is only about 7 minutes walk to Hollywood/Highland metro station, 4 minutes walk to a bus stop on Hollywood Boulevard that has buses that go to numerous places such as Sunset Strip etc and close to a number of attractions such as the Kodak Theatre and a stunning view of the Hollywood sign. When it was time to check out, the receptionist was genuinely interested in how I enjoyed my stay, what I thought of the accommodation, where I was heading to next and if I knew how to get to get transport to my next destination. When I told her I would be taking an internal flight, she said, “sounds like you are in for a long day” and gave me a large bag of snacks and drinks free of charge. Perfect. It was then just a 7 minute walk to the metro station that took me directly to LAX and onwards. Overall, this is an excellent hotel in a great location with superb staff, incredible rooms and provides an experience that exceeds expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A happy holiday”
Reviews.Author: 8happytraveller
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 very happy days at the Magic castle Hotel. Our rooms weren't flash but were so so spacious and very comfortable. The bed was so good. Loved having the kitchen and our little balcony to sit on. The free goodies from Reception were really appreciated especially by our teenagers as was the breakfast. My favourite was the complimentary hot apple cider waiting as you came in cold and tired at end of day! The best thing tho is the STAFF. They genuinely seem to care! They want you to have a great stay and will do anything to assist you. The girls on Reception could not have been better - we felt sad to say goodbye! Great location - will be back

Reviews.Title: “It was just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: Canada4me
Reviews.Content: My two teenage children and I stayed at the Magic Castle for 4 nights after reading lots of different hotel reviews. I was very happy with our decision as the staff were friendly and very helpful. We had a one bedroom suite and my only comment would be that because the suite was right in the corner ( opposite the reception) it was a little dark. It was not easy to keep the blinds open as the table outside is where breakfast was eaten. The rooms were spacious and the kitchen great as we could prepare or bring in what ever we needed. The hotel is well located and the staff helped with directions on how to get to anywhere you wanted and would take time to explain things. I would have liked to know about the ability to visit the show at the Magic Castle when I booked as it requires formal attire which I did not have with me but would have bought if I had known. Ask about this if you are thinking of going. The breakfast was good and it suited me that I could take it to our room for the kids as they did not rise as early as me. I would definately go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: alli34
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night here and the management was so nice. They answered all of our questions, provided us with great information and made our stay pleasant. The hotel is older but in decent shape. When we got there, our room was upgraded to a suite, which was nice. It is very close to all of the attractions. Would recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and superior customer service as an alternative to the chain g”
Reviews.Author: BrotherSmith
Reviews.Content: Summary: The Magic Castle – great location and superior customer service as an alternative to the chain gang. When and why we stayed: We stayed here for 5 nights in December 2007 during a holiday in LA and Las Vegas. Cost: We paid £90 per night for the room plus breakfast. We booked the room via Expedia. Room: We stayed in Room 219 which was actually an apartment with separate bedroom, bathroom, kitchen & lounge/dining room. The bedroom contained a king-sized bed, television, drawers and vast wardrobe space with no shortage of hangers (a pet hotel peeve of mine is that most provide a dearth of hangers!) The lounge/dining room was family sized and contained a sofa; desk and chair; television; DVD player; CD player, as well as dining table and chairs. The kitchen contained a fridge, microwave, oven, hob and a life-saver - a coffee maker! The bathroom was clean, and included a smallish tub and shower. Complimentary toiletries were supplied each day. The Hotel: The Magic Castle may not be the most modern or grandest hotel that we have stayed in but more importantly for us the customer service provided was superb and the staff were very helpful, something you can’t always state after a stay in a chain hotel. It was the nothing-is-too-much trouble approach that we appreciated, for example, the hotel posted our cards for us for no charge – and they all arrived! The Magic Castle provides some wonderful extras like a complimentary Mini Bar (from Reception). The Menu includes Coke, Doritos, Kit Kat and Popcorn. The in-room replenished daily Wolfgang Puck coffee was super! Breakfast cereals, juices, scones and croissants are left in reception from 7AM each morning. Breakfast can be eaten at tables besides the pool or in your room (trays are supplied). There is parking outside the hotel or in an underground parking area (access obtained via your room key). A $10 per day charge is levied. If you have mobility issues ask for a ground floor room as there is no lift to the Upper Floor. Location: The Magic Castle is in a great location – it really is only 5 minutes (safe including at night) walk from Hollywood Boulevard and the Hollywood & Highland Mall (where the Oscars are held in the Kodak Theatre); Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the Walk of Fame. The city: LA is a fantastic, cosmopolitan, real, living city. This was my second visit and my wife’s first, so I could guide her to the highlights. We visited: Hollywood Forever cemetery; the Capitol Tower; Hollywood Farmers Market (excellent); The Grove Mall (A Mall!); Santa Monica (The Pier isn’t as good as Brighton’s) and Venice Beach; Pasadena; The Getty Art Gallery; The Getty Villa in Malibu (it was cool to drive on the Pacific Highway to get there); and Beverley Hills which is such a cliché but I strangely enjoyed none the less. Driving in LA was nowhere near as bad as I had expected. Although in the words of the Dionne Warwick song: “LA is a great big freeway”. Having GPS in the car really helped and I would suggest essential equipment for any visitor to LA. Feel free to E mail me if you require further information.

Reviews.Title: “Sad for rest of LA hotels that this is #1”
Reviews.Author: WorldTripster
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights over Christmas. There were some really great things about the hotel - staff seemed very jolly, the free "mini bar"; basically you can select soft drinks, chips, candies from a huge selection - for free, 24 hours a day. The continental breakfast wasn't really gourmet, but certainly there were some nice pastries and hey - it's free! On the downside our room was barely big enough for cat swinging and the recent renovations themselves look like they need some renovating. Our main complaint was that our room was really noisy. The walls are paper thin and, apparently unlike the other guests, we are in the minority as we like to sleep until 9.30am or so when we are on vacation. Sadly we were woken daily at 7am by stomping up and down stairs outside, doors slamming and whoever happened to be in the room next door - thanks to an adjoining door they literally sounded as though they were in the same room as us. Also slightly off-putting - the ashtray for our floor was right outside our window and by our air conditioning unit so a few times we had the A/C on only to find moments later our room smelling of smoke. Also pretty annoying was the lack of regulation of hot water in the shower - every day there was leaping in and out of the stream of water from either being scalded or frozen. It's a sad indictment of LA hotels that this is ranked the best hotel - it is not the worst I have ever stayed in, but it's no star. All in all the location is pretty good, and rates reasonable, if you are a smoker that doesn't need much sleep/privacy and is OK with an invigorating game of hot/cold in the shower every morning this is the perfect place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Mini Bar”
Reviews.Author: SunlovingSnowgirl
Reviews.Content: We had so much fun at Magic Castle! We stayed 3 nights. The best part was the friendly and accomadating staff, who packed us a "snack bag" for our beach day, cleaned our room and organized it wonderfully even though we pretty much left it a sty every time we left, and accomadated our very large daily request for bottled water and snacks! The pool was fun and really suprisingly not very busy. We loved the breakfast and would go back to the Magic Castle in a heartbeat! The rooms are fun becuase they are not your typical hotel room, they are like mini apartments. The room could use a repaint and new furniture, but they are comfortable and fun, and unique! The place is smaller than what it looks on online pics, which I think is nice. Overall, Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle is Truly Magical”
Reviews.Author: jewelgem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle for 1 night and we only have praise for the property. We were welcomed with an ice cool glass of retro lemonade and were told by the lovely receptionist we had been upgraded for free as they had the room avaliable. We couldnt have been happier we were told were to park our car and how to get to our room and what time breakfast was which we didnt even know was included so that was also an added bonus! We made our way to our room and were amazed by the size we had been given a suite and it was lovely, it had a kitchen a living area a fab bathroom that had lots of mirrors to do your hair and makeup and really good lighting! They had even left some chocolates on our pillow with the next days weather forcast! Only complaint would be how dark the rest of the room was but thats all! The Location is also fantastic it is simply 5 mins walk to the chinese theatre and the area isnt scary at all, so we were very pleased. Having that location made the Magic Castle worth every penny. The next morning breakfast was served around the gorgeous pool area and we had coffee cerals and muffins in the sun it was a great way to start our days sightseeing! Overall i would say The Magic Castle is excellent value for money as u dont actually pay that much for the service you receive, in my opinion i would always pay that little bit extra to stay here for all the added extras and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Major investment needed”
Reviews.Author: Rohi
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that a Tripadvisor recommendation has been off the mark. This hotel needs a major refurbishment and some serious investment rather than cosmetic amateur tinkering. We stayed 2 nights and asked to be moved the 2nd night. Had we not been moved to a better room (still not great) we would have moved hotels. This was echoed by other guests who also had to be moved. We were touring California and this is the only hotel that was well below expectations, such that we would not recommend it or stay there again. The staff were friendly and helpful but seem to experience requests for room changes frequently. They have a few rooms which are adequate and some which are not. Even the adequate rooms still have flaws such as enamel peeling from shower trays, bits of board covering up holes, stains on carpets. The staff were very helpful but that cannot compensate for a basically inferior accommodation. I'm not sure how this hotel made it to Number 2 rating for LA???

Reviews.Title: “Much better than cookie cutter hotel chains”
Reviews.Author: mrs_brown_7
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel and we were extremely pleased with the facility, accomodations and especially the service. Our one bedroom suite was LARGE, the main bed (queen) was divine. Nice sheets, not the cheap stuff and good pillows. There was a flip out sofa which our young adult son said , "not bad for a flip out" and they provided a single roll away bed for our young adult daughter who said " the sheets were soft and the blanket was fluffy". The suite was impeccably clean. The staff was great. What ever you needed they either got for you or pointed you in the right direction. The location was great we just parked the car and walked to our desitinations (all touristy stuff). They provided a shuttle to take us to the Magic Castle which was just up the hill but hard to walk in heels. The morning breakfast was delicious; great coffee, delicious pastries (try the little bran muffins...yummy). Everyone was so helpful and pleasant we had such a wonderful time and I highly recommend it if you like unique places to stay. This is not a brand new facility but it offers everything and more. It is truly charming and cozy,check it out. It beats the cookie cutter hotels hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: katetkins
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 2 star trying to act like a 4 star. We were impressed with the pictures and discription online and booked it for one night in the standard room. Although it started off nice with a free upgrade and a glass of sparkiling lemonade at check-in...it slowly became a big dissapointment. The hotel is very old and has a old getto apartment feel to it. The room from a far looked okay but when you walk in you will see stained carpet, peeling paint, cracks in the walls, older stained furniture, and rusty tubs. There were cob webs in the shelving and hair from the past guest in the tub in our room. The maids must do a half-ass job because there was tons of stuff they missed. The next morning we ate in the breakfast which also SEEMED pretty nice. After breakfast I wanted to make tea and when I poured the water in a cup I noticed brown chunks floating in it. It was pretty discusting because that was the same water I used for my oatmeal that I already consumed! I was assured that it was "only" old coffee and that they would take care of it. Don't be fooled...this is a 2 star and NOT worth the money. It angers me how much money these places bring in and where it's NOT going.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ster74
Reviews.Content: Although I do agree with some of the previous reviews that state that this hotel could use some renovations, that in no way means that the hotel was dirty or run down, the room was clean as was the rest of the hotel. More importantly the service that the staff provided was exellent, from the time we checked in until the time we checked out we always felt welcome. The staff was friendly and very helpful with any questions that we had and went above and beyond to make our stay an enjoyable one. The extra bonus of having complimentary drinks and snacks available from the front desk was appreciated, it was nice to be able to grab a drink to take with you on the way out. I would definitely recommend the Magic Castle Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The friendly staff make for a great stay”
Reviews.Author: Poulman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bargain. Great location in Hollywood, 5 mins walk to Grauman's Chinese Theatre, underground car park (you need a car in LA), big rooms to suit a family with a couple of kids. This used to be a small apartment block, so the rooms have separate bedrooms, walk-in wardrobes, large sitting rooms with sofa bed (for the kids) and fully equipped kitchen areas. Excellent continental breakfast is served by the pool and there is a free mini-bar (yes you did read this right). Basically you can get whatever non-alcoholic drink and snacks you want from the reception for no charge. But the best feature are the staff, They will bend over backwards to serve and nothing is too much trouble for them. After they make sure you have directions and maps for your destination, they practically force in to your hands cold bottles of water to take with you. The building is in need of moderate maintenance, and I could possibly knock a star off for that reason But the beds are really comfortable, and as i said the staff really make this place. Definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Caslte needs updating”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDallasTX
Reviews.Content: Depending on what type of traveler you are this hotel may suite your needs. I stayed here on business and had an average stay. However, this hotel is superb for families with kids (especially in the summer months) when they can play in the pool. My one bed room suite was very large and included a kitchen but needed a lot of minor repairs (paint, wall texturing, a few fixtures in the bathroom). All rooms have a dvd player with a complimentary video library at the front desk. The beds are comfortable and the a/c unit cools very well. The wifi is complimentary and worked fairly well. A big plus was the complimentary snack bar at the front desk. Munchies, snack crackers, popcorn, all types of soda, and candy etc. You are welcome to ask for anything, anytime, and its complimentary (although a tip is always nice once in a while, in my opinion). I do want to note that upon my first night there I made sure to check all of my windows and sliding door and found them ALL to be open and unlocked. I was a little concerned because I had left all of my valuables there and then found that someone could have walked right into the room. Housekeeping "supposedly" does this to air out the rooms but just recheck yours if you decide to stay. Dinner at Yamashiro was well worth it. Not too expensive. The hotel can make reservations for you and will provide transportation to the top of the hill, complimentary. Continental breakfast is served 7am to 9am everyday. Very good pastries, juices, and croissants. Parking is $9 per day. No room service. Staff was pleasant and caring. The hotel provides a decent service for the price. Since this is an old apartment building, your hotel experience is bound to be different. I prefer more of a typical hotel establishment with a few more amenities. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Be Nicer”
Reviews.Author: KiwisAbr0ad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Magic Castle for 4 nights in September with our 2 kids aged 8 & 10. They fell in love with the staff there, especially Daphne who along with everyone else was fantastic.I can't speak highly enough of them. We found the hotel well located, the room clean and quiet but the staff really make the difference. They couldn't do more for you which makes this place a winner. Its not the flashest hotel around but the added things like free snacks, adequate breakfast and superb service make The Magic castle a must if visiting Hollywood. Highly Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SnoopyTennessee
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel. The hotel is located in Hollywood, a couple of blocks from the Highland Mall and Grauman's Chinese Theater. It isn't fancy, but that is part of it's charm. It gives you the feel as if you are living in L.A. The staff is very friendly. Where most hotels charge you an outrageous price for water, sodas and snacks, they give them to you. Whenever you want something to drink or a snack, all you have to do is ask at the front desk. The pool is heated. A swim at night is a great way to relax. The breakfast was good. They have cereal, yogurt and fresh pastries. The scones were really good. If you get a chance, make a dinner reservation at the Magic Castle. You normally have to be a member or be invited to visit it. Hotel guests are allowed to visit it as long as you eat dinner there. It was a lot of fun. When we are in the L.A. area, we will be sure to stay at the Magic Castle Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat the staff here”
Reviews.Author: klingoneddie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in Sept as part of our tour of southern Califonia. I have to say that the location of the hotel really was excellent, only 3/4 minutes walk from Manns Chinese Theatre and 4/5 mins to the Metro (very handy for getting to /from Universal Studios). Hotel parking was an underground secure park for only $9 a day. Thats a bargain in this part of town, believe me. Found the hotel really easily from the Freeway, just ensure you have printed off a map from Expedia or bought a street map beforehand. Arrival and checkin was quick and made more pleasurable with the refreshments made available by the reception staff. Staff--let me tell you about the staff. You will find it very hard to find a hotel in which all the staff are so helpful, cheerful and welcoming. Sean and Megan deserve a special mention here, in particular Sean who really went the extra mile. (on checkout, Sean made up a bag of goodies for us for our drive to Vegas) Every evening one of the staff would come to your room to check everything was OK and distribute chocolates!! Every question posed to the staff (you know , those boring ones about where to go, how to get there etc, the ones they had heard a thousand times before) were met with a cheerful smile and enthusistic reply. I was so impressed with the service I had to tell Gretchen, the desk manager ,how godd her people were. Complimentary breakfast was good and set you up nicely for the day. Pool was small but cool, just what you need in LA. Only downside to this place is that it does need some refurbishment BUT rooms are clean and comfortable. (this is the reason I have given 4 stars rather than 5) The bed was great . Great views from the restaurant at the top of the hill. Shuttle bus will take you up there. We went as a family of four, kids both over 20 but we all enjoyed the stay. I would happily stay here again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly hotel in the centre of things”
Reviews.Author: betsywanderlust
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Personal Service, Good Location Hotel is relitavely small so great personal service staff friendly and helpful, pool looked nice especially at night, didn't use it though. So unsure what temperature like but I heard it was heated. Breakfast continental style. Cereals, croissants, muffins, toast, Juices etc. I liked the muffins You can get free soft drinks and snacks from reception if you ask There is a self service laundry room which is handy and its not too expensive for washing or drying. Close to Chinese Theatre, which is just down the slight hill, turn the corner. I have to say I felt a bit unsure about walking back to hotel at night as its up a side street, don't know if I should have been worried or not but we were ok. On the positive side it really is not too far from the centre of things. Only drawbacks; The price - paid approximately £125 altogether, per night which I consider quite expensive Kitchen did not have all the equipment that I would have wanted, a bit short on cutlery, pans, cooking equipment. And a little bottle of washing up liquid would have been handy, self catering hotels sometimes provide shampoo etc, why not washing up liquid - just a thought. But I expect if I had asked more things would have been provided, as it happened we ate out anyway. Only thing used was the fridge for drinks Would I recommend? If you are willing to spend £100+ a night then yes. If I went back to Los Angeles I'd stay again. (Disclaimer - This information is my personal opinion only, not fact!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: UK_holiday_traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 3 nights and were upgraded immediatley when we checked into the room because of a problem in the bathroom. The hotel is well situated within easy walking distance of Sunset Boulevard and other attractions. It is clean, needs some updating in bathrooms but the biggest bonus was the helpful staff. All staff without question from reception to the cleaners couldn't do enough for you. There were free soft drinks, snacks, maps and useful info on places to go and where to eat. Of particular mention was Sean "The Guru" who was a credit to the hotel. I definately recommend the Magic Castle situated next door to the hotel it was brilliant. Although you do need to wear jacket and tie (Jackets can be supplied bu the hotel or Castle at reception) and ladies are expected to wear cocktail dresses - still worth it. A good class hotel with outstanding staff that makes it the right choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: msmegmog
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in a King room for one night in September predominately so we could go to the Magic Castle, and the hotel didn't disappoint. After staying in 4 other hotels during our holiday in the US, it was the only place that felt like home and we both slept like logs.The service is impeccable - from the drink offered at checkin, to the special touches like a free mini bar service, 24 hour access to the pool and the extra efforts the staff go to ie. allowing us to return to the hotel to have a shower before our late night flight home to Australia and even driving us up the small hill to the Magic Castle due to me wearing heels! It's not the cheapest hotel in Hollywood - but definitely the best value for money, and you can't beat the location. I'd thoroughly recommend and will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the BEST service received in any hotel!”
Reviews.Author: quickcars
Reviews.Content: We booked this property to be able to enjoy the Magic Castle for my birthday and were not dissapointed! I recently read a negative review and wonder if that guest and I were at the same hotel! This 'botique' hotel was formerly a small apartment complex delightfully converted to a hotel that allows their guests access to the famous Magic Castle (fees required but worth every penny if you're a fan of magic). We found our one bedroom suite most welcoming. It was clean, freshly painted and the linens divine. Yes, we've stayed at much newer, more modern properties, but NONE with such OUTSTANDING CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! FREE (yes, free) snacks for the asking....soft drinks, water, candy bars, etc. Breakfast included the most delicous scones ever made among other choices. This property would be a super bargain for a travelling family to the Hollywood area. Its central location and spacious accommodations allow one to save $ by cooking in. We are local southern Californians and were only interested in attending the Castle until our arrival. The concierge enthusiastically provided a walking tour map and lots of local information. A real tourist's delight. Although I've not checked rates for similar properties, we found this place a pretty good deal! If you want Ritz attention & roomy accommodations, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Not top of the list”
Reviews.Author: PK1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel following the reviews on Tripadvisor. The location is really good, as its close to Hollywood and all trips, however the hotel itself is very basic. It stands beside the very impressive Magic Castle club, but you cant go there unless you wish to reserve a table for dinner. The rooms are very small, and just about clean. The bathroom was not very pleasant and there was just about enough room to get in and out of the room, even though it was a larger than normal. Overall, we would not recommend staying here as its quite below par and the reviews were not really accurate.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect location”
Reviews.Author: soteri
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stopped here for 7 nights while visiting our son who lives in hollywood. This is our second visit to the Magic Castle and once again it was a great stay,from booking over the phone with Adam to meeting Gretchin again who made us feel most welcome. We stopped in a 1bed apartment which has all you need for an extended stay,full kitchen,2 tv,s,great comfy king bed,warm pool,internet wireless and the most kind and helpful staff. It is a short walk to the Hollywood attractions and close to the metro line. In suming up after a 14hr flight from Australia to the US,the Magic Castle IS our home away from home. Terry and Bev Anderson, Ballina NSW Australia

Reviews.Title: “Great Service would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: SteveUK07
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere close to Hollywood and Universal Studios to stay on our last trip. We picked the hotel due to great reviews on a number of sites so set out with high expectations. Have to say we were not disappointed, some of the best service I have ever had at any hotel. The hotel is very well placed to get to Hollywood, Chinese Cinema and El Capitan cinema are just one block over. We were able to walk with a 7 year old child to the El Capitan and watch a Film, great fun as they still have an Organist playing in the cinema before the film starts. Very easy to drive to Universal Studios, only takes about 10 minutes. Would definitely stay again if I was visiting Central LA

Reviews.Title: “magic stay at the magic castle!”
Reviews.Author: jo67London_UK
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Magic Castle in August and it was fab! The hotel is in an excellent location just a couple of blocks from the walk of fame and the entertaining Hollywood and Highland centre. Upon our arrival from LAX we were greeted with glasses of chilled juice and from then on the staff were just so friendly and helpful. We were given free bottled water at night and a selection of cookies and hershey bars all free!! We had a suite sleeping six, we had ample room and the rooms were clean. In the mornings the hotel does a complimentary breakfast of cereals, croissants, fruit, yogurts, toast and being America, doughnuts!! they really go the extra mile. we had read reviews of this hotel and this is really what made us pick it... we were not disappointed.... would absolutely stay here again. Just one moan DO NOT eat at The Grill in the Highland centre.....patronising staff, overpriced food, worst meal ive had in the states.. ever!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I did not change to Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: ninabean
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative review recently I was a little concerned about the Magic Castle Hotel. Thankfully this hotel turned out to be the best during our tour of the West Coast/Nevada. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which provided two double beds in one room, full lounge with sofa bed and kitchen. All areas were clean, slightly dated but spacious and more than met our needs. We had a small balcony overlooking the pool area which was also lovely. Of course as has been said may times the service is second to none. It more than makes up for any shortcomings that the property may have ( although I cant find any!). Gretchens team are the most helpful and friendly reception staff I have ever come across. Advice on sightseeing, directions, restaurants were all willingly provided. Complimentary mini bar went down well with the kids. The breakfast was excellent, providing fresh pastries/scones/muffins etc. We were also delighted to recieve a tasty calamari appetizer compliments of the hotel when we visited the Asian restaurant situated above the hotel( fantastic food and views). The location of the hotel was also perfect, a short 5 min walk taking us into centre of Hollywood and Highland. We had a fabulous time in LA, partly due to the MCH. We will return one day and tell all our friends to visit this hotel if in LA. Many thanks to all including Daphne( who persuaded me to keep my reservation by email prior to our visit).

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pheslie
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights in a jr suite. 2 adults 2 teens. the room was clean and spacious. the beds were very comfortable. the small kitchen was fine because i was on vacation and not cooking dinners. the pool area was fine. it was not too small as others felt. the staff is amazing. they are california beautiful to look at with a personality and hospitality just as beautiful. this hotel gives you anything you may want...drinks snacks movies sparkling lemonaid ice pops by the pool any day any hour you may not even have to ask...they just know your hot and tired and hand you a treat. ok now to the bathrooms...they are very clean but small and not updated.....but the shower was hot the toilet flushed and they were spotless,,,,,couldnt take away from the rest of the hotel.parking was underground and secure. a small grassy area across the street attracted a few undesireables but they never bothered us or even noticed us..they stayed on their side of the street and did what ever it was they were doing. we were away almost 3 weeks this was our favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “As described by all positive reviewers .. Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: leocleoc
Reviews.Content: We needed a large living space for 4 people. Mom, Dad, 18 year old daughter and 20 year old son. We stayed here due to the reviews. We were not disappointed. The room was a 1 bed suite. The main king size bed, sofa bed, and roll away bed were all very comfortable. The suite was large, very clean with good storage and A/C. The kitchen was very clean and had everything needed. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Daphne and Shawn. The Magic Castle hotel staff rock.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel staff in the USA”
Reviews.Author: rojp
Reviews.Content: spacious apartment style rooms (good for our kids 8 and 12) well equipped in a great central location 5 mins walk from chinese theatre and roosevelt hotel (best burgers i have ever had at 25 degree restaurant there). pool was small and crowded so we didn't swim - breakfast was excellent and generally you could sit around the pool to eat in the morning. i agree with other comments that the staff are amazing - all of them - nothing was too much trouble. they also have a great free minibar policy and free dvds which i am sure costs them small $ but makes the guests feel good - great idea! we will stay there again in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Out of Date - Appeared Dirty -”
Reviews.Author: 99bottles
Reviews.Content: Warning - I'm about to pan this place. I know people don't like it when people give bad reviews. If you read my review you will probably think "well that guy is picky or a snob" or "this guy is an idiot that has never travelled because look at all the positive reviews". Just so you know where I am coming from and can better judge whether or not you believe my bad review. I'm a 30 year old professional and have done a lot of travelling - some for business and a lot for fun. I'm from Toronto. I've travelled extensively in the United States. I know that this place is a 3 star hotel and not a 5 star hotel. I understand that in a major North American city that $180 is not a lot to spend for a nights stay in a downtown location. All I expect from a 3 star hotel is: clean and current decor in the lobby and rooms but nothing flashy, basic amenities like internet and a desk to do some work on, and reasonable staff that are polite and moderately helpful. If this place had all of these things I would have given it a 5 rating or said it was excellent. I was on my honeymoon and I would not come back to this hotel. My main complaint is the rooms. I'd rather just spend an extra $75 or $100 a night to stay somewhere decent. If I had known what this hotel was really like I would have gladly dropped the extra cash somewhere else. I paid about $180 bucks for a Thursday night stay - too expensive for what it was. - Cons - The pictures on the website are misleading because they don't show you the grungy bathrooms, noisy window unit air-conditioners, or stained carpets. The room also had a musty smell which I might expect in Mexico or South America but not in the United States. I was pretty disgusted with our first room and asked to be moved. The next room was still grungy but slightly better. Honestly, this place needs to change the carpets in the rooms. It could use a complete overhaul, however, it definitely needs new carpets. I know that the rooms are probably just as clean or dirty as any other hotel but when the carpets are beat up and stained it just makes you feel like you need to wear shoes in the room at all times. Both the rooms had a dirty $30 a night motel feel about them. - Pros - Good location to do all the tacky Hollywood stuff (visit Mann's theatre, the walk of fame, etc.). Friendly and helpful staff during the day time. The night time staff llooked like they were into goth, demons and depression. Maybe I'm getting old but I'm not into hotel staff having lip rings and blue hair (I don't know if they were friendly or helpful because I didn't bother talking to them). The pool was open 24 hours (but looked pretty nasty and was more of kids urinal than a pool). Free WiFi for your laptop. Nice soaps, creams, and stuff. Pretty comfortable bed and bedding. Free snacks and DVDs that are available in the lobby. - How is this #2 on TripAdvisor???? - Because of this hotel and it's #2 rating in Los Angeles, I don't know whether I will ever trust TripAdvisor ratings again. Are travellers so enamoured by friendly staff and free candy bars that they overlook the rooms being disgusting and in drastic need of renovation. The only thing magical about this place is that it somehow got a #2 rating on TripAdvisor. Don't stay here if you want to spend anytime at all in your room or at the hotel. This place is NOT romantic. It might be okay for famillies with kids because you can get rooms with kitchenettes to save on dining costs. We just had a room without the kitchen. Overall my 2 rating is generous.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: mary092
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for 3 nights and were disappointed. This is the first time I've sent a review to tripadvisor, however I'm surprised it's ranked as number 2 in Tripadvisor's recommendations. We found the room OK. The whole place needs a bit of a re-vamp. The rooms have carpets on the floors and they are quite dirty and need replacing. This is quite unhygenic we felt. Also, in the corridor areas, the carpets and really filthy. And paintwork is quite stained in places. Staff are OK, but don't dress in a professional manner- there's a general 'goth' theme to the dress of the staff. The accommodation was quite expensive, and I felt the need to add my review as I don't feel this place is up to scratch.

Reviews.Title: “Offbeat but fun and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: daisygirl59
Reviews.Content: Overall our experience at the Magic Castle Hotel was very good, and my two kids both said they wanted to come back - and I did not hear that comment about either of the other two hotels where we stayed in LA. This is a hotel with history and personality. It's not another Holiday Inn Express or whatever. It is also in the city, folks - yes, you will see homeless people, and yes, you will see interesting street life on Hollywood Boulevard. If that scares or upsets you, I would advise picking another area in which to sightsee. Hollywood may be undergoing some gentrification but it is not Disneyland. As everyone says, the front desk staff members go out of their way to make sure you are satisfied. I saw the manager all over the place all the time, not hiding back in an office. We had a king bed suite and the space was just huge. The kitchen and bathroom were very clean; I had no problem at all there. My favorite spot was the balcony over the pool, where you could sit and read the newspaper, watch the kids in the pool, or just drink your morning coffee before another day of sightseeing. Breakfast included the yummiest scones ever and top-notch coffee. Now, on the other hand, it is a remodeled older former apartment building and there are some irritants. The stairs and railings need paint, and some coverings on the stairs are coming loose. The carpet in the hallways is getting worn. There was a crack in the paint on one wall in our kitchen, and a small hole in a window. The stopper in the bathroom sink didn't work. Some of the housekeeping was a little spacey - plenty of forks and knives in the utensil drawer but no spoons, no glasses replaced one day, no bath mat another day. But if it really deeply mattered to me I am sure the desk would have sent up more spoons or another bath mat immediately. I think this is a great little hotel, and I'll be sad if it gets sold and turned into yet another condo development or generic hotel. The best option would be new owners who could spruce it up without raising the prices too much or losing the great staff members. Thanks again for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff went above and beyond the call of duty!”
Reviews.Author: Love_2_Travel233
Reviews.Content: Date: August 6, 2007 Reviewer: Kitchener, Ontario My son and I stayed at the Magic Castle hotel from July 20 to 24. This hotel was on a list recommended by the school that my son was attending an open house for as it was only a 15 minute walk from the school. I thought the hotel would be bigger and was a little disappointed when we arrived. It reminded me of the show Melrose Place with the rooms all surrounding the pool. But the staff put us at ease the minute we arrived and the good thing about a smaller hotel is that the staff get to recoginize you very quickly and they also know who doesn't belong there. They were so friendly and greeted every time we walked by.My son and I had a one bedroom suite with dining area and kitchen and 2 queen beds that were very comfortable.The rooms were very clean and large.
