The shower was amazing as it had so much pressure that washing my hair was so easy. 45 minutes before we were checking out and our limo ( that the hotel had arranged for us) was to pick us up, I dropped a glass in the sink and it broke and I sliced my finger quite badly and I could not get the bleeding to stop. My son went down to the front desk and staff came to my aid and said I needed stitches and they would drive me to a local clinic. Panic set in as I was afraid we would miss our flight. The hotel manager drove me and my son to a clinic she goes to and that was 5 minutes from the hotel and when we arrived she explained my delimma. They saw me immediately and she waited in the waiting room for me and helped my son with all the paper work. 30 minutes later with 5 stitches in my finger we were on our way back to the hotel, were the limo driver had been contacted and asked to wait for us. He did and we were only 15 minutes off schedule and we made our flight with time to spare. I can't thank the management and hotel staff enough for taking care of me and keeping my son calm through this unusual event. I would recommend this hotel even if I didn't injure my finger and we will definately be staying there again when my son is attending school there.

Reviews.Title: “Unmatched Customer Service...Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaPhil
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is a quaint, small hotel (42 rooms I think) just steps off the Hollywood strip and within very short walking distance to the Chinese theater, Kodak theater, etc. Our family of 4 (kids: 15 and 11) stayed 4 nts in late July in a spacious 1-bedroom suite...more like a 1-bedroom apartment. Beds were cozy, climate control and wireless network (free) were reliable and cleanliness, impeccable. This is an older building and nothing fancy but nevertheless, clean, tastefully decorated and spacious. As you have read from previous reviews, the most redeeming quality of this hotel is its Customer Service. Sort of a throwback, of sorts, to the hotels of old where customers were treated as royalty and where the entire staff are all on the "same page" when it comes to taking personal responsibilty for exceeding customer expectations. Very rarely do you find this prevailing attitude among staff in American hotels. The hotel offers free beverages, movies and snacks unlike most hotels that "nickel and dime" its customers to squeeze out every bit of profit imaginable. Here, they truley understand that their customers are their best advertisers. Needless to say, we had a great time at the Magic Castle and overall we had a blast in Hollywood. Special thanks to Daphne Springs who went "above and beyond" to help make this a vacation we will never forget. We were sad to leave this place but look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very Warn Out”
Reviews.Author: milwaukee123
Reviews.Content: My family just got back from the Magic Castle in July. We were greeted with a warm welcome. The positives of this hotel were the unlimited free snacks and beverages and the directions to places from the front desk. My family thought the rooms were very outdated and kind of grungy, especially the bathrooms. The bathrooms had lots of chipped paint, and the bathtub barely drained. The rooms also had very old tvs. We decided to check out a day early because we were not satisfied with the room quality. They said it was fine and we wouldn't be charged. When we checked out we paid for the two nights we were there. I just got my credit card bill and we were charged $130 more than the amount from the receipt I had signed. Now I have to dispute it with the credit card company. This hotel is really no better than a Motel 8.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sophie040
Reviews.Content: Family of 5 (3 teenagers)- we stayed for 3 nights in this comfortable though basic hotel. very good sized suite, great breakfast, very friendly and helpful staff even though we arrived after midnight. Free minibar a great success. Very close, by car, to Venice beach and Universal studios and within walking distance of Kodak theatre and walk of fame. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Good, And even Better”
Reviews.Author: Cockycorkey
Reviews.Content: If you want large rooms, with friendly staff, great location as a tourist family friendly with privacy and attentive staff that will go out of their way to help then STAY HERE...... One of the best hotels we stayed at during our 3 week visit to CA. Can't say enough about it. Great place to stay......

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZorglubWaterloo
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay. All the good comments are right. At the arrival they offer you a welcome drink, explain you the things to do in the hotel, give you a map of the area and explain you main things to see. Rooms are very big. We wanted to order a guided tour of LA, they recommended some to us and even called to make the arrangement for us. What a great service, with a family atmosphere. All day long you can get free drinks (water, juice, pop) from the front desk as well as snacks or sweets. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff, so and so rooms”
Reviews.Author: frombaritomiami
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for a base in Los Angeles, and the staff is really magnificent, however the rooms are outdated and in need of renovation. First the good: free internet, great great staff always helpful, free snack foods 24/7, good parking although tight spaces in the garage, good breakfast with pastries from Susina, a local bakery, available coin laundry. The bad: we stayed in two different rooms, a regular and then a suite room and the findings were similar. Peeling paint in the bathrooms, rusty brown water from the sink and the tub for the first few minutes of the water running, our lampshade was broken on the night stand, the tub faucet was leaking, rooms were not serviced until 5-6pm. Lastly, but this just for those who have kids, there is no elevator and multiple ramps of stairs to go up and down, it can become difficult with luggage and small babies. I was told that the hotel, as well as a nearby hotel and the Yamashiro resturant are up for sale and maybe that is why the rooms are a little rundown; if it was not for that this hotel would deserve 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service/Rooms Need Some Fixing”
Reviews.Author: tennis1122
Reviews.Content: We recently got back from our stay at the Magic Castle and when we first arrived we were greeted with sparkling lemonade. When my husband first entered the room he was less than impressed, especially\ with the bathroom. There were numerous cracks and spots of peeling paint. The toilet also had trouble flushing and the shower did not drain properly. I notified the front desk and they said someone would come and fix it, well not one ever fixed it. Instead they gave us money off each night of our stay. We also found it handy that they give you free snacks like candy bars, cookies, and chips. The breakfast was alright, many of the pastries were dry. The Magic Castle is in a nice location in Hollywood, but I became concerned when I saw homeless people sleeping directly across the street from the hotel. Overall I'd say the service is the best thing the hotel has going for it.

Reviews.Title: “Cant Beat It !”
Reviews.Author: Vince9
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 5 days at the Magic Castle and it is one of the best hotels we have ever booked into. We have previously booked into all the so called big name exclusive hotels but they cant match the service you get here. Right from our arrival we received a very warm welcome from Daphne at the reception who couldnt do enough to help us ( all the staff were good ) The room was an excellent size and included a dvd player with a free selection of dvds at the reception. You will also receive complimentary mini bar goodies such as potato chips, chocolate and diet cokes etc. Do not pay any attention to any moaning reviewers who might complain about a crack in a wall or some trivial nonsene, this hotel is well worth the money. We stayed at the Roosevelt the last time we visited L.A and although it was nice, Magic Castle is the better option.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: snazzyjan
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly impressed with the amount of service this hotel gives their customers! All the staff is friendly and accomodating. As soon as you enter they give you a fruity drink (non alcoholic) and welcome you to the hotel. Around 5pm every day, a staff member comes around and gives mints and a card with tomorrow's weather on it. At their 7-10am complimentary breakfast (with real food from a local bakery (pastries, toast, cereal, coffee, tea), not all that greasy stuff you get at other hotels) the manager always walks around and asks how you're doing and how they can help you. The concierge desk is very helpful with anything from directions, to food, to drinks, to Free DVD rentals! They have a heated pool in the center that's 24hrs. The setup of the building is very "community oriented". The room itself - is "hooked up"! When you walk in they have soft music playing on the stereo in the living room. Yes a living room! You don't just have a bedroom, but a kitchen, living area with a pullout couch, a spacious bathroom, tons of closet space... it's like an apartment more than a hotel room. They really go out of their way to make you feel at home. The location is perfect - you're a block or so away from Grauman's Chinese Theater, the Kodak Theatre and all these shops and food places. There's some museums in the area. If you're not from the area - bring with you a detailed street map. It's really easy to get lost around there, and the traffic is ridiculous - but you'll have a great time! Also - if you want to get into the Magic Castle Club - make sure you have the right dress code! Dresses for ladies, Blazer and tie for gentlemen.... When I come back to LA, if I need to find a place to stay - I'm definitely booking a room here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay - Service Nice; Comfy Stay”
Reviews.Author: mini
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is at a good location in Hollywood - walkable distance to Hollywood and Highland; Mann's Chinese Theater, and other points of interest in the area. It is next to the Magic Castle - which is where you can have a nice dinner (or more casual Sunday brunch) and watch some magic shows. The rooms are large - ours had a kitchen, living room, bathroom, and bedroom. The rooms are comfortable - however at some point will need to be updated. Beds were comfortable and we enjoyed our stay. Swimming pool is open 24 hours and the included continental breakfast in the morning is a nice touch. The juice drink on check out was a very nice tough. The hotel also prides itself on service! We were there on my birthday. It was so nice to find a birthday card in the room from the hotel...and a wonderful small cake in the refrigerator. They also let the Magic Castle know that it was my birthday and they made me feel special for Sunday brunch! Overall, service is quite nice; and it is very personalized touch. Enjoyable. One major note about the hotel - you need to be comfortable climbing stairs for almost all the rooms. We were on the 2nd floor and soon got used to climbing the 3 sets of stairs to reach our room. The rooms are large for families....and nice for young families...some have balconies....however do take note about the stairs. In general, the hotel knows where it needs to please its customers. It also seems to know its downsides and compensates by very personal and nice service. Its not the best in the area - but is a comfortable - and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice ... Great success”
Reviews.Author: giantburrito
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle over the July 4 holiday. The service itself was borderline amazing. Our main man Shawn gave us the hook up with Snickers, Doritos, and M&M (yum!) for free at the front desk. For breakfast they had a spread of cereals, muffins, and "scones". To me, the scones were nothing more than a cookie in a funny shape. But I wasn't complaining - who doesn't love a cookie? In fact, I would eat cookies at every meal if I could. They're delicious. Anyway, the location is great. We walked over to the Chinese theatre place and saw Chewbacca (the REAL Chewbacca) walking around. Crazy. It was also easy to get over to West Hollywood for some all-you-can-eat tacos at Hamburger Mary's. They also have burgers and a whole lot of sausages available. The room was in good shape, particularly if you enjoy a jungle environment. One of the rooms did not have a working AC. They offered to give us another room, but we chose to stay. The way we saw it, it was like getting a free trip to the Rainforest Cafe every night. My only real issue with the place was the clientèle. On the 4th, a bunch of rabble rousing kids went into the pool. They were being a little loud and partying (one of them even doing a stripper pole dance in the pool) but who can blame them - it's the 4th of July! They all seemed really thirsty as well. Maybe that's why they kept asking people to "make it rain".

Reviews.Title: “The Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: GNPlover
Reviews.Content: Recently thoroughly enjoyed a six-night stay at the Magic Castle Hotel. I travel quite a bit and this is by far the most accommodating lodging I have ever encountered. As stated in previous reviews, it is definitely the staff that makes this place so wonderful. I was traveling with a friend, my 14-year-old niece and her 13-year-old granddaughter, for a "girls" week in LA. It started upon arrival with some sparkling lemonade, which was very welcome after a long day flying from the east coast. The girls had mentioned they were hungry and were immediately presented with some snacks, complimentary. The staff then asked about our plans and brought out the maps while we were discussing our itinerary, with helpful suggestions. The location is wonderful, close to the Kodak Theater, Hollywood & Highland Center, the Walk of Fame, with plenty of places to shop and eat. It was so enjoyable to have breakfast out by the pool, and the scones were wonderful (wish I had some right now!!). But, back to the staff, you are all fantastic. A special thanks to Daphne and Christen for the special attention to our two teenage girls. They are still talking about you two and are already planning next year's trip, so you will most likely be seeing us again next summer. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “June 28, 2007”
Reviews.Author: bikingmar
Reviews.Content: I have plenty of fabulous things to say about the Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood. The moment we walked in we were greeted by Shawn at the Front Desk who was very friendly and helpful. We arrived a couple hours before the typical check-in and asked if our room was available (standard queen room) but it was not, so he provided a free upgrade to a one bedroom suite! The suite was very clean and spacious, they even turn down your bed at night and leave chocolates on the pillows with the weather forecast for the next day. Megan at the front desk was also quite helpful, booking reservations at a nearby restaurant, offering us a ride to the restaurant and sending us a free appetizer! The breakfast spread is better than the continental breakfasts most large chain hotels offer, and the croissants and scones were very tasty! Location is another key point, one block from Kodak Theatre, Graumanns, and shopping at the Hollywood/Highland Centre. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kmbmommy
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle Hotel was all that it was built up to be on tripadvisor. Make a reservation here and enjoy your vacation. The location in Hollywood is terrific. You can walk to the Hollywood and Highland Center, the Chinese Theatre, the Kodak Theatre, Hollywood Walk of Fame, etc. For this part of town, their price is more affordable than most and you get your money's worth in space. We reserved a one-bedroom suite and it included a living room with a pull-out sofa, a dining area, a full kitchen, patio with table and chairs, small bathroom and a separate bedroom with a king bed. One sign of their excellent customer service was that they had already placed a rollaway in the living room for my son before we arrived. The room had almost more closet space than my own house! The morning breakfast was adequate with offerings of delicious scones and assorted pastries, yogurt, fresh fruit, cereal and milk, juices and coffee. Our children enjoyed the heated swimming pool in the courtyard. The room itself needed some updating. The telephones, furnishings (bed and dresser, sofa bed) and the bathroom were very outdated. The A/C in the bedroom also was not sufficient to cool the room. My in-laws had a studio room which was more updated than ours and they were quite pleased with my choice of hotels! We loved this hotel and would stay here in a heartbeat if ever in LA again. Why? Because of the wonderful staff and excellent customer service! The staff were ALL very customer-friendly. "Service with a smile" must be their motto. When we checked in late on a Thursday evening, they offered us an orange soda spritzer in champagne glasses to welcome us to the Magic Castle Hotel. They gave us a menu of snacks (incl. sodas, bottled water, candy, and chips) available free any time of day (we took full advantage of these throughout our stay). They offered us popsicles as we lounged by the pool. They lent us free DVD's for viewing. They also printed out information on a world premiere happening on Hollywood Boulevard. By far, the nicest "touch" was the birthday cake and balloons they had for my mother-in-law in her room when we checked in on her birthday. Their covered parking is very secure and we took advantage of the added bonus of entrance to the Magic Castle for Saturday brunch. That is a "must do" as well!!! Thank you, Magic Castle Hotel and Staff, for a wonderful stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Yini
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with this hotel after reading good reviews on this site. We found our one bedroomed suite to be be very dark, shabby and in need of a serious update. Some changes had been made e.g. new bathroom sink but rather than replacing the bath and tiles they had just been painted over and the paint had started to flake. The carpets were very old and stained and there were also stains on some of the furniture. The TV cabinet was also old and dirty. Shutters on the windows didn't open properly and we were constantly trapping our fingers when trying to gain access to the balcony. We stayed 2 nights but our room was not serviced. Breakfasts were nice and fresh and the staff very helpful, but overall it did not meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “not disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 3dsmom
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our vacation in Hollywood and enjoyed our stay at the Magic Castle Hotel. I want to thank the hotel staff for all their help. They went out of their way to make out stay enjoyable. We had a one bedroom suite, which was large enough for me and my husband and two teenage daughters. The room was very clean. The continental breakfast was very good. It wasn't your typical hotel continental breakfast, the food was not stale and the scones and crouscents were very good. Once again, I want to thank the staff for all their help and I will recommend this hotel to all my friends and we will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent Excellent Excellent!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NurseMom115
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and this is the best hotel we ever stayed in! Where do I begin?? Customer service was top rate! Gretchen is a doll. Spoke to her for over an hour the week before we arrived. She recommended everything for us to do with the kiddies. She also arranged a lovely surprise upon our arrival. A complimentary upgrade to a two bedroom suite. She also stopped by personally to deliver a case of the kids favorite juice. The room was magnificent! Spotless, bright, comfortable, cozy, home-like, modern, clean,huge are just a few words to describe it. The location is awesome too. Easy access to all the big sights...Walk of Fame, Chinese Theater, El Capitan, Tour Buses to Beverly Hills, Sunset, one train stop to Universal etc. The pool was a great treat with lots of big purple fluffy towels. The kids had a ball. Free continental breakfast too--best coissants I ever tasted . Laundy machines with complimentary detergent and they even mailed some letters for me for free. The kiddies enjoyed movies at night with goodies like candy and popcorn--again all free. Whenever you called or passed by the Front Desk, they couldnt be nicer and more helpful. We decided to stay an extra day and they accomodated us with the same room and the same rate. No problem! The staff goes above and beyond. Gretchen, Megan, Tom, Mary Jane...they were all incredible and we were all sad to have to leave. We definitely intend to stay here again without a doubt. The last night the cleaning staff decorated the kids room and left star-shaped sunglasses for each of them. It is by far our home away from home! Excellent place!

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes it special”
Reviews.Author: sunbird1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Magic Castle in May for a 3-day stopover in LA as my best friend & I headed to Hawaii. We are both experienced travelers (I am a travel agent) and were both so impressed with how wonderful the staff was - from the "Champagne" greeting when we arrived at the reception desk to their reccommendations for dining,providing maps, directions, bus routes, etc. They were friendly, professional,efficient, and helpful. All with a cheery smile, too. The breakfast mini-scones were to-die-for! I can still taste their buttery sweetness. Classical music was was playing as we entered our suite. Big fluffy bathrobes were provided, as well as a lovely selection of toiletries. The bedding was very comfortable w/ a down duvet. The kitchen area is huge and well-equipped. All was very clean and comfy, but it could use a little spiffing to be perfect - not a problem for us, though. The owner is definitely on the right track - he's got the best staff I've ever encountered. Thanks to Gretchen, Megan, Mary Jane, Shawn and all the rest - you all are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NicSheffield
Reviews.Content: During our stay we received excellent service from all the staff at The Magic Castle. Our room was modern and clean and although we did not use the pool, it was lovely to sit and eat breakfast there each morning. Gretchen who worked there was extremly helpful when we were deciding on which trips to go on. We would recommend not booking tours with LA city tours as we were picked up for the wrong tour, then the following day we were not picked up for our original tour as planned, We then received verbal abuse from the manager of the tour company!. Overall we had a excellent holiday and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and awesome staff ....”
Reviews.Author: americabound
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a month in America. Travelling with our three older teenage sons I chose the Magic Castle based on Tripadvisor reviews and I must say I was pretty smug with myself for my cleverness. The room we had was a huge two bedroom with a king in one and a queen in the other and a sofa bed.. The only problem we had was that I had reiterated that we had three older sons who WOULD NOT even consider sharing a bed.............it would not do with their Aussie teenage pride!.....but when we arrived late there was no extra bed. Any angst I may have felt evaporated immediately when the concerned staff did everthing in their power to remedy the situation. I wish I had noted the name of the lovely lady who spent so much time on her knees trying to get the airbed to work and the gentleman who helped her. I would like to thank them here!! The boys swallowed their pride and the next evening a mattress was carried up for us. All in all this was a small inconvenience considering all the pros. Each day when we came back the room was spotless, there were chocolates on the master bed and soft music was playing on the stereo. The pool is lovely and we had a midnight swim each evening. Breakfast was lovely out by the pool and everyone seemed to take in the atmosphere, chatting through breakfast. There was a large variety for breakfast and with three teenagers it was a wonderful start to the day....sorry about the consumption of all those croissants....THE BEST EVER my 13 yr old says! A quick walk took us to the subway for Universal Studios one stop away..following the carefully detailed directions from the outstanding young man on the desk who gave us bottles of water as we were to be out all day! Sorry again for the lack of name (my husband's fault this time!!) but our grateful thanks all the same. Another quick walk two blocks to Hollywood Boulevard where we soaked up the atmosphere before dinner at Mel's Diner. A nice motel in a central location that is made a truly MAGIC experience because of the staff. Thank you ALL!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: family4MI
Reviews.Content: Discovered this hotel through a Travelzoo special. It was on the upper end of this family of four's budget, but worth every penny! Parking at $9 was very reasonable and appreciated. This hotel provides a pleasant stay without nickel and diming you after you arrive. They offer movies to borrow for free and even give you a bucket of goodies to enjoy with it. They offered us fresh lemonade on arrival and snacks for the long ride ahead when we left. Very pleasant and helpful staff!! We had an upper floor king bedroom suite with balcony overlooking the end of the pool. Lots of room for a family to relax! The continental breakfast includes pastries, yogurt, cereal, some fruit, juice and coffee. My only suggestion is that they make the breakfast seating area non-smoking. There's nothing worse than sitting there enjoying your breakfast and have the person next to you light up and then linger over coffee continually smoking. The location is outstanding. It's a short walk to Hollywood Walk of Fame, Kodak Theater and the bus stop to get to the Griffith Observatory. The hotel staff will happily help you get timed tickets to go up to the observatory. For my next visit to Hollywood, we will not have to research hotels as we found the one to return to! Thanks Magic Castle for an enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Mary Jane Rocks at the Magic Castle!”
Reviews.Author: anniet66
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay last week at the Magic Castle. We got a great rate that was advertised on Travelzoo.com. The rooms are okay. They are huge but need a bit of freshening up. Breakfast was sufficient for being free and the pool was nice. Parking for $9 was the cheapest we saw on our trip. The best part about this hotel is the front desk attendant Mary Jane. She provided us insight on where to go and what to do, helped us book reservations at the hottest restaurants and used her connections to get us it. It became a joke that every day we had to go to Mary Jane to figure out what we were going to do and where we were going to eat! She is the best part about Magic Castle and deserves a raise!!! (and no, I am NOT related to her!)

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysbeenyou
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for a “once in a lifetime” holiday. I traveled with my Mother and 2 friends all the way from Bath, UK. While we didn’t enjoy LA as much as we thought we would, we have to applaude this excellent hotel. For us, it made our holiday. We stayed in a lovely suite with a balcony overlooking the pool. The apartment itself had everything we needed(And the comfiest bed I have ever slept in). It was fantastic being able to take a late night swim or being able to sit by the poolside In the day being served ice lollies. The hotel was also so close to Hollywood Boulevard, the walk of fame and a lot of big attractions. It is also close to the metro station so its easy to get to places such as “Universal Studios”. Now, I had read how great the staff were but I never expected how amazing and kind they ALL were. Every single employee helped us somehow or another, they were very keen to help us with directions when we wanted to go somewhere and always asked if we needed anything. Our “favorite” was Sean, who came up to help us when we had problems and then made us a “goodie bucket” for when we were watching the films. If the manager reads this, please make sure Sean knows we were very grateful to him. In conclusion, I’d like to say that the Magic Castle Hotel has been my favourite hotel I’ve ever stayed in and would thoroughly recommend it if you’re staying in the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KristenMc
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle Hotel was fantastic! It was like a little oasis with the hotel surrounding a central, sparkling pool. The staff was wonderful and very accommodating, the room was light and bright and spacious, and also very clean and comfortable. The location is convenient to everything and is even walking distance to some great attractions (including the Magic Castle itself). Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: emmymac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first two days of our honeymoon in November 2006. The location for access to Hollywood sites was fantastic - very close to the Chinese Mann theatre and Hollywood walk of fame. As it was so close to Hollywood Bld it also meant easy access to the Metro Our room was really nicely decorated and was clean - plenty of room for all of our bags! The beds were big and comfortable. The pool area also seemd nice, we did eat breakfast out there but unfortunately it was too cold for a dip! The thing that set this place apart from a lot of the other hotels on our Honeymoon was the staff. Every single person that we dealt with was pleasant and courteous and so helpful. From recommending places to visit and eat, to arranging transport, we really couldnt' have asked for anything more. Although this hotel may not be very swanky, if you want to stay somewhere that really treats it guests well - then this is the place! Also they recommend a restaurant "Yamashiro". We would also recommend it, the hotel staff take you up to it and also collect you. The view across LA at night is breathtaking and the food is pretty good to! Would definitely recommend the crispy chicken!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: BarDil
Reviews.Content: Decided to write a review of magic castle to express my anger at the continued applauding of this hotel.......Hello, No. 2 hotel in los angeles, it is absolutely crazy that this noisy, basic, grotty hotel is given this status. It is interesting if you look back at the reviews that all the bad ones express the same problems and believe me they are true. The only thing this hotel (more like a motel) has going for it is that it is near hollywood boulevard. Bedroom/apt was a short walk from main motel.It was beside other residential apts. Not very good first impression, very un hotel like. Room had light door with paper thin walls. No dvd player even though all rooms were supposed to have one. Left a do not disturb sign on door when we went for dinner, but came back to see a maid had entered and left two chocolates on our pillows but stole a bottle of piper champagne out of our luggage. I am being totally truthful & sincere when I say this. Hotel will probably write a response to this denying it but I am not a fool. I know when I am fleeced. It is also very interesting if you look at other bad reviews of this motel, that I was not the only one who was stolen from. There was noise all night long from cars zooming right outside our bedroom window and cars pulling in to car park just outside our front door with partying yobs etc. Any reply from Magic Castle in my view is a desperate cry from a desperate motel. Very, very, very dissappointed with this accomodation. It was not exactly cheap either at $300 a night. Do not stay here! Would you like me to say it again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: karendg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle for three nights in April, 2007 along with our friends. We both had one-bedroom suites on the first floor adjacent to the pool and there were 10 of us in all. Everything about this stay was wonderful. The hotel staff are unbelievably kind, helpful and efficient. The full kitchen and the cont breakfast made snacks/meals easy. The hotel's location is central and it's smaller, so it's easy to get in and out of - unlike huge resort properties. The pool was heated and the tables outside it made the courtyard the perfect morning and evening retreat before and after busy tourist filled days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JulieEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle for just 2 nights, 28 and 29 March at the start of a 2 week trip travelling from LA to Vegas. I had spent a lot of time researching all our hotels through TA and found all to be exactly what we wanted. Magic Castle was fantastic, as other reviewers have said, the location couldn't be better, just a few minutes walk to Chinese Theatre etc. We were with our 11 and 13 year olds and felt completely safe walking out in the area, although look out when crossing the busy road. Gretchen and staff were amazingly helpful, sent us off with beach mats, beach toys and lots of snacks when we went to Santa Monica beach. Yes rooms are a little dated but beds really comfy, and we didn't spend much time in room except to sleep. Kids loved the pool, small but heated, they felt totally relaxed here as staff so friendly and easy going. Only negative comment would be that there was no "touristy" info, leaflets etc on display, although you only had to ask for info and were then given everything you needed. Would have been nice to have been able to browse through things as in most hotel lobbies. Overall, couldn't have found a better place to stay and would definately go back

Reviews.Title: “Good with Illusion of Something Better”
Reviews.Author: jellyb
Reviews.Content: There are two ways one could write a review of the Magic Castle Hotel, from a perspective of comparison with other properties in the area and from a perspective of comparison with all hotels in general. This is the only property I've stayed at in the Hollywood area so I can't compare it to other nearby properties but feel that would be the fairest way to evaluate this property. I research my vacations to death and hadn't run across many properties that had such a uniform, overwhelming positive response so I felt this was a no-brainer. Three words best decribe this place: Location, Staff, and Location. Did I say location? As far as I can tell, if you want to be within walking distance of the center of the Hollywood Universe, this is a superb choice (although there is really not much to see besides the Walk of Fame, Chinese Theater, and the new Mall at Hollywood & Highland - otherwise this area is pretty cheesy/touristy definitely something you can see in a half day.) Nevertheless it is a good base from which to explore other surrounding areas. I'd say the reviews in general overhype this place a tad too much. The staff is on the ball and provide little 'extras' here and there like the champagne glass of lime pop when you check in, popsicles at the pool, the chocolates and weather report card in the evening. I guess these little things really impress people as many other properties don't make the small effort to do similar things. As a result, these little things they do help to give the illusion (yes pun intended) that this property is something very special. The reality is the rooms (at least ours and from reading some of the other reviews) are spacious and clean, but bit run-down and apparently have probably had only minor cosmetic rennovations in recent years such as a coat of paint and maybe some new carpet. Most (not all) of the furnishings are sparse, cheap, dated, and in some cases tired looking. There are many small aspects (although minor) of the room which were in disrepair such as peeling paint on the bathroom ceiling, linoleum coming up around the tub, slidding shudder off it's hinges (which maintenance didn't fix properly), etc. The bathroom is small, basic, and very dated with very old fixtures. It appears the only thing they've done recently to the bathroom is slap some cheap, ugly Corian on the countertop. Water pressure is good and hot water doesn't run out. A big plus. Bedroom bed was comfortable, although a little on the firm side, too firm for my wife. The mattress on the pull-out was a joke. No way anyone over 50 pounds could get a good night's rest on it. Definitely need a new pullout mattress. The rooms have a very (I'm guessing) 1950's feel so don't book here expecting to get something newly renovated with latest furnishing and appliances. I didn't really expect this anyway but you get the feeling the owner is trying to maximize profits instead of reinvesting back into the rooms and the staff is trying to do these little extra things to make up for it. (You can rennovate while still retaining that old-school charm.) Many may characterize the rooms as having a nostalgic feel and the overall hotel having a boutique feel, which it does, and we liked that feel. The pool is small, but adequate. There is no Jacuzzi (a big minus). The layout of the hotel against the side of a hill with a U shape is great as it makes the inner courtyard/pool area shielded from the loud traffic of the busy street out front. Housekeeping service is excellent. I'd recommend staying here but don't go here with high expectations like you'll being staying at a small, boutique version of the Beverly Hills Hotel. I'm guessing that this place receives very high marks partially because comparatively it offers an excellent value for it's location and especially for those that prefer an alternative to the high-rise hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for exploring Hollywood and L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Wicki
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 from Germany and just returned from a great stay at the Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood. As so many before us we definately can recommend this hotel to just anybody. The appartments, the hotel itself, the pool, the breakfast in the morning... everything was fine and made our 2-night-stay very pleasant. The Walk of Fame is just a minute-walk away, we did explore downtown L.A. using the 1-day-metro-card, station is also just minutes away from the hotel. All the staff was very pleasant and always helpful. We definately will return to this place when we come to visit L. A. + Hollywood again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BrucknerPacific
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my family for 9 days from late March to early April. I stayed in a one room suite and my inlaws had a 1 BR right next door. We were looking for a hotel on the red line because I would be commuting to my firm's office in Downtown LA, and my wife would be traveling around Southern Cal with my inlaws, our 3 daughters, and either my brother or her brother and his new wife. First of all, the location of the hotel is amazing. Hollywood is well located to see everything there is to see in LA. They went to Pasadena, Universal, the Aquarium in Long Beach, Santa Barbara, Laguna Beach. We never had bad traffic. Also, it was a blast staying in Hollywood - our first morning, we went to the Chinese Theater and to the Kodak Theater (although the meaning of Oscar's was lost on my daughters - American Idol was much more relevant). The rooms are huge. The staff is super helpful. The breakfast pastries delicious. The free soda, water and snacks a treat. Really, what more do you want in a hotel. We also went to the Magic Castle. DO NOT PASS THIS UP. What a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: klgSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay, especially if you have kids with you. There is plenty of room to spread out. The staff is unbelievably wonderful. They asked us as we were checking in if we were there for a special occasion. I told them my daughter's 11 birthday. They managed to get a birthday card and box of goodies up in the room for my daughter before we got to the room. A little later they came to our room with popsicles for the kids. The continental breakast is great. The location is great for site seeing. Hollywood Blvd is one blockaway, Beverly Hills is near by, Universal Studios is 1 metro stop away. San Diego, CA

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Spot!”
Reviews.Author: cruzcontrol13
Reviews.Content: This is the very best hotel in LA (Hollywood). It truly is a "home away from home". The rooms are comfy, clean, modern, with all the amenities anyone might need. It is my third visit at the Magic Castle Hotel and the only place I stay while in Hollywood. The manager, Mike, along with the staff is always welcoming, helpful, attentive, and accommodating...just a delight! It is central to everything, just behind the famous Chinese theater and easy access to all of Hollywood's famous landmarks. The best thing about this hotel is the amazing service and the feeling of being in a cozy environment while on business or vacation. Thumbs up!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at the Magic Castle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DharmaGirl
Reviews.Content: I loved this place so much the first time I stayed back in October, that I booked it again for the night of February 3rd. I'd requested the same 1-bdrm I'd had the last time, but they put me in a room that was actually bigger and nicer than the first one! (The bathroom in this one was especially roomy.) Reception was great about getting me checked in quickly since I was exhausted and needed a nap! Again, the sound of soft music was playing as I first entered the room. I should say apartment instead of room since the suite is enormous, with a hallway leading from the large living room to the bathroom, and then another to the bedroom. Just incredibly big for a hotel room! I was going to a comedy club on Hollywood Blvd, and instead of calling a cab in the nightmare Saturday night traffic I was advised by the hotel staff to walk where I was going instead, so I did. That was just perfect. I walked up the bustling boulevard over all the stars on the sidewalk and watched the tourists gawk at the familiar Hollywood landmarks and street performers. It was about a 10 minute brisk walk and well worth it. I got back to the hotel earlier than I'd expected that night, so I went down to the desk for snacks (complimentary) like candy bars and microwave popcorn. I was even able to check out a DVD for the night, free. (There's a DVD player in the full entertainment center in the large living room.) Since it was still fairly early and the hotel shuttle driver was on the site I asked if they could take me up the hill to their sister property, the Hollywood Hills Hotel. (It's on the grounds of the restaurant Yamashiro.) The view of all of Los Angeles and Hollywood from up there was just phenomenal. Evidently, the rooms aren't as nice as in the Magic Castle Hotel, but the views more than make up for it. (No views from the Magic Castle Hotel down the hill.) Afterward, I made my microwave popcorn and a cup of tea in my large full kitchen, and sat out on my big balcony overlooking the pool and just enjoyed the quiet night and the great weather. Overall, another great stay. Management and all the front desk employees went above and beyond to make my stay comfortable and get me everything I needed. I'll definitely be staying here again the next time I go to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: juliemallett
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel from the 26th february 07 til the 6th of march 07, the staff there were brilliant from the moment we turned up, nothing was too much trouble for the reception guys, it didnt matter what time of day or night you required something, they were always on hand and willing to help, the room was very spacious and was cleaned to a high standard every day, and the standard of the breakfast was high, something for everyone, in the evenings the maid came round with chocolates and a card telling us what the weather was going to be like for the following day, ive stayed in a few hotels in america, but nothing compares to this hotel, its the best!!!! a special thankyou to the manageress, ( sorry i forgot your name) for printing maps, and giving us directions to all the attractions. highly trained dedicated staff we will be back next year with out a doubt to this hotel thank you magic castle for making our stay in hollywood such a pleasure julie, nigel mallett, louise small and joshua small

Reviews.Title: “Great service but rooms could use updating”
Reviews.Author: youngboo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night . The service is great, personal and anticipitory. Much more than you would expect. The continental breakfast was terrific. High quality baked goods, cerel and milk, great cooffee and a nice selection of teas. When I asked for a Diet Coke, it was provided gratis. The pool area is nice and the underground parking at no charge a treat. Now for the other part. It is acutually a converted apt. building. We stayed in a room on the front facing the street. The traffic noise continued all night. Since we were only on the second floor, it was quite noisy. We had what had been a small 1 bedroom apt. with a full kitchen. It looks like it was built in the 40's or 50' and not much other than paint has been done /updated since and the paint was peeling in the bathroom. It is great location with wonderful staff but the rooms themselves are not up to par. My husband, a Holiday Inn kind of guy from a medium sized Mid-Western town, declined to give the name to a friend who was heading up to Holly wood.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: Richchick
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day stay in Hollywood with my 2 teenagers ages 13 & 16. We have enjoyed staying in many 5 star hotels around the world and have experienced very good service. I have to say that the Magic Castle Hotel can stand with the best when it comes to friendly staff, great service, and cleanliness. Arrival: The hotel is centrally located in Hollywood and was easy to find. The lobby is not large but is very accommodating, welcoming and tastefully decorated. The staff greeted us warmly and seemed genuinely friendly. On one side of the lobby there was a large arrangement of cookies, an assortment of teas, spiced cider, and packets for hot chocolate. There was also cool water containing sliced cucumbers. A delicious continental breakfast is served every morning from 7- 10AM. The food is arranged in the lobby and can be enjoyed out by the pool or you can take it to your room. Checking in was quick and the staff carried our luggage to our room which was on the second level. There are no elevators but there are rooms on the ground level if stairs are a challenge. There are also a few steps to the front entrance of the hotel. The rooms surround a large, lovely courtyard. Many of the rooms on the second and third levels have balconys overlooking the courtyard. Ours did not but I will know to ask ahead for one next time we visit. In the center of the courtyard is a 'splash pool'. If you want Olympic laps this is not the pool for you. It is just the right size for a refreshing dip and floating around. My kids loved it. Our room: We had the junior suite and found it to be fairly large and very clean. The carpeting looked new. In addition to the TV there was a DVD player and CD player. My kids brought their laptops and there was wirless internet for them. The hotel has a nice complimentay DVD library. When my kids went to select DVDs they were surprised with a complimentary bucket of microwave popcorn packets and an assortment of candy. The beds have down comforters and the mattresses were firm and comfortable. Turndown service is provided every evening along with chocolate mints. Location: The hotel is located at the foot of a hill within 2 blocks of busy Hollywood Blvd. Once you turn off of Hollywood Blvd the crowds and noise seem to thin out appreciably. The subway is about 3 blocks from the hotel on Hollywood Blvd and we used it to get to Universal Studios. The city was in preparation for the Oscars while we were there. All of these preparations take place in the 2 block area close to the hotel. The Hollywood/ Highland subway stop is closed on the day of the Oscars. Metro and auto traffic is detoured as well beginning several days before the Oscar presentations. Pedestrian traffic is also detoured on Hollywood Blvd beginning several days prior to Oscar day but all the major sights are still accessible such as the Kodak theater, walk of fame, and Chinese theater. I was told that this inconvenience only happens during the week of Oscar preparations every year. We found it fun and exciting to watch the city get ready for the Oscars day by day despite the inconvenience of the detours. Staff: I have never been treated better at any hotel that I have ever stayed at. The staff just go out of their way to make your stay pleasant and enjoyable. They are friendly, courteous and they let you know that they are there for you. When my kids were up into the night with jet lag I spent lots of time going to the lobby for DVD's and snacks and Marzia on the night shift was so patient and helpful. All the staff should be commended. They give you 5 star service and 5 star treatment. There are lots of bigger, grander, more luxurious hotels in L.A. but the staff at the Magic Castle make it stand along side any of them. In my opinion, there is none better. We enjoyed our stay at the Magic Castle Hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: rag714
Reviews.Content: We adored the Magic Castle. It was a real delight to find such clean, comfortable, friendly and quiet accommodations just a block away from the madness of Hollywood Boulevard. From the moment we arrived (and were upgraded to a suite) until we checked out we could find nothing to fault. Our only minor quibble is that our suite was on the back with a view of a wall. However, since we were receiving a spacious suite for the price of a standard room it would have been ungracious to complain. The hotelв's leek decor, the spacious rooms (at least the suites; we didn't see the standard rooms) the delightful courtyard, and the excellent continental breakfasts (pastries from Susina's Bakery are terrific!) have been mentioned in other reviews and we concur with all of the positive comments. Worthy of special mention is the outstanding staff. Everyone was very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable of the area. Thanks to Nick and Sean (spelling?) for all your good advice and the drinks and snacks! By the way, one of the best reasons for staying here is to gain access to the Magic Castle Club. The only way you can get in to see the magic shows is to be a member of the Academy of Magical Arts or to stay at the hotel. The Victorian building in which the Club is located is a real hoot, dinner was good, and the magic shows were absolutely terrific.

Reviews.Title: “It's the perfect Hollywood experience.”
Reviews.Author: no1pettyfan
Reviews.Content: I am a return visitor to this hotel and it will be my first choice anytime I stay in the area. I have never been to a hotel where they treat you like you are someone so special. I went there with a big group of friends and we were there to see a rock & roll show. We had multiple rooms. Gretchen and her staff took care of our every need. We are still talking about our trip and how special our time at the Magic Castle was. The hotel has a great retro look and you can feel the history there. The rooms are clean and large enough for friends and family to hang out in. It's the perfect place for a large gathering. The hotel is located one block from Hollywood Blvd so it's a short walk to go see the sights. You really get the feel of Hollywood staying here. The pool area is lovely. Whether you are sharing pizza under the stars with your friends at 2am or a wonderful continental breakfast in the morning sunshine it's a warm inviting place. Thank you Gretchen for making us feel so welcome. We will see you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “a knobby weekend”
Reviews.Author: nurktwin
Reviews.Content: i was lucky enough to find this hotel last september when a large group of us came from around the world to see tom petty and the heartbreakers at the hollywood bowl. the hotel is so great and charming, not the huge stuffy hotels most people stay in. i actually told a few friends this past weekend that the castle brings me back in time to the 60's where you would expect the 'rat pack' to stay. so when we needed a hotel for this past weekend to see 2 shows by 'the dirty knobs' , it was a no brainer where to stay. once again we had a huge turnout and everyone was amazed at how gretchen and the staff handled everything. there is nothing they can't provide for you, 2am pizza party by the pool, no problem, it's yours. signs on your room door welcoming us, candy baskets in our rooms (and thanks for the wine too gretchen). this hotel and staff just literally bend over backwards to make all your dreams come true. the hotel location is just perfect, easy 1-2 block walk to the prominade for shops and restaurants, walk of fame, grauman's chinese theater, disney malt shop and so much more. going the other direction is the hollywood bowl and further up the hill is universal studios theme park. this hotel is at the top of my list and will be my home whenever i visit LA. thanks gretchen and staff. hope to see you again soon.......ben

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MagnoliaSanDiego
Reviews.Content: The main feature of this hotel is the SERVICE! From the moment we arrived, we were treated like we were in the only guests in the place. The friendliness and professionalism of the staff just blew us away. The room was large and clean, with an incredible view of the Hollywood Hills. The day we checked out, I was lamenting the fact that we were too late for the complimentary continental breakfast. In a jiffy, there was a staff, suggesting we sit by the pool (a gorgeous January day in LA), and she brought us coffee, pastries, scones and warm croissants to enjoy before we left. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel Tucked into The Hollywood Hills”
Reviews.Author: SEJacobs
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel and let me just say, again this staff outdid themselves to make us feel welcome. They have the nicest people working there from the front desk to the housekeeping staff. All led by an incredible manager, Ms. Gretchen Crookes. She is amazing!!!! I can honestly say I have never EVER been to a hotel where I experienced this sort of hospitality. I had the feeling that there is nothing I couldn't ask Gretchen or her staff and they wouldn't try their darnedest to get it for you. The rooms and suites are gorgeously designed. It's an old building true, but beautifully renovated. The furniture has the retro look for that era and I simply adore it. I love the fact that they are the only hotel I've ever stayed at with a 24 hour pool. Throw in the delicious morning pastries and that yummy Wolfgang Puck's coffee and you're in for the hotel experience of a lifetime. Great location too. It's in walking distance or a short drive to every happening spot in Hollywood. You just have such a good feeling when you leave there. I'm sure it's difficult to please everyone totally all the time but if they don't, it's not for lack of trying. They want your stay to be pleasant. I plan to make this place my home away from home whenever I visit L.A. Give it a try if you're ever in town, I'm sure you will be delightfully surprised. Thank you so much to Gretchen and the entire staff for making our stay a most incredible experience once again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great weekend!! Thank you staff of The Magic Castle!”
Reviews.Author: WildflowerNJ
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say what a great experience staying at the Magic Castle is. Gretchen is just the best at what she does as is the whole staff. A few of my friends stayed the weekend and we were treated like rock stars. No detail was overlooked. The croissants were so good I went back a few times for them...yummm!! If you are ever in LA and wish to know how the other half lives, book this hotel. A big thank you to all of your staff, Gretchen, and to you..you guys know how to make a weary traveler so welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ladyvalerie
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Magic Castle on January 11, 2007. I was one of several girls that shared a two-bedroom Suite. We were in town to see Daughtry that night. The staff was very accommodating and the whole room had a very comfortable feeling. I slept on the sofa bed and it was more comfortable than any of the other hotel beds I have slept on! One of the staff persons, Gretchen, brought us snacks the next morning and also some photos of Daughtry that she had printed up especially for us. I highly recommend this hotel, and would stay there again on my next trip to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: toodlee
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 just returned from a 5 night stay at the Magic Castle and it was fantastic. The front desk staff are all excellent. Shawn and Gretchen I remember by name but the entire staff is phenomenal and puts many 4 and 5 star properties to shame. Covered parking at $9 a night is a bargain and the staff will bring your luggage to the room. Our one bedroom suite was spotless and well maintained. A large refrigerator, microwave, utensils and stove (all of which were clean and in working order) just added to a relaxing stay. Ate at Yamahiro's twice, great drinks, unbelievable view and shuttle service from the hotel. No safety issues whatsoever. Occasional glitches in internet service, but the staff was on top of the situation. Can't say enough- value, location, parking and great staff. We will make this our LA hotel for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service of a 3 week trip to USA”
Reviews.Author: kiwizuzu
Reviews.Content: This is the most amazing hotel I have ever been to!!!! To all those people who only look at appearences - yes the paint may be peeling, yes the cupboards might need updating etc etc but the FANTASTIC service far outways any peeling paint. My mother and I arrived from New Zealand after a 12 hour flight where we didn't sleep and spent 3 hours in customs then spent over an hour trying to pick up our rental car (that's a whole other review) so my mood wasn't really good! Once we stepped into the lobby and we were greeted by Shawn my mood completely changed. He was fantastic as were all the staff. Everytime we left and came back to the hotel we were greeted with a smile and were asked how our day had been and what we had been up to. We were given maps to different things we wanted to see, were given recommendations for restaurants which were all good, I asked to buy stamps for all the Christmas cards that I was sending home and was told that my mail would be' taken care of ' and it was and when we left we were given a huge snack pack for our drive to Las Vegas which had drinks, chocolates, cookies and potato chips. Shawn and Gretchen are major assets to this hotel and I hope they are still there when I visit LA again later this year. If you have any doubts about staying at this hotel, don't, this is the ONLY place to stay in Los Angeles and the ONLY place I will ever stay when ever I am visiting Los Angeles in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, thanks reviewers!”
Reviews.Author: GracieChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here, I went ahead and booked 2 nights in a 2bdrm suite. We were traveling up and down the CA coast visiting family and we wanted to end on a tourist-y note. Can't beat the location or the service. The area felt safe enough that I let my two teen-age sons walk to and from Hollywood Blvd un-escorted, even during the evening. Big kudos to Gretchen. I called to confirm our arrival and she asked me what she could to do meet our needs. Just being asked was nice. She had books, tour guides all ready for us when we arrived. The rooms do have a slightly run-down feel but I think it adds character. The bedding was very comfortable, the accommodations more than roomy enough for 3 teens, me and my 70 year-old mother. Everyone was pleased which is no small accomplishment. I agree with what past reviews said about the pool, the b-fast etc. If I ever visit Hollywood again I would definitely stay again. Better yet, move the whole place, staff included, to Encinitas. I know I'll be visiting there more than Hollywood. ps if you stay be sure so stop by the pool to chat with Danny. He's a long-time resident and a good guy with great stories.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, excellent, excellent and did I say excellent!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nmartino211
Reviews.Content: I happened to find the Magic Castle Hotel through the interent and thought..."that sounds pretty good"...but what an understatment. My 3 teenage daughters and I travelled to LA from Toronto and from the moment we walked in the door were extremely impressed with the hotel. The suite (definitely not a traditional hotel room) was wonderful, the location was great and the staff were amazingly friendly, helpful and made the experience truly enjoyable. They took care of everything from getting us a rental car, gave us recommendations of places to go and see and provided my girls with loads of snacks and extras that will keep them talking about the experience for months!!! I have never seen them his enthusiastic about any place. Special thanks to Gretchen, Nick and I wish I could remember the other gentlemans name that was on the same shifts as Gretchen. They were always there at the ready for anything we needed....although Gretchen we never did get around to that picture of me and the girls in the red converible...ha ha! I would definitely recommend the hotel and will stay there on any future trip to LA. Thanks to everyone you were fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all cost”
Reviews.Author: Leyland123
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel following all the "wonderful" reviews that we had seen placed on trip advisor. After a 12hr flight from New Zealand we looked forward to booking in. Staff on the front desk where very helpful when checking in and gave us the key to our room. Upon arriving at the front door we wanted to leave, the carpets were filthy, plaster was pealing off the walls and when we opened the door we could have cried. The room was terrible. The furniture looked extremely dated and the shower area was disgusting. All we wanted to do was get some sleep but in all honesty we couldn’t have slept given the conditions. Went down to the front desk and asked if we could change rooms, the new room was even worse. With this in mind we checked out and booked into the Marriot across the road. This was a real let down given all the great reviews that have been wrote previously. In all honesty this was the worst hotel that we have ever stayed in (albeit very short)

Reviews.Title: “Magical stay”
Reviews.Author: kathymander
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 night stay over the New Year's Holiday at the Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood. The staff were great and even provide a ride up to the Yamashiro Restaurant at the top of the hill above the Hotel. The view and food are incredible. Memoirs of a Geisha was partly filmed here. The hotel staff were very friendly and accomodating. Walked into the lobby to the wonderful smell of hot cider and cinnamon(cookies too). Afternoon tea is available every day. Bottled water is provided as you need it. Our room was spacious for our family of 4: 2 adults and 2 teenagers. We could fall asleep in our bedroom and not hear their late night movie.Had a full kitchen. Every morning we took our breakfast back to our room to sit on the patio enjoying the morning sun. Breakfast was great, cereal, pastries, fruit, yogurt, granola, juices, coffee. There is a pleasant heated outdoor pool for sunning or swimming. Staff helped us with directions/maps and reservations. We did the family brunch at the Magic Castle Club on Sunday at their recommendation. We had great food and were treated to a Magic show that was funny and truly amazing. Our son thought it was as good as Universal Studios. This hotel is located very close(walking distance) to Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the stars walk on Hollywood Boulevard. We took the metro to Universal Studios-it is 1 stop away. We were centrally located to make easy drives of 20 or 30 min to Pasadena, Santa Monica and the Getty Center. We will definitely stay here when we come back to LA. This hotel helped make our vacation an almost perfect trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: lorlexrik1
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews online we booked and had a fantastic experience here. The room was large and clean and amenities like an apt. which made it perfect traveling with our 2 kids. The front desk staff could NOT have been any more helpful and courteous. They shuttled us up the mountain to Yamashiro restaurant, provided driving directions and suggestions of where to go. The only negatives were the pullout sofa's mattress was prettty worn out to the springs and they did not have any replacements and the rooms were not very soundproof as the other bathrooms were quite loud as was the traffic. But- nothing is perfect but this place was close- great location, room and service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest staff I have ever met!”
Reviews.Author: CRZY4CHRIS
Reviews.Content: There were 6 of us who stayed in the 2 bedroom suite and we were extremely pleased. From the moment we stepped foot in the Magic Castle hotel we were treated like royalty. Doors were opened for us, a sparkling juice cocktail was handed to us in champagne glasses, and chocolates and biscotti's were available - what more could a girl want!!! We were then escorted to our room by Gretchen. who let me tell you is a GEM!!! I hope the MC realizes what a special employee they have here. She made us feel so incredibly welcome...just can't say enough about her!!! The room was pleasant and spacious for all of us. Of course, a second bathroom would have been nice - haha! Everything was nice and clean..something I always appreciate in a hotel room!! The hotel is in a perfect location too...just a few short blocks to Hollywood Blvd. We felt very safe in the hotel! The next morning we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast that the hotel provides. There were delicious scones, yogurt, cereal, coffee, tea available...everything was wonderful! Overall, it was a great experience and even plan on staying there again in the near future. We had decided to do some sightseeing the next day and even though we had checked out, the hotel had graciously held our luggage for us. Gretchen even provided us with some "travel snacks" for our plane trip home. Talk about hospitality!!! We were all impressed with this hotel...you will not go wrong with this one! Just want to add that all the employees (wish I could remember all their names) were incredibly friendly..we just spent the most time with Gretchen and therefore, remember her name!

Reviews.Title: “Had a magic birthday at the Magic Castle Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ExitRatRace
Reviews.Content: I had wanted to go to the Magic Castle Club for my birthday but heard that it was a private club for members only. However, my boyfriend discovered that guests of this hotel were given admission to the club during their stay. The reviews looked good so we took a chance. We were not disappointed. The staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Upon arrival we were offered cookies and hot cider. The club is just right next door to the hotel, but if you ask, they are happy to shuttle you up the small hill just so the ladies don't have to try and hoof it up there in high heels! I certainly appreciated that. :-) When we came back from the Magic Castle (which we LOVED!) there was a pretty box all wrapped up in a ribbon that contained an adorable mini birthday cake and a card signed by the staff! What a nice touch--and yummy cake too. We were surprised to hear that the pool is heated to 80 degrees year round so we took advantage of that fact and had a romantic and refreshing moonlight swim. (They don't close the pool at night, they just ask that you observe "quiet hours" and not disturb others). The hotel was close enough to walk to all the other places that we wanted to see so it was the perfect place to stay. I would definitely stay there again if I am in the area. Thanks Magic Castle Hotel Staff for a magic birthday!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosie1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 21.11.06 for three nights. Had a one bedroom suite overlooking the pool. The suite was great. Spacious, clean and tidy. It does look a little tired in places, paintwork, cupboards etc, but it is really nothing to worry about. The other features more than make up for it. The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate for us, juices, coffee, toast, pastries, yoghurts, cereals etc which can be eaten by the pool, weather permitting, or taken to your room. The staff were very attentive and friendly. The location was brilliant. A few minutes walk to the walk of fame, Graumans Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre etc. We were able to have dinner in the Magic Castle Club. My husband thoroughly enjoyed this. It was a really great place, Magicians were all very good, some better than others though. I would definitely recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love it, Love it, Love it!!”
Reviews.Author: cz2
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Thanksgiving trip to LA and I had to comment on our stay at the Magic Castle. Our extended family (grandparents, aunt, uncle,niece,nephew, and daughter) stayed at the hotel for a week while visiting family in LA. This was our second stay at the hotel and while we didn't think our first stay could be topped...it was. The wonderful staff, attention to detail, comfortable surroundings are not a fluke, a one time occurance. This hotel truly cares about their guests and their experience at the Magic Castle and it is evident in everything they do. From the moment of check in, the great breakfast (poolside or in your room), the heated pool (the kids loved it), the comfortable rooms (we love the duvet!) to the movie "packages" for the kids (free dvd's and movie snacks). We have, as a group, stayed at hotels around the world and we all agreed that this is the best! Not the most deluxe, yes, the paint is chipping in places. It is not an exclusive 4 star ,but by far the most inviting, comfortable place. We hope to return next year, the only reason we might not is because my in laws are in their 80's and the stairs (no elevator) :( are really hard for my mother in law ( though she vows to return!) Thank you to everyone at the Magic Castle for helping to make our family trip a wonderful time. P.S. ceiling fans in the bedrooms would be really nice! (especially the first floor rooms)

Reviews.Title: “Reviews Were Right!”
Reviews.Author: DiMor
Reviews.Content: Our family of five (four adults, one child) just returned from our vacation, and I am so happy to report that our Magic Castle stay was great. I had booked the two-bedroom suite after reading these reviews, and I had my fingers crossed that my family would approve. They did! The staff was great (Hi Gretchen) and so friendly. We were met with chilled fruit juice upon check-in. The pool water was warm and refreshing. The location cannot be beat. The complimentary contintental-style breakfast was a plus. The best thing besides the great staff was the CLEANLINESS. We were so comfortable sleeping in such clean quarters... As there are no elevators, be prepared to climb some steps from the (secure) garage to your room, very do-able for most people. We hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: OsideLB
Reviews.Content: We loved the Magic Castle! It is a really cute little boutique hotel with the most amazing staff I have ever encountered! Yes, I've stayed at the Four Seasons and in various hotels around LA and no staff comes close. We stayed on our anniversary and while I barely mentioned it as a special occasion they treated us like rock stars. Among other things, we had to change our dinner reservation last minute because the restaurant was too far out of the way before our concert. They got us into the sushi restaurant up the hill, shuttled us up there, and even had a lovely complementary appetizer waiting to start us off. The rooms were great (we had a suite) and the hotel was convenient to walk to the Lucky Strike for a cocktail later. The only thing I would change is the pool. It needs a little updating and is pretty small...real estate is tough to come by in LA. I really can't say enough about the helpful, friendly, fun, & really on-top-of-it staff of professionals. They're the best.

Reviews.Title: “wow! loved it”
Reviews.Author: scoobyscout
Reviews.Content: we decided to pay a visit to los angeles and not knowing a single thing about it we decided that staying close to holywood walk of fame was important to us... after some researching we found the most perfect hotel possible. four minute walk and we were at the chinese theatre.!!! breakfast included. even better. staff friendly and knowledable. yes that was full marks as well. so after relaxing in our rather large private room (which included chocolate on the pilllows) we enjoyed a hearty healthy breakfast by the pool before chatting with the excellent staff on what to do and how to get there. armed with our free map we were soon on the local subways... i highly recommend this fantastic friendly hotel to anyone who is unsure about anything los angeles!!!!

Reviews.Title: “lovely place”
Reviews.Author: jayne.d
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Magic Castle hotel in a 2 bed suite overlooking the pool for 4 nights. All the staff were super friendly, helpful and informative. The pool was great at 11pm at night after a hard day of sightseeing and the rooms spacious and clean. Great beds and toiletries. Just all round great!!

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly service”
Reviews.Author: kobrien
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle Hotel is fantastic. A bit dilapidated and our rooms had horrors like thorn curtains and windows facing a giant clima box and an even less attractive wall. HOWEVER it had a great and safe location right behind Hollywood Boulvard, the courtyard pool is heated which was a thrill as nights in LA are chilier now. The staff was so friendly warm and welcoming and did everything whatever we requested in a split second. The internet was complimentary so as the breakfast. They also have lovely spiced water and fruit in the hall for free. The Magic Castle show was awesome and it is itself worth the stay. Once we got over the state of the room we felt like home.

Reviews.Title: “The Friendliest staff ever”
Reviews.Author: hr06
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed the magic castle. The staff were so friendly. The accommodations are clean, a bit old. The location is prime for doing the typical tourist scene. When you enter the hotel there is a bowl of apples and cucumber water to quench your thirst. The continental breakfast was great, fresh croissants and scones every morning. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Forest1963
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a perfect combination of friendly staff and a great location. After a long flight we were welcomed like long lost friends with a drink in the foyer - fantastic! The room was very spacious and comfortable although not luxurious. The breakfast in the morning was relaxed and plentiful. Again, everything being presented in a very friendly way. With the Chinese Theatre and Walk of Fame literally 10 minutes walk away and Universal Studios barely 15 minutes drive, this hotel is very well situated if you only have a short time in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: toby1kenobi
Reviews.Content: We expected more, to be honest, but we ended up in one of the smallest rooms, which was pretty small! Given the price the hotel's not in quite as good condition as you might imagine, however the location is good, the staff are friendly and helpful and the breakfast is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel of our Trip”
Reviews.Author: Tezzarooney
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends stayed at the Magic Castle whilst on a whistle stop tour of the States. We only booked for one night, yet stayed for an extra two because of the great service we received from the staff and the spacious apartment sized room we stayed in. The hotel staff exceeded all of our expectations and were always friendly and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was delicious and handy when you're travelling on a budget. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends, family and anyone who travels to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel , and location”
Reviews.Author: M2E
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel we stayed at during our honeymoon (Value for money too). Staff were very friendly, the hotel room turned out to be a huge appartment, kitchen, lounge, dining table, dvd player, 2 tvs, hi fi, soft music playing, kitchen with drinks and food. Would recommend to anyone. 1 block walk to the walk of fame, chinese theatre, kodak theatre & Hollywood Bowl. Everything you need within walking distance. Just brilliant. Admission to the neighbouring Magic Castle included, Complimentory breakfast and newspaper each morning. Free dvd rentals and tomorrows weather forecast posted in your room each night. Staff go out of their way to help. We stayed in over 5 hotels through out California / Nevada on our trip - most higher star rated and none came close to the quality and experience. Finally upon arrival home after the trip a postcard had been sent hoping you had enjoyed your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service was great, but room just ok”
Reviews.Author: rahir
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night while visiting friends and family. The staff couldn't have been nicer- from the glass of limonada when we arrived to great directions on our way out to dinner and complimentary scones, fruit, and juice for breakfast. We really felt like we were at a small 5 star hotel! The room, though, wasn't up to par. It was really small- barely enough room for the bed, end table, desk, and tv/stand, and the furniture reminded me of the stuff we had in college. The mattress was flabby, sinking in the middle. The tv also had a big purple spot on the lower right screen.
