The bathroom pretty much matched the bedroom: there was some paint/baseboard issues, and there were no turkish bathrobes as the website advertised. Turndown service was a nice touch, though, and the pillows were really plushy. For us, the location, $8 parking, and service stood out above everything else, and if you're looking for some charm in Hollywood, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Magic staff”
Reviews.Author: AussieNSW
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here on 11th Oct. The staff were funny , helpful and actually were enjoying doing there jobs. They made us feel at check in like we were friends who had come to visit not paying customers. After a long drive from San Francisco we arrived tired and stressed. We arrived a few hours before check in and the check in staff stored our luggage and happily put it in our room when it was ready. They provided us with great directions and suggestions on what might interest our family of 6. The room was clean and suited our needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff at the Magic Castle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katgold
Reviews.Content: Have just returned home after a 3 night stay at the Magic Castle Hotel during our LA leg of our holiday. Firstly all the postive comments regading the helpfullness and friendliness of the staff particuarly at reception are absolutely true! The staff could not have been more helpful from giving directions and maps to giving my daughter a gorgeous box of "I love LA" chocolates when she felt sick. The breakfast each morning was a treat and so welcome. The rooms are spacious but quirky and whilst they are not luxuorious they have a charm that is very welcoming. I highly recomend the postion the staff and this hotel.I will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GirlandBoy
Reviews.Content: Hotel is less than a five minute walk to the Walk of Fame and Mann's, even for me in my flip flops. Hotel location also means you are close to some of the main bus routes (along Hollywood Blvd) for those using public transport to get about like we were. Rooms are clean and the suite we had would have been big enough for us to live in! Breakfast being included is such a bonus and we really enjoyed eating it by the pool each morning. As mentioned on a number of other posts the staff are absolutely fantastic and could not have done more for us. They give us great directions every day and great advice on what buses to take where. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Else Mattered”
Reviews.Author: 1stclasstraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was charming and MOST of the staff was friendly. We loved the spacious room, but couldn't take off our shoes, as the carpet was filthy. None of the positives really mattered once an employee stole my medication out of my room! One of the medications is not carried by many pharmacies, and is very expensive. I spent the entire last day of my trip searching for a pharmacy. Obviously, they do not do background checks or use good judgement when hiring. They did not discount my stay or compensate me in any way. The cost to replace the medicine was $460. I have no idea if the employee was even fired. Beware, and do not leave valuables or medication in your room! I will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: catvic
Reviews.Content: what a lovely hotel. staff could nt do enough for us. easy going clean and friendly. how we d love to go back. so close to everything you want to see. kids made very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: noordhuisfamily
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay. Walking distance from everything. The hotel is old, the kitchen cabinets were old (we had a suite), but everything was very neatly painted. And it was very (and I mean very!) clean. The bed slept excellent. Staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful. We came with 3 kids (4,2 and 1 year old) and they lent us a book: Visiting LA with a stroller. Such a nice gesture. They loaded us with advice for places going for diner, how to use the metro etc. And when I asked the closest store for buying milk in the evening (the two youngest drink milk before going to bed, and we hadn’t found a store on our way back to the hotel) the staff said it was too far to walk and offered us milk from their kitchen. They were so helpful! Also when we went to the pool the kids got a popsicle. And also, we really got there early (before noon) but it was no problem to check in, what was really a blessing when you’re traveling with 3 small kids. We loved the breakfast. Being Europeans it was so nice not to get eggs and sausages but really good muffins, bread and toast. And the whole day there was fresh fruit and iced water (with cucumber) in the lobby available. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend it enough!”
Reviews.Author: MissRyan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a double room at the Magic Castle, for our week long trip to LA in June 06. When we arrived we found we had a *huge* suite. The staff were absolutely lovely, friendly and funny and very attentive. It had a great pool, a laundry room, and tasty breakfast was available every morning. The suite was great, complete with a good sized kitchen and balcony. The only slight let down was the bathroom, which could have done with a lick of paint, and the carpets could have done with a bit of a clean, but generally it was excellent, and extremely good value for money. The customer service at the hotel was really good, they left Hersheys kisses next to the bed every day, and in the evenings left us a card with the next days weather forecast on so that we'd be prepaped. The staff always had time to listen to you, and were full of suggestions and recommendations. The hotel is in a great location, just next to the walk of fame, right in the centre of Hollywood. I really can't recommend it enough. One night we went for dinner at the Magic Castle club, which is next door, and while it is a beautiful building, and the magic shows were spectacular, the food was overpriced and not very nice. I'd recommend going for the shows, but definitely not for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, great value”
Reviews.Author: Sharon55
Reviews.Content: Our "junior suite" turned out to be a spacious one-bedroom apartment with full kitchen, lots of closet space, and many extras and suprises. Two chocolate cakes and some gifts awaited us in our kitchen when we checked in , courtesy of the hotel (we were celebrating our 2 children's birthdays). Staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful. This place is an amazing value, especially considering its location in Hollywood, just walking distance from major attractions. This is a great place for families. We will definitely go back next time we are in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Some paint would be nice”
Reviews.Author: westyboy
Reviews.Content: Yes, the hotel is friendly, clean and centrally located, but what they reallly need to do is get some good painters and plasterers in there to touch up some of the crumbling walls. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Adored the Magic Castle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmhathhjsros
Reviews.Content: I found the Magic Castle Hotel on the internet. I stayed there for three nights with my husband, my sister, and my nephew. For my nephew's 16th birthday, I bought him a ticket to come from Ireland to CA. It was his first visit to this country. All four of us absolutely loved the hotel -- location was great. My nephew loved Hollywood Blvd... We loved the proximity to everything. The suite was spacious and clean and right beside the pool. In addition to all that, we absolutely loved the staff. They knew it was my nephew's birthday trip, so they had a birthday cake and card waiting for him when we arrived. They called him by name. They could not have been more helpful with directions, rental car, you name it. I stay in hotels a lot, and I'm pretty picky. I have never, ever found a more friendly staff in any hotel anywhere in the world. They really did treat us like family. I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else in LA. Full marks.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: Proboscus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. It is a small old fashioned boutique hotel with the best of everything - not in terms of glitz and glamour - in terms of the things that really matter. The suites are roomy, modern, clean, and comfortable and have every amenity you need. The beds were great too! There was enough room to stay for weeks; in fact it was like a small apartment. The pool and layout of the hotel is perfect and makes you feel like you are in a community. The location is great if you want to walk around Hollywood and do the tourist stuff. Walk up to the Hollywood Bowl and see the museum there. It's interesting. The unique and plentiful breakfast was delicious and great way to start the day - sitting at the pool and eating fresh baked goodies. There is parking under the hotel for a reasonable price and it is easy. But the absolute best thing about this hotel hands down is the staff. From the minute I spoke to Gretchen on the phone to book the room until the second we said we left and Mike and his staff said goodbye - all of them were amazing! They deserve a customer service award. Even my two teenage boys could not get over how helpful the staff was about everything. And always pleasant with a smile and a friendly attitude. As my boys put it " Mike is the Man". They were very impressed. Oh yes, and don't miss the view from the restaurant on top of the hill above the Castle - also one of their properties. The food was great there too! I would go back to LA just to stay at the Castle again. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: destination1
Reviews.Content: I truly agree with the entry on July 19th. The two bedroom suite was also not very clean. It may have been the old dirty carpet that made it seem dirty. There were cracked tiles in the shower. A very old ironing board that you pull down from a small closet in the kitchen. Ice cube trays and not an ice maker. Oh that's right, it was an old refridgerator. A closet with cleaning supplies that looked like a junk closet. A small swimming pool, that even the kids (ages 12 and 13), did not like. Wireless internet service that did not work. I would never stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone. As much as we paid for our 4 night stay, it was not worth it. The only good thing about the bedrooms were the comfortable beds with the white comforters. We had the desk clerk call for a cab when it was time for us to leave. We waited for 30 minutes and no cab showed up. I believe the cab company that was called only own two cabs, a mini van and a car. I had to go down to the street to flag a cab down myself.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel customer service ever!”
Reviews.Author: mpcmommy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle twice in the last year and have never experienced such incredible service before. The staff is willing to fulfill all your needs: everything from a knife for the kitchen to detergent for the laundry to directions to anything in LA. We stayed in one of the one bedroom suites, which was very spacious--about 800+ square feet. It had a large living area, dining area, and smallish, but functional kitchen. The bathroom was nice and the king sized bed was very comfortable. There was also lots of storage. The pool area is very nice and the staff will regularly bring you popsicles. The continental breakfast is absolutely delicious and is supplied by a local bakery. It is within walking distance of the Hollywood Walk of Fame and Magic Castle shows are free to guests, although, unfortunately we were not able to take advantage of this.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Make the Experience!”
Reviews.Author: HH1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Magic Castle Hotel for two nights the week of August 13th, 2006. The hotel room was expansive, with a large bedroom, a much larger living area equipped with a sleeper sofa and dining table, and a full kitchen. The hotel courtyard features a beautiful, clean pool, which if I had more time I would have loved to enjoy. The location is great, near Hollywood attractions and providing easy access to other parts of L.A. The greatest perk is, of course, the ability to visit The Magic Castle for dinner and entertainment, and I recommend the experience to everyone. The finest quality of The Magic Castle Hotel, even with the advantages described above, is the staff. Friendly and helpful, they introduce themselves with a smile and a complementary cold, crisp sparkling juice served in a champagne glass. No question was left unanswered, whether about the room, activities in the area, transportation, directions... I would particularly like to thank Gretchen Crookes, the Guest Services Manager, for doing everything possible to make my stay enjoyable short of accompanying me around town! I highly recommend The Magic Castle Hotel to one and all planning a trip to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and great visit”
Reviews.Author: Radar_Geek
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Magic Castle Hotel in July. I had read reviews about how good the staff is, and these reviews are no exaggeration. We were greeted with soft drinks in wine glasses and given popsicles at the swimming pool. The front desk gave us great advice on tours and restaurants and made reservations for us. They were very knowledgeable about the area. The quickly helped us with anything we needed. We had one meal at the Magic Castle Club. It was a very unique experience that was quite enjoyable. The hotel is well located. We were able to walk to Hollywood Boulevard for tours and sight seeing. The fee for parking a car was more reasonable than other hotels in the area. We never had problems finding a parking place, and the parking lot was very secure. The rooms are not new, but they are well maintained. We had a great deal of room, and the kitchen was very convenient. The hotel was very charming and had a lot of character.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families. Loads of Space”
Reviews.Author: traceyp
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one bedroom suite ( room 105) for 3 nights last week. Our family of 4 included mom, dad, daughter 13 and son 10. The location of the hotel was great for walking to the majority of the Hollywood sights (Chinese Theatre, Kodak, Starline Tours, El Capitan theatre, Disney Soda Fountain, and the Hollywood and Highland Shopping Center). The room had more than enough space and was clean and provided all the necessary amenities. The staff was extremely helpful and we enjoyed the breakfast every morning sitting at the tables by the pool. Other users mentioned the bathrooms as an area of concern, so I was a bit worried. However in our room, there were only two specific issues: there was no working extractor fan which probably caused some of the peeling paint on the ceiling over the shower and the towel rack that they chose was far too flimsy for the weight of the towels and was begining to come loose from the wall. But that is it!! The remainder of the room was very nicely decorated to modern standards for a boutique hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical stay”
Reviews.Author: wrw1105
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel during a vacation to the LA area. The hotel is small but in a great location, just two blocks from Hollywood Blvd. One of the best parts was its association with the Magic Castle. Minors can't get into the Castle to see the performances except on weekend brunches and unless you are with a member. The only exception is for those staying at the hotel. Since my son is a magic buff, that was a big attraction of staying there. However, we were pleasantly surprised with just about everything. Most impressive was the staff which was so incredibly friendly and helpful. They were never overbearing but always willing to help out. The rooms were decent, but not overly impressive. They had everything we needed. I was a little taken aback by the carpets, which looked a little worn, but half-way through our stay, they were being replaced. The beds were very comfy while the bathrooms were a little tired, but still very functional and clean. Every morning there was a continental breakfast served in the small lobby. I ususally took my food out to the pool-side tables and sat there. The pool was a great feature; it wasn't too big but was great for cooling off. My only complaint was one night, at about 2 a.m., some drunks jumped in and were a little noisy. But that was an isolated occurence. If you're there on vacation, you can easily walk to Hollywood Blvd and all the attractions there. As well, the hotel next door -- which I wouldn't suggest you stay at -- is where Janis Joplin was found dead. Overall, I'd go back to this hotel in a minute, based largely on the staff. Great job

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Vienna81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for four nights in early August, and we really enjoyed this hotel. Everyone who works in the hotel is very friendly and helpful, especially with providing recommendations on places to eat and helping out with directions. We stayed in a studio room and the furniture was renovated, but the carpet was not. The bed was large and comfortable. The hotel is a few blocks from all the Hollywood attractions like Kodak Theatre, etc. The breakfast is basic and pretty good. We liked the free DVD rentals a lot. There is a fridge in the studio. There was that there was a lot of noise the first two nights from other hotel guests next door. The walls are very thin. There were some cracks in the wall. Also, the shower temperature was not totally consistent. The parking garage is good but small, and the spaces are very tight. We did not use the wireless internet, so we cannot comment on it. There is an internet kiosk that is 20 cents/minute if you do not have a laptop. If you are looking for a posh and luxurious experience, this is not the hotel for you. However, if you are looking for great value and a comfortable experience, and don't plan on being on your room all day, Magic Castle is a good fit.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good...”
Reviews.Author: woolpitch
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Magic Castle twice now and really enjoyed both stays. The location is perfect - a 5-minute walk to the Hollywood & Highland area, but far enough away from Hollywood Blvd to be quiet. Also very easy to get on the route to other tourist areas, eg Santa Monica. The hotel has obviously had some refurbishment in the last couple of years, but - as others have posted here - the decor still needs to be updated in some areas. The bathroom in particular looked very old. But in terms of getting the exotic 'old-style Hollywood Motel' feel, it's right on the money. Despite the old bathroom, I would certainly stay here again and would recommend the hotel to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE HOTEL AND ITS AWESOME STAFF”
Reviews.Author: BRboy
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about the Magic Castle Hotel and its incredible staff. The experience was great from the moment we arrived and all the way through check out. At check in, we were provided with sparkling italian sodas (an unexpected treat on such a warm day). The rooms were tastefully appointed. And they even had complimentary breakfast and free wireless service. The best part of our stay is when we went into our room. There was a chocolate cake and a card signed by the staff. I'm not sure how they even knew it was my birthday. I highly recommend staying at the Magic Castle. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Magic of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: RTown
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed one night at the Magic Castle. Our overall impression is the Magic Castle was worth the stay. It is extremely close to all the Hollywood action. The rooms were as described with nice linens and clean appearance. Our room had new carpet. Parking is a reasonable $8 a day, not uncommon in LA no matter where you park. The front desk was friendly and we received a cold bubbly beverage upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - not as we expected from reviews or Hotel website”
Reviews.Author: ChoosyPerson
Reviews.Content: We use Tripadvisor for all our hotel choices when visiting a new city and as Magic Castle was rated #3 in Los Angeles and the Hotel's own website shows lovely photos of a hotel "completely renovated in 2004" we booked with confidence. Apparently the ground floor consists of suites which are renovated, but the other rooms are certainly not renovated and are in fact quite shabby. The cleanliness was well below standard as the room was very dusty in all corners. Very old worn carpets, a functional but run down bathroom, a very noisy dilapidated air conditioning system and hard to control ceiling fan are among the highlights. On the plus side the room was a decent size, the bed was quite comfortable, there is an empty fridge which is useful and a desk, plus a large TV and a DVD player. The wardrobe is a fair size with large mirrors and a safe. On our last day we took the complimentary continental breakfast which was very good and we would have taken every day in hindsight, although there wasn't quite enough informal seating to accomodate all the guests wanting to sit outside. We found the staff to be varied - some were helpful when we asked for advice. However there was a general reluctance to change our traveller's cheques each day which seemed incredible - we were often told they "didn't have" $100 to change, but then go back and ask someone else and they would. This is a small apartment style hotel, with the feel of a beach hotel without the beach. The very small pool is the focal point around which the three or four floors of rooms are built - with no ramps or elevators! Getting your cases up the stairs is a nightmare! The location of the hotel is it's best feature. Our main reason for visiting was to see a show at the Hollywood Bowl which turned out to be a 10-15 minute walk which saved being stuck in traffic. The Chinese Theatre and other main attractions are 5 minutes walk away. However, there are numerous other hotels situated along the same road which would be worth investigating if you wish to stay in this location. We would almost certainly not return to the Magic Castle hotel and would not recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A magical place....”
Reviews.Author: MrsPacker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are avid travellers and we loved this place. It is an older hotel (it used to be an apartment building) so no, it isn't perfect but we found it to be clean, comfy, in a great location and offering one of the finest young staffs we have ever dealt with. Full kitchen, nice bedrooms. A lot of bang for your buck. Delish breakfast by the pool gave us the opportunity to meet interesting people. The pool was small but enjoyable. A great opportunity to visit the adjacent Magic Castle and see a great show (dress up!). Within walking of Grauman's and the hubub of Hollywood Blvd, so there are plenty of places to eat, people watch and buy groceries. Staff bent over backwards to be helpful. Caution: some of the rooms are near a busy road, so ask for a quiet room. We go to L.A. every year to visit relatives and we plan to return to the Magic Castle Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: MeanieMaureenie
Reviews.Content: We needed a quick get-away for a weekend... and spent out time here 4th of July weekend. We originally made our reservations from Orbitz.com, but when our room was not was what we expected, the manager quickly upgraded our room to a suite with no extra charge or fuss. We were greeted with sparkling lemonade and were continually accomodated with cold popscicles through-out the hot day along the pool. They even had people come and give us the forecast for the following day. Everyone at the Magic Castle Hotel was more than accomodating and gave us the most relaxing weekend I have had in a very long time! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ladydi1780
Reviews.Content: I booked the Magic Castle Hotel after reading all the great comments on Trip Advisor...and what a great decision it was! We stayed in an adorable 1-bdrm suite...very clean and comfy!! The staff is wonderful and very considerate.....we were in town for my husband's 30th b-day and upon arrival there was birthday cake and a bottle of wine!! The hotel even made reservations for us at the Magic Castle Club where my husband was surprised with the restaurant staff singing "Happy Birthday" while bringing him ice cream. The manager, Darren Ross, was very helpful in planning our stay and Mary Ann even shuttled us up the hill to the Magic Castle Club so we wouldn't have to walk in the heat! I can go on an on about all the great things we experienced at the Magic Castle Hotel. I definately recommend it and will return the next time we are in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Like Sleeping In a Sauna”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Magic Castle Hotel - Hollywood from July 6/06 to July 9/06. The hotel is very well located, the staff is friendly and curteous. However the accomodations were too hot to handle. Whenever we came back from our outings with 85degree farenheit weather outside, we were welcomed to a sauna. The reservations were made for 5 adults, one of which had a medical problem(leukemia). We were given a two bedroom suite with a pull out sofa bed in the living room. The problem arose when we discovered that the pull out sofa bed was so old and mouldy that there was no support for the mattress. The staff provided us with a small fold up cot, which we had to place in one of the rooms(taking away privacy). The reason we had to place cot in room is because we also realized early in our stay that if all three air conditioners(one in each room and one in living room) were functioning, the breaker would go off. We advised the hotel of the problem they assured us it would get fixed but it wasn't. By our second night stay, it didn't matter if we had three air conditioners running or only one, the breaker kept going off. When we checked out, the hotel staff advised us that they were aware of the problems in that specific room (106) and to compensate they gave us two nights of "free parking". What we don't seem to understand is why would they accomodate us in the only room that had inadequate air conditionning and an old run down sofa bed when we purposely had advised them that one of the guests had a medical problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Unique Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff is wonderful. The hotel is very unique and cozy. We stayed there with a wedding party and the layout of the hotel made it so easy to mix and mingle with family we haven't seen in years. The rooms are spacious and not stuffy like most hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Lissete
Reviews.Content: We reserved a 1 Bedroom suite which was very ample & comfortable. We are a family of 4, 2 adults & 2 teens. It was nice to just go to another room to get away from them. The breakfast is basic but nice, it was enough for us to get a start to our day. The room has TONS of storage, which was great for us since we were packed for 16 days. The bed in the bedroom was kind of hard for me. I have a SAM adjustable bed at home so what may be hard for me may not be for others. We did ask for a roll awa which never showed but the girls decided that they could both sleep on the pul out ok so we didn't persue it. They have a laundry room which I did use, only $.75 per machine & they supply the detergent. They also offer free WiFi which was really slow through out our stay, sometimes we could not connect at all. I guess this is hit or miss. This is an older apt. building so it does have it's quirks. These little things did not get in the way of us having a nice stay. The staff is super friendly & eager to please. The only thing we regretted was asking for a top floor suite! From the garage to our room we climbed about 40 steps! My husband practically had a heart attack bringing up our bags. A staff member did help with our bags and we almost killed him as well, we had HEAVY bags! I will consider the Magic Castle Hotel if we ever return to Hollywood but we will definitely not request the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “misinformed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We telephoned from the East Coast, but were not informed (a) that the Magic Castle Club has a dress code or (b) no children are allowed. So, our stay was very disappointing for our two teenageers. For one of them, the Magic Castle was to be the birthday surprise. The hotel should inform potential guests.

Reviews.Title: “An Enjoyable Visit”
Reviews.Author: CatCalico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel on June 2nd and June 3rd. There were five of us traveling (3 adults and 2 kids ages 9 and 11) and we stayed in a one bedroom suite. Upon check-in we were greeted by the staff at the front door. The person at the desk was very pleasant and helpful and made us feel like we were valued guests. After we checked in we were moving our luggage from the car to our room. When a staff member saw us moving our luggage, he immediately offered to assist us. Our room was spacious and comfortable. We requested a roll-away bed when we made our reservations and it was in the room when we checked in. The weather was quite hot during our stay and the room was pleasantly cool. There was an air conditioner in the living room and bedroom. The kids wanted to use the pool immediately and it was quite refreshing. The breakfast provided in the lobby area was really good with a variety of fruit and freshly baked goodies. The coffee was very tasty as well. The location was great - walking distance to the Chinese Theater and Walk of Fame. We were able to go to the Sunday Brunch at the Magic Castle which was really nice. Our stay was enjoyable. The staff at this Hotel really knows how to provide an exceptional cutomer experience. The entire staff from the manager at the front desk to the housekeeping staff work in conjuction to make the guest feel special. We all had a great time - it was a nice break from the average chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Crappy Bathroom Can Spoil A Stay”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler42
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magic Castle June 23 - 26, 2006 in room 113. This hotel is a real mixed bag. Great location in the heart of Hollywood. But a bathroom that is in desperate need of renovation. Helpful, friendly staff that is really attempting to keep an older facility going. But an incredibly uncomfortable and droopy sofa bed that was cruel and unusual punishment for our teenage sons. Unexpected extras like free DVD loans and juice in a champagne glass on check in, but they couldn't find a remote for our TV. But our big complaint was the bathroom and not the fact that the bathtub was so old that the porcelain was worn off. Our issue was the toilet. There was a large plunger strategically placed next to the toilet that I had to use at least four times during our stay. We complained and the maintenance team came the next day. When we returned that evening, the toilet wouldn't flush at all - they had broken the chain and left. Another call and the team returned and within the hour, we could flush. Sort of. The saga continued but I won't dwell on the details other than to say that one time we lost the battle resulting in an unpleasant overflow. The staff took $50 off our bill but that's not enough for us to take the plunge again at the Magic Castle.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but room was a little musty”
Reviews.Author: FHWNPW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in June. The staff were very friendly and helpful but the room was lttle a musty. We opted for a one bed suite and the room was a great size, this was a refurbished room however due to the choice of colour of the carpet the room didn't look newly refurbished . On our last night the people upstairs had the TV on all night which kept us awake so wasn't a very pleasant ending to our stay. All in all we had a great stay, especially as this is only a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what I expected”
Reviews.Author: kryptonicat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel after browsing through this website and expedia and the like. Some of the pictures showed the motel with very contemporary rooms. However, when I arrived at the hotel I was less than impressed. It must be said that there are two sides to this hotel. On the one side, you have what are called "one/two bedroom suites". These are the the rooms you are going to see in the pictures when you are booking. However, the room I got was a "deluxe queen" I believe. These rooms it seems are not yet renovated, and not at all up to the standards of what you pay for. My girlfriend and I checked in to what looked like a rennovated apartment building next to the magic castle. Not met by sparkling cider and not shown to our room as the other guests were when checking in. The first room we went to had a broken lock to its connecting room which made it free for me or my neighbors to open up our doors and enter each others rooms. So, the hotel decided to place a small table in front of the door to make all well. Beyond that, the room was sitting well in the 90 degree range. So...we asked for another room. No problem there...and we were given another unimpressive, unrennovated room. The room was steaming again and until we left we had to run the air conditioning unit on high to stay at all comfortable. After complaining about our first room and expressing our concern that we didnt get what we paid for, nick at the front desk said he would try and get us in to a nicer room the following day. Next day....back down to the front desk to ask about a new room (and to ask why the wireless internet wasnt working, which we were directed to a 1-800 number for tech support). We were told by one of the ladies that since we didnt come to the front desk by 11am someone was already booked in the nicer room. So were they willing to give us some kind of discount or do anything for us? Nope. She said she tried to contact us, even though our phone never rang and we were only about 30 feet away for her to walk and knock on our door. So following that...we decided to check out early. We had already walked along the strip the previous day and didnt mind moving a little bit further away. During our complaining and early departure, not once did we talk to Mike, the front end manager who sat just behind the glass at the front desk, or did we talk to darren, the hotel manager who was onsite as well and who also knew of the situation. On the positive, this motel is extremely close to the Chinese theater and if you get a rennovated room, your stay will probably be quite nice. However, while I stood at the front desk to check out I called Comfort Inn and Suites and got an exceptionally nicer room for about $40+ cheaper, but it was just a little futher off the strip. Basically, only stay here if your going to pay the extra for the larger rooms, and that is if you really want to pay that much. If your just looking for a room close to the strip, there are more than enough close to hollywood blvd or sunset that are quite cheaper and much nicer. On a side note of the staff at the Magic Castle, Nick was professional and nice enough as was one of the other gentleman we were helped by on our first day there. However, the two ladies we ran in two at the front desk on the next day seemed to possess little knowledge and even less tact. But, most of all the management was not at all up to calibur. Providing no contact giving us no explanation and no apology. We got the sense that this was not the first time the motel has had to deal with people in our position.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: roadstar445
Reviews.Content: On June 11,12,13 & 14 three of us stayed in room 211. Big bedroom, full kitchen, couch/bed, deck with tables and chairs, which overlooked the pool. Free Internet worked all the time and was fast. Mary Jane greeted us and could not have been nicer. She even gave our daughter a cake celebrating her college graduation! Lots of activity in the heart of Hollywood and just 1 block away at Kodak Theater & Graumen's allowed us an easy walk to get free movie tickets (premier showing of Fast & Furious Tokyo Drift) experience a TV show (Jimmy Kimmel Live-free also) and see a movie opening (Jack Black interviewed by Entertainment Tonight for the movie Nacho Libre). This is no Hilton but comfortable and clean. Free local newspaper delivered to our door and free breafact. Many stairs and no elevator may be tough for some but staff will get your bags to your room. Indoor parking keeps your car cool on those hot CA days. Staff is very helpful and finds creative ways to correct issues. When the stove didn't work Mary Jane didn't just cook our pizza but also gave us free bottle of wine – stove was fixed the next day. Mary Jane, Marc and Darren answered our every question while the rest of the staff was also friendly and did their jobs well. Met 3 recent medical graduates from the UK at the pool who said the same accommodations in their country would have cost 3x as much. I also felt that we too received our moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nine Women....Yes 9 women went to Hollywood. Before we left I read many reviews on the Magic Castle Hotel and it always had positive responses. The hotel was located in a great location if you wanted to walk to Hollywood Blvd (stars on the sidewalk), the Kodak Theater and the Chinese Theater. The hotel staff was on the ball and every hotel should be trained by them. If they did not have something you needed they were going to do their best to accomodate you. I have never been treated so nice. The hotel is a little on the older side but the rooms were really spacious and very clean. The daily weather card was a nice touch too. The continental breakfast was tasty and brought in every morning from their local bakery. I really recommend the Magic Castle and if I were to go to HOLLYWOOD again, I would stay their in a skinny minute. GREAT job hotel staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle from June7-10th. We had a non-renovated room. It was older (with iron marks on carpet), but not bad at all, in fact it was quite roomy and very clean. We had a one bedroom suite so we had plenty of room to spread out. The hotel is very close to Hollywood Boulevard and all its' crazy attractions. Two not so great things...the pool feels like they put ice cubes in it at night. And the maids never serviced our room even though I kept putting out the "please appear" sign each morning. I had to go get myself new bath towels every day. Also, a little minor comment, someone might want to mention that they CHARGE for their parking ($8/day). Did I miss that on the website? Maybe that is the norm for LA. All in all we had a good time here (my son & husband enjoyed watching their own tv shows on the two tv's and I enjoyed them not arguing over who is hogging the remote) :) The staff is great & quite helpful.

Reviews.Title: “More Motel than Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTxn
Reviews.Content: A co-worker and I stayed at the Magic Castle hotel on business last month. Not quite the "boutique hotel" I was expecting. Felt much more like a budget travel motel with the window unit air conditioners and iron burns on the carpet. Wireless internet did not work well at all. If you're trying to locate a cheap room near the Walk of Fame - ok. If you're needing a business class hotel because all others in the area are full - keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Great "hidden" hotel blocks from Walk of Fame”
Reviews.Author: Michigander94
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel in April, 2006 with my family (including 2 young children). I was inexplicably concerned before arriving that it may have been a mistake. I was met with a glass of chilled sparkling juice by a friendly and helpful reception agent and knew I had no reason to worry. The room was basic and somewhat outdated, but having kitchen facilities was great. Pool was supposed to be heated but was fridgid. The price was good and location great! We could walk to the Chinese Theater. It also had a sort of quirky charm. I would recommend it highly to those looking for non-chic, comfortable accomodations in downtown Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: raven11
Reviews.Content: Have been at the Magic Castle Hotel for 6 nights. Got a non-renovated room for the first night, a bit wore-down. Complaint. Got a renovated, perfect room the next day just like in the advertised pictures and bottle of redwine for the inconvinience. Was totally satisfied. Breakfast was far beyond average, milk, coffee, tee, muffins, cookies, toast, oranges, apples, croissants. Could even take it with me to my room. Complimentary newspaper every morning. Roomservice was excellent, everything clean. Staff at the reception was polite and very helpful. And the location is perfect for everything. If I´m looking for somethimg to complain, the only thing was the not so excellent TV reception in my room ( 109 ). But who is in L.A. to watch T.V. anyway? So, over all, if your looking for a not-so-expensive-hotel with a first-class-service you are definitly right wit this hotel. And if you are lucky, you meet Tom Cruise on your last day in L.A. just right around the corner like i did...

Reviews.Title: “Mother's Day Treat”
Reviews.Author: MWVCAA
Reviews.Content: What a sweet little hotel! My daughter and I arrived from out of state for a Mother's Day weekend retreat. She had the fold-out couch and I got the bedroom. The mattress was excellent and the duvet and down pillows were superb. As all the reviews mentioned, the staff were all super friendly and bent over backwards to help you. Maps and tips on fun things to do were readily given. They even bought me a six-pack of Diet Dr. Pepper, as they had none stocked, and put it in the frig while we were out! The pool, heated, is open 24 hours, so we took advantage of that. We never took a taxi - the subway is two blocks away, as is shopping, dining, and people-watching. Try Mel's Diner - very good. And go to Universal Studios during the week. We went on Monday - no lines at all. But remember, it closes at 6 pm! The hotel seems quite safe and it was quiet. Rooms were being renovated with new carpet as we left. Our room could use some new carpet as well, but it was very clean and did not have an odor. The CD and DVD players were a plus! Thanks to Ashley, Mary Anne, and Nick - these were the only names I caught, but as I said, everyone was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice for LA”
Reviews.Author: JonKMontreal_Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a TV crew at the Magic Castle, and although I suffered many jokes about wanting to stay at a hotel with such an odd name it turned out to be a great spot. LA is tough for hotels - so much of the city is not a city, at least by non-LA standards - it's hard to find a place where you can actually walk to a store or restaurant. The Magic Castle - which seems off of a set for a TV show or film - is well located, friendly (in the best sense of the word) and comfortable. If you get a "suite" it's really a one bedroom apartment - some of the small rooms, however, can be quite small. Rates vary according to season - but most of the year it's quite affordable. There is no elevator - which would have been a problem except that the staff lent a hand and even with a lot of metal boxes we were okay. Jon - Montreal, Quebec

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and fine for the money”
Reviews.Author: 5oclocksomewhere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for five nights and returned home 4/27/06. I was there for a nearby conference. I arrived a bit early, exhausted from flying cross country. The staff were very nice, brought me a cool glass of lemonade and found a different suite for me that had already been cleaned. My one bedroom suite was just as I'd read about in former reviews. It was gigantic for one person. The walls, rugs, furn, could use some TLC, however the place was immaculate and housekeeping prompt and efficient. My king sized sleigh bed and down duvet was the best part at the end of a long business day. Front desk staff was always cheerful and helpful anytime I called with questions. The hotel is on a decent street as opposed to several nearby and an easy walk to The Kodak Theatre, Graumanns, etc. if that's why you're in Hollywood. There is also a new METRO station very close by which was clean, easy to navigate and only a 5 minute ride to Universal Studios. It's not a high-end hotel; however, all the above mentioned things made up for the lack of posh. I would drefinitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Staff - Avoid Suite 222 At All Costs”
Reviews.Author: MercerIslandMom
Reviews.Content: This review would have 2 stars if not for the staff. I researched Hollywood hotels for quite a while, and loved Magic Castle's spacious 2 bedroom site with the hip, new furniture displayed on the Magic Castle's website. Our family arrived and was ushered to Suite 222, the one room outside the hotel which was a (recently?) converted studio. It was dingy, had only 1 of the 2 promised bathrooms, offered closets so musty that I immediately re-closed the doors, and a shower the size of a coffin. But the real horrible twist was the paper-thin walls and the loud noise from the street. I immediately requested a room change but none was available and the newbie clerk said "just close the windows". With all windows closed, this heavy sleeper was awoken multiple times and finally crawled into bed with her children in an inner room where noise was still heard. I went to the clerk the next morning almost in tears: for $250 a night, I expected more, at least a decent night of sleep. She ended up refunding the night's charge, assigning us to a new room (switching us with new unfortunate guests), and treated us to a box of treats. Very pleasant. The new room was all that I had expected: light, roomy, and hip. No street noise since we were in a courtyard off the street. It was recently renovated but already wear was showing through, but still, after that nightmare Suite 222, it was heaven. Great staff. Ready, helpful, and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The Magic Castle is Magic!!”
Reviews.Author: V-Bareford
Reviews.Content: We loved this little hotel! From the first experience with the front desk to the last good-bye as we drove out of the secured parking lot, this was just the most pleasant experience. The French lemonade that was served as we checked in was a delightful way to begin our stay, and it only got better after that. Any problems were addressed immediately and with a smile. Directions were very good and a map was printed off when needed. It is not the fanciest or the largest, but it is just a wonderful, fun and clean place to stay while in Hollywood. In fact, you would never know you were only two blocks from one of the busiest streets in LA, it was so quiet and peaceful. We will definitely be returning to the Magic Castle!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stumc1
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle is a great little hotel, just a few minures walk from Hollywood Boulevard and Manns Chinese Theatre, yet in a quiet quite location. Its also close to the subway and Universal Studios, and has its own secure car parking garage. The staff were really friendly and the breakfast which you could eat by the pool was ok. The bedroom was large and the beds were VERY comfortable. All in all it was a great base for exploring Hollywood and the rest of L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Apartment Like Hotel in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: tru205
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three week trip to the US where our final port of call was L.A. We drove into LA (having hired a car in Anaheim), saw the Hollywood sign up on the hill and exited the 101 freeway to cruise along a dirty and dumpy street that is Sunset Boulevard. Despite the imagery its name conjures up, Hollywood in reality holds minimal glitz or glamour and as we neared the hotel, we started to worry that our hotel may be similar to the surroundings. But no! We were pleasantly surprised as we rounded the corner to the Magic Castle Hotel and were suitably impressed - it was a fabulous place to stay. For the great price it offered location, space and amenities with only a couple of shortcomings. The hotel appears to be an old apartment block remodelled into a hotel. The rooms all surround a pool (very Melrose Place like) and are very spacious. Our room had a full kitchen with microwave, stove, fridge and dining table. There was a fold out sofa bed in the second room for our son. (Great for kids but not really for adults as it was not all that comfortable.) There was a television in both rooms (though the one in the master bedroom would only show one channel), a dvd player (you could borrow dvds from reception at no charge) and the bathroom had a bath and shower but was a little tired. The room itself was not young, but was spotless and there were some very nice little touches including chocolates on pillows, a card with the expected weather for the next day and a complimentary continental breakfast. The bed in the master bedroom was incredibly comfortable! The staff were very friendly and helpful, the security was good and undercover, secure parking was available for $8 a day. The hotel was located a block away from the Chinese Theatre and the stars in the sidewalk of Hollywood Boulevard - but LA is somewhere you really need a car so depending on what you are interested in this would determine whether you thought it was a good location. Overall, a great hotel for the price. A fabulous option for travellers with kids as you can cook for yourself and have the space and a pool to amuse the children. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “spacious and relaxing - little gem in LA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's not the Four Seasons, but it's not Four Seasons price. Incredible value for your money...the suite is literally a one bedroom apartment with full kitchen, dining room, living room with DVD player, and 2 tvs. Separate bedroom. Ashley and Marcelle from front desk are amazing and helpful and so are everyone else whom I came in contact with. The whole hotel is like Melrose Place and although the carpet is a little worn, the bed was so comfortable with down pillows and down duvet. It was the most relaxing stay, simple pleasure....I would definitely come back. The Magic Club brunch/show was okay....lots of kids so depends on what you are looking for...activities for the kids, great! a relaxing morning brunch....no....my 12 year old daughter loves it. I definitely can skip this as food is mediocre and show is mediocre. I love the hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and Delightful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BJB1945
Reviews.Content: This place is simply the best. We were greeted with smiles and the famous, but not very often found, American 'Can Do' attitude to any request or enquiry. We had a one bedroom apartment that was stylishly and simply furnished. It was clean, the bed was 6' and had lovely cotton linen and down duvets and pillows. The bathroom, although not modern, was again clean and had everything you could need, including nice toiletries. There was a television in the living room and the bedroom, and also a DVD player and CD/Radio player. Each evening, whilst we were out, one of the staff came and tuned the radio into soothing classical music and left a hand written card on the pillow telling us the weather for the next day, together with two Hersheys Chocolate Kisses. Each morning, a free newspaper was delivered to our room. Breakfast is included in the rate, and although the pastries are delicious, there is a lot of sugar in them, and also most of the cereals are of the less healthy variety. This is the only negative I could find. There is an excellent laundry with washing machines and dryers and it costs $1 per machine load! This is not well advertised. There is also free internet access, although when I enquired, the manager offered to loan me his new laptop, so I was able to sit by the pool and check my e-mail! I have read reviews mentioning stairs to climb. Well, the hotel only has ground floor and first floor rooms, so is hardly in the league of needing a lift! We were on the first floor and the balcony overlooked the pool, as do most of the others. The stairs are really not an issue, unless you have a real mobility problem. The location is perfect for all the Hollywood sites, and we hired a car, with the help of the wonderful Reception Staff. They also printed off detailed driving directions to Universal Studios and the Getty Museum. In three months of travelling, we found no hotel staff to match those at the Magic Castle. They need to be publically recognised. I am sure they go home with a smile on their faces, as they do a great job with total commitment and must feel very satisfied at the end of the day with all the people they have made happy. I would stay here again without any doubt, but probably bring some healthy meusli with me!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful stay at the Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: bostonjazz80
Reviews.Content: We just returned from April spring break in Hollywood with our two teenagers, and we loved our four nights at the Magic Castle Hotel. First and foremost is the service at the hotel. It is rated as a "two star" place, but that doesn't do justice to the very customer-focused attitude of all the staff. They helped us whenever we needed it, and they treated us with a sincere friendliness that you don't learn in customer service class. It seems that the owners or managers have done a great job of hiring the right people. They all seemed genuinely concerned about our happiness at the hotel, and they went out of their way to help us whenever necessary. Again, this wasn't the "false smile, patronizing attitude pretense" that seems to pass for customer service; this was a bunch of nice people trying to make sure we had a good time at their place. One example: Our key card was not working for us to enter their garage, so one of the staff members came out of the hotel to help. (Yes, apparently they were monitoring the garage entrance and noticed our problem.) When I pointed out the problem, the gentleman used his card to open the garage for us, then said that he would run inside, re-program my key card, and meet me in the garage to give me my card. (Yes, he came down to meet me.) This is just one example of how they went out of their way to take care of us. We also enjoyed the other aspects of the hotel: the location is great (close proximity to all of the Hollywood attractions), our 1-bedroom suite was spacious and decorated with personality (not a generic hotel look), and the heated pool, although on the small side, gave us a peaceful retreat from sightseeing (my kids loved the pool). We had a great time at the hotel and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 days at the Magic Castle, encouraged by the reviews here. Overall, it was an okay experience, but not great. The plusses: The rooms are quite large. Our one bedroom suite was clean and the full kitchen was nice to have. I cannot compliment the housekeeping staff enough. Also Ashley at the front dest was very helpful and pleasant. Location is good-- it is within walking distance to the Hollywood and Highland entertainment complex and most of the other Hollywood attractions. It is also one stop down from Universal Studios on the Metro. The adequate: There is a continental breakfast. If you love carbs, this is the place for you! There were only pastries, cereal, and juice available. The not so great: The hotel, being on a busy street can be noisy. The quieter rooms were off street, but up lots of stairs. If you have bad knees, or are not in good shape you WILL be exhausted! In short either you deal with the noise or you get put in a room far away with no elevator in sight.

Reviews.Title: “Many amenities and great value”
Reviews.Author: arlenejoe
Reviews.Content: This is a fine location in Hollywood - 1 block from Grauman's Chinese Theater and the whole tourist scene on that same block. Good eating, lots of movie theaters, shopping, fun stuff happening all along the sidewalk, stars and handprints of celebrities. Yet, the hotel itself feels residential. In fact, the hotel was an apartment complex before, so the feel is very homey around the swimming pool. Service is the best - friendly, quick to fix the shower door, very responsive. They certainly aim to please. Yamashiro's, the famous upscale restaurant in the gorgeously historic building overlooking the city, is part of the business, so they booked our dinner reservation and drove us up to the restaurant. Best part is that the hotel stay allows us entry into the Members Only Magic Castle. We had Sunday brunch there with our kids and saw 3 shows. Very fun afternoon that lasts 3 hours. The price is a real bargain for what you get. Don't expect a physically sparkling site - it's an older building that's been remodeled nicely but not extravagently. The only downside is the noise. Pretty noisy, especially with the cheerleading team that was in town for a competition. We probably wouldn't stay there again because we wouldn't need to be in that location and see the magic shows or dine at Yamashiro's again, but for a one-time treat, I'd highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BLGAW
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 (parents, 2 teens and a grandmother) that stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel March 11-14. The hotel is located at the bottom of a hill, next door to the Magic Castle Club. My mother and I would walk up the hill to the Japanese restaurant (Yamashiro's) at the top to enjoy the view each morning. The location is very good for just walking to the Kodak Theater or Graumanns Chinese Theater. Since we had a car, it was also centrally located to everything else. Our one bedroom unit was always clean. The furnishings were kind of "art deco" simple. We also had a small kitchen with stove and refrigerator. The staff was awesome!! They could answer any question about Los Angeles and always did it with a smile and additional information that I would not have thought to ask. (I am wondering if they have to take some kind of knowledge test before they are hired?) They were always very accomodating and quick to bring extra towels or blankets when we asked. Since the weather was chillier than we had expected, we did not use the pool. But our daughters are hoping to come back during the summer. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place . . . Lots of Steps”
Reviews.Author: speerlaw
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle hotel was fantastic! As an amateur magician, I had heard that the hotel was not the best place to stay at, but I disagree with that now. The hotel is a renovated apartment complex that was built in the late 50's. It has been completely renovated and is very comfortable and clean. The staff was great and the service was 110%! The only drawback was that there a lot of stairs leading up to your room, so if you can't handle stairs, make sure you have a room on the lower level. GREAT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: By far one of the best Hotel's I've ever stayed in, beats anything NYC could provide in Customer service. Rooms were Huge! CLEAN!, with a very modern decor, more of a Hip apt feel then a Hotel. every small detail went un noticed, from the Hershey kiss and weather report card delivered to you at night, to the friendly and well informed staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: PinkLadyOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days during Christmas vacation, 2005. There were 6 of us; 2 seniors, 2 adults and 2 children, and we all thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. While the building is older, worn, and was never fancy to begin with; the rooms are big, comfortable, and in a perfect location. The service we received from the entire staff was very friendly and the best customer service any of us had ever experienced. I told the staff that I would post a positive review here and on cruise critic as a way of saying thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Not as "magical" as we hoped!”
Reviews.Author: nls1330
Reviews.Content: We spent two February nights at The Magic Castle based on Trip Advisor reviews. Because of the high rating we expected above average accomodations, but were disappointed. Our street facing room was noisy and we had to run the AC fan at night to block out the traffic. Our biggest concern, however, was the bathroom. The linoleum tile had two cigarette burns, the sink was sluggish and the aluminum doors on the tub enclosure were encrusted with years of gunk and mildew. The bathroom was in dire need of renovation and should not have been offered to guests. On the positive side the suite was large, staff was friendly and the location was good for touring the Hollywood area. All in all it was OK but not a No. 1 rating in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: psc7811
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for 4 nights Feb 19-23 based on previous reviews in one of the renovated one bedroom suites. It would be redundant to detail all of the plusses (location, staff, room, breakfast) to this fine hotel since I agree with all of those mentioned by recent reviewers! I wouldn't hesitate one second to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “More than Magic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay in the whole of LA. We rented a one bedroom apartment for 10 days in Jan/Feb and had the most wonderful time. The apartments are like little homes - very clean, comfortable and spacious - and the location of the hotel itself is very central. The staff were really friendly and unbelievably helpful (thanks especially to Ashley, Mike, Gretchen, Nick and Jason), navigating LA and the surrounds was easy due to their great advice and even better directions. And now we want a heated pool just like the one at the Magic Castle so we too can swim every day in the middle of winter! Don't look anywhere else for a hotel - just book this one if you can get a room.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good hotel for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: Kamaainamama
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2-year old son and I went to LA last weekend to visit my sister-in-law, and we stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel overnight, based on the recommendations I had read on this site. I was very pleased to find we agreed with the very positive comments. Our room was spacious, tidy, and well-equipped (e.g., kitchen has eat-in area with table/chairs for 4 and comes with dishes, glasses, dishwashing soap; plenty of towels; 2 plush bathrobes), and with the pull-out couch in the living room, we were able to let our son go to sleep early in the bedroom while my husband and I stayed up watching television and relaxing in the living room. The staff was warm, helpful, and accomodating. When we called to ask for recommendations on take-out/delivery in the area, they brought menus to our room. We later called to inquire about drink vending machines, and sodas were brought to our door. The following morning, we found the continental breakfast options to be ample, and of much better quality than you find at many chain hotels. The only glitch we encountered was a lapse in hot water, which we were told was a problem the hotel was having, and that was remedied within a few hours. I should also note that travelers keep in mind that this is a 2-star hotel--there won't be a *wow* factor upon entering the hotel, and there are certain signs of use (e.g., bleach stain on the sofa, chipped pain on the molding) that you wouldn't encounter at, say, a Ritz Carlton. But bearing that in mind, I felt the hotel was a very good value and the excellent customer service can't be beaten--we would certainly stay there again the next time we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in LA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ever since my family found this hotel, we never look back and find another place to stay while in LA. We have been staying at this hotel (mostly 1 week ++ per stay) every holiday season since 2001. It feels like home.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality, Hospitality, Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: newmansgang
Reviews.Content: I booked six rooms for myself and colleagues for a stay in Hollywood to attend a teacher's conference. I did this after consulting Tripadvisor, and I'd have to say that our experience was even better than the reviews. Darren, the Hotel Manager did his best to make us happy from booking through check-out. In fact, I left my luggage at the hotel and did not realize that it remained behind at the hotel. We were already at the airport, and it was too late to return to the hotel. After a call, Darren saved the day by delivering the bag to the airport himself-on his day off! The rooms were spacious, clean, and the bed was firm and like sleeping in my own. All of the desk personnel were friendly, concerned and consistently helpful(including shawn, ashley, gretchen, jason and stan). These people are so good at what they do that they should open a hospitality management school. The breakfast was very, very good -scones, croissants, wolfgang puck coffee, cereals and fresh fruit. We have traveled quite a bit (around the world), and I must say that this establishment is one of the best values out there. So, if you're planning a stay in Hollywood, strongly consider the Magic Castle!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: clr0524
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights during Thanksgiving week. The rooms are HUGE. (I think they were apartments previously ). Full kitchen, 2 TVS, DVD player. The bed was super comfotable - the best of any hotel I have ever stayed in. Plenty of storage space, lots or room for a family. Delicious continental breakfast (try the scones). The staff was very friendly and welcoming. This was our third stay in the Hollywood area - we would not stay anywhere else again. We found it to be very quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational service”
Reviews.Author: Hollybear
Reviews.Content: My family spent 3 nights in a Magic Castle self-contained suite in October 2005. From the moment we got there the staff were incredibly friendly, helpful, intelligent and funny, and this made our stay there an absolute delight. I chose this place for the price and because of the comments made on this website by other travellers who were so impressed with the service. The 2-bedroom suite more than met our needs (including 3 TV's, which set the kids in raptures!). The suites look out over the pool - most of the suites have balconies as well - and it was just a lovely cosy atmosphere. While we were loafing around the pool we were offered towels, free bottled water and even icy-poles! Breakfast is included in the price and consists of a good selection of cereals and juices, together with great coffee and fresh cakes and pastries. You can eat by the pool or take it back to your room while you read the complementary paper. As well as being terrific value for money, the location is excellent; one block from Hollywood Boulevard and one metro stop from Universal Studios. All the hotel staff were friendly and helpful, always. I have never stayed in a hotel where everybody was so good-humoured. On our last day we left our bags at reception before flying out later that day, and I was wondering what to do with a pair of Mickey Mouse ears that would probably get scrunched in transit. When we came back to collect our bags, Gretchen (front desk) had packed them in a separate box, with 2 polaroid photos of her and the office manager Mike modelling the ears. How cool is that!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindaabc
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay. Good location. Staff is very helpful and know all about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I stayed at the Magic Castle for our Hollywood getaway weekend after reading the reviews for it on the internet. We loved it and will not stay anywhere else if we ever get back to Hollywood. Mike Filson really knows how to pick his staff, as every person who worked there was friendly, helpful, and willing to do whatever it took to make our stay pleasurable. They took the time to counsel us on where to go, how to get there, and even helped us get the transportation we needed. The rooms were spacious, and although the bathrooms were a little older, we never found that to be a problem. For those who like to cook, there is a kitchen in every room. The hotel is within walking distance of Hollywood Boulevard and all the attractions there. We took taxis wherever we went, and rented a car for one day. I highly recommend this hotel, if for nothing else, the excellent service always with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel! 5 Star Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I was a bit weary when booking my room at the Magic Castle Hotel. I have read the reviews and made my decision based on them. I have checked out other hotels reviews, and decided that I liked the Magic Castle Hotel. I was glad I stayed there! From the first minute I checked in, I was treated like royalty. The manager was there to open the door for me, the lovely girl at the front desk offered me a complimentary bottled water at check in, and then they whisked me away to my room. On the way to the room, they told me about the hotel, informed me that the pool was open 24 hours. I have never heard of a hotel that has a 24 hour pool. I sure did enjoy those late night swims! The next morning I woke up and went to the lobby area to enjoy a wonderful continental breakfast. This is not your typical hotel breakfast. They served Wolfgang Puck coffee, fresh fruit, juices and cereal. You must try the scones and the criossants! Excellent! They even came to my table to refill my coffee! Later that day I approached the front desk on advice on what to do. They have tons of information on area attractions. Did I mention that they are one block from the world famous Chinese Theater and the new Kodak Theater? I was given information on local places to eat, museums and great tourist maps! So I went on a great walking tour of the city. It was nice! After a long day of walking and sightseeing, I came back to the hotel to find my bed turned down with a small chocolate kiss on my pillow. Of course, I went for my late night swim and called it a night! I often travel to LA for business and was happy to see that the hotel offers free high speed wireless. Its great to be able to work from my room or sit around the pool area. It was pretty warm when I visited, so I was offered popsicles! I thought this was playful and friendly! Every single staff member I came in contact with was ever so friendly. Always smiling and willing to help! They even remembered my name!! The room I got was spacious and lovely. Apparantly it wasn't one of the newly remodeled rooms, but I still loved it. New furnishings and a great bed! My room had a balcony that overlooked the pool. I suggest you make that request when you are making your reservations! I can go on and on about this wonderful hotel! I have read some of the negative comments from other guests, but I didn't see any of that happening. Yes the hotel is on a busy street, but the noise isn't that bad. I did hear the people next to me, but it wasn't a major deal to me. I can't wait to go back! I feel like family there! Keep up the good work! A big thanks to Ashley and Mike who gave me great directions and information on things to do. To all of you reading this post, book your room here! You won't be dissatisfied!!

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get a good room!”
Reviews.Author: scooby007
Reviews.Content: The mixed reviews on this hotel are confusing but completely understandable if you have actually stayed at the Magic Castle. I think part of this might depend on which room you stay in, having booked this hotel some time ago I was surprised to read today that some of the rooms have been refurbished and redecorated as ours wasn't. A new kitchen and bathroom probably would have increased my impressions considerably, unfortunately knowing this was one of our 'budget' choices we didn't think to request another room The breakfast is different and very good, unless you are like my husband who insists on meat at every meal! We had a one-bedroom suite and this was very large and well-equipped although I wouldn't have enjoyed cooking as the kitchen was just too old. It is also as everyone has said very noisy. I have to say this as well, although I have tried not to judge the hotel as its location is good for Universal and the Chinese Theater. However I would not recommend Hollywood for LA virgins its just not a nice area, and as this hotel seems to be recommended for families I can only presume that they would be driving everywhere during their stay. We were recommended to stay closer to the beaches and if we go to LA again this is what we will do.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice place to stay ....”
Reviews.Author: Cartman88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle for 3 nights in Oct 2005 – we only chose this hotel because of the continual positive reviews we had read and we were not disappointed. From the moment we checked in we were made to feel welcome – helped us with our bags before we got in the door - offered us each a complimentary bottle of water – gave us a good run through what the hotel and surrounding areas had to offer – basically offered to help with anything we needed. We did have some problems with accessing the internet in our room and they came straight in and sorted it out. The accommodation was very spacious with a separate bedroom and living room and kitchen. The location is one street back from Hollywood Boulevard and only a couple of miles from Universal Studios. Have to say a big thanks to Shawn and the rest of the staff for a really enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our Place in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaferDavis_CA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel last week and it was terrific. Just like having an apartment in L.A. We felt very comfortable there - just like we were home. Who wants to go on vacation and not feel relaxed? - that's what the Magic Castle is - home away from home. Big comfy one-bedroom - plenty of room for us and the two kids. The beds are like heaven and we enjoyed breakfast poolside. Also loved taking the Metro to Universal - Needed the car very little. Great staff -always a smile and more help than you asked for. Its definitely "our place in L.A."

Reviews.Title: “Good Service but Noisy location”
Reviews.Author: DavidLau
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for 3 nights in October 2005. The reason that we picked this hotel was to have a kitchen and be close to our destination - Universal Studios. As previously stated in all of the other reviews, the crown jewel of this hotel is the very good service given by the young staff. Also previously stated, the layout of the hotel is as the set of the Melrose Place TV show. All of the rooms surround a small courtyard with a small pool in the middle. No elevators, just stairways. The rooms themselves are reasonably sized for a suite-type hotel. They have been recently renovated, but not particularly well. In our room, the bathroom door didn't shut properly and the baseboards were already peeling. The kitchen was fully stocked with pots, pans, utensils, etc. Besides the TVs, there was also a small stereo system in the living room and a DVD player - nice. The sofa bed was not comfortable as the mattress wasn't well supported to the metal frame. A nice feature is that they use down comforters instead of regular blankets. Of special note, was the great water pressure in the shower. It was like standing underneath a giant waterfall! The continental breakfast is good, not great. As previously mentioned the baked goods were above average. Parking is $8/day for the small gated garage. The garage is a little tight, but we didn't have problems finding a spot every night. The main reason that I'm only giving an average rating was the level of night-time noise. The walls are pretty thin. Eventhough the location of our room was supposedly one of the more quiet sections, there was much traffic and weekend-partying noise until 2am. Of course, this isn't solely the hotel's fault, but rather the nature of their location - 1 block away from the night-life hub of Hollywood and Highland. On the plus side for the location: a) the hotel is a 4 minute walk from Grauman's Chinese theater b) we took the metro to Universal Studios, which was another 2 minute walk from the Chinese theater Here's an example of the good service: One of the female staff asked me if I slept well when I went to get breakfast and I complained about the noise. She purchased some ear plugs for us, and the plugs did help somewhat. In general, the staff is pretty attentive and helpful. For me, the good service and other perks didn't overcome the fact that it's an older building without good sound-proofing.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent time at this hotel, it was actually my second stay there and now the only place I will stay when vising in LA which I travel to apprx 4 times a year on business. The service is excellent, the staff are extremely helpful and lovely. The rooms are apartment suites and therefore very spacious and great value for money. The hotel has recently undergone refurbishment so everything is in good condition. Location is a real plus, particularly as I am a single female traveller, shops and restaurants are in walking distance and the area feels very safe. A big bonus for me is the WIFI in all the rooms which is complimentary, this works impeccably which is a necessity for me and my work. I have and would advise anyone travelling to LA who needs to be located in or near the West Hollywood area to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff shame about the accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Truth19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the end of October this year and only picked this hotel through the views of the people on this site. I have to agree that the staff were brilliant, howevere this did not mitigate the fact the first 1 bedroom suite we were allocated was appalling, suite 219, insect screen had fallen off, the kitchen work sufaces were cracked and it looked like the kichen had not been replaced since the 50's.
