The bathroom was not much better, again cracked tiles, the shower screen, I am guessing was meant to be clear glass, however this had turned to a disgusting limescales opaque colour. We complained and were moved to an alternative suite. This at first seemed very pleasent until closer inspection. The bath had not been sealed properly, which had led to the floor rotting away in the bathroom and the hallway. For no one to have said anything before we arrived was hard to believe, but when we pointed it out it was temporarly rectified. In conclusion, stay at this hotel if you don't have high expectations and would like great service.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the Magic Castle was a good value. The staff was exceptional - each person we dealt with took extra time to suggest good restaurants or things to do, and also helped us with transportation, reservations, etc. It made the difference for the hotel in general, which could use a little updating: ie) the carpets should be cleaned. The bed was very comfortable, and our room was spacious and clean. The kitchenette is a definite asset. We (on the 1st floor) didn't notice many problems with noise. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a five star hotel”
Reviews.Author: VisitorTraveller
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a three night stay at the Magic Castle. My feelings about this hotel are very mixed. On the one hand, the location was fantastic - it really IS one block behind Grauman's Chinese Theater, the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Hollywood Blvd, and very near the Hollywood Bowl. We paid over $1000 for three nights' stay. That included $8 a night parking and over $40 a night in taxes. I had told them on the phone that I was travelling with my mother who can't walk very well, and they said they'd do what they could but when we arrived we were put in the far outside building, up quite a lot of stairs. This required walking across a sloped and often slippery driveway as well as two flights of stairs. When we got to the room, it was huge, which was nice. Two separate bedrooms and an uncomfortable fold out couch in the living room (there were 3 of us), as well as a nice kitchen. But no balcony, no view of the pool, and the street we faced (Franklin) was NOISY - the traffic was horrendous, loud, constant honking and loud stereos until 3 in the morning every night. If you seal the windows and turn on the air conditioning it's tolerable but just barely. There was a musty smell to the room, and none of the remotes worked. Three tvs and not one remote worked. They did come up and fix that when we called down. The furnishings and carpet were serviceable but not as nice as the pictures on the website would lead you to believe. The breakfast was nice - Wolfgang Puck coffee and nice pastries, cereals and some little fruits. The staff is the best part of this hotel - friendly, helpful and very knowledgable. Shawn was the best, and Gretchen was nice too but they were very busy with what seemed to be more important guests than us, and we didn't feel particularly special. I would stay there again, but would demand better accomodations for the premium price we paid. If you want location, there's no better one for Hollywood. But if you want a quiet night's sleep there might be better places.

Reviews.Title: “If this is the third best hotel in LA, stay home!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there totally on TripAdvisor reviews. Big mistake. The staff IS very friendly and helpful, so if that is what you are interested in, go ahead and stay there. Our room (not a suite) was about the size of my bathroom at home. It was badly in need of paint and maintenance. (especially the bathroom) Our bed was like a rock. Would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff and Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: Swissmiss007
Reviews.Content: The staff and location make this hotel so extraordinary. The room we had (two bedroom suite) was clean, large and reasonably quiet. Yes you can hear the people upstairs and you can also hear pipes and ventilation. But I dont think you can find better in a city like LA. Gretchen (thanks for the lift!) Ashley and Jason looked after us SO well. You dont need to spend money buying an LA guide-book with such invaluable help and information at the front desk. Nothing seems to be too much trouble. With our high Swiss standards, we were more than happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: KCTraveler6
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! Excellent hotel with a great location one block off Hollywood Blvd next to Kodak Theater. Staff was very good. Heated pool made it enjoyable for a fall swim. One bedroom room was huge.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in October '05, and would definitely go back. Yes the bathroom in the suite we stayed in was a little in need of a refurb, yes you could hear the people above walking (or was it leaping?) across the floor, and the pipes are a little noisy, but the attitude of the staff and the location are unbeatable. I picked up a bug on the plane from Sydney to LA, and the staff not only organised me to get to a doctor but on my return there were flowers and a get well card in the room. Nothing is too much trouble for Jason, Gretchen, Sean and the rest of the crew. Having a kitchen is well worth it-there are a number of good supermarkets in the area, and dining in with a bottle of Californian wine-watching one of the many DVDs available free from reception-is a great way to finish a big day out. The staff can also recommend excellent pizza delivery. If you get the chance, go to the Magic Castle. We were a little sceptical, but had a great evening, and the food was much better than we were expecting. Overall a great introduction to LA.

Reviews.Title: “First-class Hotel like no other”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood was truly a pleasure. We stayed there while celebrating my wife's birthday. Even before we got there for the weekend, they had begun catering to us. On their website I had secured a great rate of $129 a night for a standard room. I called and went through options for our evenings out, including one at the infamous castle, and after advising me at length Ashley and Mike made all of the arrangements exactly as I had hoped. Upon arrival Darren, the manager, had upgraded us to a suite at no charge, and while we were out Gretchen even snuck a birthday cake into the room to surprise my wife. Darren also arranged for a complimentary appetizer at Yamashiro for us, a nice touch on our first night that made us feel very at-home. Every member of the staff was all smiles, polite and very competent. And everything they had arranged for us went like clockwork the entire weekend. The day we were leaving, we missed our wake-up call which Sean had arranged and Ashley actually knocked on our door to make sure we were up! I would, and will, go back in a second. Never before have we been treated with such great care and customer service, to the point we felt like royalty. And the suite was huge, breathtaking, and well-furnished and kept. I can't say enough about this place. They're the best.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with the Magic Castle Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a hotel for my family's vacation, I went on some other websites. I had a friend tell me about tripadvisor and I am glad he did. I was a little hesitant about booking this hotel, but after reading the comments, I felt better. I even called the hotel and spoke with a wonderful lady who assured me that my family would be taken great care of. So I booked a 4 night stay in a two bedroom suite. Upon arrival, they assisted us with the bags, took them straight to our room. The guy who checked us in was quick and even offered us complimentary water bottles. It was great because it was warm outside. After check in, the agent showed us to the room. The room was clean, large and the furnishings were great. Even a dvd player and cd player. The beds were great. Wanted to take the mattress home with me. Every morning my family and I would eat the fantastic complimentary continental breakfast poolside. The scones, muffins, croissants were all wonderful. They even have the employees serve you more breakfast. Such service! It's a great way to start your day. The second day we didn't know where to start the adventure. Everyone at the front desk was so knowledgable of the area. Any time we had a question, they were there. Never dealt with such friendly staff. Everytime we walked through the lobby or past an employee on the property, they always greeted us and smiled. My kids loved the pool and especially loved the free popsicles. On a hot day, it's a nice treat. My wife loved the lavendar chilled face cloths that was brought to her poolside. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Definately, a 5 star hotel in my eyes. You can't get better service. I want to say thanks to Mike, Ashley, Gretchen and Shawn. All who were wonderful. And also, the wonderful breakfast lady who kept my coffee cup hot and full, THANKS!! I will definately recommend this hotel to everyone I can. Keep up the good work Magic Castle Hotel. I can't wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, location & staff”
Reviews.Author: cadgwith
Reviews.Content: Thank you to Tripadvisor users for your recommendations re this hotel - you were right. We stayed 7th to 11th September 2005, and it was great. I'd asked for a quiet room, on the top floor, with a bedroom away from the pool, but a balcony overlooking it, and that's exactly what I got (we were in room 215 - a suite). We had very little problem with noise - once a TV from next door could be heard through a connecting door, and some kids were in the pool late one evening - but, as our bedroom faced the back, and the connecting door led onto a hallway, not our bedroom, we were fine. The breakfast was good, the laundrette very cheap and convenient (with soap powder free!) & the lift up to Yamashiro much appreciated. The suite was large, effectively (if slightly noisily) air-conditioned and clean (with some charming original fitted furniture mixed with the modern items), and the bed big and comfortable. The staff were exceptional - very friendly, helpful in giving advice and booking taxis, restaurants, etc, and quick to mend a faulty safe in our room. The house keeping staff even did our washing up on 2 days. Yamashiro's was terrific - stunning views, a great atmosphere, and not too expensive. The hotel's location is very good - 5 minutes walk to Grauman's, 10 minutes to Hollywood and Highland metro station (and next door to the hotel where Janis Joplin died, rock fans). We felt safe walking around the area during the evening. We hope to return to LA, and if we do, we'd love to stay at the Magic Castle again.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with Magic Castle Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Bride and I stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel in September of 2005. We were looking for sightseeing opportunities @ Venice Beach. Santa Monica Pier and Hollywood Blvd.- Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theatre...etc.. The hotel was 1 block off Hollywood Blvd. with great service from the staff and a tasty continental breakfast offerred each day. The Magic Castle Hotel is well kept , clean but has a small pool area ( which separate from its size met my need for cooling off after a day of hiking the streets of Hollywood and surrounding areas. The overall Room and Bed were clean and well kept but older, which lent some charm to the hotel. I liked the hotel and the service offerred from its staff and would easily recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here if you're a light sleeper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magic Castle based purely on the reviews on Trip Advisor.... and unfortunately it didnt match up to them. If you are the kind of person who values your sleep, dont stay here. However, if you like listening to the bathroom habits of complete strangers in the next room, or you like hearing every word of other guests conversations while youre lying in bed, or if you like being woken up every 5 minutes by slamming doors, TVs and children running around in the bedroom below, then this is definitely the place for you. Having read other reviews saying this hotel should be a 5 star hotel, I can only assume that none of those reviewers have ever stayed in a decent 5 star hotel. The carpets were filthy, the kitchen was ill-equipped and we had a colony of spiders living on the living-room ceiling. Our toilet backed up and overflowed and when i contacted reception to ask for help, no one came. When I called again, I got told that the member of staff Id spoken to had forgotten about it. There were one or two staff who were helpful but no more than I would expect from a hotel. My boyfriend was really unwell at the time and he needed peace, quiet and rest so I ended up spending a day searching for alternative accomodation in LA. When we told the staff that the noise in the bedroom of our suite was intolerable, they couldnt understand as that was supposed to be the quite part of the hotel!! We would never stay there again. If youre a noisy person with noisy kids, maybe your own noise would drown out that of everyone else. If youre a quiet couple looking for a romantic get-away with privacy - forget it.

Reviews.Title: “The Magic Castle Hotel is Magical!”
Reviews.Author: lawmitch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently went to L.A. for a wedding and to visit our daughter. With all the rave reviews of the Magic Castle Hotel, how could we not try it? We arrived there in the evening with high expectations, but we were quickly disappointed. The carpeting in our room had numerous holes like cigarette burns (it turned out that these were dark spots). The next morning we debated about complaining to the management. After some hesitancy, we decided that management should know that our experience was not consistent with the reviews that we had read. After all, we were going to be there for three more nights. We started wondering whether the reviews were written by real guests of the hotel. We addressed the carpet problem with the person at the front desk. She was very understanding and offered to place us in another comparable room. However, this room was near the street, and we did not want to risk the possible noise. So we decided to stay put and thought that was the end of it. As we were enjoying our breakfast at poolside, we were approached by the general manager. He apologized and offered us further assistance. He indicated that another room was opening up that morning. A little later that morning he gave us the key for this newly vacated room. Were we surprised! The room was enormous with a full kitchen, dining area, living room, etc. Besides this free upgrade, he advised us that the first night would be deducted from our bill. With large smiles upon our faces, we promptly moved over our luggage to our new luxury suite. We then went back to the pool for swimming and sunbathing. Upon our return to the suite, we found a beautiful bouquet of flowers from a florest with a note apologizing for the inconvenience from the general manager. This was astonishing! Where do you get such service from a hotel? The remainder of our stay there could not have been better. The location is 2 blocks from Grauman's Theater and other tourist sites, as well as the subway that we took to Olvera St. The pool was refreshing with staff members bringing out popsicles and cool towels. The staff members were incredible - from helping with directions to caring for our every needs. The general manager was awesome and went over the top in making sure that we were satisfied. Would we stay there again? In a heartbeat. For us, the Magical Hotel was magical!

Reviews.Title: “I hope this place never changes”
Reviews.Author: crouchhill
Reviews.Content: Three guys. All from London. Stayed at Magic Castle off the reviews from this site. My god were they right. Jason, Gretchen, Amy and the others were SO SO helpful and friendly that it is quite unbelievable. The hotel was magical and I will go as far to say it was my best ever hotel experience. The only worry I have of putting in a good review is that they will think 'hmm, maybe we shouldn't be a 2 star hotel' and jack up the prices for the future... If I go back to LA, this is where I will stay cos the location on Franklin is perfect and the rooms are delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Magic Castle was nice”
Reviews.Author: shazqazi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel from September 7th to the 9th and liked it. I would not give my stay five stars because our room had ant problems and it also had an odor which was strange. The staff took care of the ant problem immediately but the odor was there to stay. Bathrooms need a little updating. Overall my stay was comfortable and the staff were very well-informed about what to do in the surrounding neighborhoods. The staff also had an anniversary cake for my parents which was very thoughtful. Also, it looks as if this hotel was an apartment and was converted into a hotel. May be that is why I thought that the ambience was o.k. But I would definitely recommend it to people who are looking for excellent staff and a central location in hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Magic Castle staff are the absolute best! They are very warm, friendly and patient. I just spent my 30th birthday there and it was such a wonderful experience. I rented a one-bedroom/kitchen suite that was just darling, and so unexpected when you arrive from the outside! It was clean, spacious and decorated with modern furniture. When I first walked in, a birthday cake and card, signed by each staff member, greeted me. We swam in the heated pool and the staff served us popsicles! It was so awesome and all my guests had a great time! It was the best hotel experience that I have had... Thanks Magic Castle Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: miloumilou
Reviews.Content: What everyone has said is true! We stayed for a week. We've traveled all over the world and it really doesn't get much better than this. The Magic Castle is simply the best!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ferriby
Reviews.Content: After a lovely welcome from the staff , we unpacked our swimming gear and went into the warm pool.It was nightime and the lights made it seem magical. We put on our plush robes (provided) and settled down for the evening. The following morning the staff helped us book and print our tickets for our front of line passes for Universal Studios which was a saving on the gate price. Breakfast included fruit , cereal, and buns delivered by the local bakery which were delicious. This can be eaten in your room, or at the tables around the pool. Whilst sunbathing the following morning, ice pops and cold lavender face cloths were brought to us, this was a very nice touch. The rooms are very comfortable; we had two queen beds, dining table , kitchen, and dvd player .( dvd's can be chosen from a list at reception)..chocolates are provided at bedtime. The staff are the most helpful we have come across and we cannot praise the hotel enough. I thank all other trip advisors for helping us choose this hotel. As it was our first trip to the USA we valued your comments.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: kkrs
Reviews.Content: I hope this adds some unique perspective to the prior reviews, but it's hard not to heap the same praises on this charming hotel. We selected the Magic Castle after reading the great reviews here and stayed for 5 nights. The location is terrific if you're planning on visiting in the "greater LA" area. We visited attractions such as the Getty Museum, Burbank (Warner Brothers), downtown LA, West Hollywood and Beverly HIlls and found this an excellent location . The staff was terrific - they bent over backward to be helpful and providing outstanding suggestions and help. We went to a concert at the Hollywood Bowl and Gretchen suggested a local market to purchase some gourmet picnic items which made our evening perfect! Maps, directions, suggestions were all very useful (I even called from the car at one point in downtown LA and was given directions and a great suggestion for lunch on Olvera Street (again, thanks, Gretchen!). We had a 1 bedroom suite and found it very comfortable (although the walls are rather thin).. The continental breakfast was great to have as it allowed us an easy pace in the morning to sit on our balcony, enjoy a light breakfast, read the complimentary paper and plan the day. I would not hesitate to recommend the Magic Castle. Location, staff, pleasant accomodations, spacious, nice extras, gated parking, etc., etc. My only suggestion might be to add a little bit of variety to the breakfast items (since you probably can't do much about the sound). Thank you management and staff of Magiic Castle - you exceeding our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars in Our Book!!!”
Reviews.Author: JAL25
Reviews.Content: We have been traveling for over twenty years. Never have we encountered a staff like the crew employed by the Magic Castle Hotel. These young people go the extra mile to make your stay in Hollywood memorable. We returned from a month-long vacation of the West Coast having stayed in 22 hotels and the Magic Castle was without a doubt the best experience. I was leery booking a hotel for a week which AAA rated only two diamonds but after reading the reviews by the "folks" on Trip Advisor, I decided to ignore the pros. Wise choice. The hotel is in an excellent location for tourist yet quiet. We did not want to rent a car as my husband had already driven 1,200 miles on the first leg of the trip. This hotel is close to all forms of public transportation and sightseeing venues. We arrived three hours before check-in time in hopes of storing our luggage. To our shock, the staff said our room was ready and we had been given a complimentary upgrade to a suite!!! The suite was immaculate. The staff recommended which tours were worthwhile, what to see on our own and how to get there and advised us what we should NOT do via public transportation. I had wanted to take the transit system to Long Beach to tour the Queen Mary. They were adamant it would not be safe to do so. Only my mother has ever been this concerned for my well-being. The staff even went so far as to call taxi services on my behalf (without my asking) to check rates to Long Beach. They advised public transportation to The Reagan Library in one day was not do-able either....too many stops thus not enough time to tour the Library. The staff booked tours for us, which when we tried to book ourselves, were told there were no openings....hence the name Magic! The heated outdoor pool in the courtyard is open 24/7. They just ask you keep the noise level reasonable after 9pm. The on-site laundry facility is suppose to close at 9pm but when I was doing laundry after that hour, they said "no problem". When I inquired as to why AAA only rated the hotel two diamonds, they explained that several factors are considered by AAA in their assessment which they don't tell the reader. 1. There is no bathroom in the lobby. This is silly as all 39 guestrooms are a short walk from the lobby. 2. There is no elevator. Another stupidity as there are only two floors. 3. No restaurant on site. Another no-brainer......there are two very classy restaurants right next door. The AAA rating of two diamonds is a terrible injustice to this wonderful hotel and their employees. To Ashley, Gretchen, Jason, Nick, Shawn and everyone else we came in contact with during the week......thank you.....you are all five stars in our book!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of four recently stayed at this glorious place in West Hollywood. Although the builing is a little older and it does show in places, it is definitely worth the stay. The facilities are clean, safe and exceptionally located. The staff is fabulous, very polite, helpful! The bedding is exquisite, feather duvets, luxurious robes, great towels, etc. Chocolate on the bed tables every night and locked parking. I was lovely eating the continental breakfast on our private balcony overlooking the pool every morning...the pastries were gourmet and plentiful, in addition to fresh fruit, cereal, juices, milks (all kinds) and coffee. Free wireless internet access everywhere on the property, two televisions in the suite (one for kids and one for us), free CD library at the front desk, great soaps and shampoos....and I could go on and on. This hotel is fabulous and is worth a try...you will not be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Fell in Love with the Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This little gem of a hotel hidden in Hollywood right behind Kodack Theater/ Hollywood and Highland , seems to have been discovered by foreign tourists or maybe a US tourists as well. Wanted to write one review from a business person perspective. This hotel did not only meet my needs but FAR exceeded them in each possible way. Hotel is quiet, has high speed internet, "studio rooms" are more like large apartments , decorated beautifully, chocolate bars in room at night, balconies, popsicle's by pool in the afternoons, and a staff that absolutely blows away any of my business hotels (Marriott, Hyatt, Hilton, etc) service. I was so overjoyed by my visit: can honestly say for first time in my life on a business trip, I contemplated staying longer. I'm so much looking foward to next trip that I have actually moved it up one month! Congartualtions to an incredible hotel and staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a hoot!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled to stay @ 3 hotels on this trip since we like to try new hotels but after we arrived @ the Magic Castle, we cancelled our reservations @ a Sheraton and Hyatt and stayed for 6 days in our "home away from home"! They upgraded us from a standard room to a suite, bought pizza for all the guests one night when the power went out in that area of town and treated us like old friends, calling us by name. Every single employee @ this hotel was friendly and accomodating--it was kind of like we had an apartment there and knew our neighbors. We'll be back for more!

Reviews.Title: “A great value Hollywood experience”
Reviews.Author: Katoomba_Traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel for 7 days as the last stop on a two month "round the world" trip. Our itinerary included a number of hotels in the $US150-$200 range across the globe and we would have to say that the Magic Castle was by far our best hotel experience. The friendliness of the staff is exceptional and extends way beyond the shallow "have a nice day" that often passes for good service in the US. The staff and management appeared genuinely eager to assist in any way to make our stay as enjoyable as possible - (well done guys!). The hotel itself is ideally located in the heart of the resurgent Hollywood district and for a tourist has that quintessential "Hollywood feel". This was aided by the hotel's apparent appeal to out-of-town creative types who stay there for a day or two to pitch their film scripts - so wireless laptops and movie talk by the pool. The hotel is actually split in two, with the main building down the bottom of the hill and another one up the top. We initially booked a room up the hill and although the LA views are good, these rooms had not been renovated (Jan 2005) and were rundown. Guests are also required to walk up and down the hill for breakfast and any other concierge needs. After a couple of days, we decided to move into the main building and were put in a much nicer, larger and newly renovated room that was surprisingly at a lower price. The Magic Castle is not an international luxury business hotel (and hence lacks some of the trimmings), but is excellent value for those seeking an LA experience at a reasonable price. (Note we have also stayed at the similarly priced LAX Airport Sheraton, which is a good hotel too, but has no atmosphere) Some tips: To avoid disappointment, we suggest that you ask for an upstairs renovated room in the main building that faces the pool and is not on the main road. Guests at the Magic Castle Hotel are given the privilege of being able to visit the Magic Castle club next door to watch some of the top magicians in the world perform in a range of atmospheric theatres in a big Victorian house. Even if you stay for one night at the hotel, definitely take up this offer (and book ahead) as it is a genuinely unique LA experience that is not open to the general public. Visit the Japanese restaurant at the top of the hill (behind the hotel) for either dinner or a late night drink as it has some of the best views in LA. We were lucky enough to be there after heavy rain and the views were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: Vicky22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The staff are the best hotel staff I have ever come across, they anticipate your every need and are extremely friendly and helpful. We were booked to stay for two nights but stayed three as we enjoyed it so much. We were lucky enough to get upgraded to a suite on arrival, it was huge. Having the kitchen gave us the option not to have to go out and we were able to order a takeaway after our host provided us with a handful of menus once she heard us say we were hungry when we checked in. Breakfast in the morning gave a good selection of cereals, toast and delicious pastries. The hotel has an intimate relaxed atmosphere. The pool isn't big but it is big enough and the pool area catches the sun in the mornings. The hotel also provides a shuttle to Yamashiro which has the most delicious menu. I would recommend Magic Castle, great value and brilliant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle is the best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so cool! I loved the vibe of the place, and if you're touring Hollywood this is the place to stay. You can walk to Hollywood Blvd, but the hotel is quiet and relaxing. I loved the retro feel, especially how rooms open onto the pool courtyard. You feel like Marilyn Monroe could be sunbathing there. Plus, there's a guy who comes around with complimentary popsicles :-) The rooms themselves are great. We stayed in the 2BR/2BA suite (myself and husband, and his parents) and had plenty of space. The full kitchen was a great way to not have to eat out every night, and it was great to eat breakfast in before heading out for the day. The beds were comfortable and there was a ton of closet space. One note: While the suite had window AC units, the bedroom my husband and I stayed in had a sub-par non-window AC. It didn't matter so much because the weather was perfect, but I wouldn't have been so happy in mid-July. However, the rest of the place was so nice it didn't really hurt our stay. The staff was extremely nice and very accommodating to our large number of suitcases and 4am departure time. We were in town for a family wedding at Yamshiro and it was so convenient to take Magic Castle's shuttle up to the restaurant. I will definitely be staying here next time I come to LA!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magic castle recently. I was somewhat sceptical with a name like this but because I was travelling with My wife, daughter and our 2 mums I really needed good value clean accomodations. Well we were pleseantly surprised when we arrived. Magnificent room with 2 double beds, large living area and great kitchen with all facilities. We immediately headed off for a walk and found that we were within 400 metres of Manns chinese theatre and Hollywood Boulevavrd. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. You get a basic breakfast which you cna eat on the patio or in your room. The only worry was that if you dont have a ground floor room you have a lot of stairs to climb, I had 6 Suitcases to deal with and was exhausted bringing them in (there is no lift). Overall highly recommended and fantastic for a family, location perfect and you can walk to a lot of major attractions from here. Go and Enjoy LA...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The setting (two room suites) and location (in Hollywood) made this a perfect stop for families visiting tourist attractions in Los Angeles. The care the staff (Nick, Ashley, Shon, Marxia, Jason and Amy) all took with my family was simply wonderful as every question and accomodation was addressed when they could do so, efficiently and with a smile. It was a real pleasure to stay here as one of the most relaxing stops on our trip. Thank you for helping us discover this fantastic family hotel. Fr. Bruce

Reviews.Title: “great location & very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Barto
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in mid-June & found the place lived up to our expectations based on prior reviews. The unit was very comfortable with two separate bedrooms with king-sized, very comfortable beds. One negative aspect of our particular unit/apt concerned the air conditioning units which were weak in both bedrooms (one was an indoor free standing unit which didn't do much). It wasn't unbearably warm, so we didn't mention it. On the other hand the main unit in the kitchen area worked great. Breakfast by the pool in the morning was nice, although a few more tables would have been useful. This hotel is in a great location , being only a short walk to Hollywood & Highland where there is great shopping & dining as well as the chinese theatre. I must agree with other reviewers concerning the staff. They were indeed very helpful & provided excellent service. They also provided excellent driving directions to our various locations & even provided us with a business card & hotel phone number should we need further assistance while on the road. Secure indoor parking was also a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “Magic”
Reviews.Author: MDUK
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on trip advisor while we were looking for reviews of the Holiday Inn, the original hotel we were going to stay at. We decided to try 'The Magic' because of the reviews, its link with the adjoing magic club and were attracted by its general quirkiness. It is ideally situated for Hollywood boulevard, being less than 5 minutes walk away. We had a car (which we kept in the secure underground car park overnight for $8 a night) and drove to Disneyland which took around an hour and Universal studios which took about 10 minutes. The accomodation was ideal for a family, a double room and a bed setee in the lounge, basic kitchen facilities and seperate bathroom. The FREE buffet breakfast was well received by the children (cereal and croissants being much closer to their normal fayre than the heavy cooked buffets offerred elsewhere). Echoing previous reviews though, the hotel does need to invest in some more tables and chairs in that area. The staff are the one single differentiator from any of the other hotels we visited during our 2 weeks in the states. Without exception, they all try and make a difference to your stay. Really first class hospitality. Special mention to Gretchen and Jason. Would I stay again- definitely.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: jacsbri
Reviews.Content: From the moment I called the Magic Castle Hotel to make our reservations I encounter a friendly and caring of staff. I told the person at the other end of the line, my husband and I were celebrating our 40th Wedding Anniversary! That's FOUR DECADES, yikes! The young woman chuckled at my comment. I explained my husband is legally blind, and I am anticipating knee surgery within the near future. She said, "No, problem. We have the perfect room for you." She was right! I asked her to please tell about the hotel ... describe it. She said the courtyard looks like a scene from the television program a few years ago called 'Melrose Place.' And that's exactly what we found ... we felt like we had walked into a movie set. The desk assistant that checked us in greeted us with a huge smile, helped me with our bags, explained some of the surround sites, and told us about the continental breakfast offered each morning. Our room was lovely. You could tell it was an older hotel that had been refurbished. But with great attention to detail! It was so clean. The bed was comfortable with a wonderful soft duvet. There was a refrigerator, a coffee maker, blow dryer, huge remote control television, makeup mirror, delicious smelling tangerine smelling soap, shampoo and cream rinse and abundance of wonderful fluffy towels. The staff surprised us with a small Anniversary cake and a card signed by each member of the staff. It was like having family help us celebrate! Additionally, the individual who made our hotel reservations, went one step further, and offered to make our dinner reservations at the Magic Castle Club for us as well. At the Club we received VIP treatment. If you are in the Hollywood area ... stay at the Magic Castle Hotel. We highly recommend it! Your stay will be magical!

Reviews.Title: “The Magic Castle is truly the "yes" hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephanieOakton_VA
Reviews.Content: Where do you stay when your group consists of 38 high school drama students and chaperones coming to Hollywood for the first time from Virginia?? You want them to be welcomed, safe, comfortable and in a great location. The answer was a real winner....The Magic Castle Hotel! We all had suite rooms so the students felt more like they were in apartments rather than hotel rooms. The beds were all queen and king size so everyone was comfortable. The bedding is new, fresh and so comfortable you could melt into it. Each room had a kitchen, so the students could make snacks for themselves. Each morning a continental breakfast is provided, but not like at most places. The Magic Castle has fresh baked goods from a bakery and gourmet coffee. The juices and milk were quickly refilled, and the cereals and fruit bountiful. The morning we left at 5:00a.m. the hotel had an individual breakfast bag for each student as they boarded the bus!! How thoughtful can you be!?!?!? The location on this property is amazing. It is one block from the Kodak theater area. So it is in walking distance of many area attractions, shopping, restaurants, and the Metro. There was also a guard on the property to ensure safety, although we never felt unsafe. Because this hotel is associated with the Magic Castle itself any guest has the ability to go to this exclusive magic mecca. The Sunday brunch admits children and has shows that are age appropriate....and the buffet was out of this world. yum! The best part about the Magic Castle Hotel is the staff itself. They call themselves the "yes" hotel, and they live up to it. When we arrived they served popsicles! When the students needed anything they felt comfortable going to the front desk and asking for everything from paper/pen to milk for scrambling eggs. A lot of the front desk workers are young working actors and are happy to share their stories. Every single employee was a delight and so willing to be of service. Unselfish service is hard to find today, but the Magic Castle Hotel offers it bountifully. This hotel is a rare find, perfect for our group, and I hope others will enjoy it tool

Reviews.Title: “Unique Property - Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dv8r
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised by the Magic Castle on a recent trip. It's a pleasant oasis just a few steps from the silliness & sleaze of Hollywood Boulevard ( Graumans, Fredericks, Pantages etc). The staff was friendly, and possibly because we booked online via Orbitz, they gave us a free upgrade to a large well equipped poolside suite. Room came with newly upgraded modern furniture, CD & DVD players & a kitchen. Be sure to take a hike up the hill to the fabulous old Japanese restaurant Yamashiro, which features a japanese garden & spectacular views of the entire LA Basin. The 600-year-old pagoda, that sits up there was imported from Japan in 1914, and actually is the oldest building in California!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff is so friendly and accommodating, lots of special perks and treatment, reasonable rates, and great location. Staying here was a huge part of what made a trip to Hollywood/L.A. extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasic Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in at the Magic Castle we were treated like very special family members. Ashley offered to help us with our luggage and showed us to our room, all the while answering our many questions we had about the area. The room was clean and inviting. The mattress was not one of the typical cheapo's..this one we wanted to bring home with us! The general manager, Darren Ross, suggested restaurant choices for us. We chose the Yamashiro restaurant which is a part of the Hotel. We were driven to the restaurant by the complimentary shuttle van. Upon our arrival we were given a table for two that overlooked the city of Los Angeles...arranged by Darren. We felt VERY spoiled!! The food was prepared perfectly..We had the Filet Mignon which we could cut with our forks! Darren dropped by during dinner to see if everthing was satisfactory and we said yes, but the next time we stayed at the Hotel we would request a room with a balcony. Within seconds Darren was on his phone to the front desk and secured a balcony suite for our next two nights with them. We know where we will stay the next time we are in the Hollywood area. Service like this is rare these days!! The staff, Nick, Jason, Gretchen and everyone gets our "Two thumbs up" recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Big room - Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: eadeser
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 2 nights on 16 day touring holiday in california. Hotel was well located 5 mins walk from holiday bouv. (which was very dissapointing, tacky and full of hawkers) Room were clean and huge. Staff though were not very freindly, we asked about changing travelers check and mentioned we should try and find a bank, but could'nt tell us where the nearest one was. Also not a hotel for people with a problem with stairs, we had to go up and down six filghts to get to our room which was only on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Even lovelier than I had imagined!”
Reviews.Author: LisaBrooklyn_NY
Reviews.Content: I had chosen to stay at The Magic Castle based on the many positive reviews I'd read on this site. I enjoyed a wonderful room, a super comfortable bed, and a delicious breakfast. The setting was cheerful and pretty. The staff kind and helpful. I would definately stay there again and highly recommend in to all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location & Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel on business a few days ago and couldn’t believe the level of service at this little hotel. They surprised me with a free popsicle while I was sitting out by the pool!!! I mean come on!!! Every hour or so someone from the front desk would come out and offer free popsicles. I’ve never seen anything like this….but it was great. All the guests were talking about it and were extremely happy. I had wireless internet in my room and out by the pool and they don’t charge for it which is a refreshing change. I had a new one-bedroom suite, apparently they are just about done renovating their rooms. The suite was HUGE! I had my own full kitchen, huge living room and nice size bedroom. I had a DVD Player in the room and they don’t charge to borrow from their DVD library. Everywhere I turned, there was a staff member greeting me by name. Even the turndown attendant knew my name! Oh yeah…each night they came to turn down my bed and refresh my towels. The robes in the room are a very nice touch!!! There were a lot off people wearing them during breakfast (which is very good by the way). My company is going to start booking more with the Magic Castle Hotel. It’s the best around. Thank you to the entire staff! The only negative is that the continental breakfast closes at 9am on weekdays. BUT….when I told the front desk agent that I was surprised by this….he, without any hesitation, went to the kitchen and brought out hot coffee, a variety of delicious pastries, a selection of cereal, and juice. This level of service is rare and I truly appreciated it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but somewhat disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the Magic Castle Hotel on the basis of the reviews on this website and the fantastic photographs on the hotel's website. Only when we arrived did we realise that the photos on the website are mainly from the magic club, which is completely separate from the hotel annexe and quite different in style. The hotel part is small and set around a courtyard, there are lots of steps to navigate if you have heavy luggage or are unsteady on your feet and no elevator (check out the photos posted by another reviewer). The rooms are pretty basic and our bathroom was quite roughly finished, but it was clean and comfortable and had everything you need, including a refrigerator. The table top ironing board was a pain as it collapsed every time any kind of pressure was applied - a regular ironing board would have been much better. Other than that, the facilities in the room were fine and the shower was EXTREMELY powerful! It was quite noisy at night with other guests arriving back late and also there was some traffic noise as our room was right by a side street. Breakfast was OK. The big pluses for this hotel are its location, the reasonable cost and the extremely helpful and pleasant staff, especially Mike - give that man a raise! My overall impression was that this hotel was fine for the money but I am still confused by the fabulous reviews on this website - I've stayed in worse but I've stayed in better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice . . . . becoming GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: MardiGrasGourmet
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights in Hollywood March 19 - 22. This smallish hotel offers a fantastic location for seeing the sights on Hollywood Blvd. The Mann is one block down. Our room was a bit worn, RM 204. Older furnishings, some missing tile in the bath and the kids were not happy with the lumpy springs in the pullout. There is currently remodeling taking place, and the remodeled rooms are much nicer. A delightful staff more than made up what we lacked in our room. I have traveled to many places and have NEVER encountered people like the staff at this hotel. The Ritz cannot compare, and that is no BS. They made suggestions for tours, made reservations, attended to our requests, and even went out of their way on more than one occasion for us. Do yourself a favor and book a remodeled room and enjoy your time in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I flew my fiance to the Magic Castle as a surprise for his birthday. The Magic Castle Hotel was the obvious place to stay as they can give you a pass to the Magic Castle and I didnt know how to get in otherwise. I was most pleased with the service. Not only did they have a small gift and card waiting for my fiance, they notified the Magic Castle it was his birthday and got us a magnificent table at Yamashiro the following night. My only complaint was that when they cleaned the room they didnt take away our breakfast tray. Other than that, it was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “I Wish I Had More Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this property courtesy of Trip Advisor and I feel it is my duty to report that the majority of the write-ups are true. This place is great! It was very easy to find and close to the Chinese Theatre etc.... The complementary breakfast was more than delicious and fed my family of 4 with no problem. The baked goods were awesome as was the coffee! Make sure you get to breakfast right when they start serving so you can get the best scones! Parking for this hotel is in an enclosed garage underneath the structure. It is gated and secure. We stayed in one of the rooms that has yet to be renovated and it was more than comfortable. My wife got a peek at one of their newly renovated rooms however, and has informed me that the next time we are in Hollywood we WILL be statying in one of those instead. (Helpful tip: Parking charge at this hotel is $8 per day) This hotel would mak a great homebase if you are planning on exploring the Hollywood, Beverly Hills areas of Los Angeles. We would most definitely staty there again.

Reviews.Title: “Magically wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: ca_yee
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magic Castle hotel for one night this past weekend. We were going to the Magic Castle Club to see the show that night so we thought we'd make it more convenient on ourselves. The only complaint we had was the room wasn't ready when the front desk told us it was going to be. We got there around 2 p.m. and was told it would take another 45 minutes to get to our room. So, we decided to do the Walk of Fame and all that stuff around the corner. Went and ate lunch and got back around 3:30 and find out our room was not ready yet. We sat in the lobby and about 15 minutes later, the front desk told us that our room just didn't have a duvet cover on the bed. Frankly, we don't even use a the duvet so we told her we didn't care and please let us in our room. After following the wrong set of stairs with two rollable filled luggages, we finally get to our room. Boy what a nice room it was! The living room had very nice and comfortable couch and chair. They had marble counter tops in the kitchen and in the bathtub! Even had a bathtub/jacuzzi that I had to use as soon as I saw it. Talk about being in heaven!! The bed was a very comfortable king size one with a down comforter and pillows to match. Used the great cotton robe that was there for our use. Unfortunatley, we had to leave at 5 a.m. the next morning so we couldn't indulge in the continental breakfast that was being offered. We got a great deal for that room considering it's location. I would stay there again for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great room, great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In general, I was very happy with my experience at the hotel. We stayed there for 5 nights, and we had no problems. This hotel is definitely one of the better places I've stayed. This was my first trip to Los Angeles. The people at the front desk were very friendly and helpful, giving us accurate directions to wherever we wanted to go. This building was an old apartment building, and it doesn't have any elevators. There are plenty of stairs to climb, so if you're physically disabled or have problems walking, this may not be the place for you. The rooms, however, are fantastic! If you get a suite (which I thought were reasonably priced), you will get a bedroom, a bathroom, a living room (with couch and coffee table, not to mention the DVD player and television), and a kitchen. The beds were very comfortable, and there are air conditioning units in the rooms. The Magic Castle Hotel has a private garage, which you will receive a key for when you receive your room key. I found this very comforting, as it is a small garage, and no one else has access to it besides the hotel guests. There is a nice pool at the center of the hotel, and also a continental breakfast every morning, which includes pastries, toast, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee, milk, and juices. It's not a large breakfast, but it's sufficient to get you through the day. Uphill from the hotel is the Magic Castle Club (you must be 21 to enter). It is located in a Victoria-era house, complete with some secret passageways and a piano-playing ghost. The club is exclusive, and you can only be allowed in by a member of the club or by making reservations at the front desk. I had a very good time going and watching the magic shows there. (There is a $15 cover charge, and you must order food... but the food is good, and the shows are worth it). As for location, the hotel is 2 blocks from Hollywood Blvd... we walked to the Walk of Fame and Grauman's Chinese theater. It is located near an entrance to Hwy 101, Sunset Blvd, and La Brea avenue, which will get you pretty much anywhere you want to go in and around Los Angeles. I hope that this review has been helpful to you... I would DEFINITELY RECOMMEND this hotel. :-)

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in LA?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can this really be one of the best hotels in Los Angeles? My friend and I spent one week in March 2005 at the Magic Castle Hotel .. and a seven-night stay gives one a great chance to really evaluate a property and its services. Here's our evalution: The Upside: Moderate rate; very convenient location; oversized one-bedroom suites with full kitchen;; firm mattress on platform bed; absorbent towels; great bath products; breakfast muffins & croissants; warm-water, year-round pool; inexpensive washer and dryer on premises; and pleasant staff. The Downside: Noise on Friday nights; paper-thin walls; uneven maid service; dirty rug (rubbed off on our white socks); overcrowded hotel garage on weekend nights; high-carb and high-sugar cereals; old air conditioning units; and three broken items in suite. Highly recommended on weeknights!

Reviews.Title: “#4 Hotel in Los Angeles????”
Reviews.Author: johnicho19
Reviews.Content: Upon reading the glowing reviews for the Magic Castle Hotel I decided to book 2 nights. Upon check in the clerk informed me that we had been upgraded to a suite and that it was one of the "newly refurnished rooms". Well if room 204 is a newly refurnished room I would have hated to see what the others looked like. The carpeting was stained, there were holes and cracks all over the bathroom wall and there was a large black mark in the tub. Granted the location is good, however if I knew that the rooms looked like this I would have gone to the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic hotel, went there for Christmas and new year a couple of years ago. Staff are so friendly and polite. Hotel was spotless and rooms were amazing , like our own apartment. Would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All of the reviews we read before we left were true. This hotel had a great location; down the street from Chinese Theatre, Kodak Theatre and subway link to universal studios. It was also a short drive to beverly hills, sunset blvd, century city and Farmers Market. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating and rooms were clean. If staying in LA again we would definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle O.K.”
Reviews.Author: LAtoLVTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Magic Castle. The staff was incredible!! They were so helpful and pleasant. The continental breakfast was awesome. We had a small room which was nice and had Tangerine Bath Bloomers lotions and shampoos. There had very noisy guests in the next room. The soundproofing was not so good however the staff compensated for our restless night. The hotel is in the best spot for walking to the Graumann's Chinese Theater and Kodak theater, walk of fame, etc. The metro is very close and you can go to Universal Studios with one stop. The Yamashiro Restaurant is so great and someone will drive you up from the hotel and pick you up when you're done. Look for celebrities at the restaurant and check out the awesome view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and magic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice and helpful staff. A charming and magic hotel. The very best recommendation from a satisfied norwegian family of four.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: gtgsf
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on three things: location, access to the Magic Castle Club and TripAdvisor reviews. Keep in mind this is not a luxury hotel. Never mind the Wolfgang Puck coffee and Bath Bloomers toiletries. As its rating suggests, this is not a luxury hotel. However, the staff is very friendly and attentive and you can't beat the great location. As noted in previous user reviews, it is walking distance to many Hollywood attractions and the Metro. Unfortunately, the rain prevented us from seeing/using the hotel to its best advantage. Given the weather, we chose not to swim or use our balcony although other guests did. We were given a one-bedroom suite in the back on the third floor which appears not to have been redone. While the decor was tired, we appreciated the space, spending more time inside than we had anticipated due to the rain. Ask for another room if you cannot climb stairs. Everyone raves about the continental breakfast, which I would rate as average. Again because of the rain, we were unable to eat outside next the the pool (which ended up almost overflowing and had to be drained at the end of the weekend) and had to carefully make our way back to the room balancing our trays while climbing two flights of stairs. Staying at the hotel would have been easier in sunny, dry weather! The bottom line is that if you are looking for a hotel room under $200 with lots of space in a great location this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average hotel room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice, the first time with a group of girls for our friend's bachelorette party. The location was great, the staff was fine (though, admittedly, we were not that demanding of them), and the suite was huge. Also, we like the '50s/'60s-era feel and the fact that we weren't in another cookie-cutter chain. The location is also wonderful. I look forward to my next trip back to the Magic Castle.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service!!”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodMike
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Magic Castle Hotel! The minute I walked in the lobby, I felt at home. Checking in was easy and painless! The front desk agents were all friendly, walked us to our room and they explained everything about the hotel. Within walking distance to all the major Hollywood atractions, this hotel is ideal. Our room was spacious. We got a 2 bedroom suite with a ktichen. This was great! The breakfast is great! Juice, great scones, cereals and fruit! We ate out by the pool and even met another family that was staying there. This is not your typical hotel. If you are looking to be treated well, you must check this place out. We came back from a long day and was suprised to see our beds were turned down with chocolate on our pillows! Overall, great stay! I wanted to say a special thanks to Gretchen and Mike, who planned out our entire stay! Thanks again! If ever in LA, we will make sure we will stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Magic Castle is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I did lots of research before booking accomodation in LA, and based on what I had read on the reviews here, decided to base myself at the Magic Castle Hotel. The hotel did not disappoint. The location, for starters is hard to beat. About 5 minutes walking distance from Hollywood Blvd and all the major attractions like Kodak Theatre, Hollywood and Highland, Manns Chinese Theatre - making it was very convenient to drop in and out of the hotel during the day. The hotel itself - the size of the suite is just amazing, it was much more like living in an apartment then in a hotel room. There was a kitchen (complete with oven, microwave, full sized fridge, cutlery), dining table, pull out sofa, bath room, bedroom and the overall living room space was very spacious. The breakfast every morning was great, an assortments of cereals, pasteries, drinks and fruits that you can eat out by the patio area near the pool or take back to your room. The staff were also top-notch. Friendly, and always willing to answer questions at any time or provide assistance, they know how to deliver the best customer service! Lastly, if you don't have a laptop to make use of the wireless internet connection at the hotel, there is also an Internet kiosk available for use at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just up the street from the Kodak theater/shops. The staff at the hotel was WONDERFUL. They upgraded our room at no extra cost and allowed us to check in and check out at very odd times (3am/1am) with no hassle whatsoever. The parking is underground, which concerned us given that our vehicles were large (F250 long bed pick-up and an Expedition) but they worked that out with us too and reserved special parking spots underground so we could fit. They even gave my husband the security guard's parking spot for his truck! The room was beautifully remodeled and very clean. It had a spacious kitchen, a huge sitting room, dining room, bedroom and bath. The heated pool was also clean and had several guests swimming in it all day and into the evening hours. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Alenic610
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our three children stayed at the Magic Castle from December 30-January 2, 2005. We had a one bedroom suite and found it to be old, but clean with lots of pillows and fluffy comforters. I loved having the use of the guest laundry and one of the front desk folks even went so far as to go home in a rain storm and bring back dryer sheets when I asked if they had any available for purchase! The pool was located in a nice courtyard. We didn't get to use it because of the rain and the temperature, but it looked clean and inviting. The continental breakfast served in the lobby was very nice. The coffee was very good (I heard someone say it was Wolfgang Puck coffee) and the pastries and breads were fresh. They also had some fresh fruit (apples and tangerines) and a good assortment of juices, tea and hot chocolate. The location of the hotel is great. It is located on a quiet street off of Hollywood Blvd. It has easy access to the Metro station as well as major freeways. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Magic Castle”
Reviews.Author: Australia07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle from December 25 to 27, and couldn't have been happier. We were immediately upgraded to a one bedroom suite, my sister was upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. Whilst the rooms are certainly basic, they have everything you need and are quite comfortable, with very comfortable beds. The hotel was originally an apartment building, and retains that homely feel. The staff could not have been more helpful, answering any of our questions and assisting wherever possible. The breakfast in the lobby was simple, but ample, and each evening there was hot cider and cookies in the lobby. The location is perfect, you feel like you are in a suburban oasis, yet 2 minutes walk down the street and you are in the heart of Hollywood. It is close to transport, shops and restaurants. Overall, if you want something fancy, don't stay here. However if you want a comfortable hotel, with exceptionally friendly staff in an excellent location, this is the place for you. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but average hotel room...”
Reviews.Author: cambriant
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Magic Castle from 21-26th December. First of all, I must say that the hotel was really conveniently located to most of all the attractions. Barely 1 block from Hollywood Boulevard, 5 minutes drive from Universal Studio, 15-20 min drive to downtown and close to Getty Center. Since it was our first time in LA, and I'm usually not too good with car rides, it was really great that everything was close in proximity. The hotel room was alright. It was clean, but the house cleaning wasn't too thorough. Shampoo supplies were never replenished during the 5 night stay we were there. Cups that we used to make hot drinks were never washed. The room wasn't the newest, but it was clean. Not that big, but considering the terrific location, it was great. If you are planning on staying at the Magic Castle, I would strongly recommend spending an additional $20 for a one bedroom apartment. I caught a glimpse of the apartment from time to time, and it seemed so much newer and spacious, and more inviting. We were trying to save some money, but kinda wished we had spent that additional $20/night. Apart from that, hotel staff were really friendly and helpful. Continental Breakfast (Croissants, muffins, scones, toast from a local bakery) is actually self service, available in the small lobby. I love the croissants, but they seem to run out pretty early in the morning. But all in all, it was a great stay. I would stay there again, for the excellent location, but would definitely fork out the extra money to get a one bedroom apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time at the Magic Castle...very large room. The staff were courteous and friendly and anticipated our every need. We will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “My new home in LA”
Reviews.Author: costaltraveler
Reviews.Content: I cannot think of a place where I would rather stay while in LA. I felt like I owned a little apartment rather than rented a room. The property was well cared for, the "apartment" was newly redecorated and had more ammenties than my own home. The staff was on duty 24/7 and we felt that they truly wanted to add to the positive experience of our stay in any way they could while being pleasant and not intruding on our privacy. I could go on and on but need only say "WELL DONE"

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY recommended!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading excellent reviews for the hotel on this site, we booked a double suite requesting a street view. On arrival, despite arriving hours before the check-in (7am), we were provided with our room and invited to enjoy the complimentary breakfast of freshly baked pastries, cereal, toast, fresh fruit, juices and coffee. The room was huge! With one king size bed in the "living room" and another in a separate room we slept like babies!! The bathroom was small but clean and the fridge in the kitchen was great for keeping drinks and left-overs cold. We would especially like to mention Sean who was soooo helpful with everything including printing out bus schedules and routes for us, and Lorianne who gave us tips on where to spot the stars. Most of all with no car, the location - just one street away from Hollywood Blvd - was worth the cost of the room alone. We could walk to the Hollywood and Highland subway station if we wanted to travel somewhere but so many attractions are right on the Blvd - including the movie premiere we saw!! We totally recommend staying here to all travellers!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magic Castle for 3 days and it was fantastick. We stayed in a lovely updated room. We had two kids with us, so having a big place with an extra room was a great treat. Especially since we had all just spent 5 days in Disneyland in a hotel room... The staff was courteous and very helpfull. The breakfast was what we expected fruit, juice, coffee, muffins. The pool and all the facilities were very clean. For the money you just can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Staff! Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Magic Castle Hotel in Hollywood is now our home away from home. The rooms are larger than mine at home. Employees are great! Always a smile! So courteous and helpful! Didn't get a new room, but my room was great! Had a balcony so I can smoke since its a non smoking hotel. Its nice that my room didnt stink like old smoke. Breakfast was free and great too! Try the scones! All I can say is, if you are looking for a great LA getaway, check this place out! You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: Pukeko
Reviews.Content: Great location above Hollywood Boulevarde, we would walk down to there every night for dinner. We stayed at the Hollywood Hills Hotel, great views and very quiet, away from all the hustle and bustle. Housekeeping let the side down though, no toiletries in the apartment when we arrived, not even soap, these were supplied promptly when asked for. We had no coffee pot when we went to make coffee in the morning, and had no plug for the sink to was the dishes that housekeeping never washed. Dont let this stop you going there though, as the location is great and the rooms are clean and have a great view, management were fantastic (have probably fixed housekeepng problems already) the pool is fantastic, can definately recommend this one!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!! we would certainly stay here again"”
Reviews.Author: stefanovas
Reviews.Content: We spend 8 nights at the “Magic Castle Hotel”. Our room was not overlooking the pool, room 305. We had no trouble with noise from the street. Our room was normal size. The bathroom too. Everything was very clean. We want to say a good word for the great job of the people at the reception: Mike, Nick en Gretchen were always very friendly and helpful (they also booked for us a studio tour). They are really doing a great job over there. The staff were amongst the most helpful and friendly we have ever come across anywhere. A few mins walk to Hollywood Blvd, subway, restaurants etc.. Great breakfast served in the lobby (pastries, coffee and cereals) that you can take to your room or sit and enjoy around the pool. You are given a key to open the electronic gate into the underground garage. You get a coffee pot, fridge, and iron in the room. Internet access in the lobby (10 min. for 2 dollars). It was an excellent hotel, in a super location, and we would certainly stay here again on our next trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “MCH and Hollywood Hills”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Hills Hotel & Magic Castle Hotel are run by the same people. Walking distance to Mann's Chinese and Hollywood Blvd. Walk of Fame. Check-in at MCH lobby. Gated parking is $8. The HHH is at the top of the hill, across from Yamashiro Japanese restaurant. MCH at bottom of hill, across from the famous Magic Castle. Great views on top at HHH; there's a big, quiet pool up there too but it needs a new pool floor. MCH pool is much smaller & less private but newer/better maintained. My first room at HHH had a fantastic view but carpet and chairs were worn and stained. I asked to be moved to one of the newly refurbished rooms (improvement going on at both HHH & MCH). The staff was very understanding and immediately moved me to a new suite at the same price. Nice staff here, unlike some other uptight LA places. Continental breakfast served in MC lobby is great, but somewhat incovenient for HHH guests who must walk or drive down the hill. Not enough seating too. If you stay at either HHH or MCH, you get access to the Magic Castle next door, an extremely cool private club of magicians. Plan a night for dinner there-- wander around the club afterwards, it's awesome. Jacket/tie required for men. I'll be back!

HotelInfo.Name: Magic Castle Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 7025 Franklin Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
